finding: The analysis found that individuals carrying the apolipoprotein E4 (ApoE4) allele, defined by the rs429358 SNP, have a significant increased risk of developing dementia. This finding was particularly relevant as the cohort demonstrated this genetic predisposition in conjunction with liver fibrosis as a synergistic risk factor.
title: Association between Liver Fibrosis and Incident Dementia in the UK Biobank Study

finding: Similarly, the SNP rs7412, which is also associated with the apolipoprotein E gene, showed that carriers of this allele had an elevated risk for dementia. The data highlighted the importance of these SNPs in the context of other health factors such as liver fibrosis, where both genetic and environmental factors contributed to the risk profile for dementia in the study population.
title: Association between Liver Fibrosis and Incident Dementia in the UK Biobank Study

finding: The finding related to the rs429358 SNP was significant as it was associated with the presence of the APOE4 allele. Cognitively-normal APOE4 carriers, identified through this SNP, exhibited a greater anticipatory MCAv increase, a pronounced MCAv decrease with orthostasis, and a shorter latency of peripheral MAP responses compared to noncarriers.
title: APOE4 carriers display loss of anticipatory cerebral vascular regulation over AD progression

finding: The rs7412 SNP played a crucial role in the classification of APOE carriers. It was found that individuals with the APOE4 allele, determined by this SNP, had distinct phenotypes of cerebral vascular dysfunction, particularly during the hemodynamic challenge of orthostasis, showing unique compensatory responses that diminished as Alzheimer's disease progressed.
title: APOE4 carriers display loss of anticipatory cerebral vascular regulation over AD progression

finding: This variant was associated with ALL susceptibility and served as a shared variant among multiple blood cell trait clusters, with a significant p-value indicating its relevance.
title: Genetic Determinants of Blood Cell Traits Influence Susceptibility to Childhood Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia

finding: The rs1065853 variant, located in the APOE/APOC1 locus, was identified as the most significantly associated variant with treatment-related LDL-C reduction from baseline in the IMPROVE-IT study. It had a high posterior-probability-of-replicability (PPR = 1) and a very strong signal in the pooled GWAS 2df test (p = 1.09 x 10^-51), indicating its critical role in the response to statins and involvement in lipid metabolism and drug transport.
title: Statistical Assessment of Biomarker Replicability using MAJAR Method

finding: The sentinel variant rs10421326 was noted for its association with increased varenicline effectiveness and demonstrated additional connections to blood cell measurements related to immune response.
title: Genome-wide association study of varenicline-aided smoking cessation

finding: The study found that the minor G allele of rs1244787406 was significantly associated with an increased risk of dementia and Alzheimer's disease among carriers in the Finnish population. Specifically, it was noted that carriers had a median age of onset for dementia of 76.5 years compared to 79.0 years for non-carriers, demonstrating a relationship between this SNP and earlier disease onset.
title: Monoallelic TYROBP deletion is a novel risk factor for Alzheimer’s disease

finding: Similar to rs1244787406, the variant rs1002399693 was identified as a proxy marker for the monoallelic deletion in TYROBP and showed an association with earlier onset of dementia and Alzheimer's disease. The findings indicated it could be used alongside rs1244787406 in identifying individuals at risk.
title: Monoallelic TYROBP deletion is a novel risk factor for Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The SNP rs4802269 at 19q13.32 was identified through MTAG as a significant signal in the analysis of depression and BMI and served as an eQTL for the gene EML2 in cerebellar tissues.
title: Multi-trait genetic analysis identifies novel pleiotropic loci for depression and schizophrenia in East Asians

finding: The SNP rs2277732, located at the DPP9 locus, was positively associated with idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis, showing an OR of 1.17 (p=5.34 x 10^-5), suggesting its relevance to respiratory conditions linked with severe COVID-19.
title: A Phenome-Wide Association Study of genes associated with COVID-19 severity reveals shared genetics with complex diseases in the Million Veteran Program

finding: The SNP rs74956615 from the RAVER1 locus was associated with a reduced risk for autoimmune conditions such as psoriasis (OR = 0.71, p=1.5 × 10^-22) and rheumatoid arthritis (RA) (OR = 0.78, p=4.6 × 10^-9), suggesting its potential influence on immune response related to COVID-19.
title: A Phenome-Wide Association Study of genes associated with COVID-19 severity reveals shared genetics with complex diseases in the Million Veteran Program

finding: The SNP rs34536443 at the TYK2 locus was linked to a reduced risk of autoimmune diseases, including psoriasis and RA. It functioned as a missense variant resulting in partial loss of function, hence explaining its dual role in influencing COVID-19 severity risk.
title: A Phenome-Wide Association Study of genes associated with COVID-19 severity reveals shared genetics with complex diseases in the Million Veteran Program

finding: The SNP rs11085727 at the TYK2 locus was associated with a reduced risk of psoriasis (OR = 0.88, p=1.35 × 10^-17) and psoriatic arthropathy (OR = 0.81, p=9.54 × 10^-10), further supporting the protective role of TYK2 variants.
title: A Phenome-Wide Association Study of genes associated with COVID-19 severity reveals shared genetics with complex diseases in the Million Veteran Program

finding: This SNP was identified in the African ancestry cohort, showing a significant association (P<sub>AFR</sub>=2.5 x 10^-8, beta<sub>AFR</sub>=0.67 [0.43 to 0.90]) with telomere length. It was not detected in the non-Financial European (NFE) analyses, marking it as a unique finding in this specific population group.
title: Genetic architecture of telomere length in 462,675 UK Biobank whole-genome sequences

finding: The study highlighted that the APOE genotype, particularly the presence of the rs429358 SNP, played a role in the association between socioeconomic factors and cognitive performance in relation to Alzheimer's disease (AD) risk. It was originally found that carriers of the APOE4 allele (which includes the rs429358 SNP) exhibited increased risk for AD despite the protective benefits associated with higher socioeconomic factors.
title: Sex differences in the associations of socioeconomic factors and cognitive performance with family history of Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The analysis also emphasized the importance of the rs7412 SNP in the APOE gene, which, when evaluated alongside rs429358, helped categorize individuals into APOE4 carriers and non-carriers. This categorization was essential for understanding the nuanced interactions between socioeconomic factors, cognitive performance, and family history of Alzheimer's disease (FHAD) within the study's context.
title: Sex differences in the associations of socioeconomic factors and cognitive performance with family history of Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The rs429358 SNP, part of the APOE gene, was associated with Alzheimer's disease risk, specifically regarding the presence of the APOE ε4 allele, which significantly increased the likelihood of developing dementia.
title: Analysis of 470,000 exome-sequenced UK Biobank participants identifies genes containing rare variants which confer dementia risk

finding: The rs7412 SNP, also within the APOE gene, contributed to the determination of APOE ε3 and ε4 allele doses, correlating with elevated risk factors for Alzheimer's disease as observed in the study.
title: Analysis of 470,000 exome-sequenced UK Biobank participants identifies genes containing rare variants which confer dementia risk

finding: The SNP rs492602, which mapped to the FUT2 gene, was identified as a co-localized genetic loci for VTE and SARS-CoV-2 infection.
title: Shared genetic etiology and causality between COVID-19 and venous thromboembolism: evidence from genome-wide cross trait analysis and bi-directional Mendelian randomization study

finding: The SNP rs10402468 was significantly associated with DME, located within the BABAM1 gene. The odds ratio was 1.55 (P=4.62×10^-13), with evidence of replication in multiple datasets. This association was found to be independent of diabetes status, suggesting its specificity to DME.
title: Multi-ancestry GWAS analysis identifies two novel loci associated with diabetic eye disease and highlights APOL1 as a high risk locus in patients with diabetic macular edema

finding: The missense variant rs429358 in APOE was associated with a decrease in both BMI and weight over time, showing a reduction of 0.060 SD in expected BMI slope and 0.063 SD in expected weight slope for each copy of the minor C allele. This association was independent of baseline obesity.
title: The genetic architecture of changes in adiposity during adulthood

finding: The SNP rs429358, which is associated with the APOE-ε4 genotype, was found to be a significant factor in the downregulation of four proteins (TBCA, ARL2, S100A13, and IRF6) based on proteomic analysis. This downregulation was replicated in external datasets and was associated with Alzheimer’s disease biomarkers. The relationship between this SNP and protein levels highlighted the gene's influence on molecular processes linked to late-onset Alzheimer's disease (LOAD).
title: Serum proteomics reveals APOE dependent and independent protein signatures in Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The rs769449 variant located at the APOE locus was significant for all three CSF biomarkers, indicating its well-established role in Alzheimer's disease as a risk factor.
title: Genome-wide meta-analysis of CSF biomarkers in Alzheimer’s disease and Parkinson’s disease cohorts

finding: The variant rs601338, located in the RASIP1 gene, was confirmed as strongly associated with antibodies against Norwalk virus, with a significant association (P = 2.3 × 10^-9). This finding was in partial linkage disequilibrium with the FUT2 stop mutation, suggesting that the secretor status phenotype, determined by the FUT2 gene, influences the humoral response to Norovirus infection.
title: A systematic investigation into the non-genetic and genetic factors affecting the human anti-viral antibody repertoire

finding: This SNP was specifically linked to a dynamic caQTL, with its enhancer influencing the expression of MYO9B and HAUS8 in SMCs, indicating its significant role in the pathological states associated with CAD.
title: Single cell variant to enhancer to gene map for coronary artery disease

finding: The rs732310 variant located at AMH was identified as a novel locus affecting reproductive hormone pathways, although it did not show an association with AMH levels in the study.
title: Genomic and proteomic evidence for hormonal and metabolic foundations of polycystic ovary syndrome

finding: The rs769449 variant at the APOE locus was found to be significant for all three cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) biomarkers (Aβ, p-tau, t-tau), with associations confirmed in previous studies.
title: Genome-wide meta-analysis of CSF biomarkers in Alzheimer’s disease and Parkinson’s disease cohorts

finding: The rs429358 SNP was associated with the APOE ε4 allele, which was linked to an increased risk of Alzheimer's Disease (AD). In the study, carriers of the ε4 allele exhibited a higher risk of AD, particularly in the context of K. pneumoniae infection.
title: Klebsiella pneumoniae infection increases risk of Alzheimer’s Disease in the UK Biobank cohort

finding: The rs7412 SNP was associated with the APOE ε3 allele, which was part of the established genotyping for APOE isoforms. While it did not directly show an increase in AD risk independently, the presence of the ε3 allele was considered in the context of the increased risk linked to K. pneumoniae infection and the ε4 allele carriers.
title: Klebsiella pneumoniae infection increases risk of Alzheimer’s Disease in the UK Biobank cohort

finding: Part of the <italic>KLK3</italic> gene at 19q13.33, the associated variant indicated extreme significance with <italic>P</italic>=3.2 10<sup>−638</sup>, underscoring its pivotal role in prostate-specific antigen expression.
title: Leveraging Genetic Determinants of Prostate-Specific Antigen Levels Towards Improving Prostate Cancer Screening

finding: Associated with <italic>KLK3</italic>, this SNP was significant at <italic>P</italic>=2.1 10<sup>−4</sup> which indicates its potential utility in prostate cancer screening.
title: Leveraging Genetic Determinants of Prostate-Specific Antigen Levels Towards Improving Prostate Cancer Screening

finding: This SNP has been linked to <italic>KLK3</italic> as well, indicating its pivotal role in the physiology behind PSA.
title: Leveraging Genetic Determinants of Prostate-Specific Antigen Levels Towards Improving Prostate Cancer Screening

finding: This variant related to <italic>KLK1</italic> showed critical significance to PSA levels under multi-ancestry analyses.
title: Leveraging Genetic Determinants of Prostate-Specific Antigen Levels Towards Improving Prostate Cancer Screening

finding: This variant, associated with <italic>KLK3</italic>, suggested reversal effects post-bias corrections indicating complex interactions between PSA and prostate cancer risk.
title: Leveraging Genetic Determinants of Prostate-Specific Antigen Levels Towards Improving Prostate Cancer Screening

finding: The rs201118034 variant in NOTCH3 showed a risk difference of approximately 6% overall, peaking at 10% for individuals aged 60-80, relating to CADASIL, a significant adult-onset hereditary condition impacting brain health.
title: Deleterious Variants Contribute Minimal Excess Risk in Large-Scale Testing

finding: The SNP rs8887 from the gene PLIN4 was identified as modulating obesity-related phenotypes in humans. It was associated with the weight outcomes of infants in a study that linked methylation profiles to weight trajectories, indicating its significant role in childhood obesity risk.
title: Methylation profiles at birth linked to early childhood obesity

finding: The SNP rs190712692, located near APOC1, was associated with lower body fat percentage (BFP) and had significant associations indicating lower high-density lipoprotein (HDL), lower triglycerides (TG), and an increased risk of coronary artery disease (CAD). The results indicated that the allele associated with lower BFP also linked to worse lipid profiles.
title: Sex-stratified GWAS of Body Fat Percentage after Adjusting for Testosterone and SHBG in the UK Biobank

finding: The C allele of rs7412, associated with lower BFP, was also linked to lower HDL and lower TG levels, thereby increasing CAD risk, mirroring effects observed in rs190712692.
title: Sex-stratified GWAS of Body Fat Percentage after Adjusting for Testosterone and SHBG in the UK Biobank

finding: Significant as an eQTL in visceral adipose tissue for multiple nearby genes, indicating its relevance in studies focused on obesity.
title: Sex-stratified GWAS of Body Fat Percentage after Adjusting for Testosterone and SHBG in the UK Biobank

finding: In a study involving ~1000 African-American participants, rs12459249 was associated with nicotine metabolite ratio (NMR), contributing to understanding smoking behavior among this population.
title: Genetic insights into smoking behaviours in 10,558 men of African ancestry from continental Africa and the UK

finding: Similar to rs12459249, variant rs111645190 was identified in a study of ~1000 African-American individuals, exhibiting association with nicotine metabolite ratio (NMR), thus highlighting its relevance in smoking behavior genetics.
title: Genetic insights into smoking behaviours in 10,558 men of African ancestry from continental Africa and the UK

finding: Also linked to nicotine metabolite ratio (NMR), rs185430475 was identified in a study involving ~1000 African-American participants, underscoring its contribution to the genetic landscape of smoking behaviors.
title: Genetic insights into smoking behaviours in 10,558 men of African ancestry from continental Africa and the UK

finding: The SNP rs7412 was part of the genetic assessment that determined APOE genotype. Participants were classified based on their allelic combinations regarding the presence of the ε4 allele, which was shown to modify the risk association of GFAP and NfL levels with dementia. Specifically, the presence of the ε4 allele amplified the associations between elevated GFAP and NfL levels and the risk of dementia.
title: JOINT CONTRIBUTION OF MARKERS OF NEURODEGENERATION AND HYPERCHOLESTEROLEMIA TO DEMENTIA RISK

finding: Similar to rs7412, SNP rs429358 was analyzed for determining APOE genotype, which included identifying ε4 allele carriers. This genotype contributed to how GFAP and NfL levels were associated with dementia risk, with the ε4 allele serving as a significant modifying factor in the strength of these associations.
title: JOINT CONTRIBUTION OF MARKERS OF NEURODEGENERATION AND HYPERCHOLESTEROLEMIA TO DEMENTIA RISK

finding: The SNP rs429358 was related to the E4 dosage of the APOE gene. It showed that higher E4 dosage was associated with greater odds of developing hallucinations and cognitive decline in the context of Parkinson's disease.
title: Monogenic Parkinson’s Disease and the Impact of APOE E4: A Case-Control Study

finding: The SNP rs7412 was also implicated in determining the APOE haplotype and the E4 dosage. Similar to rs429358, it was associated with increased risks of adverse cognitive symptoms in those with Parkinson's disease.
title: Monogenic Parkinson’s Disease and the Impact of APOE E4: A Case-Control Study

finding: linked to CACNA1A, it was identified among significant CUD-specific SNPs.
title: Multivariate genome-wide association meta-analysis of over 1 million subjects identifies loci underlying multiple substance use disorders

finding: noted as a significant SNP near FUT2, contributing to understanding GWAS results for substances.
title: Multivariate genome-wide association meta-analysis of over 1 million subjects identifies loci underlying multiple substance use disorders

finding: The research indicated that rs1035064, tied to ZNF682, exhibited significant interaction with STST for SBP (P_GxE=4.8×10^-9).
title: A Large-Scale Genome-Wide Study of Gene-Sleep Duration Interactions for Blood Pressure in 811,405 Individuals from Diverse Populations

finding: The study also confirmed interactions at rs10406644 for PP with STST (P_GxE=2.0×10^-4), reflecting earlier reports.
title: A Large-Scale Genome-Wide Study of Gene-Sleep Duration Interactions for Blood Pressure in 811,405 Individuals from Diverse Populations

finding: The rs429358 variant in the APOE gene was associated with longevity, supporting its known role in increasing AD risk.
title: The effect of Alzheimer’s disease-associated genetic variants on longevity

finding: The rs7412 variant in the APOE gene showed a significant association with longevity, reinforcing the hypothesis of its impact on AD risk.
title: The effect of Alzheimer’s disease-associated genetic variants on longevity

finding: The top SNP for nicotine metabolism was rs56113850, located on chromosome 19. It was associated with genetically determined faster nicotine metabolism, meaning that the C allele was linked to higher nicotine metabolite ratios. This SNP explained a significant portion of the variance in the nicotine metabolite ratio (NMR) at approximately 32.1%. Additionally, the presence of the C allele was correlated with higher cholesterol, triglycerides, and poorer cardiovascular indicators, indicating less favorable health outcomes.
title: A Phenome-wide association study of genetically determined nicotine metabolism reveals novel links with health-related outcomes

finding: This SNP was associated with VTE in the FUT2 gene, indicating a potential role in the genetic etiology between COVID-19 and VTE.
title: Shared genetic etiology and causality between COVID-19 and venous thromboembolism: evidence from genome-wide cross trait analysis and bi-directional Mendelian randomization study

finding: The SNP rs429358 was part of the APOE allelic dose evaluation and was associated with increased odds of hyperlipidemia (OR 1.15, P=1.8×10^-129), dementia (OR 1.55, P=5×10^-19), and Alzheimer's disease, indicating its role as a significant genetic risk factor for these conditions in the studied cohort.
title: Phenome-Wide Association of APOE Alleles in the All of Us Research Program

finding: The SNP rs7412 was also considered in the APOE allelic dose analysis and contributed to the identified associations with hyperlipidemia (OR 1.15, P=1.8×10^-129) and Alzheimer's disease (OR 1.55, P=5×10^-19), highlighting its influence in altering the risk for these neurological and metabolic phenotypes.
title: Phenome-Wide Association of APOE Alleles in the All of Us Research Program

finding: NeEDL identified rs429358 as part of an epistatic interaction with rs7412 in the APOE gene, which has been previously noted as a potential epistatic SNP combination related to Alzheimer's disease risk. This combination was included in the 25 highest penetrance SNP combinations for the disease, emphasizing its importance in understanding Alzheimer's disease diagnostics.
title: Network medicine-based epistasis detection in complex diseases: ready for quantum computing

finding: NeEDL also identified rs7412 as part of an epistatic interaction with rs429358 in the APOE gene, reinforcing the hypothesis that these two SNPs collectively provide insights into Alzheimer's disease risk. The investigation highlighted this combination's significance in the context of developing more effective diagnostics for the disease.
title: Network medicine-based epistasis detection in complex diseases: ready for quantum computing

finding: The SNP rs77149320 was located in the intronic region of FCAR, which encodes the IgA receptor FcαR. This variant was associated with higher risks of nephritis and nephropathy, and it affected myeloid cell regulation by disrupting the PRDM1 transcription factor binding motif.
title: Genome-wide studies define new genetic mechanisms of IgA vasculitis

finding: The SNP rs4806602 was identified as one of the risk alleles in high LD with rs77149320. It disrupted the PRDM1 binding motif within a regulatory region of FCAR, suggesting its role in enhancing the regulatory activity associated with IgAV.
title: Genome-wide studies define new genetic mechanisms of IgA vasculitis

finding: Similar to rs4806602, rs73065472 was part of the same regulatory mechanism affecting FCAR expression through interference with PRDM1 binding. Both SNPs were significant in the context of increased IgAV risk.
title: Genome-wide studies define new genetic mechanisms of IgA vasculitis

finding: The SNP rs1865097 was associated with lower exclusion rates at a splice acceptor site in FCAR, potentially influencing IgAN and demonstrating a relationship with lower FCAR expression, which contrasts its role in IgAV.
title: Genome-wide studies define new genetic mechanisms of IgA vasculitis

finding: In the study, the apolipoprotein E (APOE) epsilon alleles were determined based on the allelic combination of SNPs rs7412 and rs429358. The classification of individuals into APOE genotypes was relevant to the understanding of their risk for Alzheimer's disease (AD) and all-cause dementia.
title: Long-term low-dose acetylsalicylic use shows protective potential for the development of both vascular dementia and Alzheimer’s disease in patients with coronary heart disease but not in other individuals from the general population: results from two large cohort studies

finding: Similar to rs7412, the SNP rs429358 was analyzed in connection with the apolipoprotein E (APOE) alleles. The genotype determined by the combination of rs429358 and rs7412 allowed researchers to classify study participants which was crucial for linking genetic predisposition to Alzheimer's disease (AD) and dementia incidence.
title: Long-term low-dose acetylsalicylic use shows protective potential for the development of both vascular dementia and Alzheimer’s disease in patients with coronary heart disease but not in other individuals from the general population: results from two large cohort studies

finding: Identified in context with TSH levels, the INSR gene associated with this SNP was also previously linked to erectile dysfunction.
title: Uncovering the Shared Genetic Components of Thyroid Disorders and Reproductive Health

finding: The SNP rs429358, tagging APOE4, exhibited significant interactions with age on both apolipoprotein B (ApoB) and triglycerides (TG) with p-values of 9.0e-14 and 5.4e-16, respectively. This finding was replicated in both the Copenhagen General Population Study (CGPS) and the Estonian Biobank (EstBB). Furthermore, it was noted that the genetic effects attenuated with increasing age.
title: Large-scale genome-wide interaction analyses on multiple cardiometabolic risk factors to identify age-specific genetic risk factors

finding: The SNP rs17248720, located near LDLR, revealed a significant interaction with age on ApoB levels, with a p-value of 2.0e-09. This finding indicated that the interaction remained significant in analyses that accounted for gender.
title: Large-scale genome-wide interaction analyses on multiple cardiometabolic risk factors to identify age-specific genetic risk factors

finding: This SNP, associated with the KLK3 gene, was found to significantly impact PSA levels in African ancestry individuals (β=0.0821, p=4.6e-11) and was recognized for its high correlation with KLK3 protein levels.
title: Genome-wide association study of prostate-specific antigen levels in 392,522 men identifies new loci and improves cross-ancestry prediction

finding: This SNP showed a strong association with PSA levels in African ancestry individuals (β=0.224, p=1.4e-13), also linked to the KLK3 gene, further confirming the influence on PSA levels.
title: Genome-wide association study of prostate-specific antigen levels in 392,522 men identifies new loci and improves cross-ancestry prediction

finding: This variant was significantly associated with PSA levels in African ancestry individuals (β=-0.213, p=2.0e-10) and showed relevance due to its link with PSA gene variants.
title: Genome-wide association study of prostate-specific antigen levels in 392,522 men identifies new loci and improves cross-ancestry prediction

finding: This variant had a strong association with KLK3 protein abundance, underlining its significance in the biochemical regulation of PSA.
title: Genome-wide association study of prostate-specific antigen levels in 392,522 men identifies new loci and improves cross-ancestry prediction

finding: This SNP was associated with increased KLK3 levels, affirming its role in prostate-specific antigen regulation.
title: Genome-wide association study of prostate-specific antigen levels in 392,522 men identifies new loci and improves cross-ancestry prediction

finding: The SNP rs7412 was associated with the apolipoprotein (APOE) ϵ gene genotyping, specifically in identifying APOE ϵ4 carriers, which were linked to reduced processing speed and executive functioning in females. This finding was derived from an analysis involving 221,124 middle-to-older-aged females from the UK Biobank, indicating a significant impact of the rs7412 genotype on cognitive performance.
title: Female-specific factors are associated with cognition in the UK Biobank cohort

finding: The SNP rs429358 was utilized in conjunction with rs7412 to approximate APOE ϵ4 genotype. This genotype was notably associated with diminished processing speed and executive functioning in a dose-dependent manner among female participants, supporting prior evidence of its impact on cognitive decline in relation to age-related neurocognitive disorders.
title: Female-specific factors are associated with cognition in the UK Biobank cohort

finding: The missense mutation rs35186399 in the CFD gene was associated with AMD, showing a protective effect with an odds ratio (OR) of 0.73, suggesting it decreased the risk of AMD and was notably linked to reduced complement C8 levels.
title: Distinctive cross-ancestry genetic architecture for age-related macular degeneration

finding: The protective mutation rs61760904 in the RRAS gene was found to show a significant decrease in AMD risk with an OR of 0.75, while also being linked to increased blood pressure.
title: Distinctive cross-ancestry genetic architecture for age-related macular degeneration

finding: Prioritization of MYO9B as the likely causal gene was based on its association with the sentinel variant rs7246865, underscoring its role in CAD.
title: Discovery and systematic characterization of risk variants and genes for coronary artery disease in over a million participants

finding: The variant rs429358 was reported to have an effect size comparable to that of TREM2.p.R47H in relation to Alzheimer's Disease (AD). It showed a highly significant association with AD and was positioned within the context of the study's focus on innate immunity alterations that correlate with AD risk.
title: Polygenic risk score analysis identifies deleterious protein-coding variants in novel immune pathway genes ATP8B4, FCGR1A, and LILRB1 that associate with Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The SNP rs429358, mapped to the APOE gene, was identified as the top variant in the cluster labeled 'Increased inflammation', with a weight of 4.6. This variant was noted to be more frequent in participants of inferred European (EUR) ancestry, indicating significant associations with inflammation-related traits.
title: A clustering approach to improve our understanding of the genetic and phenotypic complexity of chronic kidney disease

finding: The SNP rs429358 was linked to increased risk for Alzheimer's disease as it is a component of the APOE genotype, particularly in the presence of the ε4 allele (ε4ε4 and ε3ε4). This connection was part of a broader analysis of imaging-derived phenotypes in the UK Biobank cohort.
title: Multi-organ imaging-derived polygenic indexes for brain and body health

finding: Similarly, rs7412 contributed to the identification of Alzheimer's disease risk, acting alongside rs429358 to define the APOE genotypes. This SNP was notable for its association with the ε4 carrier status, which was shown to increase disease susceptibility in the study.
title: Multi-organ imaging-derived polygenic indexes for brain and body health

finding: The SNP <italic>rs79668907</italic> was associated with low-density lipoprotein (LDL) cholesterol levels, highlighting its importance in the study of blood biomarker variability across populations.
title: Inter-population differences of allele frequency and regulome tagging are associated with the heterogeneity of loci identified by cross-ancestry genome-wide association studies

finding: The p.G137S variant (rs730882082) in the LDLR gene was associated with significant increases in LDL cholesterol levels, with 25.4% of heterozygous and 54.7% of homozygous carriers exhibiting high levels (greater than 4.9 mmol/L), indicating a risk for familial hypercholesterolemia (FH). Additionally, this variant was linked to increased risks of ischemic heart disease (HR 1.51, P=0.00096), peripheral artery disease (HR 1.69, P=0.046), and the need for coronary operations (HR 1.78, P=0.0035). Thus, it was concluded that p.G137S significantly contributed to cardiovascular disease risk and metabolic health issues in the Greenlandic population.
title: An LDLR missense variant poses high risk of familial hypercholesterolemia in 30% of Greenlanders and offers potential for early cardiovascular disease intervention

finding: This SNP was identified as the lead cis-meQTL for cg17944885 on chromosome 19p13.2, showing associations with methylation levels in the general population, particularly linked to ESKD risk.
title: Blood methylation biomarkers are associated with diabetic kidney disease progression in type 1 diabetes

finding: This SNP correlated with cg12272104 near DAZAP1 and was associated with ESKD in comparison to macroalbuminuria, reinforcing its importance in kidney disease progression.
title: Blood methylation biomarkers are associated with diabetic kidney disease progression in type 1 diabetes

finding: The single lead variant rs429358, associated with Lewy body dementia, was identified as part of cluster 21 linked to the gene APOE. This variant demonstrated significant connections to multiple age-related traits, including age-related macular degeneration, Alzheimer’s disease, atherosclerosis, and importantly, longevity. The finding indicated that longevity has considerable overlaps with other health aspects such as healthspan, stroke, obesity, osteoarthritis, type 2 diabetes, and lipid measurement.
title: Integrative analysis of GWAS and co-localisation data suggests novel genes associated with age-related multimorbidity

finding: The rs7412 SNP was part of the APOE genotype analysis, indicating the presence of the APOE e4 allele was associated with increased risk of dementia and worse cognitive abilities. However, no significant interaction with KL genotype was identified.
title: Lack of evidence for interactions between APOE and Klotho genotypes on cognitive, dementia and brain imaging metrics in UK Biobank

finding: The rs429358 SNP contributed to the characterization of the APOE e4 risk genotype, which was linked to worse outcomes in terms of cognitive impairment and brain structure. There were no significant interactions with the KL locus found.
title: Lack of evidence for interactions between APOE and Klotho genotypes on cognitive, dementia and brain imaging metrics in UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs429358 was identified as being associated with cerebral infarction, particularly within the context of the APOE gene. This finding highlighted its relevance in the Southern Chinese Hakka population.
title: Seed-based morphometry of nodes in the default mode network among patients with Alzheimer’s disease in Klang Valley, Malaysia

finding: The SNP rs7412 was also associated with cerebral infarction, confirming its linkage to the APOE gene and its significance in the same population mentioned for rs429358.
title: Seed-based morphometry of nodes in the default mode network among patients with Alzheimer’s disease in Klang Valley, Malaysia

finding: Replicated in both the Pain Questionnaire and fibromyalgia cohorts, this SNP indicated a strong association with both ME/CFS and fibromyalgia.
title: Genetic Risk Factors for ME/CFS Identified using Combinatorial Analysis

finding: The SNP rs548960608 on chromosome 19 related to CEBPA, which was upregulated in excitatory neurons. This variant was found to have a significant association with the AD phenotype, thereby providing primary evidence of a new rare locus.
title: Identification of 16 novel Alzheimer’s disease susceptibility loci using multi-ancestry meta-analyses of clinical Alzheimer’s disease and AD-by-proxy cases from four whole genome sequencing datasets

finding: The rs429358 SNP within the APOE locus replicated the protective effect of the APOE ε4 allele against PSP, showing an odds ratio of 0.72 and a p-value of 0.02.
title: A Novel Susceptibility Locus in NFASC Highlights Oligodendrocytes and Myelination in Progressive Supranuclear Palsy Pathology

finding: The SNP rs3752246, located in the ABCA7 gene, demonstrated a strong association with lactosylceramide (LacCer) levels, specifically LacCer (d18:1/24:1), showing a Pearson correlation coefficient of -0.53 and a significance level of P = 7.16 x 10^-44. This finding suggested that variations in ABCA7 can affect LacCer concentrations, which are linked to cognitive performance and Alzheimer's disease (AD) risk. The study revealed that 10 AD-related SNPs in ABCA7 were associated with lower expression of ABCA7 in the brain, supporting the role of LacCer metabolism in the pathways contributing to AD risk.
title: Metabolome-wide association study on ABCA7 demonstrates a role for ceramide metabolism in impaired cognitive performance and Alzheimer’s disease

finding: SNP rs184017 was identified as the top SNP in the case-control genomic study of neuropathologically-confirmed Alzheimer's disease (ncAD) with a very low p-value of 5.8×10−55, indicating strong association near the APOE region.
title: Neuropathology-based GWAS for Alzheimer’s disease reveals novel susceptibility loci and highlights sex-specific pathways

finding: The SNP rs34342646 was the top SNP identified in the Braak stage analysis, showing a significant association with a p-value of 9.85×10−53, suggesting its relevance in the progression of Alzheimer's disease neuropathology.
title: Neuropathology-based GWAS for Alzheimer’s disease reveals novel susceptibility loci and highlights sex-specific pathways

finding: In the NP score analysis, rs34095326 was found to be the top SNP with a p-value of 3.91×10−34, indicating its association with the neuropathological features related to Alzheimer's disease.
title: Neuropathology-based GWAS for Alzheimer’s disease reveals novel susceptibility loci and highlights sex-specific pathways

finding: The variant rs201680145 (NM_000435.3(NOTCH3):c.3691C>T), which results in the missense amino acid substitution p.Arg1231Cys, was significantly associated with subcortical hemorrhagic stroke, showing an odds ratio (OR) of 3.39 and a p value of 3.87×10^-9. Furthermore, it was associated with all strokes combined, presenting an OR of 2.30 and a p value of 7.79×10^-10. This variant was found to be enriched in South Asians with an alternate allele frequency of 0.58%, and it was responsible for approximately 2.0% of hemorrhagic strokes and 1.1% of all strokes in this population.
title: NOTCH3 p.Arg1231Cys is Markedly Enriched in South Asians and Associated with Stroke

finding: The rs532051930:A variant was found to be significantly associated with the COVID-19 hospitalization phenotype with an odds ratio of 93.9 and a very low minor allele frequency of 0.003%. This association was supported by two independent studies and suggested to influence the transcription of the EEF2 gene, which is critical for viral replication. However, replication attempts in additional datasets revealed no carriers, raising questions about the validity of the association.
title: A catalog of associations between rare coding variants and COVID-19 outcomes

finding: The PLIN4 p.Q372X variant (rs201581703) was shown to have adverse effects on WHR_adjBMI, marking it as an important finding in the regulation of fat distribution.
title: Identification of rare loss of function variation regulating body fat distribution

finding: The SNP rs7248481 was reported to have the strongest association with bipolar disorder (BD) within the East Asian ancestry meta-analysis. It contributed to the overall understanding of the genetic architecture across different ancestries.
title: Genomics yields biological and phenotypic insights into bipolar disorder

finding: Connected to genetic variants involved with spermatogenesis and enriched for expression in testes and lung, supporting its relevance in male reproductive biology.
title: Genome-wide analysis identifies 66 variants underlying anatomical variation in human neuroendocrine structures and reveals links to testosterone

finding: SNP rs429358 was identified as the well-known APOE E4 risk allele for Alzheimer's disease (AD), with a Bayesian CPP of 0.144 and a highly significant p-value of 7.72 × 10−13. This variant was found to have significant enrichment across all five AD-related phenotypes studied.
title: Scalable Bayesian functional GWAS method accounting for multivariate quantitative functional annotations with applications to studying Alzheimer’s disease

finding: SNP rs10414043 was identified with a Bayesian CPP of 0.111 and a p-value of 2.71 × 10−12. This variant is located upstream of the APOC1 gene, associated with AD and blood protein traits, demonstrating significant findings for the AD-related phenotypes.
title: Scalable Bayesian functional GWAS method accounting for multivariate quantitative functional annotations with applications to studying Alzheimer’s disease

finding: SNP rs7256200 was found to have a Bayesian CPP of 0.315 and a p-value of 2.71 × 10−12. Like rs10414043, this variant is upstream of the APOC1 gene and relates to the context of AD and blood protein traits.
title: Scalable Bayesian functional GWAS method accounting for multivariate quantitative functional annotations with applications to studying Alzheimer’s disease

finding: SNP rs7412, along with rs429358, is recognized as a missense variant associated with the APOE E4 allele risk for AD. It represents a significant variant related to AD phenotypes.
title: Scalable Bayesian functional GWAS method accounting for multivariate quantitative functional annotations with applications to studying Alzheimer’s disease

finding: SNP rs1065853, which is located upstream of APOC1, was identified as significant for global AD pathology and known GWAS signals related to blood protein factors. This variant was part of the identified SNPs in relation to AD.
title: Scalable Bayesian functional GWAS method accounting for multivariate quantitative functional annotations with applications to studying Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The SNP rs56113850 located in the CYP2A6 gene was noted for its association with coffee consumption, confirming previous reports.
title: Habitual Coffee Consumption Increases Risks for Metabolic Diseases: Genome-wide Association Studies and a Phenotype-wide Two Sample Mendelian Randomization Analysis

finding: The SNP rs113534512 located at the HCN2 locus was included as a significant finding associated with coffee consumption.
title: Habitual Coffee Consumption Increases Risks for Metabolic Diseases: Genome-wide Association Studies and a Phenotype-wide Two Sample Mendelian Randomization Analysis

finding: The minor allele of rs34536443 was associated with an increased risk of lung cancer, with an odds ratio (OR) of 1.15 (95% CI 1.07-1.24, P = 1.72 × 10^-4). Similarly, it was associated with an increased risk of non-Hodgkin lymphoma, having an OR of 1.18 (95% CI 1.05-1.33, P = 5.25 × 10^-3). These findings suggested that therapeutic TYK2 inhibition, as mimicked by the partial loss-of-function variant rs34536443, may elevate the risk of these two cancers.
title: Germline TYK2 mutation and cancer risk

finding: The SNP rs429358 was part of the 992 SNPs tested within the APOE region (APOE+) that showed an association with Alzheimer's disease (AD) below the Bonferroni significance threshold (pBonf, p-value <0.00017). This SNP is known to be a significant contributor to AD risk, primarily due to its association with the apolipoprotein E (APOE) protein. In the context of this study, its inclusion was essential to understand the genetic overlap between candidate proteins and AD, as the APOE alleles are well-established risk factors for the disease.
title: Assessing genetic overlap and causality between blood plasma proteins and Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The variant TOMM40:rs11556505-T exhibited a higher frequency in European APOE ε4 carriers and a lower frequency in African carriers. It was shown to increase the risk of Alzheimer's disease among these populations.
title: Biobank-scale characterization of Alzheimer’s disease and related dementias identifies potential disease-causing variants, risk factors, and genetic modifiers across diverse ancestries

finding: The APOE:rs449647-T variant was found to increase the risk of Alzheimer's disease in individuals of African ancestry, while it decreased the risk in European APOE ε4 carriers, underscoring its modifying effects across ancestries.
title: Biobank-scale characterization of Alzheimer’s disease and related dementias identifies potential disease-causing variants, risk factors, and genetic modifiers across diverse ancestries

finding: The 19q13.31:rs10423769-A variant was associated with reduced Alzheimer's disease risk in African populations and was highlighted for its higher frequency among controls compared to AD cases among carriers of APOE ε4.
title: Biobank-scale characterization of Alzheimer’s disease and related dementias identifies potential disease-causing variants, risk factors, and genetic modifiers across diverse ancestries

finding: The ABCA7:rs72973581-A variant was reported as protective and was part of the total of 21 variants extracted for analysis related to Alzheimer’s disease.
title: Biobank-scale characterization of Alzheimer’s disease and related dementias identifies potential disease-causing variants, risk factors, and genetic modifiers across diverse ancestries

finding: The NFIC:rs9749589-A variant was documented as resilient in relation to Alzheimer's disease risk.
title: Biobank-scale characterization of Alzheimer’s disease and related dementias identifies potential disease-causing variants, risk factors, and genetic modifiers across diverse ancestries

finding: The APOE3 Christchurch:rs121918393-A variant was included among resilient variants impacting Alzheimer's disease.
title: Biobank-scale characterization of Alzheimer’s disease and related dementias identifies potential disease-causing variants, risk factors, and genetic modifiers across diverse ancestries

finding: SNP rs11085720, an intronic variant in the DNMT1 gene, was identified as significant (p-value = 2.3 × 10^-12) in both the two degree of freedom and one degree of freedom meta-analyses. Although the SNP was not significant in the previous deCODE meta-analysis, its identification suggested a potential role in birth weight regulation, possibly implicating pathways related to DNA methylation and transcriptional regulation during embryonic development.
title: Direct and INdirect effects analysis of Genetic lOci (DINGO): A software package to increase the power of locus discovery in GWAS meta-analyses of perinatal phenotypes and traits influenced by indirect genetic effects

finding: With a p-value of 8.80x10^-6, rs10853894 on chromosome 19 exhibited the highest odds ratio (4.853), indicating a significant association with ITR. This SNP is linked to the ZNF17 gene, known for its role in various biological processes, which further elucidates the genetic underpinnings of antidepressant response.
title: Genomic predictors of response to antidepressants in Major depressive disorder (MDD): A GWAS-Based Study on Indian cohort

finding: The rs429358 SNP was investigated for its association with Alzheimer's disease (AD) risk. This SNP is part of the APOE gene which influences the levels of soluble Aβ biomarkers in individuals. In the context of the study, carriers of the APOE ε4 allele, which is determined by this SNP, exhibited a decreased Aβ42/40 ratio compared to cognitively normal (CN) individuals, indicating a higher risk for developing AD.
title: Comparison of plasma soluble and extracellular vesicles-associated biomarkers in Alzheimer’s Disease patients and cognitively normal individuals

finding: The rs7412 SNP, another variant of the APOE gene, was also analyzed in relation to Alzheimer's disease (AD). Like rs429358, this SNP contributes to the classification of individuals as APOE ε4 carriers. The study found that CN individuals carrying the ε4 allele showed a decreased Aβ42/40 ratio, reinforcing the correlation between this SNP and increased susceptibility to AD.
title: Comparison of plasma soluble and extracellular vesicles-associated biomarkers in Alzheimer’s Disease patients and cognitively normal individuals

finding: The SNP rs429358, known as the APOE E4 tagging variant, was found to be associated with cognition progression in Parkinson's Disease (PD). This association highlighted the role of genetic factors in cognitive decline among PD patients.
title: Elucidating Molecular Networks Underpinning Heterogeneity in Parkinson’s Disease Progression Across Clinical Manifestation Spectrum

finding: The SNP rs61752561 was also recognized as a well-established causal variant of PrCa, affecting glycosylation and function of prostate-specific antigen. This was included within the context of a set of credible causal variants identified using the h2-D2 method.
title: A novel Bayesian fine-mapping model using a continuous global-local shrinkage prior with applications in prostate cancer analysis

finding: The variant rs601338 was associated with lower anti-norovirus antibody levels (P = 2.01 × 10^-10). It is a stop mutation in FUT2, indicating the non-secretor phenotype, which is linked to resistance against norovirus and susceptibility to type 1 diabetes and inflammatory bowel disease.
title: Demographic and genetic factors shape the epitope specificity of the human antibody repertoire against viruses

finding: The rs429358 SNP, which is part of the APOE allele classification, was linked to 2.48 attributable DALYs, primarily due to its impact on Alzheimer's disease and related dementias, showing a high hazard ratio of 5.97 (95% CI 5.57-6.40) and very strong significance (P=1.0×10^-128).
title: Genetic risk factors have a substantial impact on healthy life years

finding: Along with rs429358, this SNP is part of the APOE classification and contributed to 2.48 attributable DALYs related to Alzheimer's disease risk. The aggregated effect from both SNPs highlighted the significant role of APOE alleles in longevity and dementia.
title: Genetic risk factors have a substantial impact on healthy life years

finding: The variant rs143473297 contributed to 56.1 yearly population DALYs per 100,000 in individuals of Finnish ancestry due to increased dementia risk, showing a high hazard ratio of 1.95. This variant had notable enrichment in the Finnish population.
title: Genetic risk factors have a substantial impact on healthy life years

finding: The rs2032905 variant was located near the TSHZ3 gene, with high LD to eQTLs in induced pluripotent stem cells (iPSCs). TSHZ3 is crucial for postnatal function and the development of corticostriatal circuitry, supporting its association with sporadic miscarriage.
title: Trans-ancestral Genome Wide Association Study of Sporadic and Recurrent Miscarriage

finding: Found to have suggestive significance in the 'both-controls' GWAS concerning psoriatic arthritis, indicating a potential role in disease pathogenesis.
title: Accurate cross-platform GWAS analysis via two-stage imputation

finding: It exhibited suggestive significance in relation to psoriatic arthritis in the 'both-controls' analysis, supporting its contribution to disease risk.
title: Accurate cross-platform GWAS analysis via two-stage imputation

finding: The SNP rs641738 located in the MBOAT7 gene was found to be a significant determinant of liver disease susceptibility, particularly impacting hepatic fat accumulation.
title: Studies to develop a glucagon sensitivity test in humans: The GLUSENTIC study protocol

finding: The TM6SF2 gene containing SNP rs58542926 was acknowledged for its role in modulating liver disease risk, particularly through effects on lipid metabolism.
title: Studies to develop a glucagon sensitivity test in humans: The GLUSENTIC study protocol

finding: In the melanoma OCEANS panel, a variant in the MAP2K2-207 amplicon was confirmed to be the non-pathogenic SNP rs10250. This finding indicates the presence of this SNP in the analyzed panel, demonstrating its potential relevance in the context of OCEANS technology.
title: Oncogene Concatenated Enriched Amplicon Nanopore Sequencing for Rapid, Accurate, and Affordable Somatic Mutation Detection

finding: The rs429358 SNP in the APOE gene was significantly associated with multiple measures of cognitive function, including Hindi Mental State Examination (HMSE) score, general cognitive function, executive function, and orientation, in a study of South Asians. It was highlighted as a missense variant that differentiates the APOE ε4 allele from other alleles and had a minor allele frequency (MAF) of 10.9% in LASI-DAD. Previous studies had not found an association, but the larger sample size in this study likely allowed for the discovery.
title: Region-based analysis with functional annotation identifies genes associated with cognitive function in South Asians from India

finding: The SNP rs7412 was part of the APOE genotype assessment, which was categorized into six sub-genotypes and then into groups of APOE ε4 carriers and non-carriers. This classification allowed for the examination of how risks associated with cognitive decline due to Alzheimer's disease varied significantly between carriers and non-carriers, particularly around the age of 70.
title: Apolipoprotein E moderates the association between Non-APOE Polygenic Risk Score for Alzheimer’s Disease and Aging on Preclinical Cognitive Function

finding: The SNP rs429358 was similarly utilized in the categorization of APOE genotypes. It, along with rs7412, helped establish the impact of APOE ε4 status on cognitive decline related to Alzheimer's disease, demonstrating that individuals identified as carriers experienced more pronounced adverse effects from genetic risks around age 70.
title: Apolipoprotein E moderates the association between Non-APOE Polygenic Risk Score for Alzheimer’s Disease and Aging on Preclinical Cognitive Function

finding: The rs7412 variant, which is part of the apolipoprotein E (APOE) gene, contributed to the risk of developing late-onset Alzheimer's disease. Possession of this variant indicated an increased risk for cognitive impairment, as it is associated with one of the key alleles (E4) that significantly heightens Alzheimer's disease risk. The study highlighted that individuals with one copy of the APOE-ε4 allele had a 3-fold increase in risk, thus establishing its relevance in neurodegenerative conditions.
title: History of incarceration and age-related cognitive impairment: Testing models of genetic and environmental risk in longitudinal panel study of older adults

finding: The rs429358 variant, also part of the APOE gene, was noted to influence the genetic predisposition for Alzheimer's disease, similar to rs7412. This variant's association with the APOE-ε4 allele indicated substantial increases in the risk of cognitive impairment among individuals, as those with two copies of the ε4 allele faced a 15-fold increase in risk of developing Alzheimer's disease, further underscoring the gene's critical role in neurodegenerative disease etiology.
title: History of incarceration and age-related cognitive impairment: Testing models of genetic and environmental risk in longitudinal panel study of older adults

finding: The SNP rs429358 was genotyped to determine APOE haplotype status and plays a crucial role in defining the risk associated with the APOE ε4 haplotype, which is implicated in various neurodegenerative diseases.
title: Lack of Epistatic Interaction of SNCA with APOE in Synucleinopathies

finding: Genotyping of rs7412 also contributed to the establishment of APOE haplotypes, influencing risk assessment for conditions associated with the APOE gene.
title: Lack of Epistatic Interaction of SNCA with APOE in Synucleinopathies

finding: The SNP rs429358, found in the APOE gene, was highlighted as a significant predictor of dementia risk, particularly associated with increased Alzheimer's disease risk. It was noted for its dose-dependent effect, with variants impacting APOE protein isoforms.
title: Improving genetic risk modeling of dementia from real-world data in underrepresented populations

finding: This SNP, also linked to the APOE gene, was identified as a top predictor for dementia risk, being important in models for both HLA GIA and AA GIA groups.
title: Improving genetic risk modeling of dementia from real-world data in underrepresented populations

finding: SNP rs483082 was recognized as one of the top predictors for the HLA GIA group in dementia risk analysis, indicating its former association with the APOC1 gene.
title: Improving genetic risk modeling of dementia from real-world data in underrepresented populations

finding: Identified as a significant predictor in the AA GIA group, rs2627641 was associated with BLOC1S3 and contributed to the predictive importance in dementia risk modeling.
title: Improving genetic risk modeling of dementia from real-world data in underrepresented populations

finding: The SNP rs35106910 was highlighted as a significant predictor in the EAA GIA group, associated with the CBLC gene and contributing to overall predictive importance for dementia risk.
title: Improving genetic risk modeling of dementia from real-world data in underrepresented populations

finding: This SNP was identified as significant for the EAA GIA group, related to APOC1P1, and it was among the predictors that contributed a substantial amount to predictive importance.
title: Improving genetic risk modeling of dementia from real-world data in underrepresented populations

finding: The rs7412 variant was associated with the Apolipoprotein E (APOE) ε4 genotype, which significantly increased the risk of dementia by 2.5-fold for heterozygotes and 6.3-fold for homozygotes compared to APOE ε3/ε3. The variant was correlated with cognitive decline as well.
title: Effect of APOE and a polygenic risk score on incident dementia and cognitive decline in a healthy older population

finding: The rs429358 variant was associated with the APOE ε4 genotype, leading to a 2.5 to 6.3-fold increased risk of developing dementia, and it also had a significant association with cognitive decline, indicating its importance in the phenotype related to dementia within the studied cohort.
title: Effect of APOE and a polygenic risk score on incident dementia and cognitive decline in a healthy older population

finding: The SNP rs768563000, corresponding to NM_000527.5(LDLR):c.718G>T (p.Glu240Ter), was classified as likely pathogenic or pathogenic based on its assessment by the ClinGen FH Variant Curation Expert Panel. This variant was included in the MVP genotype array for potential clinical actionable results in the context of familial hypercholesterolemia.
title: Introducing return of results in the Million Veteran Program: Design and pilot results of the MVP-ROAR Familial Hypercholesterolemia Study

finding: The SNP rs145787161, referenced as NM_000527.5(LDLR):c.2140+1G>A, was also selected for return based on its classification as likely pathogenic or pathogenic by at least one submitter in ClinVar. This selection emphasized its relevance in the clinical context of diagnosing familial hypercholesterolemia.
title: Introducing return of results in the Million Veteran Program: Design and pilot results of the MVP-ROAR Familial Hypercholesterolemia Study

finding: For SNP rs377271627, which corresponds to NM_000527.5(LDLR):c.296C>G (p.Ser99Ter), the SNP was confirmed to be likely pathogenic or pathogenic. Its inclusion in the MVP genotype array illustrated its significance in the study targeting familial hypercholesterolemia as a medically actionable condition.
title: Introducing return of results in the Million Veteran Program: Design and pilot results of the MVP-ROAR Familial Hypercholesterolemia Study

finding: A novel low-frequency variant in the RUVBL2 gene was identified in EUR and was significantly associated with opioid dependence (OD) with a p-value of 6.59×10^-10. This variant was a rare INDEL with a minor allele frequency (MAF) < 0.01 in Europeans but common in non-European populations. It had a CADD score of 27 indicating high likelihood of deleteriousness, and in silico predictions suggested it could affect splicing.
title: Whole-exome sequencing study of opioid dependence offers novel insights into the contributions of exome variants

finding: The SNP rs429358, associated with the APOE e4 allele, was strongly associated with 13 of the 17 endophenotypes, especially related to amyloid-β measures, with suggestive effects on tau and cognitive memory scores.
title: Genome Wide Analysis Across Alzheimer’s Disease Endophenotypes: Main Effects and Stage Specific Interactions

finding: The variant rs72986630 was predicted to drive expression of ZNF823 and suggested to be protective against schizophrenia, established through chromatin accessibility analysis disrupting the REST transcription factor's binding.
title: Trans-ethnic eQTL meta-analysis of human brain reveals regulatory architecture and candidate causal variants for brain-related traits

finding: The rs601338 variant was part of the FUT2 locus, where a stop-gain variant was linked to chronic sputum production. It facilitated the understanding of the correlation of a nonsense allele with the non-secretory phenotype of ABO(H) blood group antigens.
title: Genome-wide association study of chronic sputum production implicates loci involved in mucus production and infection

finding: The sentinel variant at the FUT2 locus, rs492602, was associated with decreased lung function measures and was positively correlated with chronic sputum production risk. It was also noted for its role in various infections and the non-secretory phenotype.
title: Genome-wide association study of chronic sputum production implicates loci involved in mucus production and infection

finding: This missense variant resulted in a Glycine to Serine amino acid change and was also noted to be functionally important in the context of the FUT2 locus. It was positively correlated with the chronic sputum production risk allele.
title: Genome-wide association study of chronic sputum production implicates loci involved in mucus production and infection

finding: The rs17632542 variant in KLK3 was associated with elevated risk in individuals with prostate cancer, having an odds ratio of 1.49 with a p-value of 3.87×10^-7.
title: Assessment of Genetic Susceptibility to Multiple Primary Cancers through Whole-Exome Sequencing in Two Large Multi-Ancestry Studies

finding: The SNP rs7412 was part of the APOE genotype frequency analysis and contributed significantly to the APOE risk score. It was highlighted as essential for constructing the APOE risk score, which is known to have a strong association with Alzheimer's disease risk.
title: Effect of Pathway-specific Polygenic Risk Scores for Alzheimer’s Disease (AD) on Rate of Change in Cognitive Function and AD-related Biomarkers among Asymptomatic Individuals

finding: The SNP rs429358, alongside rs7412, formed the basis for the APOE risk score associated with late-onset Alzheimer's disease. This SNP was crucial in determining the odds ratios used to assess Alzheimer's risk, indicating its significant role in cognitive decline and biomarker variations.
title: Effect of Pathway-specific Polygenic Risk Scores for Alzheimer’s Disease (AD) on Rate of Change in Cognitive Function and AD-related Biomarkers among Asymptomatic Individuals

finding: The SNP rs429358, part of the APOE gene, was identified as a significant factor in classifying individuals as ε4-carriers, which has been previously linked to Alzheimer's disease (AD) risk.
title: A FinnGen pilot clinical recall study for Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The SNP rs7412, also in the APOE gene, contributed to the classification of individuals in the study as ε4-carriers or non-carriers, further establishing its relevance in the context of Alzheimer's disease risk.
title: A FinnGen pilot clinical recall study for Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The SNP rs429358, part of the APOE gene haplotypes, was associated with increased brain age gap. However, it was noted that while the association was significant with a p-value of 7.8e-06, it did not reach genome-wide significance.
title: Genome-wide analysis of brain age identifies 25 associated loci and unveils relationships with mental and physical health

finding: The SNP rs7412 was also part of the APOE gene haplotypes tested for associations with brain age gap, contributing to the findings related to Alzheimer's risk factors.
title: Genome-wide analysis of brain age identifies 25 associated loci and unveils relationships with mental and physical health

finding: The SNP rs429358 contributed to the APOE4 isoform in the genetic risk score that demonstrated strong positive associations with higher low-density lipoprotein cholesterol (LDL-C) levels at different ages, confirming its significant role in Alzheimer's disease liability.
title: Effects of genetic liability to Alzheimer’s disease on circulating metabolites across the life course

finding: The SNP rs7412, along with rs429358, defined the APOE4 genotype seen in the genetic risk scores that were found to impact cholesterol-related traits positively, verifying its critical involvement in Alzheimer's disease risk.
title: Effects of genetic liability to Alzheimer’s disease on circulating metabolites across the life course

finding: Similar to rs7659823, this variant displayed higher prevalence in East Asians and was linked to heart failure susceptibility.
title: Genome-wide analysis of heart failure yields insights into disease heterogeneity and enables prognostic prediction in the Japanese population

finding: The SNP rs7412 was part of the determination of APOE haplotypes, which defined the APOE subtypes including APOE4. The research highlighted the significant association between the APOE4 genotype and reduced brain functional connectivity, particularly in male carriers of the allele.
title: The Interaction Effects of Sex, Age, APOE and Common Health Risk Factors on Human Brain Functions

finding: Similarly, SNP rs429358 contributed to the classification of the APOE haplotypes, implicating the APOE4 variant. The study findings asserted that this genotype was linked to decreased brain functional connectivity, especially notable in males, indicating the complex influence of genetic factors on aging-related brain functional connectivity.
title: The Interaction Effects of Sex, Age, APOE and Common Health Risk Factors on Human Brain Functions

finding: The SNP rs72654445, localized to APOC1, was identified as an important variant in determining membership in clusters C0 and C1. This finding suggested its relevance in the genetic risk for neurodegenerative diseases.
title: Genetic risk factor clustering within and across neurodegenerative diseases

finding: The SNP rs112952132, which is part of the CEACAM16/AS1 gene, was also found to be a significant variant for distinguishing cluster C2 from C0 and C1. This indicated its possible relevance in the overlapping genetic risk for neurodegenerative diseases.
title: Genetic risk factor clustering within and across neurodegenerative diseases

finding: Similar to rs112952132, the SNP rs111278137, related to CEACAM16/AS1, was significant in determining membership in cluster C2, showing its importance among genetic variants contributing to neurodegenerative disease risk.
title: Genetic risk factor clustering within and across neurodegenerative diseases

finding: The SNP rs7412 was identified as a significant genetic variant associated with the number of APOE-ε4 alleles in the study. This SNP was particularly important for understanding the genetic risk factors that may affect cognitive performance and brain health, providing a link between genetic predisposition and potential neurologic outcomes.
title: Comparison of approaches to control for intracranial volume in research on the association of brain volumes with cognitive outcomes

finding: The SNP rs429358 served as a critical genetic marker for determining the number of APOE-ε4 alleles in the cohort. Its analysis contributed to the assessment of how genetic variations influence brain structure and cognition, further elucidating the genetic architecture that could underlie cognitive decline in aging populations.
title: Comparison of approaches to control for intracranial volume in research on the association of brain volumes with cognitive outcomes

finding: The rs116843064-A variant, corresponding to the E40K mutation in ANGPTL4, was associated with significantly lower triglyceride levels and reduced risks of coronary artery disease (CAD) and type 2 diabetes (T2D). The posterior probability of E40K being the causal variant for triglycerides was established at 99.99%, confirming its role in lifelong ANGPTL4 inhibition. This was validated through multiple methodologies including GWAS meta-analyses and FinnGen studies.
title: Impact of loss-of-function in angiopoietin-like 4 on the human phenome

finding: The rs429358 locus in apolipoprotein E was found to be associated with hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC) specifically in patients with cirrhosis, indicating a potential genetic risk factor for HCC development in this high-risk population.
title: Machine learning predicts liver cancer risk from routine clinical data: a large population-based multicentric study

finding: The study included rs429358, which was known to be significantly associated with both type 2 diabetes (T2D) and dementia. The presence of this variant led to detected heterogeneity in the results related to its impact on various dementia diagnoses, indicating the need for careful consideration in Mendelian randomization analyses involving this SNP.
title: Mendelian randomization study of diabetes and dementia in the Million Veteran Program

finding: This SNP was linked to non-secretor status, which protects against certain viral infections, and had previously shown association with SARS-CoV-2 infection from earlier variants.
title: Central role of glycosylation processes in human genetic susceptibility to SARS-CoV-2 infections with Omicron variants

finding: The rs429358 SNP at the APOE locus was linked to decreased lifespan, with a p-value of 6.4 x 10^-47, and was notably higher in deaths associated with diseases of the circulatory and nervous systems, highlighting its relevance to Alzheimer's Disease and cardiovascular disease.
title: Genetic associations with human longevity are enriched for oncogenic genes

finding: The rs12720356 variant in the TYK2 gene was found to confer protection against type 1 diabetes, supported by two large GWAS studies, suggesting it influences the risk through its effect on TYK2 gene expression.
title: Genetic evidence for efficacy of targeting IL-2, IL-6, and TYK2 signaling in prevention of type 1 diabetes: A Mendelian randomization study

finding: The rs34536443 missense variant in the TYK2 gene was associated with protection against type 1 diabetes according to recent genetic evidence, demonstrating its role in autoimmune disease risk.
title: Genetic evidence for efficacy of targeting IL-2, IL-6, and TYK2 signaling in prevention of type 1 diabetes: A Mendelian randomization study

finding: The rs2304256 variant was identified as protective against type 1 diabetes in both a Southern Brazilian and a European population, indicating its significance in type 1 diabetes risk.
title: Genetic evidence for efficacy of targeting IL-2, IL-6, and TYK2 signaling in prevention of type 1 diabetes: A Mendelian randomization study

finding: The SNP rs1808382 was identified as a lead variant associated with retinal vessel tortuosity. It was previously reported and specifically linked to coronary artery disease (CAD) and hypertension. The study noted that this SNP is located in the gene ACTN4, which has implications for vasorelaxation mechanisms.
title: GWAS of Retinal Vessel Tortuosity Identifies 173 Novel Loci Revealing Genes and Pathways Associated with Vascular Pathomechanics and Cardiometabolic Diseases

finding: The SNP rs7412 was located within an exon of the APOE gene and was linked with heart failure, possessing a P MTAG HF of 6.95×10^-24.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide analysis identified novel risk loci and candidate drugs for heart failure

finding: This variant in CERS1 was associated with glycosyl-N-stearoyl-sphingosine, relevant to sphingolipid metabolism.
title: Genome-wide association study of 1,391 plasma metabolites in 6,136 Finnish men identifies 303 novel signals and provides biological insights into human diseases

finding: The DHDH variant was associated with arabinose, highlighting its role in carbohydrate metabolism.
title: Genome-wide association study of 1,391 plasma metabolites in 6,136 Finnish men identifies 303 novel signals and provides biological insights into human diseases

finding: The SLC27A5 variant was associated with 3b-hydroxy-5-cholenoic acid, linking it to bile acid metabolism.
title: Genome-wide association study of 1,391 plasma metabolites in 6,136 Finnish men identifies 303 novel signals and provides biological insights into human diseases

finding: This SPHK2 variant was associated with sphingomyelin levels, indicating its involvement in sphingolipid signaling pathways.
title: Genome-wide association study of 1,391 plasma metabolites in 6,136 Finnish men identifies 303 novel signals and provides biological insights into human diseases

finding: The rs4420638 polymorphism on APOC1 was highlighted as impacting the accumulation of homocysteine, which is associated with Alzheimer's Disease (AD) development and progression.
title: Explainable deep transfer learning model for disease risk prediction using high-dimensional genomic data

finding: The rs11568822 polymorphism on APOC1 was noted to increase the risk of Alzheimer’s Disease in various populations including Caucasians, Asians, and Caribbeans.
title: Explainable deep transfer learning model for disease risk prediction using high-dimensional genomic data

finding: The rs10524523 polymorphism on TOMM40 was linked to oxidative damage affecting the onset and progression of Alzheimer’s Disease.
title: Explainable deep transfer learning model for disease risk prediction using high-dimensional genomic data

finding: The rs2075650 polymorphism on TOMM40 contributed to Alzheimer's Disease in Caucasian and Asian populations, providing important insights into genetic risk factors for AD.
title: Explainable deep transfer learning model for disease risk prediction using high-dimensional genomic data

finding: The intergenic variant rs2081046 was identified as significantly associated with functional fecal incontinence, being located 21K upstream to the ENSG00000270212 transcript.
title: Combined GWAS and single cell transcriptomics uncover the underlying genes and cell types in disorders of gut-brain interaction

finding: SNP rs2109069, related to the DPP9 protein on chromosome 19, was noted to correlate with greater severity of COVID-19, contributing to the genetic risk factors for the disease.
title: Potential associations of selected polymorphic genetic variants with COVID-19 disease susceptibility and severity

finding: SNP rs74956615 was identified as a risk factor for COVID-19 infection, contributing to genetic susceptibility based on prior findings.
title: Potential associations of selected polymorphic genetic variants with COVID-19 disease susceptibility and severity

finding: The SNP rs8105767 was associated with telomere length reduction, establishing its relevance to cardiovascular health outcomes and the risk of coronary heart disease.
title: Leukocyte Telomere Length and Cardiac Structure and Function: A Mendelian Randomization Study

finding: The SNP rs429358 was associated with carrying at least one APOE e4 allele in the context of Alzheimer's disease. Results from the UK Biobank test dataset indicated that the presence of the e4 allele was significantly predictive of Alzheimer's disease risk.
title: Capturing additional genetic risk from family history for improved polygenic risk prediction

finding: The SNP rs7412 was similarly associated with carrying at least one APOE e4 allele, contributing to Alzheimer's disease risk assessment in the same dataset. The analysis highlighted the importance of these SNPs in understanding genetic predisposition to Alzheimer’s.
title: Capturing additional genetic risk from family history for improved polygenic risk prediction

finding: The rs7412 SNP, which is part of the ApoE gene, was a positive finding in the study. Specifically, the predictive value linked to the ApoE genotype was revealed, where the presence of the ApoE ε4 allele significantly correlated with higher risk for Alzheimer's disease (AD). Individuals with the ApoE ε4 allele, identified via genotyping of rs7412 and rs429358, exhibited predictive characteristics that aligned with the classification of AD stages.
title: Machine learning-based classification of Alzheimer’s disease and its at-risk states using personality traits, anxiety, and depression

finding: Similarly, the rs429358 SNP was also a positive finding as it defines the ApoE ε4 allele, which was associated with increased risk for Alzheimer's disease (AD). Participants possessing the ε4 variant, identified through this SNP, contributed to the classification metrics and highlighted the role of ApoE genotype in predicting AD and cognitive decline.
title: Machine learning-based classification of Alzheimer’s disease and its at-risk states using personality traits, anxiety, and depression

finding: The SNP rs7412 was identified as part of the APOE gene that contributes to the predictability for late-onset Alzheimer's disease (AD) with an 81.8% accuracy in a study. It was associated with the abnormal function of glial cells, contributing to neurodegenerative disease pathogenesis.
title: Associations between Alzheimer’s disease polygenic risk scores and hippocampal subfield volumes in 17,161 UK Biobank participants

finding: Like rs7412, the rs429358 SNP was also part of the APOE gene family, significantly influencing predictability for late-onset AD (81.8%). Its presence, alongside rs7412, was linked to changes in glial cell behavior potentially accelerating age-related cognitive decline.
title: Associations between Alzheimer’s disease polygenic risk scores and hippocampal subfield volumes in 17,161 UK Biobank participants

finding: The SNP rs429358 was identified as a critical genetic marker associated with APOE status, specifically distinguishing between APOE ε4-carriers and non-carriers. This finding related to Alzheimer’s disease (AD) has implications for understanding genetic risk factors associated with cognitive decline.
title: TWINGEN – protocol for an observational clinical biobank recall and biomarker study to identify individuals with high risk of Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The SNP rs7412 was also identified as part of the two single-nucleotide polymorphisms necessary for defining APOE status. Similar to rs429358, it played a significant role in distinguishing APOE ε4-carriers from non-carriers, contributing to the characterization of genetic risk factors for Alzheimer’s disease.
title: TWINGEN – protocol for an observational clinical biobank recall and biomarker study to identify individuals with high risk of Alzheimer’s disease

finding: SNP rs116843064 near ANGPTL4 was associated with TRL processing and clearance, illustrating its causal relationship in lipid metabolism.
title: Lipo-proteomic and metabolic fine-mapping of genetic lipid risk loci

finding: SNP rs73015024 near LDLR was associated with VLDL and LDL uptake, establishing its central role in cholesterol transport pathways.
title: Lipo-proteomic and metabolic fine-mapping of genetic lipid risk loci
