finding: The missense variant rs28362459 was associated with CEA levels, suggesting its role in cancer-related biomarker profiles.
title: Genome-wide association studies in a large Korean cohort identify novel quantitative trait loci for 36 traits and illuminates their genetic architectures

finding: Identified as significantly associated with knee pain in males, rs2742313 showed a p-value of 4.19 × 10^-9, indicating its potential role in the inflammatory pathway, linked with ILF3.
title: A Genome-wide Association Study Identifies Novel Genetic Variants Associated with Knee Pain in the UK Biobank (N = 441,757)

finding: The SNP rs56764248 was significantly associated with knee pain with a primary GWAS p-value of 1.29 × 10^-14, linking it to the ILF3 gene, underscoring its involvement in inflammation affecting joint pain.
title: A Genome-wide Association Study Identifies Novel Genetic Variants Associated with Knee Pain in the UK Biobank (N = 441,757)

finding: This SNP was associated with CILP2 expression, a gene implicated in cartilage integrity, thus indicating its possible role in joint tissue involvement in RA pathology.

finding: An identified missense variant of the TYK2 gene, contributing to the understanding of ancestry-specific genetic factors in RA.

finding: Another missense variant at the TYK2 locus, representing a significant genetic factor for RA risk specific to European ancestry.
title: Trans-ancestry genome-wide association study identifies novel genetic mechanisms in rheumatoid arthritis

finding: This SNP was found as an EAS-specific signal at the TYK2 locus, indicating its relevance in the disease risk among East Asian populations.
title: Trans-ancestry genome-wide association study identifies novel genetic mechanisms in rheumatoid arthritis

finding: This SNP in the APOE locus was identified as a trans-pQTL for TBCA levels, showing associations with multiple AD-related traits, including genetic predisposition to Alzheimer’s disease and biomarkers in cerebrospinal fluid.

finding: It was significantly associated with accelerated aging, indicating that this SNP may influence biological aging processes.
title: The Relationship Between Biological Aging with Interdisciplinary Health Indicators: A Scoping Review

finding: The SNP rs429358 located at the APOE locus was confirmed as a significant risk factor for Alzheimer's disease (AD) with an odds ratio of 2.93 and a p-value of 2.6×10⁻²³.
title: First GWAS on Alzheimer’s Disease in Argentina and Chile populations

finding: The SNP rs7412 at the APOE locus was also reported with a protective effect against AD, showing an odds ratio of 0.53 and a p-value of 6.3×10⁻³.
title: First GWAS on Alzheimer’s Disease in Argentina and Chile populations

finding: The SNP rs167479 in RGL3 was replicated at a nominal level (P-value of 1.2×10−3) for its association with gestational hypertension, corroborating findings from a larger GWAS that involved both preeclampsia and gestational hypertension.

finding: This SNP was noted for its influence on hepatic fibrosis progression in NAFLD patients. It is one of the well-validated variants associated with the disease and was involved in metabolic pathways related to liver lipid metabolism.

finding: The rs429358 SNP was part of the studied APOE haplotypes, specifically identified as the alternative allele associated with the APOE ε4 haplotype, which demonstrated a strong association with Alzheimer's Disease (AD) status among diverse ancestral groups.
title: Association of Common and Rare Variants with Alzheimer’s Disease in over 13,000 Diverse Individuals with Whole-Genome Sequencing from the Alzheimer’s Disease Sequencing Project

finding: The rs7412 SNP is part of the APOE haplotypes and contributed to the lower frequency of the APOE ε2 haplotype observed in the study samples, relevant for Alzheimer's Disease risk.

finding: This INDEL (rs113492558) was linked to AD in African American individuals (OR=2.56, p=1.7×10^-19), highlighting its strong association to the disease.
title: Association of Common and Rare Variants with Alzheimer’s Disease in over 13,000 Diverse Individuals with Whole-Genome Sequencing from the Alzheimer’s Disease Sequencing Project

finding: The frameshift deletion rs547447016 was associated with AD, validated in previous studies, contributing to the understanding of risk factors in the NHW subgroup.
title: Association of Common and Rare Variants with Alzheimer’s Disease in over 13,000 Diverse Individuals with Whole-Genome Sequencing from the Alzheimer’s Disease Sequencing Project

finding: This novel variant (rs538591288) in ABCA7 was newly associated with AD across multiple populations, emphasizing the significance of this gene in Alzheimer's pathology.
title: Association of Common and Rare Variants with Alzheimer’s Disease in over 13,000 Diverse Individuals with Whole-Genome Sequencing from the Alzheimer’s Disease Sequencing Project

finding: Identified as a newly associated ultra-rare variant in the ongoing study of Alzheimer's Disease, this variant highlighted the contributions of distinct ABCA7 variants.
title: Association of Common and Rare Variants with Alzheimer’s Disease in over 13,000 Diverse Individuals with Whole-Genome Sequencing from the Alzheimer’s Disease Sequencing Project

finding: Reported to be a frameshift deletion associated with Alzheimer's Disease, consistent with previous findings, contributing to the understanding of rare variants.
title: Association of Common and Rare Variants with Alzheimer’s Disease in over 13,000 Diverse Individuals with Whole-Genome Sequencing from the Alzheimer’s Disease Sequencing Project

finding: The second frameshift deletion (chr19:1055908:CT:C) was included in the association analysis, reaffirming the link between rare genetic changes and AD risk.
title: Association of Common and Rare Variants with Alzheimer’s Disease in over 13,000 Diverse Individuals with Whole-Genome Sequencing from the Alzheimer’s Disease Sequencing Project

finding: This novel variant (chr19:1046404:CGT:C) was newly associated with AD, contributing to the broader understanding of genetic risk factors in ABCA7.
title: Association of Common and Rare Variants with Alzheimer’s Disease in over 13,000 Diverse Individuals with Whole-Genome Sequencing from the Alzheimer’s Disease Sequencing Project

finding: Found to be associated with Alzheimer's Disease, this new genetic variant (chr19:1054250:AG:A) adds to the understanding of ABCA7-related risks in Alzheimer's.
title: Association of Common and Rare Variants with Alzheimer’s Disease in over 13,000 Diverse Individuals with Whole-Genome Sequencing from the Alzheimer’s Disease Sequencing Project

finding: The SNP rs429358 located in the APOE locus showed a remarkable association with hs-CRP levels, having a P-value of 3.30e-51, reinforcing its significance in chronic inflammation and lipid metabolism.
title: The combined impact of persistent infections and human genetic variation on C-reactive protein levels

finding: The SNP rs429358 was associated with worse Alzheimer’s disease (AD) neuropathological burden, but this association was observed only in individuals with a European <italic>APOE</italic> background. In the context of the study, the association of <italic>APOE</italic> genotype with AD pathology demonstrated significant ancestry influences, with the <italic>APOE</italic>4 allele noted to have an attenuated risk for dementia in African ancestry compared to European ancestry.
title: Global and local ancestry modulate APOE association with Alzheimer’s neuropathology and cognitive outcomes in an admixed sample

finding: The rs7412 SNP, related to the carriage of the APOE ε3 allele, contributed to approximately 30% of late-onset Alzheimer's disease (AD) burden. The allele was part of the genotype assessments that indicated a significant risk factor for AD, specifically in associations with both ε3 and ε4 alleles.
title: The proportion of Alzheimer’s disease attributable to apolipoprotein E

finding: The rs429358 SNP, which is associated with the carriage of the APOE ε4 allele, was part of the combination that accounted for 74.0% of the AD burden and 38.1% of all-cause dementia burden in the study. This highlighted the allele's major role in increasing dementia risk.
title: The proportion of Alzheimer’s disease attributable to apolipoprotein E

finding: The SNP rs429358 was part of the analysis that focused on the APOE gene status, which is crucial for Alzheimer's disease (AD) research. The findings indicated its significant role in predicting AD risk within the context of polygenic risk scores (PRS), contributing to our understanding of genetic predisposition to the disease.
title: Analysis of Alzheimer’s disease Polygenic Risk Scores using RNA-sequencing provides further novel biological pathways

finding: Similarly, the SNP rs7412 was analyzed alongside rs429358 for its contribution to APOE status. The results confirmed that this SNP also plays a vital role in Alzheimer’s disease risk prediction, further supporting the association between APOE genetic variants and the development of AD.
title: Analysis of Alzheimer’s disease Polygenic Risk Scores using RNA-sequencing provides further novel biological pathways

finding: The lead variant rs10405121 was identified as MA-specific with a greater than 95% chance of association specifically with migraine with aura.
title: Genome-wide analysis of 102,084 migraine cases identifies 123 risk loci and subtype-specific risk alleles

finding: The SNP rs10406327, an intronic variant in PEPD, displayed a significant association with VATadjBMI (P = 3.3 x 10^-24) and was also previously associated with waist circumference adjusted for BMI and type 2 diabetes.
title: Inherited basis of visceral, abdominal subcutaneous and gluteofemoral fat depots

finding: This SNP demonstrated a strong increase in chromatin accessibility (p-value 2.99e-16) and was associated with the gain of a new CTCF binding motif which influenced gene expression across the locus.
title: Multi-omics analysis in primary T cells elucidates mechanisms behind disease associated genetic loci

finding: Rs2353678 was shown to be associated with significant chromatin accessibility enhancement (p-value 2.99e-16) and was positioned near a predicted CTCF binding motif, indicating its relevance in gene regulation mechanisms.
title: Multi-omics analysis in primary T cells elucidates mechanisms behind disease associated genetic loci

finding: The study identified that the low-producing TGF-β1 polymorphism rs1800472 (C>T), specifically the T-allele, in the donor was associated with an increased risk of graft loss following kidney transplantation, demonstrating a hazard ratio of 2.13. The incidence of graft loss was significantly higher in those carrying the T-allele, leading to the conclusion that TGF-β1 has protective effects on kidney transplant survival.
title: A functional TGFB1 polymorphism in the donor associates with long-term graft survival after kidney transplantation

finding: In the 19p13.11 region, rs9636202 shared genetic influences with mean mode of anisotropy of the external capsule, indicating a strong genetic link with chronotype traits as well (PPH4 = 0.992).
title: Mapping sleep’s phenotypic and genetic links to the brain and heart: a systematic analysis of multimodal brain and cardiac images in the UK Biobank

finding: The variant rs429358 contributed to genetic associations with Alzheimer's disease type traits and was linked with insomnia genetic influences.
title: Mapping sleep’s phenotypic and genetic links to the brain and heart: a systematic analysis of multimodal brain and cardiac images in the UK Biobank

finding: The upstream variant rs708686 at 19p13.3 was previously associated with multiple conditions including Carbohydrate Antigen 19.9 levels, highlighting its relevance in the context of blood protein levels.
title: Leveraging global multi-ancestry meta-analysis in the study of Idiopathic Pulmonary Fibrosis genetics

finding: The SNP rs826323 mapped to ZNF420 showed a significant association (p=1.39×10−08), contributing to the broader understanding of addictive behaviors in relation to alcohol intake.
title: Genome-wide investigation of maximum habitual alcohol intake (MaxAlc) in 247,755 European and African Ancestry U.S. Veterans informs the relationship between habitual alcohol consumption and alcohol use disorder

finding: The SNP rs113534512, located at the HCN2 locus, was identified for the first time as being associated with coffee consumption, showcasing its significance.
title: Habitual Coffee Consumption Increases Risks for Metabolic Diseases: Genome-wide Association Studies and a Phenotype-wide Two Sample Mendelian Randomization Analysis

finding: This SNP was shown to be significantly associated with entinostat response (p=4.94 x 10^-7). It is located in the HDGFL2 gene, which plays a role in regulating gene expression via a complex that influences leukemogenesis, highlighting its potential impact on drug efficacy in AML.
title: Exome-wide association study reveals 7 functional variants associated with ex-vivo drug response in acute myeloid leukemia patients

finding: The TM6SF2 rs58542926 T/C gene polymorphism was found to be associated with significant hepatic fibrosis. In the meta-analysis including 2286 patients, the TT genotype and T allele were significantly correlated with increased susceptibility to liver fibrosis. Specifically, in the allelic model comparison of T vs C, an odds ratio of 1.292 was reported (95% CI 1.035-1.611, P=0.023), and in the recessive model comparison TT vs CT+CC, the odds ratio was 2.829 (95% CI 1.101-7.267, P=0.031). These findings indicated that the T allele may be a risk factor for hepatic fibrosis in patients.
title: Association between TM6SF2 rs58542926 T/C gene polymorphism and significant liver fibrosis: A meta-analysis

finding: It was established that the rs429358 SNP is one of the two single-nucleotide polymorphisms defining APOE status, particularly the presence of the ε4 allele, which is associated with an increased risk of Alzheimer's disease (AD). The context of this finding related to how APOE ε4 allele carriers exhibit higher susceptibility to the early stages of AD.
title: TWINGEN – protocol for an observational clinical biobank recall and biomarker study to identify individuals with high risk of Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The rs7412 SNP was identified as a second defining single-nucleotide polymorphism for APOE status. Similar to rs429358, its presence is linked to the risk of developing Alzheimer's disease, specifically in relation to the ε4 allele. This marked the significance of the APOE genotype in predicting individuals at elevated risk for AD.
title: TWINGEN – protocol for an observational clinical biobank recall and biomarker study to identify individuals with high risk of Alzheimer’s disease

finding: This SNP at locus 19p13.1 was part of a known pleiotropic cancer locus and showed associations with LUSC, indicating its multifaceted role in cancer risk.
title: Multi-ancestry meta-analyses of lung cancer in the Million Veteran Program reveal novel risk loci and elucidate smoking-independent genetic risk

finding: This SNP was connected with the ER- breast cancer credible set, illustrating its potential shared risk factors between LUSC and breast cancer.
title: Multi-ancestry meta-analyses of lung cancer in the Million Veteran Program reveal novel risk loci and elucidate smoking-independent genetic risk

finding: The minor allele of rs157585 was associated with a prominent loss of function for DNase I hypersensitive sites (DHS) in glioblastoma cells, normal human astrocytes, and monocyte cells. It demonstrated a strong negative impact on chromatin features in relevant brain cells.
title: Deciphering the tissue-specific functional effect of Alzheimer risk SNPs with deep genome annotation

finding: This SNP led to a strong gain of function in acetylation of histones 2 and 3 at various positions in H1-Derived Neuronal Progenitor cells (NPC), indicating a significant positive impact on chromatin modifications.
title: Deciphering the tissue-specific functional effect of Alzheimer risk SNPs with deep genome annotation

finding: This variant was associated with acetylation of histones 2 and 3 in H1-Derived Neuronal Progenitor cells but showed an extremely high significance in a negative context, revealing a complex role in chromatin function.
title: Deciphering the tissue-specific functional effect of Alzheimer risk SNPs with deep genome annotation

finding: This significant lead SNP showed minimal chromatin effects, despite it being close to rs75765623, suggesting that significant SNPs do not necessarily exert the most functional impact in the brain.
title: Deciphering the tissue-specific functional effect of Alzheimer risk SNPs with deep genome annotation

finding: Identified as one of the variants amid the top 100 AD GWAS that maintained a dominant chromatin effect irrespective of the genomic context.
title: Deciphering the tissue-specific functional effect of Alzheimer risk SNPs with deep genome annotation

finding: Like rs184017, this SNP showed a dominant effect on chromatin features and was part of the top SNPs examined for downstream functional impact.
title: Deciphering the tissue-specific functional effect of Alzheimer risk SNPs with deep genome annotation

finding: This SNP was associated with significant loss of function in CTCF binding sites in glioblastoma cells, particularly when in combination with rs141864196.
title: Deciphering the tissue-specific functional effect of Alzheimer risk SNPs with deep genome annotation

finding: Found to have varying functional effects regarding CTCF binding, particularly when coupled with another SNP and dependent on alleles of neighboring SNPs.
title: Deciphering the tissue-specific functional effect of Alzheimer risk SNPs with deep genome annotation

finding: Showed strong associations with the decrease in the proportion of AD cases among subjects possessing the minor allele, suggested potential protective effects.
title: Deciphering the tissue-specific functional effect of Alzheimer risk SNPs with deep genome annotation

finding: The study identified genotypes for rs7412, which is associated with the ApoE epsilon alleles. It was noted that the novelty-based SAME score differed between ApoE epsilon 4 carriers and non-carriers in first-degree relatives of Alzheimer's disease (AD) dementia patients. This finding suggested a link between the ApoE genotype and neurocognitive function related to Alzheimer’s disease risk.
title: Single-value fMRI scores reflect both stage and risk across the Alzheimer’s disease continuum

finding: The SNP rs429358 was also identified as part of the ApoE genotyping in the study. Similar to rs7412, its association with the ApoE epsilon alleles highlighted differences in novelty-based SAME scores between ApoE epsilon 4 carriers and non-carriers in AD-rel individuals, thereby indicating its significance in understanding cognitive performance and Alzheimer’s disease risk.
title: Single-value fMRI scores reflect both stage and risk across the Alzheimer’s disease continuum

finding: This lead SNP was determined to influence both FUT2 and RASIP1 expressions, with the protective G allele increasing FUT2 expression, a gene associated with susceptibility and protection against type 1 diabetes.
title: Identification of novel type 1 and type 2 diabetes genes by co-localization of human islet eQTL and GWAS variants with colocRedRibbon

finding: This variant was linked to the TM6SF2 locus, showing evidence of colocalization within fatty acid metabolism traits.
title: Genome-wide association studies and multi-omics integrative analysis reveal novel loci and their molecular mechanisms for circulating polyunsaturated, monounsaturated, and saturated fatty acids

finding: Associated with the APOE gene, this SNP was indicated to share genetic signals across various FA traits, supporting its relevance in lipid metabolism.
title: Genome-wide association studies and multi-omics integrative analysis reveal novel loci and their molecular mechanisms for circulating polyunsaturated, monounsaturated, and saturated fatty acids

finding: Also associated with APOE, this SNP was identified in model 3 as a shared signal across FA traits.

finding: Associated with PEPD, this SNP was recognized amidst the broader context of fatty acid metabolism findings.

finding: Detected in investigations of metabolic variations related to fatty acid levels.
title: Genome-wide association studies and multi-omics integrative analysis reveal novel loci and their molecular mechanisms for circulating polyunsaturated, monounsaturated, and saturated fatty acids

finding: A novel rare coding variant rs756613425 in the U2AF1L4 gene was identified among females in the EUR2 population, showing a significant association with AUD (P=5.38×10^-9). This variant had not been previously associated with AUD.
title: Multi-ancestry Whole-exome Sequencing Study of Alcohol Use Disorder in Two Cohorts

finding: This SNP was identified as a significant variant associated with PSA levels, with a p-value of 3.2×10^-638, demonstrating strong correlation with prostate-specific antigen (PSA) variation.
title: Genetically Adjusted PSA Levels for Prostate Cancer Screening

finding: This SNP was part of the identified significant variants impacting PSA levels, assisting with prostate cancer screening analysis.
title: Genetically Adjusted PSA Levels for Prostate Cancer Screening

finding: Associated significantly with PSA variation, this SNP demonstrated its relevance in understanding genetic risk factors for prostate cancer.
title: Genetically Adjusted PSA Levels for Prostate Cancer Screening

finding: Recorded with a significant association regarding PSA variability, underscoring its relevance in prostate cancer research.
title: Genetically Adjusted PSA Levels for Prostate Cancer Screening

finding: Noted with significance regarding association with PSA, showing potential in prostate cancer genetic risk assessments.
title: Genetically Adjusted PSA Levels for Prostate Cancer Screening

finding: The rs7251 locus was found to be associated with risk for schizophrenia (SCZ) and also linked to autoimmune diseases, particularly those involving thyroid dysfunction. The allele rs7251-C was correlated with higher risks of SCZ and autoimmune diseases, as well as poorer cognitive performance. Additionally, four phenotypes displayed significant colocalization with SCZ risk, namely autoimmune thyroid disease, cognitive performance, thyroid problems (not cancer), and vitiligo.
title: A transcriptome-wide Mendelian randomization study in isolated human immune cells highlights risk genes involved in viral infections and potential drug repurposing opportunities for schizophrenia

finding: The SNP rs58542926, located in the TM6SF2 gene, was associated with liver fat accumulation, replicating findings from previous studies and thus confirming its significance in the genetic architecture of metabolic dysfunction-associated steatotic liver disease (MASLD).
title: Machine learning across multiple imaging and biomarker modalities in the UK Biobank improves genetic discovery for liver fat accumulation

finding: The well-known rs429358 SNP in the APOE locus was replicated with high significance (P=2.4x10^-10), confirming its role as a major genetic risk factor for Alzheimer's Disease.
title: A genome-wide association study in Peruvians suggests new risk loci for Alzheimer Disease

finding: The risk allele rs7599-A was associated with significantly reduced expression of TMEM147 in the liver, suggesting that TMEM147 protects against gallstone formation.
title: Genome-wide Analysis Identifies Novel Gallstone-susceptibility Loci Including Genes Regulating Gastrointestinal Motility

finding: The SNP rs2003476 in the CRTC1 gene was associated with seven aging and age-related disease outcomes, specifically frailty index, late-onset Alzheimer's disease (LOAD), congestive heart failure (CHF), father's age at death, mother's age at death, breast cancer, and endometrial cancer. This finding related to the antagonistic pleiotropy theory of aging and suggested a connection between genetic variants and longevity pathways, as previous studies linked CRTC1 with extended lifespan in model organisms like C. elegans and indicated decreased CRTC1 levels associated with Alzheimer's disease in humans.
title: Early menarche and childbirth accelerate aging-related outcomes and age-related diseases: Evidence for antagonistic pleiotropy in humans

finding: This SNP was associated with the eGene CNN2, demonstrating effects on extracellular Aβ levels in neuronal models, further bridging its relevance to Alzheimer's disease mechanisms.
title: Cell-type Specific Expression Quantitative Trait Loci Associated with Alzheimer Disease in Blood and Brain Tissue

finding: The SNP rs11670056 in the ELL gene was identified as the top SNP related to the latent MDD-ASCVD factor. This gene, part of the transcription elongation factor complex, had previously been associated with various cardiovascular diseases (CVDs), blood traits, body mass index (BMI), and educational attainment. This finding contributed to understanding the genetic overlaps between major depressive disorder (MDD) and atherosclerotic cardiovascular disease (ASCVD).
title: Distinct genomic signatures and modifiable risk factors underly the comorbidity between major depressive disorder and cardiovascular disease

finding: Found intergenic to UPK1A and ZBTB32, this SNP was genome-wide significant for COVID-19 hospitalization and replicated across different analyses.
title: A genome-wide association study of COVID-19 related hospitalization in Spain reveals genetic disparities among sexes

finding: The SNP rs429358 was part of the analysis examining its association with APOE genotype and hippocampal volume in the context of aging. Significant differences in total hippocampal volume were noted in carriers of the APOE ε4 allele, which includes individuals carrying the rs429358 variant, suggesting its relevance in the decline of hippocampal volume and potential onset of Alzheimer's disease.
title: Hippocampal volumes in UK Biobank are associated with APOE only in older adults

finding: The SNP rs7412 was also implicated in the determination of APOE genotype in the study. Results indicated that individuals carrying the ε4 allele, determined by the presence of rs7412, exhibited reduced hippocampal volumes beginning from age 61, highlighting the importance of this SNP in understanding neurodegeneration related to Alzheimer's disease.
title: Hippocampal volumes in UK Biobank are associated with APOE only in older adults

finding: This SNP, linked to the APOE gene, was included in the polygenic risk profile (PRP-5) which had a significant association with complex coronary artery disease in type 2 diabetes patients, documented with an OR of 5.2 (p = 0.007).
title: Complexity of Coronary Disease and a Genetic Risk Profile in Patients with Type 2 Diabetes in Colombia

finding: The rs2307019 variant in the FUT2 gene showed significant interaction with rs507666 in the ABO locus, affecting plasma levels of ALPI, MUC2, and FAM3D. This finding was supported by evidence from both the UK Biobank and FinnGen studies.
title: Non-linear genetic regulation of the blood plasma proteome

finding: This variant associated with the FUT3 locus interacted with rs507666 from the ABO locus, influencing the plasma levels of the gastrointestinal tract-expressed protein FAM3D, marking it as a critical interaction observed in the analyses.
title: Non-linear genetic regulation of the blood plasma proteome

finding: This SNP was found to have very strong evidence for an association with periodontal disease, linked to colorectal cancer risk although exact p-values were not reported.
title: Two-sample Mendelian randomization analysis of associations between periodontal disease and risk of colorectal, lung, and pancreatic cancers

finding: The SNP rs7248481 was highlighted as the locus most strongly associated with bipolar disorder in the East Asian ancestry meta-analysis, although it was part of the broader set of 298 significant loci identified across various ancestries.
title: Genomics yields biological and phenotypic insights into bipolar disorder

finding: In the study, the low-producing TGBF1 polymorphism rs1800472-C>T was associated with increased risk of graft loss in kidney transplantation. The donor genotype frequencies significantly differed between patients with and without graft loss (P=0.014). The T-allele was linked to an increased hazard ratio (HR 2.12; 95%-CI 1.18–3.79; P=0.012) for late graft loss, indicating that this polymorphism may have protective effects for kidney transplant survival.
title: A functional TGFB1 polymorphism in the donor associates with long-term graft survival after kidney transplantation

finding: The SNP rs7412 was also linked to greater vulnerability in APOE-4 carriers, indicating that individuals with this genotype were more adversely affected by persistent financial adversity, particularly in terms of brain health and cognitive performance.
title: Persistent financial adversity and cognitive ageing: A lifecourse investigation

finding: The lead SNP rs8736 (chr19:54677189) in the MBOAT7 locus was associated with a wide range of phosphatidic acids and phosphatidylcholines, indicating its significance in lipid metabolism processes.
title: Genome-wide analysis of blood lipid metabolites in over 5,000 South Asians reveals biological insights at cardiometabolic disease loci

finding: The rs8101801 SNP in the C19orf80 locus was significantly associated with PC(40:9) and PI(38:4), implicating its influence on serum triglyceride levels and related lipid profiles.
title: Genome-wide analysis of blood lipid metabolites in over 5,000 South Asians reveals biological insights at cardiometabolic disease loci

finding: The rs601338 genotype determined secretor status, where individuals with homozygous major (GG) or heterozygous (GA) genotypes were considered secretors and compared to homozygous minor (AA) non-secretors. The study reported that non-secretors had significantly higher IgG levels against BKPyV and JCPyV compared to secretors, indicating the influence of FUT2 variation on humoral response.
title: Human genomics of the humoral immune response against polyomaviruses

finding: rs681343 showed a significant association with IgG levels against BKPyV, with a P-value of 6.40e-16. It was also reported to be in high linkage disequilibrium with rs601338, reinforcing the role of FUT2 in the immune response to this virus.
title: Human genomics of the humoral immune response against polyomaviruses

finding: This SNP was strongly associated with anti-JCPyV IgG levels, as evidenced by a P-value of 4.84e-10, further confirming the involvement of FUT2 in the modulation of the immune response to polyomaviruses.
title: Human genomics of the humoral immune response against polyomaviruses

finding: Significant associations with anti-JCPyV responses were seen for the rs2432132 SNP, linking it to the FUT2 gene and expanding on the understanding of genetic factors influencing these immune responses.
title: Human genomics of the humoral immune response against polyomaviruses

finding: The SNP rs2742313 was significantly associated with knee pain in males as well, indicating unique genetic influences within this population.
title: A Genome-wide Association Study Identifies Novel Genetic Variants Associated with Knee Pain in the UK Biobank (N = 441,757)

finding: Located in the ILF3 gene on chromosome 19, the SNP rs56764248 showed a significant association with knee pain with a p-value of 1.29 × 10^-14, emphasizing its potential role in inflammatory processes related to joint health.
title: A Genome-wide Association Study Identifies Novel Genetic Variants Associated with Knee Pain in the UK Biobank (N = 441,757)

finding: Associated with COVID-19 hospitalization (OR=0.94, p=2.50×10^-8), rs66833742 was linked to upregulation of the ZBTB7A gene.
title: Novel risk loci for COVID-19 hospitalization among admixed American populations

finding: In perfect LD with rs66833742, this SNP also associated with hospitalization linked to ZBTB7A.
title: Novel risk loci for COVID-19 hospitalization among admixed American populations

finding: Significant association was detected for rs3810291 in the ZC3H4 gene within the liability framework for type 2 diabetes, although it was not identified by the binary method, aligning with earlier studies.
title: Genetic association studies using disease liabilities from deep neural networks

finding: The rs516246 SNP was found to be in near-complete linkage disequilibrium with a stop-gain mutation in the FUT2 gene. The trans-MR association associated higher intestinal alkaline phosphatase (ALPI) levels with a lower risk of inflammatory bowel disease (IBD), providing a novel link between these proteins and IBD risk.
title: Systematic disease-agnostic identification of therapeutically actionable targets using the genetics of human plasma proteins

finding: In the analysis involving the NOTCH3 gene associated with small vessel disease (SVD) stroke, the rare variant rs115582213 was identified with a p-value of 0.03. Among 5,358 individuals in the dataset, there were 87 variant carriers, of which 17 had SVD stroke, suggesting a significant association of this variant with the phenotype.
title: BinomiRare: A carriers-only test for association of rare genetic variants with a binary outcome for mixed models and any case-control proportion

finding: The rs2307279 locus in PLA2G4C was found to stabilize the protein's structure due to the A38P missense variant, with implications for hemolytic susceptibility to HAPC among Tibetans.
title: Differences in pathogenetic mechanism between Tibetan and Han high-altitude polycythemia based on a whole genome-wide association study

finding: The study identified a positive interaction effect between age and the APOE-epsilon4 allele, specifically related to amygdala volume. This finding suggested that the APOE-epsilon4 genotype was implicated in increased susceptibility to brain aging, thus highlighting its role as a risk factor for Alzheimer's disease (AD).
title: Brain Structural Mapping of Multi-factorial Aging Mechanism Using 35,035 UK Biobank Subjects

finding: The rs7412 variant was part of the APOE genotype analysis, where it was linked to a reduced risk for developing AD due to its association with the APOE-epsilon2 allele. This allele exhibited a protective effect against AD compared to APOE-epsilon4, emphasizing the importance of the interplay of these SNPs in disease risk.
title: Brain Structural Mapping of Multi-factorial Aging Mechanism Using 35,035 UK Biobank Subjects

finding: The rs7412 SNP was associated with the ApoE ε2, ε3, and ε4 alleles, which were found to differ in their impact on cognitive performance and risk for Alzheimer's disease (AD). Specifically, variations in this SNP correlated with differences in novelty-based SAME scores between individuals at risk for AD, contributing to associations with neuropsychological test outcomes.
title: Single-value brain activity scores reflect both severity and risk across the Alzheimer’s continuum

finding: The rs429358 SNP was linked to the ApoE ε2, ε3, and ε4 genotypes, similarly influencing cognitive performance in the context of Alzheimer's disease risk. Findings indicated that this SNP played a role in differentiating cognitive performance across various stages of AD, particularly in MCI and AD dementia groups, and its association with the FADE and SAME scores was significant.
title: Single-value brain activity scores reflect both severity and risk across the Alzheimer’s continuum

finding: The analysis provided evidence that carriage of the allele associated with rs7412 contributed to 74.5% of late-onset Alzheimer's disease (AD) burden and 39.5% of all-cause dementia burden. This finding suggested a significant role of the APOE locus, in particular the APOE ε3 and ε4 alleles, in the development of AD and dementia.
title: The proportion of Alzheimer’s disease attributable to apolipoprotein E

finding: Similar to rs7412, the rs429358 was found to be significantly associated with the risk of developing late-onset Alzheimer's disease, with the study estimating that it contributed to 74.5% of AD burden and 39.5% of dementia burden. This SNP was pivotal in understanding the molecular physiology of apolipoprotein E and its impact on dementia risk.
title: The proportion of Alzheimer’s disease attributable to apolipoprotein E

finding: The SNP rs429358, a missense variant within the APOE gene, was identified as a strong protective factor against non-alcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD), with a significant association observed (P=2.17×10^-11). The ε4 allele of APOE was found to reduce the odds of NAFLD in heterozygotes and homozygotes, reinforcing its protective role.
title: Genome-Wide Association Study of Non-Alcoholic Fatty Liver Disease Identifies Association with Apolipoprotein E

finding: The variant rs11666329, located in the NECTIN2 gene, was associated with both lower CSF sTREM2 levels and an increased risk of Alzheimer’s disease. This finding is significant as it establishes a new locus unrelated to the APOE genotypes.
title: Proteo-genomics of soluble TREM2 in cerebrospinal fluid provides novel insights and identifies novel modulators for Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The rs429358 SNP was part of the Apolipoprotein E (APOE) gene analysis. It revealed a negative interaction effect with age on the volume of the amygdala, particularly in females carrying the APOE-ε4 allele. This finding indicated that the presence of the ε4 allele was associated with reduced amygdala volume as the subjects aged.
title: The Interaction Effects of Age, APOE and Common Environmental Risk Factors on Human brain Structure

finding: The rs7412 SNP, similarly to rs429358, was involved in determining APOE genotypes. It exhibited a positive interaction with age and the APOE-ε2 allele leading to increased paracentral volume in subjects with a healthier diet. This suggested that the ε2 allele could have a beneficial effect on maintaining certain brain volumes in relation to dietary factors during aging.
title: The Interaction Effects of Age, APOE and Common Environmental Risk Factors on Human brain Structure

finding: Identified as a low-frequency variant associated with lung cancer at the 19q13.2 locus, enhancing the knowledge of genetic factors influencing lung cancer susceptibility.
title: Genetic analysis of lung cancer reveals novel susceptibility loci and germline impact on somatic mutation burden

finding: The SNP rs11085147 linked to LONP1 was associated with changes in mtDNA gene expression, indicating its relevance in mitochondrial function.
title: GWAS and ExWAS of blood Mitochondrial DNA copy number identifies 73 loci and highlights a potential causal role in dementia

finding: The SNP rs12461806 was associated with TINCR/LONP1 and showed a very strong association with mtDNA-CN at GWAS significance levels.
title: GWAS and ExWAS of blood Mitochondrial DNA copy number identifies 73 loci and highlights a potential causal role in dementia

finding: Association of rs73001065 with decreased risk for non-alcoholic fatty liver disease was noted, potentially through lowering levels of the APOB protein.
title: Plasma Proteome Variation and its Genetic Determinants in Children and Adolescents

finding: Colocalized with eQTLs for TMEM190, this SNP indicates a link to hypothalamic function and its role in reproductive biology.
title: Genome-wide analysis identifies 66 variants underlying anatomical variation in human neuroendocrine structures and reveals links to testosterone

finding: Found among the common SNPs that linked BMI, WC, and HC to PCOS, this variant supported the proposition that genetic factors related to obesity play a causal role in the development of PCOS.
title: Both general- and central- obesity are causally associated with polycystic ovarian syndrome: Findings of a Mendelian randomization study

finding: The intronic variant rs73005873:G>A in MUC16 raised the risk for SARS-CoV-2 infection with an OR of 1.03 (95% CI = 1.02–1.04, P = 6.4 × 10^-10).
title: A second update on mapping the human genetic architecture of COVID-19

finding: The SNP rs641738 within the MBOAT7 gene was reported in previous findings to be linked with liver disease risk factors, paving the way for its inclusion in studies examining metabolic impacts related to glucagon.
title: Studies to develop a glucagon sensitivity test in humans: The GLUSENTIC study protocol

finding: The SNP rs58542926 in the TM6SF2 gene was implicated in liver fat accumulation and metabolic dysfunction, hence relating to glucagon response examined in the study's participant group.
title: Studies to develop a glucagon sensitivity test in humans: The GLUSENTIC study protocol

finding: This missense variant was significantly associated with proxy Alzheimer’s disease, causing an amino acid change from arginine to tryptophan (p.R239W) in the TOMM40 gene. Although its impact on protein function was unclear, it was significant in the context of the analysis.
title: Rare Variant Aggregation in 148,508 Exomes Identifies Genes Associated with Proxy Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The SNP rs190065070, near EMC10, was recognized in the largest scale GWAS and contributed to the genetic understanding of AF, although the specific contribution to AF risk requires further investigation.
title: Deciphering the genetic architecture of atrial fibrillation offers insights into disease prediction, pathophysiology and downstream sequelae

finding: The rs7412 SNP was associated with the APOE ε4 allele, which was implicated in increasing genetic liability to Alzheimer's disease (AD). This association suggested that the presence of this allele influenced neurodegenerative mechanisms, thereby affecting the structural brain measures observed in later life.
title: The bidirectional causal effects of brain morphology across the life course and risk of Alzheimer’s disease: A cross-cohort comparison and Mendelian randomization meta-analysis

finding: The SNP rs157580, located in the intron region of TOMM40 and downstream of NECTIN2, was identified as a significant finding associated with the gene APOE in the context of Alzheimer's disease (AD) dementia. This finding was established through multiple statistical methods, including lasso regression (lassosum) and probabilistic p-value analysis (P+T), showing extremely low p-values indicating strong significance (p-value = 3.38e-102 for lassosum and p-value < 1e-300 for P+T). The significance of rs157580 was crucial to elucidating the genetic mechanisms underpinning AD, particularly highlighting the influence of APOE, a known AD risk gene, and its proximity to other relevant genes such as TOMM40 and NECTIN2.
title: Proteome-wide association studies using summary proteomic data identified 23 risk genes of Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The SNP rs429358, part of the APOE block, produced significant Z statistics, leading to its exclusion from some analytical processes due to p-values treated as 0. However, it was manually included as a lead SNP in FUMA analysis due to its significant association with AD, representing a crucial genetic risk factor.
title: Multivariate Modeling of Direct and Proxy GWAS Indicates Substantial Common Variant Heritability of Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The SNP rs5117, located in the APOC1 gene, had the smallest p-value of 1.04E-22, indicating a strong association with Alzheimer's disease (AD). This finding was part of a classification model developed through a deep learning approach that identified phenotype-associated SNPs.
title: Deep learning-based identification of genetic variants: Application to Alzheimer’s disease classification

finding: The SNP rs429358, located in the APOE gene, showed a p-value of 1.41E-16, also signifying a significant association with AD. This SNP was identified as one of the most important genetic variants linked to the risk of developing Alzheimer's disease.
title: Deep learning-based identification of genetic variants: Application to Alzheimer’s disease classification

finding: The missense variant rs28362459 (p.Leu20Arg) in FUT3 was associated with gallbladder polyp (OR=1.46, P=5.1×10−11) and cholelithiasis (OR=1.11, P=7.3×10−9), indicating its role in both conditions.
title: A global atlas of genetic associations of 220 deep phenotypes

finding: The SNP rs5030775 (A18T) was associated with enhanced stimulation of the IP3 response, which could lead to altered GnRH pulse frequency, promoting increased LHB gene expression potentially linked to menstrual irregularities in PCOS.
title: Novel Mutations in Human Luteinizing Hormone Beta Subunit Related to Polycystic Ovary Syndrome among Sudanese Women

finding: The SNP rs1800447 (W28R) was associated with menstrual irregularities and elevated serum testosterone levels among PCOS cases, impacting ovarian function.
title: Novel Mutations in Human Luteinizing Hormone Beta Subunit Related to Polycystic Ovary Syndrome among Sudanese Women

finding: The SNP rs34349826 (I35T) was found to correlate with hormonal levels, specifically serum LH and testosterone, and had associations with PCOS-related dysregulation.
title: Novel Mutations in Human Luteinizing Hormone Beta Subunit Related to Polycystic Ovary Syndrome among Sudanese Women

finding: The SNP rs429358 was associated with the apolipoprotein E (APOE) gene, specifically with the APOE4 allele. This finding indicated that carriers of the APOE4 allele had an impaired energy balance in the brain, which was linked to the onset of Alzheimer's disease (AD), showing that the energy metabolism-related metabolites observed were influenced by the APOE genotype.
title: Longitudinal analysis of UK Biobank participants suggests age and APOE-dependent alterations of energy metabolism in development of dementia

finding: The SNP rs7412 was also associated with the apolipoprotein E (APOE) gene, defining the presence of the APOE2 allele. Similar to rs429358, this SNP's association highlighted the role of the APOE genotype in regulating energy metabolism linked to dementia, specifically connecting the presence of APOE alleles to the altered metabolic profiles that affect dementia risks.
title: Longitudinal analysis of UK Biobank participants suggests age and APOE-dependent alterations of energy metabolism in development of dementia

finding: The rs429358 SNP correlated with increased risk for late-onset dementia as it was part of the ApoE4 genotype. This SNP was one of two extracted from the UK Biobank and had previously established associations with cognitive decline and brain health.
title: No safe level of alcohol consumption for brain health: observational cohort study of 25,378 UK Biobank participants

finding: The rs7412 SNP also formed part of the ApoE4 genotype, reinforcing its classification as a genetic risk factor for late-onset dementia. Its inclusion in the genotype analysis highlighted the role of ApoE4 in brain health.
title: No safe level of alcohol consumption for brain health: observational cohort study of 25,378 UK Biobank participants

finding: The study indicated that there was a significant interaction effect between apolipoprotein E rs405509 T/T and the ɛ4 genotypes on cognitive impairment and grey matter volume. This finding was relevant as it highlighted the influence of the APOE ɛ4 allele, a major genetic risk factor for late-onset Alzheimer's disease (LOAD), on the structural changes in grey matter, particularly in carriers of the ɛ4 allele.
title: Apolipoprotein E genotype and MRI-detected brain alterations pertaining to neurodegeneration: A systematic review

finding: This SNP was found associated with COVID-19 hospitalization (OR=0.94, 95% CI: 0.92-0.96, p=2.50×10^-8) and demonstrated regulatory potential for ZBTB7A expression.
title: Novel risk loci for COVID-19 hospitalization among admixed American populations

finding: As a perfect proxy for rs66833742, this variant showed the same associations with upregulation of ZBTB7A in relevant tissues.
title: Novel risk loci for COVID-19 hospitalization among admixed American populations

finding: The SNP rs429358, part of the APOE genotype determination, was positively associated with susceptibility to Alzheimer's disease (AD) in the context of telomere length influencing AD risk.
title: Mid-life leukocyte telomere length and dementia risk: a prospective cohort study of 435,046 UK Biobank participants

finding: The SNP rs7412, also used in determining APOE genotypes, was found to be positively associated with the risk of Alzheimer's disease (AD), alongside rs429358 within the study's focus on telomere length and AD connections.
title: Mid-life leukocyte telomere length and dementia risk: a prospective cohort study of 435,046 UK Biobank participants

finding: The SNP rs8108669 was identified as the most significant SNP affecting the expression of the CD37 gene in B cells, CD4 cells, and CD8 cells using the IBSEP method. It was associated with the upregulation of CD37 expression, which correlates with its role in immune responses and its established association with systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE). Evidence indicated that rs8108669-C governs transcriptional regulation of CD37 in these cell types.
title: A unified framework for cell-type-specific eQTLs prioritization by integrating bulk and scRNA-seq data

finding: The SNP rs1465697 was highlighted as the lead SNP at the CD37 locus involved in multiple sclerosis (MS), demonstrating high colocalization with the CD37 gene in B cells, CD4 cells, CD8 cells, and monocytes with a posterior probability exceeding 0.98. Its significance was supported by epigenomic evidence, marking it as closely associated with the CD37 promoter region.
title: A unified framework for cell-type-specific eQTLs prioritization by integrating bulk and scRNA-seq data

finding: The rs4801778 variant was linked to reported SARS-CoV-2 infection and coincided with various red blood cell-associated GWAS loci, indicating its potential role in infection susceptibility.
title: Genetic Examination of Hematological Parameters in SARS-CoV-2 Infection and COVID-19

finding: The rs74956615 variant was associated with severe illness and hospitalization due to COVID-19, showing coincidence with GWAS signals for lymphocyte and platelet phenotypes, highlighting its involvement in immune response and thrombosis.
title: Genetic Examination of Hematological Parameters in SARS-CoV-2 Infection and COVID-19

finding: The SNP rs72999063, located about 400kb upstream of the ATP13A1 gene, was also significantly associated with adult BMI (beta=0.09 kg/m², P=3.2×10^-13), and supported by expression levels of ATP13A1.
title: Protein-truncating variants in BSN are associated with severe adult-onset obesity, type 2 diabetes and fatty liver disease

finding: The minor allele of APOE SNP rs429358 was associated with reduced expression of APOE and adjacent genes APOC2 and CLPTM1, with p-values of 5.61x10^-4 and 0.017 respectively, supporting its role in AD.
title: Transcriptome-wide association study of Alzheimer disease reveals many differentially expressed genes and multiple biological pathways in brain tissue from African American donors

finding: The rs429358 variant associated with the APOE-ε4 haplotype was initially linked to Covid-19 susceptibility with an odds ratio (OR) of 1.38, but later analyses showed decreased significance and lack of replication.
title: A year of Covid-19 GWAS results from the GRASP portal reveals potential SARS-CoV-2 modifiers

finding: The rs73005873 variant in MUC16 was associated with Covid-19 susceptibility, suggesting implications for immune function.
title: A year of Covid-19 GWAS results from the GRASP portal reveals potential SARS-CoV-2 modifiers

finding: The rs7255633 variant was associated with the Tanner 2 to Tanner 4 transition in girls and served as an eQTL and sQTL across numerous tissues. It was connected to genes previously linked to educational attainment, implicating its role in brain functions related to sexual maturation.
title: Joint models reveal genetic architecture of transitions between pubertal stages and their association with BMI in a Latino population

finding: This SNP was linked to LDLR plasma protein levels, with its significant effect observed only in STEMI patients at 24 hours (genotype x t24h interaction β=-0.29, p=0.022), suggesting its time-dependent influence on protein levels associated with cardiovascular outcomes.
title: Single-cell dissection of the immune response after acute myocardial infarction

finding: For rs10411210 at 19q13.11, a significant association was observed, with results indicating an OR of 1.24 (95% CI: 1.009-1.52, P=0.0412), consistent with earlier research linking this SNP to colorectal cancer risk.
title: Colorectal Cancer Risk and Ancestry in Colombian admixed Populations

finding: The SNP rs429358 exhibited genome-wide significant association with Alzheimer's disease (AD) in both the Asian and Hispanic cohorts within the TOPMed-r2 study.
title: A Specialized Reference Panel with Structural Variants Integration for Improving Genotype Imputation in Alzheimer’s Disease and Related Dementias (ADRD)

finding: Located intergenically at 19p13.12, this variant was linked to eGFR and sRAGE and was a significant finding in gene expression associated with kidney function as per GWAS.
title: Discovery of genomic and transcriptomic pleiotropy between kidney function and soluble receptor for advanced glycation end-products using correlated meta-analyses: The Long Life Family Study (LLFS)

finding: Identified in the 19p13.3 locus, rs2109069 was significantly associated with hospitalized COVID-19, contributing to the understanding of host genetic susceptibility.
title: Single cell sequencing analysis uncovers genetics-influenced CD16+monocytes and memory CD8+T cells involved in severe COVID-19

finding: The rs12979860-T allele in IFNL4 demonstrated a significant association with viral hepatitis and cirrhosis in the HA group. This allele was previously identified as a risk factor for severe COVID-19, with a lower frequency observed in COVID-19 patients compared to healthy controls.
title: A comprehensive knowledgebase of known and predicted human genetic variants associated with COVID-19 susceptibility and severity

finding: In the context of Alzheimer's disease (AD), the SNP rs429358 was reported to show significant association with AD, with an effect size comparable to the TREM2.pR47H variant. Its association was determined through calculations including false discovery rates, indicating a strong genetic link to AD risk.
title: Polygenic risk score analysis identifies deleterious protein-coding variants in novel immune pathway genes ATP8B4, FCGR1A, and LILRB1 that associate with Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The locus near APOC2, with the lead variant rs4803778, was significantly associated with cerebral amyloid angiopathy (CAA), maintaining significance after adjusting for APOE genotype (OR = 1.24, p = 5.8 × 10-12). This variant was linked to DNA methylation changes in the cerebral cortex, suggesting a mechanism by which genetic predisposition may influence CAA.
title: Genome-wide association study of multiple neuropathology endophenotypes identifies novel risk loci and provides insights into known Alzheimer’s risk loci

finding: The rs1065853 SNP, located in a known enhancer of APOE, was identified to have a genome-wide significant interaction effect with sex on lipid levels across 110 metabolites. This interaction demonstrated opposite effects on phospholipid concentrations in men and women, highlighting its importance in understanding sex-specific metabolic responses. The SNP is well-known for its association with various metabolic and clinical outcomes, including Alzheimer’s disease (AD) and coronary artery disease (CAD).
title: Pleiotropic and sex-specific genetic architecture of circulating metabolic markers

finding: The SNP rs56113850 was identified as a top SNP associated with faster nicotine metabolism, contributing significantly to the nicotine metabolite ratio (NMR). It was linked to increased levels of cholesterol, triglycerides, and poor cardiovascular health indicators. The C allele of this SNP was shown to associate with higher odds of quitting smoking and quitting at a younger age, indicating its role in nicotine metabolism could influence smoking behavior despite conflicting evidence from previous studies.
title: A Phenome-wide association study of genetically determined nicotine metabolism reveals novel links with health-related outcomes

finding: The polymorphism rs2288904-G/A in the SLC44A2 gene was identified as a risk factor for venous thromboembolism (VTE). This finding emerged from recent genome-wide association studies and murine studies, illustrating the significant role of the choline transporter-like protein CTL2 in platelet aggregation and neutrophil interaction with von Willebrand factor.
title: Lack of the human choline transporter-like protein CTL2 causes hearing impairment and a rare red blood cell phenotype

finding: The study reported a significant association of rs201680145, a missense variant p.Arg1231Cys in NOTCH3, with subcortical hemorrhagic stroke, displaying an odds ratio (OR) of 3.39 and a p value of 3.87×10^-9. This variant was also associated with all strokes combined (OR 2.18, p value 4.44×10^-8). Furthermore, it was noted that this variant explained approximately 5.5% of hemorrhagic strokes in South Asians.
title: NOTCH3 p.Arg1231Cys is Markedly Enriched in South Asians and Associated with Stroke

finding: The rs8111424 SNP at the UNC13A locus was identified as the strongest overall FTLD-TDP risk factor with an odds ratio (OR) of 1.37 and a P-value of 1.17×10^-8, indicating its significant role in the disease.
title: Deciphering Distinct Genetic Risk Factors for FTLD-TDP Pathological Subtypes via Whole-Genome Sequencing

finding: The rs12973192 SNP at the UNC13A locus was recognized as genome-wide significant specifically in FTLD-TDP B, being in linkage disequilibrium with rs8111424, thus reinforcing UNC13A's role in FTLD-TDP risk.
title: Deciphering Distinct Genetic Risk Factors for FTLD-TDP Pathological Subtypes via Whole-Genome Sequencing

finding: The rs576561313 SNP at the C19orf52 locus was found to be genome-wide significant in FTLD-TDP C, highlighting its role within this subtype.
title: Deciphering Distinct Genetic Risk Factors for FTLD-TDP Pathological Subtypes via Whole-Genome Sequencing

finding: The rs12608932 SNP at the UNC13A locus was confirmed as the most significant single nucleotide variant in the meta-analysis, associated with an increased risk for FTLD-TDP, due to its impact on cryptic splicing and UNC13A protein levels.
title: Deciphering Distinct Genetic Risk Factors for FTLD-TDP Pathological Subtypes via Whole-Genome Sequencing

finding: The SNP rs2455069 was identified as a cis-SNP located on chromosome 19, associated with changes in the protein CD33. The presence of the G allele at this SNP led to a missense mutation (R69G), changing Arginine to Glycine at position 69. This structural alteration in CD33 was predicted by AlphaFold3 and suggested a local change that could contribute to an increased risk of Alzheimer's disease, as CD33 has been implicated in the accumulation of amyloid plaques in the brain.
title: Deciphering causal proteins in Alzheimer’s disease: A novel Mendelian randomization method integrated with AlphaFold3 for 3D structure prediction

finding: The study found that individuals who were APOE ε4 homozygotes displayed a greater hippocampus ROI age (HA) gap compared to non-carriers of the APOE ε4 allele. This finding indicated a correlation between the rs7412 SNP genotype and accelerated brain aging as measured by the HA gap, suggesting its relevance as a biomarker for health.
title: Deep learning-derived age of hippocampus-centred regions is influenced by APOE genotype and modifiable risk factors

finding: Similar to rs7412, the rs429358 SNP was associated with the APOE ε4 homozygote phenotype, which exhibited a higher annual change rate in the left HA gap compared to APOE ε2 homozygotes. This result emphasized the SNP's role in brain aging processes and its significance in understanding the implications of the APOE genotype on health.
title: Deep learning-derived age of hippocampus-centred regions is influenced by APOE genotype and modifiable risk factors

finding: The <italic>APOE</italic> Christchurch variant (rs121918393) exhibited a nominally significant effect on age at onset (AAO) of Alzheimer's disease (AD), indicating a potential role in delaying dementia onset, although the effect size was modest.
title: Genetic Associations with Age at Dementia Onset in the PSEN1 E280A Colombian Kindred

finding: The variant rs429358, part of the <italic>APOE</italic> gene known for its influence on AD risk, showed consistent genotyping results and was linked to lower polygenic risk scores associated with later age of onset.
title: Genetic Associations with Age at Dementia Onset in the PSEN1 E280A Colombian Kindred

finding: Similar to rs429358, rs7412 also matched imputed and directly genotyped results, affirming its role in the <italic>APOE</italic> allele classification and association with later AAO.
title: Genetic Associations with Age at Dementia Onset in the PSEN1 E280A Colombian Kindred

finding: The SNP rs5167 demonstrated a statistically significant causal effect on GCA risk in the PheWAS analysis, similarly matching the direction of the variant's direct association with GCA.
title: Exploration of the circulating human secretome through protein quantitative trait analysis identifies an association between circulating levels of apolipoprotein L1 and risk of giant cell arteritis

finding: The study identified the variant rs429358 in the APOE gene, corresponding to the APOE4 haplotype, in 26% (16 out of 61) of patients diagnosed with Mesoamerican Nephropathy (MeN). The presence of this haplotype was linked to significantly elevated uric acid levels in the affected patients compared to those without the variant, suggesting its role as a genetic risk factor essential for hyperuricemia in MeN.
title: Exome Analysis Points APOE4 Haplotype as Major Risk to Develop Mesoamerican Nephropathy

finding: The SNP rs1613662 at the 19q13.42 locus demonstrated a significant association with basophil count (BASO) and venous thromboembolism (VTE). It was associated with an adipose visceral omentum eQTL, impacting collagen receptor GPVI/FcRγ activity, which is crucial for platelet activation linked to VTE risk.
title: Unveiling Shared Genetic Links between Blood Cell Traits and Cardiovascular Diseases

finding: The SNP rs116843064, located in the 19p13.2 region, exhibited the highest combined annotation-dependent depletion (CADD) score of 33. It was part of a set of SNPs linked to regulatory functions, indicating its potential significant impact on gene expression.
title: Unveiling Shared Genetic Links between Blood Cell Traits and Cardiovascular Diseases

finding: The SNP rs6511703 was one of the highlighted SNPs with significant regulatory potential, suggesting its involvement in the complex genetic landscape impacting blood cell traits and risk for cardiovascular diseases.
title: Unveiling Shared Genetic Links between Blood Cell Traits and Cardiovascular Diseases

finding: The SNP rs892090 in the GP6 gene demonstrated strong colocalization across various trait pairs, particularly in contexts linking platelets and cardiovascular diseases, reinforcing its significance in the pleiotropic relationship observed.
title: Unveiling Shared Genetic Links between Blood Cell Traits and Cardiovascular Diseases

finding: The rs7412 SNP was associated with the APOE ε2 allele, which was found to be protective against incident Alzheimer’s disease. This protective effect indicated its influence on genetic susceptibility to Alzheimer's disease.
title: Associations of Alzheimer’s disease with inpatient hospital costs and with quality-adjusted life years: Evidence from conventional and Mendelian randomization analyses in the UK Biobank

finding: The rs429358 SNP was linked to the APOE ε4 allele, which increased the risk of Alzheimer’s disease. This demonstrated its significant role in genetic susceptibility to the disorder.
title: Associations of Alzheimer’s disease with inpatient hospital costs and with quality-adjusted life years: Evidence from conventional and Mendelian randomization analyses in the UK Biobank

finding: The rs2108622 variant (V433M) in the CYP4F2 gene was found significant in the Yadav group, suggesting that carriers of this variant require a higher warfarin dosage.
title: Endogamy and high prevalence of deleterious mutations in India: evidence from strong founder events

finding: This SNP was recognized as a lead variant and nominated as a putative causal variant for adiponectin levels.
title: A multi-ancestry genome-wide meta-analysis, fine-mapping, and gene prioritization approach to characterize the genetic architecture of adiponectin

finding: A strong genetic signal (PP=96.1%) was identified between rs2288480 and multiple sclerosis (MS), with high linkage disequilibrium (r^2=0.97) with the lead variant for MS at 19q13.33.
title: From genome to phenome via the proteome: broad capture, antibody-based proteomics to explore disease mechanisms

finding: rs66532151 was identified as an independent secondary cis-pQTL associated with DKKL1 and was linked to multiple sclerosis outcomes (p-value=3.4×10^-7), hinting at its role in B-cell dynamics.
title: From genome to phenome via the proteome: broad capture, antibody-based proteomics to explore disease mechanisms

finding: The SNP rs405509 was identified as a risk allele (T/T) in the context of Alzheimer's disease (AD). It was associated with the thickness of specific brain regions, particularly the left parahippocampal gyrus, in older cognitively healthy individuals. This finding illustrated the importance of genetic factors, beyond the well-known APOE-ε4 allele, in influencing brain structure alterations associated with AD.
title: Compositional structural brain signatures capture Alzheimer’s genetic risk on brain structure along the disease continuum

finding: The study found that the APOE genotype, derived from the SNP rs7412, was associated with risk factors for incident all-cause dementia (ACD). This SNP was validated through a population-based approach involving a large cohort from the English Longitudinal Study of Ageing (ELSA) and further replication in the UK Biobank (UKB), indicating its potential as a biomarker for early dementia risk.
title: Unraveling the role of plasma proteins in dementia: insights from two cohort studies in the UK, with causal evidence from Mendelian randomization

finding: Similar to rs7412, the SNP rs429358 was linked to the APOE genotype which demonstrated associations with incident ACD. It was part of the proteome-wide analysis in the study, and its findings were supported by the substantial validation across the ELSA and UKB cohorts, reinforcing its relevance in identifying dementia risk.
title: Unraveling the role of plasma proteins in dementia: insights from two cohort studies in the UK, with causal evidence from Mendelian randomization

finding: The variant rs147110934, a predicted missense variant within ZNF628, was found associated with both FEV1 and FVC in Europeans, although it had not been previously linked to pulmonary function specifically.
title: Genome-wide Association Study of Pulmonary Function in Europeans and Africans from the UK Biobank Identifies Distinct Variants

finding: The analysis identified rs429358 as a significant tile variant within the APOE haplotype, demonstrating a strong association with Alzheimer's Disease risk and progression. The corresponding statistical significance was represented by the lowest p-value observed in the study, corroborating findings from previous GWAS studies related to AD.
title: Discovering Genetic Signatures Associated with Alzheimer’s Disease in Tiled Whole Genome Sequence Data: Results from the Artificial Intelligence for Alzheimer’s Disease (AI4AD) Consortium

finding: It was found that rs769455, when interacting with rs429358 on the same tile variant, increased the risk of Alzheimer's Disease among individuals with the ε3/ε4 genotype. This interaction highlighted its role as a potential genetic signature for AD risk, demonstrating increased encoding value when combined with rs429358.
title: Discovering Genetic Signatures Associated with Alzheimer’s Disease in Tiled Whole Genome Sequence Data: Results from the Artificial Intelligence for Alzheimer’s Disease (AI4AD) Consortium

finding: The study accounted for the impact of rs7412, alongside rs429358, in the regression model to assess additional associations with Alzheimer's Disease. The incorporation of this SNP helped to adjust the baseline model for known effects of APOE genotypes, thereby enabling a better understanding of other potential genetic influences.
title: Discovering Genetic Signatures Associated with Alzheimer’s Disease in Tiled Whole Genome Sequence Data: Results from the Artificial Intelligence for Alzheimer’s Disease (AI4AD) Consortium

finding: Carriage of the epsilon 3 and/or epsilon 4 alleles at the APOE locus, specifically including SNP rs7412, was associated with a significantly increased risk of late-onset Alzheimer's disease (AD), with an odds ratio of 3.80 compared to epsilon 2 homozygotes. This finding indicated that the genetic variation at this locus accounted for an estimated 73.6% of the AD burden in the studied population.
title: The proportion of Alzheimer’s disease attributable to Apolipoprotein E

finding: Similar to rs7412, carriage of the epsilon 3 and/or epsilon 4 alleles at the APOE locus, notably including SNP rs429358, was linked to an increased risk of all-cause dementia, with an odds ratio of 1.74. The study found that this genetic contribution accounted for approximately 42.4% of the dementia burden in the participants, emphasizing the significance of these SNPs in understanding dementia risk.
title: The proportion of Alzheimer’s disease attributable to Apolipoprotein E

finding: The rs429358 SNP was associated with Aβ42 and pTau levels in cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) linked to the APOE ε4 allele, which decreased Aβ42 (Z=-36.29; p=2.0×10^-288) and increased pTau (Z=18.31; p=6.87×10^-75).
title: Genome-wide meta-analysis for Alzheimer’s disease cerebrospinal fluid biomarkers

finding: The rs7412 SNP was linked to Aβ42 and pTau levels through the APOE ε2 haplotype, which increased Aβ42 (Z=11.97; p=5.09×10^-33) while decreasing pTau (Z=-6.59; p=4.49×10^-11).
title: Genome-wide meta-analysis for Alzheimer’s disease cerebrospinal fluid biomarkers

finding: This SNP was associated with Aβ42 levels in high linkage disequilibrium with rs429358, showing a significant relationship (Z=-25.51; p=1.57×10^-143).
title: Genome-wide meta-analysis for Alzheimer’s disease cerebrospinal fluid biomarkers

finding: rs769449 was positively associated with pTau, also linked to the APOE locus and found to have significant impact (Z=13.83; p=1.66×10^-43).
title: Genome-wide meta-analysis for Alzheimer’s disease cerebrospinal fluid biomarkers

finding: The SNP rs7412 was also linked to the APOE genotype, contributing to the determination of APOE-carrier status. Similar to rs239358, this finding highlighted its importance in assessing cognitive functions and their interaction with anticholinergic drug burden, showing that the genetic background could influence cognitive decline and dementia outcomes.
title: Anticholinergic burden in middle and older age is associated with lower cognitive function, but not with brain atrophy

finding: The SNP rs56113850 on chromosome 19 was identified as the top SNP associated with faster nicotine metabolism, explaining 23% of the variance in the nicotine metabolite ratio (NMR) based on a prior Meta GWAS. It was associated with increased odds of quitting smoking, indicating that genetically determined faster nicotine metabolism might facilitate cessation efforts.
title: A Phenome-wide association study of genetically determined nicotine metabolism reveals novel links with health-related outcomes

finding: The SNP rs72658867 was associated with lower cholesterol and a lower risk of coronary artery disease. In the context of hyperlipidaemia, it showed a protective effect with an odds ratio (OR) of 0.86, indicating that individuals with this variant had a reduced risk. This variant had a frequency of 0.012 in controls and 0.0097 in cases. When the analysis was adjusted to exclude this variant, splice region variants did not show a consistent association with risk, demonstrating its significant role in lipid levels.
title: Analysis of 200,000 exome-sequenced UK Biobank subjects illustrates the contribution of rare genetic variants to hyperlipidaemia

finding: The marker rs56113850 was associated with nicotine metabolism at genome-wide significance in smokers of European ancestry, which made it highly relevant to the prediction of nicotine metabolite ratio (NMR) across all models.
title: Predicting Nicotine Metabolism Across Ancestries Using Genotypes

finding: The marker rs11878604 was associated with NMR at genome-wide significance in smokers of African ancestry. It was identified as an independent signal and was also ranked among the most important predictors in multiple models.
title: Predicting Nicotine Metabolism Across Ancestries Using Genotypes

finding: The marker rs12459249 was associated at genome-wide significance and was top ranked in the METS meta-GWAS. It was identified as an independent signal in conditional analysis of African American treatment-seeking smokers.
title: Predicting Nicotine Metabolism Across Ancestries Using Genotypes

finding: Markers rs116921376 and rs11878604 were implicated in tobacco-related consequences, such as lung cancer and chronic obstructive pulmonary disease.
title: Predicting Nicotine Metabolism Across Ancestries Using Genotypes

finding: This SNP was found to be significantly associated with lower Apolipoprotein B, LDL, total cholesterol, and a lower risk of lipoprotein metabolism disorder (ICD10: E78) across multiple ancestries.
title: Whole-genome sequencing of half-a-million UK Biobank participants

finding: This SNP displayed a correlation with increased risk of dementia and various cognitive disorders, as well as associations with lower levels of C-reactive protein and decreased risk of liver disease (ICD10: K70-K77).
title: Whole-genome sequencing of half-a-million UK Biobank participants

finding: This common synonymous variant was associated with kidney calculus, showing that rare coding and non-coding variants can extend known associations.
title: Whole-genome sequencing of half-a-million UK Biobank participants

finding: The SNP rs7245416 regulated the protein levels of CD97 and EMR2, indicating its influence on several proteins while demonstrating pleiotropy.
title: Genetic analysis of blood molecular phenotypes reveals regulatory networks affecting complex traits: a DIRECT study

finding: The study identified that participants with the APOE e4 allele, classified by the rs7412 SNP, had a significant association with higher risks of incident dementia. Being an e4 carrier was correlated with an elevated risk, suggesting that this genetic factor was a critical modifiable risk marker for dementia.
title: Joint association of daytime sleep behaviors and dietary quality with the risk of dementia: A large prospective cohort study

finding: Similar to rs7412, the rs429358 SNP related to the APOE gene also indicated a significant connection with increased risks of developing dementia. Carriers of the e4 allele, defined by this SNP, were shown to have a notably higher likelihood of dementia, reinforcing the importance of genetic predisposition in dementia risk assessments.
title: Joint association of daytime sleep behaviors and dietary quality with the risk of dementia: A large prospective cohort study

finding: This SNP was also found to have proxy relationships that preserved its potential relevance to the research outcomes.
title: Causal effects of maternal circulating amino acids on offspring birthweight: a Mendelian randomisation study

finding: The low-frequency European-specific intronic variant rs752383928 was associated with serum urate levels more strongly in males than in females, with males showing an effect size (se) of 2.70 (p-value = 1.33×10^-50) compared to females who had an effect size of 1.63 with a p-value of 2.43×10^-8. This finding was consistent with previous studies (Sulem et al., 2011).
title: Global Biobank Meta-analysis Initiative: powering genetic discovery across human diseases

finding: The COVID-19 associated variant rs74956615 within the TYK2 gene conferred increased risk for critical illness (OR [95%] = 1.43 [1.29, 1.59]; P = 9.71 × 10-12) and hospitalization (OR [95%CI] = 1.27 [1.18, 1.36]; P = 5.05 × 10-10).
title: Mapping the human genetic architecture of COVID-19 by worldwide meta-analysis

finding: Missense variant rs34536443 in TYK2 was correlated with the risk for severe illness in COVID-19 and previously reported as protective against autoimmune diseases.
title: Mapping the human genetic architecture of COVID-19 by worldwide meta-analysis

finding: The independent missense variant rs2304256 in TYK2 was associated with critical illness due to COVID-19 (OR [95%] = 1.17 [1.11, 1.23]; P = 2.4 × 10-10).
title: Mapping the human genetic architecture of COVID-19 by worldwide meta-analysis

finding: Lead variant rs4801778 at the PPP1R15A locus was significantly associated with reported infection (OR [95%CI] = 0.95 [0.93, 0.96]; P = 2.1 × 10-8) and is linked to a missense variant associated with reticulocyte count.
title: Mapping the human genetic architecture of COVID-19 by worldwide meta-analysis

finding: The missense variant rs11541192 in PPP1R15A was associated with reticulocyte counts and indicated linkages to COVID-19 outcomes.
title: Mapping the human genetic architecture of COVID-19 by worldwide meta-analysis

finding: Variant rs56104184 was associated with reticulocyte count and demonstrated strong correlation with variants linked to COVID-19 severity.
title: Mapping the human genetic architecture of COVID-19 by worldwide meta-analysis

finding: The intronic variant rs2109069 in DPP9 was positively associated with critical illness and previously reported as a risk-increasing variant for interstitial lung disease.
title: Mapping the human genetic architecture of COVID-19 by worldwide meta-analysis

finding: The tag variant rs12610495 in DPP9 was previously reported as risk-increasing for interstitial lung disease (OR = 1.29, P =2.0 × 10-12).
title: Mapping the human genetic architecture of COVID-19 by worldwide meta-analysis

finding: The SNP rs7254729 was identified as associated with lower risk of thyroid autoimmune disease but higher risk of basal cell carcinoma, illustrating an antagonistic effect in immune-related traits.
title: Extensive antagonistic variants across human genome

finding: The study evaluated the Apo E4 genotype, defined by rs429358, as a covariate in the analysis of retinal vascular measures and their association with dementia risk.
