It was included in the Cox proportional hazards models to account for its potential effect on the incidence of all-cause dementia and dementia subtypes.
title: Retinal Vascular Measures from Diabetes Retinal Screening Photographs and Risk of Incident Dementia in Type 2 Diabetes: A GoDARTS Study

finding: The rs45524632 SNP at the KEAP1 locus exhibited significant effect size heterogeneity in relation to heel bone mineral density T-score, with a β-value of -0.042 and a p-value of 2.59×10^−5. This indicates a potential link between bone health and COVID-19 severity, reflecting broader genetic implications.
title: Host genetic liability for severe COVID-19 overlaps with alcohol drinking behavior and diabetic outcomes and in over 1 million participants

finding: The SNP rs10422256 was found to affect LDLR plasma protein levels uniquely in STEMI patients at t24h, with a genotype x time interaction effect size of \u03B2=-0.29 and a p-value of 0.022. This highlights its significance in the context of acute stages of STEMI.
title: Single-cell dissection of the immune response after acute myocardial infarction

finding: The SNP rs7412, located within the APOE locus on chromosome 19, demonstrated extremely strong marginal associations with low-density lipoprotein cholesterol (LDL-C) across multiple populations including UKBB, BBJ, and PAGE. The P-values associated with these associations were all less than 1E-200, indicating a highly significant relationship between rs7412 and LDL-C levels. This finding highlighted the effectiveness of PRS-CSx in accurately estimating effect sizes by integrating GWAS summary statistics across diverse populations.
title: Improving Polygenic Prediction in Ancestrally Diverse Populations

finding: The SNP rs115550680 in ABCA7 was reported as genome-wide significant (p=1.17×10^-8) in the analysis combining MVP and ADGC datasets.
title: African Ancestry GWAS of Dementia in a Large Military Cohort Identifies Significant Risk Loci

finding: The SNP rs73505251 in ABCA7 reached genome-wide significant association (p=3.26×10^-10) in the combined analysis.
title: African Ancestry GWAS of Dementia in a Large Military Cohort Identifies Significant Risk Loci

finding: The SNP rs73505232 in ABCA7 achieved significant association (p=4.40×10^-10) in the analysis.
title: African Ancestry GWAS of Dementia in a Large Military Cohort Identifies Significant Risk Loci

finding: The SNP rs59851484 in ABCA7 demonstrated significant association (p=3.22×10^-8) in the study.
title: African Ancestry GWAS of Dementia in a Large Military Cohort Identifies Significant Risk Loci

finding: The SNP rs34606911 was identified as an eQTL associated with ABCA7 expression, achieving p=9.16×10^-7 in the analysis.
title: African Ancestry GWAS of Dementia in a Large Military Cohort Identifies Significant Risk Loci

finding: The rs429358 SNP was found to be associated with the presence of the APOE-ε4 allele, which was shown to significantly affect Aβ plaque deposition in the entorhinal cortex and hippocampus, regions especially vulnerable to tau deposition. This association contributed to insights about how APOE-ε4 increases the prevalence of Alzheimer's disease by promoting tau spreading in the medial temporal lobe.
title: Age, sex and APOE-ε4 modify the balance between soluble and fibrillar β-amyloid in cognitively intact individuals: topographical patterns and replication across two independent cohorts

finding: The rs7412 SNP was likewise associated with the APOE-ε4 allele classification, highlighting its role in the genetic underpinning of Alzheimer's disease. Its interaction with age and sex further deepened the understanding of how genetic risk factors can influence Aβ accumulation in specific brain areas.
title: Age, sex and APOE-ε4 modify the balance between soluble and fibrillar β-amyloid in cognitively intact individuals: topographical patterns and replication across two independent cohorts

finding: The variant rs541048548 (c.1053del/p.A352fs) was identified only in severe Covid-19 patients and associated with the ICAM3 gene, which plays a critical role in the immunopathogenesis of SARS virus. It had previously been reported that ICAM3 expression is downregulated in asymptomatic Covid-19 cases compared to symptomatic patients.
title: Rare Variants in Inborn Errors of Immunity Genes Associated with Covid-19 Severity

finding: The SNP rs769450 had four nearby located hubs, including APOE, which was found in both excitatory and inhibitory neurons. Although rs769450 has been associated with the epsilon 4 allele of APOE, it was highlighted that this SNP does not influence the abundance of the APOE protein or transcript.
title: Single-cell RNA sequencing data reveals rewiring of transcriptional relationships in Alzheimer’s Disease associated with risk variants

finding: SNP rs9304690 was linked with the potassium channel gene KCNC3, which has been associated with Alzheimer's and other neurological disorders.
title: Single-cell RNA sequencing data reveals rewiring of transcriptional relationships in Alzheimer’s Disease associated with risk variants

finding: The SNP rs12610495 was highlighted as a suggestive susceptibility locus for severe COVID-19 and associated with idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis. It was noted as an eQTL for DPP9 in lung tissue, where the 'G' allele corresponded to lower DPP9 expression. Colocalization analysis confirmed shared signals with a posterior probability of 0.994, proposing that DPP9 may influence both COVID-19 severity and idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis.
title: An atlas connecting shared genetic architecture of human diseases and molecular phenotypes provides insight into COVID-19 susceptibility

finding: The SNP rs4806498 near MBOAT7 was identified in previous studies as associated with liver fat.
title: Genome-wide association study of liver fat, iron, and extracellular fluid fraction in the UK Biobank

finding: The splice region association rs200744015 at TMEM161A was found to associate with liver fat.
title: Genome-wide association study of liver fat, iron, and extracellular fluid fraction in the UK Biobank

finding: This SNP, located in GDF15, was the most significant risk locus for hyperemesis gravidarum (HG). It was strongly associated with lower circulating levels of GDF15 and showed opposite allele effects for HG risk between mother and fetus.
title: Multi-ancestry GWAS of severe pregnancy nausea and vomiting identifies risk loci associated with appetite, insulin signaling, and brain plasticity

finding: The T allele of rs12979860 was found to be overrepresented in COVID-19 patients (36.16%) compared to the control population (26.40%), with a p-value of 6.4x10^-4 and an odds ratio (OR) of 0.633, suggesting that this allele could be a risk factor for developing COVID-19. Additionally, the CC genotype frequency was significantly lower in COVID-19 patients (37.85%) compared to controls (55.51%), with a p-value of 8x10^-5 and an OR of 0.488. These findings indicated a possible predisposition to COVID-19 based on the genetic variants of IFNL4.
title: IFNL4 genetic variant can predispose to COVID-19

finding: This SNP was part of the novel loci discovered in the study, providing insights into the genetic underpinnings of ocular conditions.
title: Genome-wide analysis of genetic pleiotropy and causal genes across three age-related ocular disorders

finding: The SNP rs351973 was associated with a regional promoter interaction and linked to genes that when knocked down in models, resulted in beneficial transformations of retinal cells.
title: Genome-wide analysis of genetic pleiotropy and causal genes across three age-related ocular disorders

finding: The SNP rs429358 was confirmed as a well-known genetic variant associated with Alzheimer's disease (AD) in the APOE gene, demonstrating the highest importance score in the analysis.
title: Linkage Disequilibrium-Informed Deep Learning Framework to Identify Genetic Loci for Alzheimer’s Disease Using Whole Genome Sequencing Data

finding: The SNP rs769449, another established variant in the APOE gene, was also confirmed as being associated with Alzheimer's disease and was part of the findings.
title: Linkage Disequilibrium-Informed Deep Learning Framework to Identify Genetic Loci for Alzheimer’s Disease Using Whole Genome Sequencing Data

finding: The variant rs11556505 in the TOMM40 gene was identified as having a high importance score, further supporting chromosome 19's relevance in Alzheimer's disease risk.
title: Linkage Disequilibrium-Informed Deep Learning Framework to Identify Genetic Loci for Alzheimer’s Disease Using Whole Genome Sequencing Data

finding: The SNP rs34342646 located within NECTIN2 was highlighted for its significant association with Alzheimer's disease, thus reaffirming its relevance in the genetic architecture of the condition.
title: Linkage Disequilibrium-Informed Deep Learning Framework to Identify Genetic Loci for Alzheimer’s Disease Using Whole Genome Sequencing Data

finding: The SNP rs10414043 found within the APOC1 gene was confirmed as associated with Alzheimer's disease in this study.
title: Linkage Disequilibrium-Informed Deep Learning Framework to Identify Genetic Loci for Alzheimer’s Disease Using Whole Genome Sequencing Data

finding: The SNP rs10119, also located in APOC1, was identified as a confirmed variant associated with Alzheimer's disease.
title: Linkage Disequilibrium-Informed Deep Learning Framework to Identify Genetic Loci for Alzheimer’s Disease Using Whole Genome Sequencing Data

finding: The variant rs71352238 in the TOMM40 gene was acknowledged as an AD-associated SNP in the analysis.
title: Linkage Disequilibrium-Informed Deep Learning Framework to Identify Genetic Loci for Alzheimer’s Disease Using Whole Genome Sequencing Data

finding: The SNP rs66626994, located in APOC1P1, was identified as a previously unreported variant associated with Alzheimer's disease.
title: Linkage Disequilibrium-Informed Deep Learning Framework to Identify Genetic Loci for Alzheimer’s Disease Using Whole Genome Sequencing Data

finding: The study identified rs150593211 in the ABCA7 gene, which was different from previously reported variants, indicating new findings in Alzheimer's genetic risk.
title: Linkage Disequilibrium-Informed Deep Learning Framework to Identify Genetic Loci for Alzheimer’s Disease Using Whole Genome Sequencing Data

finding: The SNP rs601338 was part of the FUT2 locus and represented a stop-gain variant that correlated with increased risk of chronic sputum production. It was functionally annotated, highlighting its role in altering gene expression.
title: Genome-wide association study of chronic sputum production implicates loci involved in mucus production and infection

finding: The sentinel variant rs492602 at the FUT2 locus was associated with chronic sputum production risk, lung function measures FEV1/FVC, and PEF. It had complex tissue-dependent expression, influencing several surrounding genes.
title: Genome-wide association study of chronic sputum production implicates loci involved in mucus production and infection

finding: The SNP rs602662 at the FUT2 locus led to a missense variant associated with chronic sputum production risk. It exhibited a positive correlation with chronic sputum production and interacted with other variants in Mendelian analyses.
title: Genome-wide association study of chronic sputum production implicates loci involved in mucus production and infection

finding: The SNP rs681343 was associated with chronic sputum production risk and linked to responses affecting human polyomavirus infection. It was in high linkage disequilibrium with rs492602, reinforcing the association with sputum production risk.
title: Genome-wide association study of chronic sputum production implicates loci involved in mucus production and infection

finding: The rs12610495-G allele in the DPP9 locus was recognized for its association with IPF risk, similar to other IPF-related COVID-19 findings.
title: Integration of GWAS and multi-omic QTLs identifies uncharacterized COVID-19 gene-biotype and phenotype associations

finding: The SNP rs429358, located in the APOE gene, was found to be associated with basal ganglia volumes. This gene is recognized for its role in Alzheimer's disease (Alz) through amyloid degradation. The CADD score for this SNP was 18.4, pointing to possible negative effects on protein function.
title: Unveiling the Genetic Landscape of Basal Ganglia: Implications for Common Brain Disorders

finding: The rs10410835 variant was functionally linked to the NECTIN2 gene, which is located in the APOE region and has demonstrated expression in regions of the brain contributing to the homeostasis of astrocytes and neurons, and synapse formation.
title: New genetic loci discovery for Alzheimer’s disease using explainable deep neural networks

finding: Similar to rs10410835, the rs11666329 SNP was also functionally linked to the NECTIN2 gene, implicating it in Alzheimer's Disease (AD) pathology.
title: New genetic loci discovery for Alzheimer’s disease using explainable deep neural networks

finding: Identified as the top variant in the analysis, rs405509 is located at the APOE promoter and is a widely reported risk factor for AD, impacting cognitive impairment in the elderly.
title: New genetic loci discovery for Alzheimer’s disease using explainable deep neural networks

finding: The rs57537848 SNP was linked to the NECTIN2 gene, consistent with the findings in the AD context.
title: New genetic loci discovery for Alzheimer’s disease using explainable deep neural networks

finding: This variant has been previously associated with AD and is linked to the apolipoprotein C1 pseudogene 1 (APOC1P1), which is also associated with the development of late-onset AD.
title: New genetic loci discovery for Alzheimer’s disease using explainable deep neural networks

finding: SNP rs4808047 showed a negative effect of -0.07 with a p-value of 5.93 x 10^-12 and was associated with the EPS15L1 gene.
title: Multi-ancestry genome-wide association study of neutrophil-lymphocyte ratio and polygenic risk score development to explore causal association with diabetic retinopathy

finding: The rs3916804-C in ERCC2 was associated with better survival (HR=0.44, 95% CI: 0.28-0.70, p=0.0027), where C/T or C/C carriers had a median survival of 13.0 years.
title: The impact of germline variants in DNA repair pathways on survival and temozolomide toxicity in adults with glioma

finding: The rs3916788-C SNP in ERCC2 exhibited improved survival relation (HR=0.62, 95% CI: 0.47-0.83, p=0.0033) for C/C genotype carriers, returning a median survival of 13.0 years.
title: The impact of germline variants in DNA repair pathways on survival and temozolomide toxicity in adults with glioma

finding: The rs144057986-C in ERCC1 showed improved survival outcomes (HR=0.58, 95% CI: 0.42-0.82, p=0.0045) with individuals carrying at least one C having a median survival of 13.3 years.
title: The impact of germline variants in DNA repair pathways on survival and temozolomide toxicity in adults with glioma

finding: The rs429358 SNP in the APOE locus was confirmed to be a genome-wide significant hit both in CSF (Effect=-0.58, P=8.36e-49) and PET analyses (Effect=0.684, P=2.00e-25). This marker was the only consistently significant SNP with opposite effects in the two analyses, indicating its strong association with Alzheimer's disease (AD) risk and amyloid levels.
title: Connecting genomic and proteomic signatures of amyloid burden in the brain

finding: The rs12151021 SNP in the ABCA7 locus reached a significant association with AD (P=3.92e-10), contributing to understanding genetic risk factors for AD.
title: Connecting genomic and proteomic signatures of amyloid burden in the brain

finding: The rs429358 variant in the APOE locus was associated with risk of COVID-19 infection, showing an odds ratio of 1.29 (P=9×10^-9). However, the association was diminished when adjusted for cardiovascular disease and Alzheimer's disease, leading to an adjusted odds ratio of 1.15 (P=0.005). This highlighted the role of comorbid conditions in shaping COVID-19 risk.
title: Genetic association analysis of SARS-CoV-2 infection in 455,838 UK Biobank participants

finding: The rs117336466 variant located in the TMEM161A gene at the 19p13.11 locus was associated with COVID-19 positivity versus negativity, yielding an odds ratio of 2.16 (P=4.5×10^-8). However, it was not associated with risks of hospitalization or severe disease among COVID-19 cases.
title: Genetic association analysis of SARS-CoV-2 infection in 455,838 UK Biobank participants

finding: Significant allele frequency differences were found for rs2109069 between COVID-19 patients and the general population, with a p-value of 0.014. This variant was previously linked to COVID-19 severity.
title: COVID-19 relevant genetic variants confirmed in an admixed population

finding: The rs1058587 SNP in the GDF-15 gene was associated with the pregnancy-specific condition Hyperemesis Gravidarum (HG) at genome-wide levels of significance. The study established that this SNP, encoding the H202D variant, interfered with GDF-15 measurement in certain immunoassays, leading to underreported levels of the D variant. This finding provided explanations for the inconsistencies in studies linking GDF-15 levels to body weight and pregnancy conditions.
title: The common H202D variant in GDF-15 does not affect its bioactivity but can significantly interfere with measurement of its circulating levels

finding: This SNP was associated with PSA levels and prostate cancer risk. Specifically, it was noted for avoiding negative biopsies in men of European ancestry.
title: Genetically Adjusted PSA Levels for Prostate Cancer Screening

finding: This SNP was linked to PSA levels in the meta-analysis of East Asian ancestry.
title: Genetically Adjusted PSA Levels for Prostate Cancer Screening

finding: This SNP demonstrated significant impact for PSA levels among the analyses.
title: Genetically Adjusted PSA Levels for Prostate Cancer Screening

finding: This SNP demonstrated heterogeneity across ancestry-specific analyses with implications for PSA levels.
title: Genetically Adjusted PSA Levels for Prostate Cancer Screening

finding: This SNP remained significant after bias correction and showed associations with prostate cancer.
title: Genetically Adjusted PSA Levels for Prostate Cancer Screening

finding: The rs429358 SNP was associated with higher cerebral blood flow among female participants, specifically linked to higher android fat percentage and genetic predisposition as indicated by the APOE ε4 carrier status.
title: APOE4 and Chronic Health Risk Factors are Associated with Sex-Specific Preclinical Alzheimer’s Disease Neuroimaging Biomarkers

finding: The rs7412 SNP was also implicated in the same context as rs429358, contributing to the model of genetic risk for Alzheimer's disease, where it influenced cerebral blood flow in relation to sex-specific health factors.
title: APOE4 and Chronic Health Risk Factors are Associated with Sex-Specific Preclinical Alzheimer’s Disease Neuroimaging Biomarkers

finding: The SNP rs17751061 was recognized as a novel locus with a high CADD score and was predicted to be pathogenic by various tools.
title: Deep representation learning of electrocardiogram reveals novel insights in cardiac structure and functions and connections to cardiovascular diseases

finding: The SNP rs71353000 was another variant identified among the novel loci with implications in cardiac biology.
title: Deep representation learning of electrocardiogram reveals novel insights in cardiac structure and functions and connections to cardiovascular diseases

finding: This SNP was identified at the 19q13.32 locus serving as an eQTL for the nearby gene EML2 in cerebellar hemispheres, indicating a potential regulatory role in depression and weight.
title: Multi-trait genetic analysis identifies novel pleiotropic loci for depression and SCZ in East Asians

finding: The SNP rs6859 in the NECTIN2 gene was significantly associated with Alzheimer's disease (AD) risk, where each increase in dose of the A allele resulted in an approximate increase of 0.144 per standard deviation of pTau-181 (95% CI: 0.041, 0.248, p<0.01). In models adjusting for various covariates, carriers of the AA genotype had a 7.9% higher probability of being classified with AD compared to those with the GG genotype, confirming a positive and original finding regarding the relationship between the rs6859 polymorphism, pTau-181 levels, and increased risk for Alzheimer's disease.
title: The association between rs6859 in NECTIN2 gene and Alzheimer’s disease is partly mediated by pTau

finding: The rs2233678 polymorphism in the PIN1 promoter region was found to be associated with a reduced cancer risk, as detailed in a meta-analysis published in PLOS ONE in 2013. This finding related to cancer risk may provide context for understanding the broader epidemiological association between cancer and dementia, particularly since the study revealed that incident cancer diagnoses correlated with an increased risk of dementia diagnoses.
title: Association between cancer and dementia risk in the UK Biobank: evidence of diagnostic bias

finding: The SNP rs7412 was part of the genetic risk score (GRS) GRS<sup>ALZinclAPOE</sup>, which included APOE ε2 specifically related to Alzheimer disease (AD). This SNP showed a consistent association with AD risk across various European populations, indicating its relevance in the genetic landscape of AD.
title: Transferability of a European-derived Alzheimer’s Disease Genetic Risk Score across Multi-Ancestry Populations

finding: The SNP rs429358, encoding APOE ε4, was also included in the GRS<sup>ALZinclAPOE</sup>. This SNP demonstrated a significant association with AD risk, similar to rs7412, impacting the overall genetic risk profile for AD within the studied European populations.
title: Transferability of a European-derived Alzheimer’s Disease Genetic Risk Score across Multi-Ancestry Populations

finding: The study demonstrated a strong association between the SNP rs429358, located in the APOE gene (APOE4), and increased levels of phosphorylated ubiquitin (p-S65-Ub), a marker of mitochondrial damage, in cases of Lewy body disease (LBD). This association exhibited an effect size (β) of 0.50 with a p-value of 8.67x10^-25, suggesting that carrying an APOE4 allele was correlated with higher levels of p-S65-Ub.
title: Genome-wide association study identifies APOE and ZMIZ1 variants as mitophagy modifiers in Lewy body disease

finding: The SNP rs7412 was located in an area of high pleiotropy on chromosome 19q13.32 and was associated with pain through its missense variant in APOE. The relationship indicated interactions with various immunological, metabolic, and cardiovascular traits.
title: GWAS meta-analysis reveals dual neuronal and immunological etiology for pain susceptibility

finding: The SNP rs4420638 was identified as another independent SNP in the locus on chromosome 19q13.32 with high pleiotropy alongside rs7412. Its association with pain was mediated through similar immunological, metabolic, and cardiovascular traits.
title: GWAS meta-analysis reveals dual neuronal and immunological etiology for pain susceptibility

finding: The SNP rs429358 was associated with the APOE ε4 allele, which was identified as a significant risk factor for Alzheimer's disease (AD). Genomic analyses suggested that variations in this SNP contributed to differences in cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) total tau (t-tau) levels, influencing neuronal plasticity abnormalities observed in AD individuals.
title: Cerebrospinal fluid total tau levels indicate aberrant neuronal plasticity in Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The SNP rs7412 was implicated in the presence of the APOE ε2 allele, which, in contrast to the ε4 allele, was shown to be associated with potentially protective effects against Alzheimer's disease. This SNP was part of the genomic assessments that revealed how variations in APOE genotypes, including rs7412, influenced t-tau levels and plasticity protein concentrations in relation to CSF dynamics in AD.
title: Cerebrospinal fluid total tau levels indicate aberrant neuronal plasticity in Alzheimer’s disease

finding: This common variant was located near CCNE1 and was associated with a modest increase in HGSOC risk, implicating its role in the dysregulation of cellular proliferation in ovarian cancer.
title: Large-scale genome-wide association study of 398,238 women unveils seven novel loci associated with high-grade serous epithelial ovarian cancer risk

finding: The lead variant rs350143 in ARID3A had a significant association with AD, involving transcription regulation linked to immune functions and inflammatory conditions.
title: Meta-analysis of atopic dermatitis in 1,094,060 individuals identifies new risk loci, and sub-analysis characterizes the loci with disease severity and onset

finding: The SNP rs7412 was involved in an association with Alzheimer's disease (ALZ) via the isoform ENST00000252491 of APOC1, where the association remained significant both before and after conditioning on APOE risk variants.
title: Isoform-level transcriptome-wide association uncovers extensive novel genetic risk mechanisms for neuropsychiatric disorders in the human brain

finding: The SNP rs429358 was also associated with Alzheimer's disease (ALZ) through the same isoform ENST00000252491 of APOC1, with consistent significance in association even when adjusting for other APOE risk alleles.
title: Isoform-level transcriptome-wide association uncovers extensive novel genetic risk mechanisms for neuropsychiatric disorders in the human brain

finding: The APOE4 SNP, specifically rs429358, was associated with 3.6% of the variation in cortical tau. It was suggested that there exists an additive effect between this SNP and rs2113389 in influencing tau deposition in Alzheimer's disease patients.
title: Novel CYP1B1-RMDN2 Alzheimer’s disease locus identified by genome-wide association analysis of cerebral tau deposition on PET

finding: The rs429358 variant was associated with the APOE epsilon 4 allele, which was previously linked to improved myocardial performance in older age. Specifically, carriers of this allele had a 4% higher myocardial contraction fraction (MCF) compared to non-carriers, with statistical significance noted (p=0.016). This association persisted even after adjustment for confounding variables, suggesting a favorable cardiovascular phenotype.
title: APOE ε4 carriage associates with improved myocardial performance in older age

finding: Like rs429358, the rs7412 variant was also linked to the APOE epsilon 4 allele associated with enhanced cardiac function. Carriers demonstrated a consistent 1% increase in MCF in subsequent studies, indicating a beneficial effect on heart performance, which supports the concept that the allele may confer survival benefits despite known risks for diseases such as Alzheimer's.
title: APOE ε4 carriage associates with improved myocardial performance in older age

finding: The SNP rs5117, located in the APOC1 gene, was identified as the SNP with the smallest p-value of 1.04E-22, making it the most significant genetic variant associated with Alzheimer's disease (AD). This finding was part of the identification of a strong genetic risk locus that includes the APOE, APOC1, and TOMM40 genes.
title: Deep learning-based identification of genetic variants: Application to Alzheimer’s disease classification

finding: The SNP rs429358, located in the APOE gene, had a p-value of 1.41E-16, which was significant in the context of Alzheimer's disease (AD). This SNP was also reported in conjunction with other significant loci such as APOC1 and TOMM40, contributing to the understanding of genetic variant associations with AD.
title: Deep learning-based identification of genetic variants: Application to Alzheimer’s disease classification

finding: The SNP rs429358 in the APOE gene was found to increase the odds of developing dementia in Parkinson's disease patients, with an odds ratio of 1.36 (95% CI = 1.31 - 1.41, P = 3.25e-57). This SNP is a known risk factor for Alzheimer's disease and dementia with Lewy bodies.
title: Investigation of the genetic aetiology of Lewy body diseases with and without dementia

finding: The SNP rs429358, which tags the APOE ε4 allele, was associated with increased mortality in PD, with a hazard ratio of 1.47 (p-value 2.6×10^-3), and showed influence on cognitive impairment (HR=1.54, p=5.5×10^-13).
title: Genome-wide determinants of mortality and clinical progression in Parkinson’s disease

finding: The variant rs66833742 was associated with COVID-19 hospitalization (OR=0.94, 95% CI=0.92-0.96, p=2.50×10^-8) and had evidence of upregulation of <italic>ZBTB7A</italic>, confirming its significance.
title: Novel risk loci for COVID-19 hospitalization among admixed American populations

finding: The variant rs67602344 was noted for perfect LD with rs66833742, contributing to the understanding of genetic factors in COVID-19.
title: Novel risk loci for COVID-19 hospitalization among admixed American populations

finding: The rs75627662 variant showed an additive effect on LDL receptor (LDLR) levels and served as a vQTL. Stratified analyses indicated that the T-allele was associated with elevated LDLR levels, and significant alterations in correlation with LDL cholesterol levels were observed based on genotype.
title: Systematic discovery of gene-environment interactions underlying the human plasma proteome in UK Biobank

finding: The study revealed that rs3865444 significantly drove the causal inference of the level of CD33 on CD33<sup>dim</sup> HLA DR<sup>+</sup> CD11b<sup>−</sup>, which was vital for interpreting the mediation effects in the context of CD33-related immunophenotypes.
title: Causal effect of the gut microbiota on the risk of psychiatric disorders and the mediating role of immunophenotypes

finding: The SNP rs7412 was involved in determining the APOE isoform, which had been categorized based on the presence of major isoforms associated with cognitive decline. The presence of one or two copies of the 4 allele was assigned a value of one, indicating an increased risk for Alzheimer's disease and dementia as supported by multiple studies.
title: Diverging Patterns of Cognitive Decline by Sex and Race-Ethnicity in Seriously Ill Older Americans

finding: The SNP rs429358 was critical in defining the APOE isoform, similarly linking its presence to cognitive decline risks. Individuals with one or two copies of the 4 allele were categorized as having a higher risk for developing Alzheimer's disease and other forms of dementia, as substantiated by various research findings.
title: Diverging Patterns of Cognitive Decline by Sex and Race-Ethnicity in Seriously Ill Older Americans

finding: The SNP rs1326680184, located in the FCGBP gene, was identified as consistently associated with spontaneous intraabdominal hemorrhage (SIH) in severe acute pancreatitis (SAP) patients. A significantly higher proportion of SIH-SAP patients carried this variant compared to non-SIH-SAP patients (80.0% vs 27.5%). Analysis of clinical outcomes revealed that carriers of the variant exhibited poorer prognoses, including increased mortality and complications such as acute kidney injury and infected pancreatic necrosis. Additionally, the variant was linked to lower levels of FCGBP protein in serum, which contributed to the predisposition to SIH.
title: Whole Exome Sequencing Reveals FCGBP Variant Associated with Spontaneous Intraabdominal Hemorrhage in Severe Acute Pancreatitis

finding: The SNP rs730882082 in LDLR was found to be associated with altered plasma levels of three proteins, specifically showing lower levels of FGF-21, a protein relevant for fatty acid oxidation and glucose regulation.
title: Genetic regulation of the plasma proteome and its link to cardiometabolic disease in Greenlandic Inuit

finding: The variant rs34536443 was associated with an increased risk for severe COVID-19, with an odds ratio of 1.50 (95% CI: 1.40 - 1.62, p-value=4.3x10^-29). Additionally, it was associated with a reduced risk for rheumatoid arthritis (odds ratio: 0.77; 95% CI: 0.72 - 0.83; p-value=2.4x10^-12), indicating opposing effects in these diseases.
title: Complex patterns of multimorbidity associated with severe COVID-19 and Long COVID

finding: The ZNF468 locus, with lead SNP rs4801940, was found to decrease 17-hydroxyprogesterone (17OHP) levels in plasma by 0.45 ng/mL with the T allele, contributing to hormone regulation findings.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide association study in 34,394 Chinese women reveals the genetic architecture of plasma metabolites during pregnancy

finding: The LOC102724279-CYP4F2 locus (lead SNP rs12462273) was involved in vitamin K metabolism.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide association study in 34,394 Chinese women reveals the genetic architecture of plasma metabolites during pregnancy

finding: The APOA5 locus (lead SNP rs62107763) contributed to vitamin E associations.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide association study in 34,394 Chinese women reveals the genetic architecture of plasma metabolites during pregnancy

finding: The missense variant p.Arg1231Cys (rs201680145) in the NOTCH3 gene was identified as having a genome-wide significant association with subcortical hemorrhagic stroke, with an odds ratio (OR) of 3.39 and a p value of 3.87×10^-9. This variant was enriched in South Asians and indicated a three-fold increased risk of hemorrhagic stroke. Additionally, it was associated with all strokes combined in a meta-analysis (OR of 2.18, p value of 4.44×10^-8).
title: NOTCH3 p.Arg1231Cys is Markedly Enriched in South Asians and Associated with Stroke

finding: Carriers of the Apolipoprotein E ε4 allele (genotyped via rs7412) were found to be at increased risk of cognitive impairment. This finding indicated a significant association between the ε4 allele and poor cognitive outcomes in the studied population.
title: Decomposing Interaction and Mediating Effects of Race/Ethnicity and Circulating Cystatin C on Cognitive Status in the United States Health and Retirement Study

finding: The genetic variant rs429358 was used to determine the Apolipoprotein E ε4 carrier status, which was associated with increased cognitive impairment. This highlighted the role of the ε4 allele in risk stratification for dementia in the cohort analyzed.
title: Decomposing Interaction and Mediating Effects of Race/Ethnicity and Circulating Cystatin C on Cognitive Status in the United States Health and Retirement Study

finding: The rs11085727 variant at the TYK2 locus showed reduced risk for autoimmune conditions such as psoriasis (OR=0.88, p=6.48 × 10^-23) and lupus (OR=0.84, p=3.97 × 10^-06), highlighting its protective effect against certain autoimmune diseases.
title: A Phenome-Wide Association Study of genes associated with COVID-19 severity reveals shared genetics with complex diseases in the Million Veteran Program

finding: The rs2277732 variant at the DPP9 locus was associated with idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis, presenting an OR of 1.16 (p=5.84 × 10^-06), contributing to the understanding of its role in respiratory diseases.
title: A Phenome-Wide Association Study of genes associated with COVID-19 severity reveals shared genetics with complex diseases in the Million Veteran Program

finding: The study found a significant association of the APOE genotype, including the rs429358 SNP, with Alzheimer’s disease (AD) pathology, implicating its role in neurodegeneration and neuroinflammation, affecting glucose metabolism proteins and associated biomarkers.
title: Large-scale proteome and metabolome analysis of CSF implicates altered glucose metabolism and succinylcarnitine in Alzheimer’s disease

finding: Similar to rs429358, the rs7412 SNP was part of the APOE genotype analysis that showcased its significant association with Alzheimer’s disease, contributing to the understanding of altered glucose metabolism in relation to amyloid and tau pathology.
title: Large-scale proteome and metabolome analysis of CSF implicates altered glucose metabolism and succinylcarnitine in Alzheimer’s disease

finding: This SNP was a missense variant in PLAUR and was part of a cluster affecting the plasminogen-activating system.
title: Mapping pQTLs of circulating inflammatory proteins identifies drivers of immune-related disease risk and novel therapeutic targets

finding: The SNP rs1126757 was associated with better antidepressant responses among patients with major depressive disorder when combined with higher IL11 methylation levels. This finding highlighted the SNP's potential role as a genetic marker that could predict treatment effectiveness, providing insight into the interplay between genotype and epigenetic modifications in treatment responses.
title: Leveraging DNA Methylation to Predict Treatment Response in Major Depressive Disorder: A Critical Review

finding: The SNP rs189753894 was associated with the CACNA1A gene, identified as a risk gene candidate for late-onset Alzheimer's disease in a GWAS of Korean seniors. The analysis revealed an odds ratio of 1.726, indicating a significant association with AD in non-APOE e4 carriers.
title: APOE-stratified genome-wide association study suggests potential novel genes for late-onset Alzheimer’s disease in East-Asian descent

finding: The genetic variant rs12972156 at the APOE locus was implicated as an instrumental variable for Alzheimer’s disease liability. The analysis indicated that higher Alzheimer’s disease liability was predictive of weight loss in midlife, supported by a leave-one-out analysis which confirmed that its removal did not distort the effect estimates. This contrasted with conventional methods which reported little evidence of this association.
title: Examining risk factors for weight change during midlife: A Mendelian randomization study

finding: The study found that carriers of the <italic>APOE</italic> e4 allele, which includes the rs7412 variant, exhibited significantly steeper cognitive decline across multiple fluid cognitive domains when compared to non-carriers. Specifically, this decline was pronounced in memory and general cognitive function, indicating that individuals carrying this allele were at greater risk for accelerated cognitive ageing.
title: Predictors of longitudinal cognitive ageing from age 70 to 82 including APOE e4 status, early-life and lifestyle factors

finding: Similar to rs7412, individuals with the <italic>APOE</italic> e4 allele associated with the rs429358 variant demonstrated significantly greater cognitive decline across various cognitive measures, particularly in memory and overall cognitive function. This finding highlighted the rs429358 variant’s role in identifying individuals at an increased risk for cognitive decline, emphasizing its importance in cognitive ageing research.
title: Predictors of longitudinal cognitive ageing from age 70 to 82 including APOE e4 status, early-life and lifestyle factors

finding: The SNP rs601338 at the 19q13.33 locus presented the highest CADD score of 52, which suggests potential deleterious effects. It had significant associations related to type 1 diabetes and coronary artery disease, indicating its relevance in these complex traits.
title: Genetic analyses identify shared genetic components related to autoimmune and cardiovascular diseases

finding: The C-allele of rs429358, part of the APOE locus, was linked to lower scores on the Aβ pathology component (PC2), correlating with a higher latent AD score. Its effects were attributed largely to pathways involving amyloid and tau pathology.
title: Multivariate GWAS of Alzheimer’s disease CSF biomarker profiles implies GRIN2D in synaptic functioning

finding: The SNP rs2258983 was implicated in a recent BioFINDER study involving 1,591 participants. This study suggested shared effects of SIGLEC9, related to ALS. The findings were supported by robust evidence of colocalization between plasma pQTL datasets, even though no additional supportive evidence from CSF databases was discovered for SIGLEC9 in this study.
title: Prioritization of therapeutic targets for amyotrophic lateral sclerosis using protein-wide Mendelian randomization analysis

finding: The SNP rs7259350, located near the APOE/APOC cluster, was determined to be the most pleiotropic variant. It was associated with the variance of nine biomarkers including various lipids (total cholesterol, LDL-C, HDL-C, triglycerides), lipoproteins (ApoA, ApoB, LipA), liver enzymes (ALT), and high-sensitivity C-reactive protein (hsCRP). Additionally, this locus demonstrated strong main effects on the same biomarkers and was known for its interactions with lifestyle factors contributing to cardiovascular disease risk.
title: Variance-quantitative trait loci enable systematic discovery of gene-environment interactions for cardiometabolic serum biomarkers

finding: This SNP was associated with the APOE gene, leading to classifications for genotypes E2, E3, and E4, which have implications for lipid metabolism and cardiovascular disease risk.
title: Genetic Architecture And Clinical Outcomes Of The Fredrickson-Levy-Lees Dyslipoproteinemias

finding: Similar to rs429358, this SNP contributed to the APOE gene classification, affecting risk profiles for various lipid disorders.
title: Genetic Architecture And Clinical Outcomes Of The Fredrickson-Levy-Lees Dyslipoproteinemias

finding: The SNP CYP2B6 516G>T (rs3745274) was independently associated with increased efavirenz concentrations in cervicovaginal fluid (CVF) during pregnancy, showing a substantial correlation with drug levels in both CVF (beta = 997 ng/mL, p = 5.7 x 10-5) and plasma (beta = 1400 ng/mL, p = 5.7 x 10-9). This finding indicated that variations in this SNP influenced the pharmacokinetics of efavirenz in pregnant women.
title: Pharmacogenetics of efavirenz exposure in cervicovaginal fluid during pregnancy and postpartum

finding: As a sQTL for LTBP4 in fibroblasts, this novel SNP was linked to descending aortic distensibility, emphasizing the TGF-β pathway's relevance.
title: GENOME-WIDE ASSOCIATIONS OF AORTIC DISTENSIBILITY SUGGEST CAUSAL RELATIONSHIPS WITH AORTIC ANEURYSMS AND BRAIN WHITE MATTER HYPERINTENSITIES

finding: The variant rs150414818 at locus 19q13.33, was identified as a missense variant that disrupted the interaction between ALDH16A1 and HPRT1, leading to potential urate overproduction via the purine salvage pathway. This locus had previously been associated with gout, particularly in early-onset cases.
title: Exploring metabolic changes in gout – Insights from a genetic study

finding: The ALDH16A1 variant rs752383928-G exhibited negative effects on circulating cholesterol and triglyceride levels, indicating a possible cardiovascular risk associated with gout treatment strategies.
title: Exploring metabolic changes in gout – Insights from a genetic study

finding: This SNP was associated with a significant negative effect on longevity due to its tagging of the APOE-ε4 haplotype, with a coefficient of -21.84 at a P-value of 4.25E-7. This indicates that this variant had a detrimental association with lifespan.
title: Polygenic prediction of human longevity on the supposition of pervasive pleiotropy

finding: Similar to rs429358, this SNP was involved in the APOE haplotypes. Its association with longevity suggested a negative contribution to the aging process, particularly linked to cognitive decline and Alzheimer's disease.
title: Polygenic prediction of human longevity on the supposition of pervasive pleiotropy

finding: Located in an intergenic region, this SNP was associated with eQTL activity for several genes, including ARHGEF1, which is crucial for blood pressure regulation. Its contribution to longevity was suggested through mechanisms involving hypertension and cardiovascular health.
title: Polygenic prediction of human longevity on the supposition of pervasive pleiotropy

finding: The rs7508679 SNP was found to modify the effects of a lifestyle obesity intervention on waist circumference and other waist-related indicators, leading to greater decreases in the intervention group while being associated with increases in the control group. This highlighted its potential as a key genetic marker influencing obesity intervention outcomes.
title: Effect of the INSR gene variants on the long-term response to a 31-month childhood obesity intervention

finding: The rs10420008 SNP significantly modified intervention effects on waist-related indicators and body weight at 9 months, presenting better responses in children carrying the effect allele during the intervention. However, the association did not persist long-term.
title: Effect of the INSR gene variants on the long-term response to a 31-month childhood obesity intervention

finding: Like rs7508679 and rs10420008, the rs11883325 SNP modified the intervention effects on waist-related indicators from baseline to 9 months, indicating a beneficial response in those carrying the effect allele, with no sustained impact noted at 31 months.
title: Effect of the INSR gene variants on the long-term response to a 31-month childhood obesity intervention

finding: The SNP rs4804416 exhibited significant interactions with group assignment on waist-related indicators, showing that children with certain alleles benefited more from the intervention but did not maintain this benefit in the long term.
title: Effect of the INSR gene variants on the long-term response to a 31-month childhood obesity intervention

finding: Detected at the IRF3 locus, the rs7251 SNP was associated with autoimmune thyroid disease and several thyroid conditions likely driven by autoimmunity, in addition to being significantly linked with SCZ risk. Lower IRF3 mRNA expression in natural killer (NK) cells was correlated with higher SCZ risk.
title: A transcriptome-wide Mendelian randomization study in isolated human immune cells highlights interferon regulatory transcription factor 3 as a schizophrenia hub gene

finding: This SNP was situated in the 5' UTR of ZNF823, categorized as a strong candidate effector gene related to SCZ, yet detailed associations were not provided.
title: A transcriptome-wide Mendelian randomization study in isolated human immune cells highlights interferon regulatory transcription factor 3 as a schizophrenia hub gene

finding: The missense mutation rs7247025 in LILRB2 was significantly overrepresented in infected individuals compared to the general population, indicating its association with susceptibility to SARS-CoV-2 infection.
title: “Immunogenetics of resistance to SARS-CoV-2 infection in discordant couples”

finding: The variant rs59342471 in LAIR2 was found to be associated with protection against SARS-CoV-2 infection, suggesting its role as a proinflammatory mediator in immune modulation.
title: “Immunogenetics of resistance to SARS-CoV-2 infection in discordant couples”

finding: This SNP contributed to the analysis showing that genetically determined higher pancreas fat levels were associated with an increased risk of PDAC, reinforcing the causal relationship.
title: Genetic Evidence Causally Linking Pancreas Fat to Pancreatic Cancer: A Mendelian Randomization Study

finding: The SNP rs7412 was associated with a larger LDL cholesterol lowering response to statins compared to the e3e3 genotypes in the APOE genetic variants. This finding was contextually important as it related to the treatment effects of statin use on cholesterol levels.
title: The Triangulation WIthin A STudy (TWIST) framework for causal inference within Pharmacogenetic research

finding: Included in the group of 18 novel SNPs reflecting the shared genetic architecture between BMI and MS.
title: Investigating shared genetic architecture between obesity and multiple sclerosis

finding: Part of the 18 novel shared genetic SNPs that indicated a positive connection between BMI and MS.
title: Investigating shared genetic architecture between obesity and multiple sclerosis

finding: This SNP was one of the 18 novel findings pointing to shared genetic risk between BMI and MS.
title: Investigating shared genetic architecture between obesity and multiple sclerosis

finding: The SNP rs10713223 on chromosome 19 showed significant association with dizziness in the trans-ancestry GWAS, with a p-value of 3.11 x 10^-08, suggesting its involvement in the phenotype.
title: GWAS of Chronic Dizziness in the Elderly Identifies Novel Loci Implicating MLLT10, BPTF, LINC01225, and ROS1

finding: The rs7412 SNP in the ApoE gene, linked to low-density lipoprotein cholesterol levels (LDL-C), had a p-value of 2.30E-08. It has been widely identified across European, Asian, and Chinese populations.
title: A Chinese host genetic study discovered type I interferons and causality of cholesterol levels and WBC counts on COVID-19 severity

finding: The rs838133 A- allele was associated with increased carbohydrate and sugar intake, while being correlated with decreased protein and fat intake. This indicates its role in shaping macronutrient preferences in humans. Moreover, functional studies confirmed that the presence of the A- allele led to elevated plasma FGF21 levels, suggesting a significant relationship between this SNP and dietary habits.
title: Diet pattern determines circulating FGF21 levels while distinct FGF21 variants influence diet pattern and FGF21 levels

finding: The rs838131 variant was strongly associated with higher plasma FGF21 levels. It was noted that there were distinct genetic signals for plasma FGF21 levels and macronutrient intake, with this variant primarily influencing FGF21 levels rather than directly affecting dietary preferences.
title: Diet pattern determines circulating FGF21 levels while distinct FGF21 variants influence diet pattern and FGF21 levels

finding: The rs838145 variant was also shown to increase plasma FGF21 levels in functional studies. This variant supports the evidence of a genetic influence on FGF21 concentrations, which in turn could impact dietary preferences amidst established associations with other macronutrients.
title: Diet pattern determines circulating FGF21 levels while distinct FGF21 variants influence diet pattern and FGF21 levels

finding: The rs58542926-A SNP achieved an odds ratio of 2.7 (1.9-3.9) among fatty liver patients with metabolic syndrome, confirming its previous association with the pathogenesis of fatty liver disease.
title: Severe liver damage, low bone mineral content, and PDXDC1/TTC39B gene variations linked to NAFLD with metabolic syndrome

finding: Linked to schizophrenia (SCZ), this SNP was predicted to influence ZNF563, a gene responsible for neuronal differentiation. The ZNF563 gene was specifically upregulated in parvalbumin (PVALB) cells for SCZ, with a logFC of 0.61 and an FDR of 4.45 x 10^-3.
title: Transcriptomic pathology of neocortical microcircuit cell types across psychiatric disorders

finding: The SNP rs7259620 in the region of the APOE gene was noted as the strongest genome-wide association in stage 1 of the analysis, indicating a significant genetic risk for late-onset Alzheimer's disease.
The SNP rs875121 at the ATF5/SIGLEC11 locus showed association in stage 2 with a p-value of 1.03×10^-8, suggesting its relevance to Alzheimer's disease.

The study found that the SNP rs429358, which indicates the presence of the APOE ε4 allele (C-allele), was significantly associated with higher plasma p-tau217 levels. The effect size was reported as b=0.19 with a p-value of 5 x 10^-16, indicating a strong positive relationship with AD pathology.
title: Cross-sectional study of plasma phosphorylated Tau 217 in persons without dementia

finding: The SNP rs112009052 (GRCh38, chr19:40593595 A/T) was associated with increased splicing of LTBP4, which in turn was related to increased plasma levels of LTBP4 and an increased liability for AAA. The allele T was linked with a corresponding decreased transcription of a truncated LTBP4 transcript, and the posterior probability of colocalization for this SNP among four traits (sQTL, transcript-level-QTL, pQTL, and AAA) was 0.89, confirming its causal role in AAA risk.
title: Plasma proteomics reveals the potential causal impact of extracellular matrix proteins on abdominal aortic aneurysm

finding: The variant TOMM40:rs11556505-T conferred a disease-modifying effect among APOE ε4 carriers, with a higher frequency observed in Europeans compared to Africans across AD-related phenotypes.
title: Biobank-scale characterization of Alzheimer’s disease and related dementias identifies potential disease-causing variants, risk factors, and genetic modifiers across diverse ancestries

finding: The variant APOE:rs449647-T exhibited a modifying effect in African, European, and Ashkenazi Jewish ancestries and displayed the highest frequency among African ancestries in AD cases compared to controls.
title: Biobank-scale characterization of Alzheimer’s disease and related dementias identifies potential disease-causing variants, risk factors, and genetic modifiers across diverse ancestries

finding: The variant 19q13.31:rs10423769-A acted as a resilience factor, particularly in individuals of African ancestry, reducing the risk of AD in APOE ε4 carriers, with higher frequencies found in controls compared to AD cases.
title: Biobank-scale characterization of Alzheimer’s disease and related dementias identifies potential disease-causing variants, risk factors, and genetic modifiers across diverse ancestries

finding: The ABCA7:rs72973581-A variant was characterized as a protective variant among the analyzed variants, contributing to a decrease in AD risk among carriers.
title: Biobank-scale characterization of Alzheimer’s disease and related dementias identifies potential disease-causing variants, risk factors, and genetic modifiers across diverse ancestries

finding: The NFIC:rs9749589-A variant was identified as resilient, further informing the nuances of genetic predisposition to AD.
title: Biobank-scale characterization of Alzheimer’s disease and related dementias identifies potential disease-causing variants, risk factors, and genetic modifiers across diverse ancestries

finding: The APOE3 Christchurch:rs121918393-A variant was classified as resilient, engaging in the discussions regarding the various effects within APOE-related pathways.
title: Biobank-scale characterization of Alzheimer’s disease and related dementias identifies potential disease-causing variants, risk factors, and genetic modifiers across diverse ancestries

finding: The rs74956615 variant was associated with a strong protective signal against autoimmune diseases within the TYK2 locus (19p13.2), achieving a high significance level (P = 9.7 × 10^-12).
title: Meta-analysis fine-mapping is often miscalibrated at single-variant resolution

finding: The rs34536443 variant, a missense variant leading to p.Pro1104Ala in TYK2, reduced TYK2 function but did not achieve genome-wide significance due to missingness in multiple cohorts (P = 7.5 × 10^-7; PIP = 9.5 × 10^-4).
title: Meta-analysis fine-mapping is often miscalibrated at single-variant resolution

finding: The missense variant rs34187696 (p.Gly337Val) in ZSCAN5A was successfully identified for its association with increased monocyte count and asthma.
title: Meta-analysis fine-mapping is often miscalibrated at single-variant resolution

finding: This lead SNP in the TGFB1 locus provided genome-wide significance for its association with otosclerosis and was linked to reduced expression of TGFB1.
title: Genome-wide Screen of Otosclerosis in Population Biobanks: 18 Loci and Shared Heritability with Skeletal Structure

finding: This novel locus in CALR3 showed significant genetic signals in African populations.
title: Trans-ethnic genome-wide meta-analysis of 35,732 cases and 34,424 controls identifies novel genomic cross-ancestry loci contributing to lung cancer susceptibility

finding: SNP rs429358 was involved in defining the APOE haplotypes, highlighting its role as a genetic risk determinant, particularly for DLB.
title: Lack of Epistatic Interaction of SNCA with APOE in Synucleinopathies

finding: Like rs429358, SNP rs7412 contributed to defining the APOE haplotypes, indicating its importance in genetic risk assessment for conditions like DLB.
title: Lack of Epistatic Interaction of SNCA with APOE in Synucleinopathies

finding: The SNP rs17271883, located near FUT6, was identified as a tumor biomarker with strong associations to proteins and potential regulatory elements relevant to cancer cell proliferation and metastasis, indicating its significance in cancer pathogenesis.
title: The Molecular Human – A Roadmap of Molecular Interactions Linking Multiomics Networks with Disease Endpoints

finding: Associated with AC010518.3, rs103294 contributed to a genetic network suggesting connections to immune regulation, highlighting the SNP's functional relevance in disease mechanisms.
title: The Molecular Human – A Roadmap of Molecular Interactions Linking Multiomics Networks with Disease Endpoints

finding: The rs10407548 locus near the FFAR3 gene had been identified in a GWAS meta-analysis as associated with individuals reporting less frequent stools, implicating it in the genetic predisposition to constipation and potentially linking it to cardiovascular diseases (CVDs) and major adverse cardiac events (MACE). This finding suggested a role of GPR41, the receptor coded by FFAR3, in SCFA signalling and blood pressure regulation, indicating a shared genetic basis between constipation and cardiovascular conditions.
title: Constipation is associated with an increased risk of major adverse cardiac events in a UK population

finding: The SNP rs429358 was implicated in the classification of Alzheimer's disease (AD) through its association with APOE status. This finding highlighted the role of APOE alleles in AD risk, specifically showing that variations at this locus contributed to stratifying individuals in terms of their likelihood of developing AD.
title: Analysis of Alzheimer’s disease Polygenic Risk Scores using RNA-sequencing provides further novel biological pathways

finding: The SNP rs7412, similar to rs429358, was also linked to APOE status, which is crucial for understanding AD risk. The relationship of this SNP with the APOE gene emphasized its importance in the genetic predisposition to AD, reinforcing its significance in studies assessing genetic contributions to Alzheimer's pathology.
title: Analysis of Alzheimer’s disease Polygenic Risk Scores using RNA-sequencing provides further novel biological pathways

finding: The missense variant rs429358 was linked to 24 different traits, including dementia and Alzheimer’s disease, but showed a 30% lower risk of dementia in the African (AFR) population compared to European (EUR) groups.
title: Diversity and Scale: Genetic Architecture of 2,068 Traits in the VA Million Veteran Program

finding: This SNP connected with reduced risk for autoimmune conditions, including psoriasis (OR 0.88) and lupus (OR 0.84), emphasizing its importance in immune response pathways.
title: A Phenome-Wide Association Study of genes associated with COVID-19 severity reveals shared genetics with complex diseases in the Million Veteran Program

finding: This SNP associated with idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis with an OR of 1.16, reflecting previously noted associations with this respiratory condition.
title: A Phenome-Wide Association Study of genes associated with COVID-19 severity reveals shared genetics with complex diseases in the Million Veteran Program

finding: The SNP rs429358 was identified as part of the <italic>APOE</italic> ε4 allele that was inversely associated with cognitive measures in South Asians from India. The study demonstrated that carriers of the ε4 allele, specifically those with genotypes ε3/4 and ε4/4, exhibited lower cognitive function, particularly pronounced in older adults (age >68) and women.
title: Effect of APOE ε4 and its modification by sociodemographic characteristics on cognitive measures in South Asians from LASI-DAD

finding: The SNP rs7412 contributed to the formation of the <italic>APOE</italic> ε2 and ε3 alleles, and it was also connected with lower cognitive function in the studied population. However, its interaction with the ε4 allele indicated a nuanced relationship where the presence of ε4 was more clearly associated with cognitive decline, especially in female participants.
title: Effect of APOE ε4 and its modification by sociodemographic characteristics on cognitive measures in South Asians from LASI-DAD

finding: The SNP rs445925, located in the APOC1 gene, showed a significant association with HMG levels in statin users, indicating that carrying at least one minor allele was linked to lower statin effectiveness as measured by HMG, particularly dependent on statin intake.
title: Heterogeneity in statin responses explained by variation in the human gut microbiome

finding: The SNP rs7412, related to the APOE gene, also demonstrated a significant association with HMG levels that was dependent on statin use, signifying an effect on statin response where minor allele carriers experienced a decrease in HMG levels.
title: Heterogeneity in statin responses explained by variation in the human gut microbiome

finding: The variant rs429358 at the APOE locus was identified as the strongest association with Alzheimer's disease (p = 7.2 x 10^-77). This variant was confirmed in both population-specific analyses and the multi-population meta-analysis.
title: Key variants via Alzheimer’s Disease Sequencing Project whole genome sequence data

finding: The non-secretor variant in FUT2 (linked to critical COVID-19) was demonstrated to provide protection against severe disease and has been observed to affect responses to various infections.
title: Whole genome sequencing identifies multiple loci for critical illness caused by COVID-19

finding: This SNP is linked to FUT2 and shows protective effects against critical COVID-19 highlighting its immunological significance.
title: Whole genome sequencing identifies multiple loci for critical illness caused by COVID-19

finding: This stop-gain mutation was identified as the non-secretor allele associated with protection from severe COVID-19.
title: Whole genome sequencing identifies multiple loci for critical illness caused by COVID-19

finding: The R145C variant (rs769455) was identified as a significant risk factor for late-onset Alzheimer's disease (AD) among individuals with the APOE ε3/ε4 genotype. Carriers of R145C demonstrated a nearly three-fold increased risk of AD (odds ratio, 2.75), and experienced an earlier age-at-onset by almost 6 years (β, -5.72). Additionally, competing risk regression indicated a faster cumulative incidence of AD in R145C carriers compared to non-carriers, with a hazard ratio of 2.42.
title: APOE missense variant R145C is associated with increased Alzheimer’s disease risk in African ancestry individuals with the APOE ε3/ε4 genotype

finding: The SNP rs2452170 served as the lead variant for locus 34, which remained significant even after accounting for independently associated variants within the APOE locus. This suggested its relevance as a genetic factor in LOAD.
title: Largest GWAS (N=1,126,563) of Alzheimer’s Disease Implicates Microglia and Immune Cells

finding: The study demonstrated that the CC allele of rs12979860 was significantly lower in COVID-19 patients (38%) compared to controls without COVID-19 (55%), indicating a protective effect of this allele against COVID-19.
title: Genetic variation of IFNL4 is associated with COVID-19

finding: The analysis of rs12979680 indicated that the CC genotype was significantly reduced in COVID-19 patients, suggesting a protective effect of this allele, paralleling the findings from rs12979860.
title: Genetic variation of IFNL4 is associated with COVID-19

finding: This SNP was associated with the TM6SF2 gene and was recognized as a likely causative variant for fat-related traits.
title: Genome-wide association studies and multi-omics integrative analysis reveal novel loci and their molecular mechanisms for circulating polyunsaturated, monounsaturated, and saturated fatty acids

finding: This SNP was linked to the APOE gene and was noted as a shared signal among multiple fatty acid traits.
title: Genome-wide association studies and multi-omics integrative analysis reveal novel loci and their molecular mechanisms for circulating polyunsaturated, monounsaturated, and saturated fatty acids

finding: This SNP was recognized in model 3 as a shared signal among multiple FA traits.
title: Genome-wide association studies and multi-omics integrative analysis reveal novel loci and their molecular mechanisms for circulating polyunsaturated, monounsaturated, and saturated fatty acids

finding: Associated with the LDLR gene, this SNP revealed connections to histone modification and chromatin accessibility, impacting lipid metabolism.
title: Genome-wide association studies and multi-omics integrative analysis reveal novel loci and their molecular mechanisms for circulating polyunsaturated, monounsaturated, and saturated fatty acids

finding: This SNP was discussed in relation to the study's overall findings on fatty acid traits.
title: Genome-wide association studies and multi-omics integrative analysis reveal novel loci and their molecular mechanisms for circulating polyunsaturated, monounsaturated, and saturated fatty acids

finding: Identified as a significant candidate causal variant among the new loci for fatty acid traits.
title: Genome-wide association studies and multi-omics integrative analysis reveal novel loci and their molecular mechanisms for circulating polyunsaturated, monounsaturated, and saturated fatty acids

finding: The variant rs11085727, located at the 19:9927721-10977067 locus, was the lead variant related to cytokine-associated responses, implicating it in the severe inflammatory reactions observed in COVID-19.
title: Insights into genetic factors contributing to variability in SARS-CoV-2 susceptibility and COVID-19 disease severity

finding: The study found a higher frequency of the TOMM40:rs11556505-T variant in Europeans as compared to Africans, indicating its association with Alzheimer's disease (AD) risk among APOE ε4 carriers.
title: Biobank-scale characterization of Alzheimer’s disease and related dementias identifies potential disease-causing variants, risk factors, and genetic modifiers across diverse ancestries

finding: The variant APOE:rs449647-T was associated with increased risk of AD in APOE ε4 carriers of African ancestry but decreased risk in European ancestry, suggesting a context-dependent effect.
title: Biobank-scale characterization of Alzheimer’s disease and related dementias identifies potential disease-causing variants, risk factors, and genetic modifiers across diverse ancestries

finding: The 19q13.31:rs10423769-A variant exhibited a protective effect, showing higher frequencies in African and African Admixed ancestries and reducing AD risk among APOE ε4 carriers.
title: Biobank-scale characterization of Alzheimer’s disease and related dementias identifies potential disease-causing variants, risk factors, and genetic modifiers across diverse ancestries

finding: The ABCA7:rs72973581-A variant was noted to be protective across diverse ancestries, contributing to the overall genetic risk evaluation for AD.
title: Biobank-scale characterization of Alzheimer’s disease and related dementias identifies potential disease-causing variants, risk factors, and genetic modifiers across diverse ancestries

finding: The NFIC:rs9749589-A variant was noted for its resilience in contributing to the genetic understanding of AD.
title: Biobank-scale characterization of Alzheimer’s disease and related dementias identifies potential disease-causing variants, risk factors, and genetic modifiers across diverse ancestries

finding: The APOE3 Christchurch:rs121918393-A variant was evaluated within the context of its role in modulating AD risk.
title: Biobank-scale characterization of Alzheimer’s disease and related dementias identifies potential disease-causing variants, risk factors, and genetic modifiers across diverse ancestries

finding: The SNP rs429358, associated with the APOE genotype, was analyzed in relation to Alzheimer's disease. The findings indicated that the polygenic risk score and the joint predictor were positively correlated with carrying at least one e4 allele, and suggested implications for risk assessment in Alzheimer's disease based on genetic predisposition.
title: Capturing additional genetic risk from family history for improved polygenic risk prediction

finding: Similarly, the SNP rs7412, also part of the APOE genotype characterization, was examined for its relationship with Alzheimer's disease. The investigation revealed an association between the polygenic risk score and the joint predictor with carrying two e4 alleles, further contributing to the understanding of genetic risk factors in Alzheimer's.
title: Capturing additional genetic risk from family history for improved polygenic risk prediction

finding: The missense variant rs121918393-A related to APOECh carriers showed a lower overall polygenic risk score for AD (p=0.02), indicating a potential protective effect against AD.
title: Characterization of APOE Christchurch carriers in 455,306 UK Biobank participants

finding: The rs7412 SNP was associated with the carriage of the ε3 allele of APOE, which contributed to an estimated 74.5% of the burden of late-onset Alzheimer's disease (AD) and 39.5% of all-cause dementia in the studied cohort. This finding highlighted the significant role of genetic variation at the APOE locus in dementia risk.
title: The proportion of Alzheimer’s disease attributable to apolipoprotein E

finding: The rs429358 SNP was linked to the ε4 allele of APOE, with findings showing that this allele carriage was a substantial factor contributing to the burden of late-onset Alzheimer's disease, accounting for 74.5% of AD cases. The significance of this SNP in dementia pathogenesis was underscored, as it also related to the overall fraction of all-cause dementia attributable to APOE alleles.
title: The proportion of Alzheimer’s disease attributable to apolipoprotein E

finding: A significant genetic association was discovered between an intronic variant in IFNL4 (rs12979860) and RSV-specific IgG concentration. The presence of the minor allele A was linked to higher RSV IgG concentrations in individuals, with those carrying two copies of the A allele (AA genotype) having significantly higher levels compared to those with the GG genotype. The mean concentrations for AA versus GG were notable, as indicated by p=0.0043 and t-test results showing p=0.01.
title: Respiratory syncytial virus-specific immunoglobulin G (IgG) concentrations associate with environmental and genetic factors: the Factors Influencing Pediatric Asthma Study

finding: The SNP rs12979860 was positively found to impact interferon responsiveness and advanced liver disease in chronic genotype 3 Hepatitis C patients. This research indicated that variations at this locus were associated with patient responses to treatment and disease progression.
title: Study of Hepatitis C Virus infection among multi-transfused patients with inherited β-globin synthesis gene defect, in the eastern region of India

finding: The SNP rs8099917 showed a significant association with interferon responsiveness and advanced liver disease among chronic genotype 3 Hepatitis C patients. The study highlighted the importance of this SNP in influencing patient outcomes.
title: Study of Hepatitis C Virus infection among multi-transfused patients with inherited β-globin synthesis gene defect, in the eastern region of India

finding: The SNP rs10422256 impacted LDLR plasma protein levels exclusively in STEMI patients at 24 hours after the event, with a genotype x t24h interaction effect size of β=-0.29 and a p-value of 0.022.
title: Single-cell dissection of the immune response after acute myocardial infarction

finding: This SNP was noted as a novel significant locus associated with the ocular diseases examined in the study.
title: Genome-wide analysis of genetic pleiotropy and causal genes across three age-related ocular disorders

finding: Located close to the promoter region of PTBP1, this SNP was found to interact with genomic regions linked to retinal health and was implicated in retinal ganglion cell conversion.
title: Genome-wide analysis of genetic pleiotropy and causal genes across three age-related ocular disorders

finding: The SNP rs73015024, located near the LDLR gene, was strongly associated with all LDL subclasses and small to medium size VLDL particles resembling cholesterol remnants, highlighting its importance in hepatic LDL-C and non-HDL-C uptake.
title: Lipoprotein profile and metabolic fine-mapping of genetic lipid risk loci

finding: SNP rs116843064 near ANGPTL4 exhibited significant associations with multiple NMR traits, underscoring its potential role in lipid metabolism and transport.
title: Lipoprotein profile and metabolic fine-mapping of genetic lipid risk loci

finding: The SNP rs2230199 located in the C3 gene was implicated in increased risk for progression to advanced AMD. This finding was part of a broader association with genetic variants contributing to AMD.
title: Rare Dysfunctional Complement Factor I Genetic Variants and Progression to Advanced Age-Related Macular Degeneration

finding: The SNP rs147859257 in the C3 gene, identified as K155Q, was found to have a significant association with the risk of advanced AMD with an odds ratio of 2.07 (P = 0.0007).
title: Rare Dysfunctional Complement Factor I Genetic Variants and Progression to Advanced Age-Related Macular Degeneration

finding: The SNP rs2288464 was associated with MT-CN with a P value from imputed data showing a nominal significance and had a suggested effect size based on WES data. It is located in the 3' untranslated region of the MRPL34 gene, which encodes a large subunit protein of the mitochondrial ribosome. While it did not reach genome-wide significance in some analyses, it was considered a good candidate for affecting MT-CN due to its role in mitochondrial function.
title: Mitochondrial genome copy number measured by DNA sequencing in human blood is strongly associated with metabolic traits via cell-type composition differences

finding: This SNP at 19q13.3 showed suggestive evidence of association (p=1.22×10^-6, OR=1.92) and was approximately 2 kb from FSD1, a known centrosome-associated protein, and the region overlapped with an embryonic heart enhancer.
title: Genome-wide association studies of Down syndrome associated congenital heart defects

finding: The SNP rs72658867 was identified as having a protective effect against hyperlipidaemia and was associated with lower cholesterol and lower risk of coronary artery disease. This variant was found in 0.012 frequency in controls and 0.0097 in cases, showing a signed log 10 p value (SLP) of -5.21, indicating its significant role in reducing risk.
title: Analysis of 200,000 exome-sequenced UK Biobank subjects illustrates the contribution of rare genetic variants to hyperlipidaemia

finding: The variant rs12721046 was identified as a significant genetic variant associated with Alzheimer’s disease and was noted for its high precision in causal estimate. This variant was responsible for driving associations with cortical orientation dispersion index, white matter mean diffusivity, and bilateral hippocampal volumes. It was also linked to cerebral amyloid deposition, suggesting it has a crucial role in the genetic predisposition to Alzheimer’s disease.
title: Educational attainment, structural brain reserve, and Alzheimer’s disease: a Mendelian randomization analysis

finding: The rs429358 SNP was associated with the APOE epsilon 4 allele, which explained 27.3% of the heritability of late-onset Alzheimer's disease (LOAD). It was shown to mediate the effect of APOE epsilon 4 on brain regions including the entorhinal cortex, hippocampus, amygdala, and inferior lateral ventricle.
title: Brain morphology mediating the effect of genetic risk variants on Alzheimer’s disease

finding: Similar to rs429358, the rs7412 SNP contributed to the APOE epsilon 4 allele's association with LOAD, explaining a significant portion of the heritability of the disease and mediating its effects on specific brain structures.
title: Brain morphology mediating the effect of genetic risk variants on Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The rs75627662 SNP was significantly associated with LOAD and mediated the effects of APOE epsilon 4 on the mean thickness of the entorhinal cortex and the volumes of the amygdala and hippocampus.
title: Brain morphology mediating the effect of genetic risk variants on Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The SNP rs7408312 was highlighted in the study for its role in the shared genetic variants between PTSD and cardiovascular conditions.
title: Genetics of posttraumatic stress disorder and cardiovascular conditions using Life’s Essential 8, Electronic Health Records, and Heart Imaging

finding: The SNP rs145793672 at the 19p13.11 locus was associated with both MDD and MI in the context of the study, further supporting the genetic overlap between these diseases.
title: Role of Blood Lipids in the Shared Genetic Etiology Between Major Depressive Disorder and Myocardial Infarction: A Large-scale Multi-trait Association Analysis

finding: The SNP rs116843064 at the 19p13.2 locus was highlighted as the most significant exonic variant in the study, being linked to the gene ANGPTL4 that plays a crucial role in the regulation of lipid metabolism.
title: Role of Blood Lipids in the Shared Genetic Etiology Between Major Depressive Disorder and Myocardial Infarction: A Large-scale Multi-trait Association Analysis

finding: The SNP rs429358 at the 19q13.32 locus was acknowledged for its association with the gene APOE, which also has implications in lipid metabolism and cardiovascular diseases.
title: Role of Blood Lipids in the Shared Genetic Etiology Between Major Depressive Disorder and Myocardial Infarction: A Large-scale Multi-trait Association Analysis

finding: The SNP rs115550680 was identified in a 2013 GWAS conducted in African Americans, replicating an association at ABCA7, which was previously found in European populations. This finding indicated that rs115550680 was associated with an increased risk for Alzheimer's disease (AD) in African Americans, showing a level of risk comparable to the highly pathogenic APOE-D4 variant observed in Europeans.
title: Assessing the lack of diversity in genetics research across neurodegenerative diseases: a systematic review of the GWAS Catalog and literature

finding: The SNP rs67397200 located in the ABHD8 gene at 19p13.11 showed a strong positive association with ROR-P, indicating that individuals carrying the breast cancer risk allele had increased case-case risk of luminal B and triple negative intrinsic-like subtypes, and a decreased risk of luminal A subtype. This finding was reported in the context of GWAS for ER-negative cancer.
title: Development and testing of a polygenic risk score for breast cancer aggressiveness

finding: The SNP rs364691 located at 19q13.31 had a P-value of 1.6e−6 and an OR of 1.35, indicating an association with increased risk for UC.
