title: Genome-wide analysis of individual coding variants and HLA-II-associated self-immunopeptidomes in ulcerative colitis

finding: The rs7412 variant was part of the identified APOE genotype, which contributed to the shared genetic risk for late-onset epilepsy (LOE) and Alzheimer's disease (AD). This SNP was linked to the number of ε4 alleles an individual carried, indicating its relevance in the context of risk assessment for these conditions.
title: Multi-class Modeling Identifies Shared Genetic Risk for Late-onset Epilepsy and Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The rs429358 variant, like rs7412, defined the APOE genotype contributing to shared genetic risk between LOE and AD. Its role in the number of ε4 alleles further underscored its impact on the risk of developing these diseases.
title: Multi-class Modeling Identifies Shared Genetic Risk for Late-onset Epilepsy and Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: Identified among the top SNPs with the highest coefficient magnitudes in the shared genetic risk analysis, rs157580 was relevant to the pathways affecting AD and LOE, emphasizing its contribution to the genetic interplay between these disorders.
title: Multi-class Modeling Identifies Shared Genetic Risk for Late-onset Epilepsy and Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: As another top SNP with significant coefficient magnitude, rs1064725 was included in the set of identified shared genetic risk factors for AD and LOE, indicating its importance in the genetic landscape of these diseases.
title: Multi-class Modeling Identifies Shared Genetic Risk for Late-onset Epilepsy and Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: Mapped to the snoZ6 gene, rs10422350 was identified as an AD-specific risk SNP in the second step of the LASSO model, reflecting its unique contribution to AD beyond shared genetic factors.
title: Multi-class Modeling Identifies Shared Genetic Risk for Late-onset Epilepsy and Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The SNP rs12972156, located at the APOE locus, was associated with genetically predicted Alzheimer’s disease liability. The analysis indicated that this variant's removal during MR leave one out analysis attenuated the strength of the association between Alzheimer’s disease liability and weight loss, though weight loss remained statistically significant. This finding furnished strong evidence that genetically predicted Alzheimer’s disease liability was a significant predictor of weight loss in midlife.
title: Estimating the genetically predicted effects of lifestyle risk factors, educational attainment and Alzheimer’s disease liability on weight change during midlife

finding: The SNP rs56113850, located on chromosome 19, was identified as a significant genetic determinant of faster nicotine metabolism, specifically through its association with the nicotine metabolite ratio (NMR). This SNP accounted for a substantial portion of the explained variance in the NMR, with estimates suggesting it influenced nicotine metabolism in relation to smoking behaviors and cardiovascular health outcomes.
title: A Phenome-wide association study of a genetic score for the nicotine metabolite ratio

finding: This missense variant was identified as the APOE epsilon 4-tagging variant, which is significantly associated with Alzheimer's disease.
title: Insights from complex trait fine-mapping across diverse populations

finding: This frameshift variant is linked to congenital nephrotic syndrome in the Finnish population.
title: Insights from complex trait fine-mapping across diverse populations

finding: The APOE rs7412 SNP was identified as a major genetic Alzheimer's disease (AD) risk factor. Further, it was reported to be associated with cerebrovascular lesions, suggesting a role in vascular pathology related to brain aging.
title: White matter brain age as a biomarker of cerebrovascular burden in the ageing brain

finding: The APOE rs429358 SNP also served as a significant genetic risk factor for Alzheimer's disease. Similar to rs7412, it was linked to cerebrovascular lesions, indicating its influence on cerebrovascular health and the aging of white matter.
title: White matter brain age as a biomarker of cerebrovascular burden in the ageing brain

finding: SNP rs2455069 was identified as a valid IV and was significantly associated with Alzheimer's disease (AD). The presence of the G allele at this SNP led to the amino acid substitution of Arginine to Glycine at position 69 of the CD33 protein, which might contribute to an increased risk of AD due to structural alterations in CD33.
title: Robust Mendelian Randomization Analysis by Automatically Selecting Valid Genetic Instruments with Applications to Identify Plasma Protein Biomarkers for Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The rs429358 variant in the APOE locus was found to be significantly associated with an earlier age of onset (AAO) of ischemic stroke in women. Specifically, each copy of the T>C allele was associated with a 1.29 years earlier AAO, with a meta-analysis p-value of 2.48×10^-11. This SNP has previously been linked to increased mortality and stroke AAO, suggesting a potential survival bias.
title: Evidence of survival bias in the association between APOE-Є4 and age of ischemic stroke onset

finding: The SNP rs429358 is the most significant SNP at the APOE locus, associated with progression to Parkinson's disease (PD) dementia, showing a Hazard Ratio (HR) of 2.42, indicating a substantial risk for dementia conversion in PD patients.
title: Association between the LRP1B and APOE loci and the development of Parkinson’s disease dementia

finding: The SNP rs1405655 located at 19q13.33 was recognized as a genome-wide significant locus associated with severe COVID-19, with a P-value of 3.25×10^-8 and an OR of 1.09 for the minor allele C.
title: New susceptibility loci for severe COVID-19 by detailed GWAS analysis in European populations

finding: As the SCZ GWAS index SNP at the GATAD2A locus, this SNP was noted for its predicted disruption of REST binding in the promoter region, shedding light on its role in neurogenesis.
title: Cell-type specific cis-eQTLs in eight brain cell-types identifies novel risk genes for human brain disorders

finding: The SNP rs429358 was associated with the estimation of APOE isoforms in the MESA study, which examined how these isoforms relate to cardiovascular events, including subclinical measures of CVD and potential outcomes such as CHD and dementia.
title: Subclinical Vascular Composites Predict Clinical Cardiovascular Disease, Stroke, and Dementia: The Multi-Ethnic Study of Atherosclerosis (MESA)

finding: The SNP rs7412, similarly to rs429358, contributed to the estimation of APOE isoforms in participants of the MESA study, linking it to various cardiovascular risk factors and potential outcomes in relation to CVD and dementia.
title: Subclinical Vascular Composites Predict Clinical Cardiovascular Disease, Stroke, and Dementia: The Multi-Ethnic Study of Atherosclerosis (MESA)

finding: The SNP rs405509 in the APOE promoter was part of key interactions with other variants and reached the highest feature importance (FI) in machine learning models used to classify late onset Alzheimer's disease (LOAD). It was significant in its genomic profiles for LOAD, particularly in co-occurrence with rs1160985.
title: Machine learning methods applied to genotyping data capture interactions between single nucleotide variants in late onset Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The SNP rs1160985, located in TOMM40, was similarly important in the classification of LOAD, showing significant interaction with rs405509. This interaction characterized specific genomic profiles associated with LOAD individuals.
title: Machine learning methods applied to genotyping data capture interactions between single nucleotide variants in late onset Alzheimer’s disease

finding: SNP rs429358 was found to be 2.6 times more frequent in LOAD than in controls and had the highest allele frequency (AF) difference, although it did not exhibit the highest FI in the ML analysis. This SNP is known to be a well-characterized genetic determinant for LOAD.
title: Machine learning methods applied to genotyping data capture interactions between single nucleotide variants in late onset Alzheimer’s disease

finding: SNP rs7412, known for its protective role against Alzheimer's disease, was confirmed to have lower frequency in LOAD compared to controls and ranked lower in feature importance despite being a significant SNP in prior studies.
title: Machine learning methods applied to genotyping data capture interactions between single nucleotide variants in late onset Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The SNP rs769449 was identified as one of the more frequent variants in LOAD with a significant increased AF difference, highlighting its potential role in the disease.
title: Machine learning methods applied to genotyping data capture interactions between single nucleotide variants in late onset Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The SNP rs4420638 was part of a haplotype associated with increased risk for LOAD, being frequently found alongside other critical variants like rs429358 and rs769449.
title: Machine learning methods applied to genotyping data capture interactions between single nucleotide variants in late onset Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The SNP rs429358, part of the APOE locus associated with Alzheimer's disease risk, showed significant heterogeneity in its effect attributable to genetic ancestry. This SNP had the highest heterogeneity among tested SNPs (I<sup>2</sup>=96.54), indicating variation in its impact across different populations.
title: Multi-ancestry meta-analysis and fine-mapping in Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The SNP rs7412, also part of the APOE locus, did not present significant heterogeneity unlike rs429358 (I<sup>2</sup>=0). This SNP is crucial in determining the APOE-e2 allele and was consistently observed in association with AD.
title: Multi-ancestry meta-analysis and fine-mapping in Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The rs7412 SNP in the APOE gene was identified as a marker associated with early-onset Alzheimer's disease (EOAD) and was part of the genetic analysis that contributed to polygenic risk scores in the study.
title: Blood biomarker profiles in young-onset neurocognitive disorders: a cohort study

finding: The rs429358 SNP in the APOE gene was also found to be related to the risk of development of early-onset Alzheimer's disease (EOAD) and was used in determining APOE genotype and polygenic risk scores for the participants.
title: Blood biomarker profiles in young-onset neurocognitive disorders: a cohort study

finding: Identified in trans-ancestry analysis, rs10713223 showed significant association with vestibulocochlear disorders and replicated findings from the Ice/Fin/UKB/US cohort.
title: GWAS of Chronic Dizziness in the Elderly Identifies Significant Loci Implicating MLLT10, BPTF, LINC01225, and ROS1

finding: This SNP was found to have highly significant allele frequency differences in case-case GWAS, indicating its relevance in distinguishing chronic dizziness phenotypes.
title: GWAS of Chronic Dizziness in the Elderly Identifies Significant Loci Implicating MLLT10, BPTF, LINC01225, and ROS1

finding: The rs12608932 polymorphism in UNC13A was significantly related to survival in ALS patients, with a p-value less than 0.001 indicating its role as a genetic modifier affecting disease outcome.
title: The additive effect of genetic modifiers on ALS prognosis: a population-based study

finding: The variant was associated with sleep-related traits and played a critical role in the genetics of Alzheimer's disease.
title: Ancestrally diverse genome-wide association analysis highlights ancestry-specific differences in genetic regulation of plasma protein levels

finding: The missense variant rs35033974 was associated with TEX101, as identified through proteomic measurement of human spermatozoa. This finding contributed to understanding the role of TEX101-associated proteins in human reproduction.
title: Immunoprecipitation-targeted proteomics assays facilitate rational development of SARS-CoV-2 serological diagnostics

finding: Identified as a lead SNP associated with DD in the current study, corroborating earlier findings.
title: A meta-analysis of genome-wide association studies in 614,243 individuals identifies 59 novel susceptibility loci underlying Dupuytren’s contracture

finding: SNP rs429358 was found to be enriched in cognitively healthy centenarians, indicating its protective role against Alzheimer's Disease (AD), wherein the protective allele contributed to improved amyloid clearance.
title: Cognitively Healthy Centenarians are genetically protected against Alzheimer’s disease specifically in immune and endo-lysosomal systems

finding: SNP rs7412 was noted for its enrichment among centenarians, contributing to cognitive resilience against AD, particularly through mechanisms involved in lipid signaling and amyloid processing.
title: Cognitively Healthy Centenarians are genetically protected against Alzheimer’s disease specifically in immune and endo-lysosomal systems

finding: SNP rs12151021, located near ABCA7, was enriched in centenarians, indicating its critical role in amyloid clearance mechanisms and contributing to resilience against AD.
title: Cognitively Healthy Centenarians are genetically protected against Alzheimer’s disease specifically in immune and endo-lysosomal systems

finding: The SNP rs2304256 was identified as a shared locus for RA and severe COVID-19, being a common genetic indicator.
title: Disentangling the common genetic architecture and causality of rheumatoid arthritis and systemic lupus erythematosus with COVID-19 outcomes: genome-wide cross trait analysis and bi-directional Mendelian randomization study

finding: The SNP rs492602 appeared as a critical shared locus between SLE and COVID-19 hospitalization.
title: Disentangling the common genetic architecture and causality of rheumatoid arthritis and systemic lupus erythematosus with COVID-19 outcomes: genome-wide cross trait analysis and bi-directional Mendelian randomization study

finding: The frameshift deletion on ABCA7 was suggestive in both the AD-age score and Cox regressions, reaffirming its role in Alzheimer's disease susceptibility.
title: A novel age-informed approach for genetic association analysis in Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The SNP rs62121377 was characterized as an eQTL for LGALS7, showing a significant effect size (beta = -1.60, p = 4.47e-13) and consistent with previous findings linking reduced LGALS7 expression in lesional skin of psoriasis patients to keratinocyte hyperplasia.
title: Immunosuppression causes dynamic changes in expression QTLs in psoriatic skin

finding: rs492602 was identified as a significant SNP linked to the FUT2 gene, ranking as the fourth-most significant SNP associated with psoriasis. It was noted to be in high linkage disequilibrium with the eSNP rs601338.
title: Immunosuppression causes dynamic changes in expression QTLs in psoriatic skin

finding: The eSNP rs601338 was linked to the FUT2 gene, with an effect size of beta = -0.39 and p = 1.42e-19, confirming its role in psoriasis genetic risk, being in high LD with rs492602.
title: Immunosuppression causes dynamic changes in expression QTLs in psoriatic skin

finding: The sQTL rs12610495:G>A was found to be associated with notable protection against adverse COVID-19 outcomes, demonstrating effective odds ratios of 0.49 for critical illness, 0.64 for hospitalization, and 0.85 for reported infection. This indicated that the excision of intron junction brought about by this variant played a crucial role in mitigating COVID-19 severity.
title: Alternative splicing in the lung influences COVID-19 severity and respiratory diseases

finding: The SNP rs201680145, corresponding to the NOTCH3 variant p.Arg1231Cys, was found to be strongly associated with subcortical hemorrhagic stroke in a case-control analysis conducted on South Asian populations, with an odds ratio of 3.39 (95% CI: [2.26, 5.10], p value = 3.87x10^-9). It was also associated with all strokes combined (OR = 2.18 [1.65, 2.89], p value = 4.44x10^-8). The variant was enriched in South Asians with an alternate allele frequency of 0.58%, significantly higher than that in Western Europeans.
title: NOTCH3 p.Arg1231Cys is Markedly Enriched in South Asians and Associated with Stroke

finding: The SNP rs429358 was integral to the <italic>APOE4</italic> isoform characterization and contributed to the genetic risk scores established for AD. Its presence was linked to significant positive associations for lipid traits measured across different age cohorts.
title: Effects of genetic liability to Alzheimer’s disease on circulating metabolites across the life course

finding: SNP rs7412, in conjunction with rs429358, delineated the <italic>APOE4</italic> genotype within the genetic risk score framework. It was associated with alterations in circulating lipids and fatty acids, implicating a role in early AD pathogenesis.
title: Effects of genetic liability to Alzheimer’s disease on circulating metabolites across the life course

finding: The SNP rs76076446 was associated with RAX2, which is crucial in eye development and has been linked to retinal degeneration, affecting PRC layer thickness.
title: Sub-cellular level resolution of common genetic variation in the photoreceptor layer identifies continuum between rare disease and common variation

finding: The rs429358 variant in the APOE ε4 locus was found to be a significant risk factor for Alzheimer's disease and showed strong genetic influences on functional connectivity in both resting and task-based fMRI, particularly affecting the visual cortex within the secondary visual and default mode networks.
title: Genetic influences on the intrinsic and extrinsic functional organizations of the cerebral cortex

finding: Similar to rs239358, the SNP rs7412 was also linked to the APOE genotype classification. The results highlighted that individuals carrying the APOE epsilon 4 allele, identified through rs7412, showed a greater susceptibility to cognitive impairment, establishing a connection between this SNP and cognitive decline risk in the studied population.
title: Anticholinergic burden in middle and older age is associated with reduced cognitive function, but not with brain atrophy

finding: The variant rs7412 of the APOE gene was associated with different rates of cognitive decline at extreme old age. Specifically, this SNP contributed to the categorization of APOE alleles e2, e3, and e4, which correlated with the total memory scores in participants, indicating its role in cognitive function.
title: Bayesian Variable Selection Utilizing Posterior Probability Credible Intervals

finding: The variant rs429358 of the APOE gene was linked to varying rates of cognitive decline among centenarians. This SNP was essential in determining the APOE allele types that were analyzed in relation to total memory scores, supporting its association with cognitive decline.
title: Bayesian Variable Selection Utilizing Posterior Probability Credible Intervals

finding: The rs5030775 (A18T) polymorphism was reported to be associated with more potent stimulation of the IP3 response compared to wild type LH. This mutation potentially altered GnRH pulse frequency and increased <italic>LHB</italic> gene expression, which could influence serum LH levels and associated menstrual cycle irregularities in women with PCOS.
title: Novel Mutations in Human Luteinizing Hormone Beta Subunit Related to Polycystic Ovary Syndrome among Sudanese Women

finding: The rs1800447 (W28R) polymorphism was associated with protein glycosylation, which impacted responses to controlled ovarian stimulation and was linked to menstrual irregularities and elevated testosterone levels in women with PCOS.
title: Novel Mutations in Human Luteinizing Hormone Beta Subunit Related to Polycystic Ovary Syndrome among Sudanese Women

finding: The rs34349826 (I35T) polymorphism was associated with increased serum LH and testosterone levels, and was linked to irregular menstrual cycles but not to recurrent abortions, emphasizing the importance of LH in follicle maturation.
title: Novel Mutations in Human Luteinizing Hormone Beta Subunit Related to Polycystic Ovary Syndrome among Sudanese Women

finding: The rs8179181 variant of the TGFB1 gene was associated with Parkinson's disease (PD), with a reproducible protective effect indicated by an odds ratio (OR) of 0.48 (95% CI 0.32–0.73, p = 0.00057) across both the discovery and replication phases of the study.
title: TGFB1 rs8179181 polymorphism is reproducibly associated with Parkinson’s disease in a Spanish population

finding: In the context of Alzheimer's disease (AD), the rs429358 SNP was used to assess the impact of APOE epsilon 4 allele count on AD diagnosis. The sensitivity analysis conducted demonstrated that this SNP significantly influenced the results, as APOE epsilon 4 count is strongly associated with AD.
title: CSF sphingomyelins in Alzheimer’s disease, neurodegeneration, and neuroinflammation

finding: The rs7412 SNP was analyzed alongside rs429358 in the determination of APOE genotype relevance for AD. The treatment of these SNPs as covariates revised the interpretations concerning their association with AD pathology.
title: CSF sphingomyelins in Alzheimer’s disease, neurodegeneration, and neuroinflammation

finding: A missense variant in PLAUR that connects its mediation to the plasminogen-activating system, relevant for trauma responses.
title: Mapping pQTLs of circulating inflammatory proteins identifies drivers of immune-related disease risk and novel therapeutic targets

finding: The study indicated that SNP rs1160985, positioned at chr19:45403412, was a top-hit in genetic analyses while assessing the polygenic risk score conditioning on other relevant genetic variations among the cohorts studied. This SNP's exclusion from the APOE region aimed to get more accurate associations with Alzheimer's disease and cognitive decline.
title: Polygenic effects on the risk of Alzheimer’s disease in the Japanese population

finding: The SNP rs1808382 was identified as a lead variant in the gene ACTN4, which showed strong association with both vascular tortuosity and coronary artery disease (CAD). It was previously reported in association with CAD, reinforcing its role in cardiovascular disease mechanisms.
title: GWAS of Retinal Vessel Tortuosity Identifies 173 Novel Loci Revealing Genes and Pathways Associated with Vascular Pathomechanics and Cardiometabolic Diseases

finding: The G allele of rs12610495 resulted in lower DPP9 expression and higher methylation at a specific CpG site in lungs of individuals with IPF. This variant was associated with increased risk of both IPF and critically ill COVID-19, and showed strong colocalization with eQTL signals in fibroblasts from IPF lung.
title: Context-specific eQTLs reveal causal genes underlying shared genetic architecture of critically ill COVID-19 and idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis

finding: This SNP was associated at the eQTL level for DPP9 in fibroblasts, highlighting its role in the context of IPF as a plausible causal variant.
title: Context-specific eQTLs reveal causal genes underlying shared genetic architecture of critically ill COVID-19 and idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis

finding: This variant demonstrated strong colocalization with DPP9 expression in IPF cases, highlighting its role as a causal gene associated with this disease.
title: Context-specific eQTLs reveal causal genes underlying shared genetic architecture of critically ill COVID-19 and idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis

finding: SNP rs351973 exhibited a causal role and overlapped with an enhancer region for PTBP1, indicating its potential interaction with genes related to eye disorders.
title: Genome-wide analysis of pleiotropic and functional variants across three age-related ocular disorders

finding: The SNP rs7412 was part of the <italic>APOE</italic> haplotypes assessed in the study. It was found to significantly contribute to the risk stratification for dementia in conjunction with demographics and presence of <italic>APOE</italic>*ε4, particularly in non-Latinx White and Latinx populations. The findings underscored the relevance of this SNP in understanding genetic predisposition to dementia across different ethnic groups.
title: Dementia Risk Scores, APOE, and risk of Alzheimer disease: one size does not fit all

finding: The study identified rs255774 within the LILR gene cluster as a novel susceptibility locus for Crohn's disease (CD), showing an odds ratio (OR) of 1.32 (95%CI 1.22 to 1.42, P_meta = 1.71 × 10⁻¹²). Furthermore, rs255774 was found to be a splicing QTL associated with intron splicing efficiency of LILRB2 in whole blood, implicating its role in MHC class I-mediated immune responses.
title: Regulatory Variants on the Leukocyte Immunoglobulin-Like Receptor Gene Cluster are Associated with Crohn’s Disease and Interact with Regulatory Variants for TAP2

finding: The SNP rs429358 was observed to have a strong association with the levels of three cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) modules (M26, M33, and M34), which are related to Alzheimer’s disease (AD) pathology. This association remained significant even after adjustments for potential population stratification using a genomic control (GC) correction approach.
title: Proteomic Network Analysis of Alzheimer’s Disease Cerebrospinal Fluid Reveals Alterations Associated with APOE ε4 Genotype and Atomoxetine Treatment

finding: The C-allele of this SNP, known as the ε4-allele, showed a significant association with Aβ pathology (PC2), with a score adjustment of -0.50SD (SE=0.50, p=1.3*10^-29). It was part of mediation pathways affecting AD status through amyloid and tau pathology.
title: Multivariate GWAS of Alzheimer’s disease CSF biomarker profiles implies GRIN2D in synaptic functioning

finding: The SNP rs10417628 was identified as a missense variant in the <italic>AMH</italic> gene, and was determined to be the strongest signal associated with circulating AMH levels. This variant was significant at p = 1.2 × 10<sup>−11</sup> and affected AMH detection in certain assays.
title: Genome-wide association study meta-analysis identifies three novel loci for circulating anti-Müllerian hormone levels in women

finding: The rs7412 variant of the APOE gene consistently demonstrated higher PAR estimates across all ancestries for Alzheimer's disease, particularly among Black/African American and East Asian individuals.
title: Multi-ancestry population attributable risk assessment of common genetic variation in Alzheimer’s and Parkinson’s diseases

finding: The rs429358 variant of the APOE gene was found to have high PAR values across all ancestries, being the highest in Black/African American and East Asian populations for Alzheimer's disease.
title: Multi-ancestry population attributable risk assessment of common genetic variation in Alzheimer’s and Parkinson’s diseases

finding: SNP rs3745683 in ANGPTL8 was significantly associated with reductions in multiple lipid traits, including lower levels of HDL-C, cholesterol, and ApoA in OSA patients. The variant attenuated ANGPTL8 transcription by inhibiting the binding to transcription factor YBX1, correlating with insulin levels. Insulin stimulation facilitated transcription factor YBX1 phosphorylation, promoting its nuclear translocation and ANGPTL8 expression.
title: Insulin-AKT1-YBX1 Regulation of ANGPTL8 Promote Lipogenesis in Obstructive Sleep Apnea-Associated Dyslipidemia

finding: The variant rs2075803 was found proximal to the SIGLEC9 gene, where it has been linked to increased protein levels in plasma and neutrophils from COPD patients. It was previously associated with higher exacerbation frequency and greater emphysema, underscoring its significance in the disease.
title: Proteomic Networks and Related Genetic Variants Associated with Smoking and Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease

finding: The SNP rs429358 was classified as potentially deleterious, indicating its relevance to chronic pain genetic research.
title: The genetic architecture of pain intensity in a sample of 598,339 U.S. veterans

finding: The variant rs429358 at locus 19q13.32 was associated with insomnia and task functional connectivity in the secondary visual network.
title: The role of sleep in the human brain and body: insights from multi-organ imaging genetics

finding: As a significant marker in KLK3, rs17632542 was shown to have a strong association with PSA levels, affecting prostate cancer risk evaluations.
title: Incorporating Genetic Determinants of Prostate-Specific Antigen Levels Improves Prostate Cancer Screening

finding: This SNP, also related to KLK3, was significantly associated with PSA levels, enhancing screening strategies for prostate cancer.
title: Incorporating Genetic Determinants of Prostate-Specific Antigen Levels Improves Prostate Cancer Screening

finding: The intronic SNP rs872629 in the SIGLEC5 gene was significantly associated with decreased levels of mumps-specific IL-1β secretion (p=1.77E-09) and TNFα secretion (p=1.3E-11). It showed strong linkage disequilibrium with rs1106476, emphasizing its role in mumps vaccine-induced immune responses.
title: Genome-Wide Determinants of Cellular Immune Responses to Mumps Vaccine

finding: The intronic SNP rs1106476 in the SIGLEC5 gene was found to significantly associate with lower levels of mumps-specific IL-1β (p=1.78E-09) and TNFα (p=1.32E-11) production, highlighting its impact on cellular immune response to mumps vaccination.
title: Genome-Wide Determinants of Cellular Immune Responses to Mumps Vaccine

finding: Another intronic SNP in SIGLEC5, rs112456998 was identified with a significant association to mumps-specific IL-1β secretion (p=3.21E-09), emphasizing its contribution to the immune response.
title: Genome-Wide Determinants of Cellular Immune Responses to Mumps Vaccine

finding: This intronic SNP in SIGLEC5 was significantly associated with variations in mumps-specific IL-1β secretion (p=3.85E-09), reinforcing the SNPs in the SIGLEC region's role in vaccine-induced responses.
title: Genome-Wide Determinants of Cellular Immune Responses to Mumps Vaccine

finding: The SNP located in the SIGLEC14 region was significantly associated with mumps-specific IL-1β secretion (p=9.36E-09), showcasing its importance in the immune response.
title: Genome-Wide Determinants of Cellular Immune Responses to Mumps Vaccine

finding: This SNP in SIGLEC14 showed a significant association with IL-1β cytokine response variations, with a p-value of 2.9E-08, indicating its role in mumps-specific immune outcomes.
title: Genome-Wide Determinants of Cellular Immune Responses to Mumps Vaccine

finding: Reportedly associated with mumps susceptibility, this SNP was noted to play a role in immune responses corroborated by earlier studies.
title: Genome-Wide Determinants of Cellular Immune Responses to Mumps Vaccine

finding: The SNP rs429358 located at 19q13.32 had a strong association with Alzheimer's disease and was notably linked to the visual cortex in the secondary visual and default mode networks. The risk allele 'C' was associated with decreased functional connectivity in the visual cortex, which correlated with visual deficits, a primary symptom of Alzheimer's disease.
title: Genetic influences on the intrinsic and extrinsic functional organizations of the cerebral cortex

finding: The rs429358 variant was identified as a strong risk factor for delirium, with a reported odds ratio of 1.6 [1.55 – 1.65], and a highly significant p-value of 9.7×10^-177. This missense variant was part of the APOE-ε4 haplotype and exhibited population-specific genetic effects for delirium.
title: Dissecting the genetic and proteomic risk factors for delirium

finding: The rs7412 variant demonstrated a significant association with delirium, with an odds ratio of 0.84 [0.79 – 0.88] and a p-value of 1.8×10^-11. It was linked to the same APOE-ε4 haplotype as rs429358.
title: Dissecting the genetic and proteomic risk factors for delirium

finding: The rs117310449 SNP was identified in the multi-trait analysis and demonstrated an association with delirium, showing an odds ratio of 1.09 [1.07 - 1.1] and a p-value of 7×10^-38.
title: Dissecting the genetic and proteomic risk factors for delirium

finding: The rs7412 SNP was directly genotyped as part of the APOE genotype which was found to be associated with a 2.5-fold increased risk of dementia for heterozygotes and a 6.3-fold increased risk for homozygotes compared to ε3/ε3 individuals. Additionally, it was linked to a 1.4-fold increased risk of cognitive decline.
title: Effect of APOE and a polygenic risk score on incident dementia and cognitive decline in a healthy older population

finding: The rs429358 SNP was also part of the APOE genotype analysis revealing similar results as rs7412, noting a 2.5-fold increased risk of dementia for heterozygotes and a 6.3-fold increase for homozygotes against ε3/ε3, along with a 1.4-fold increase in risk for cognitive decline.
title: Effect of APOE and a polygenic risk score on incident dementia and cognitive decline in a healthy older population

finding: The SNP rs11085147 was found to be significantly associated with mtDNA copy number (mtDNAcn) in brain data, with a p-value of 0.0436 after Bonferroni adjustment. This finding indicated that each additional dosage of the alternative allele of rs11085147 increased mtDNAcn by 0.23 standard deviations. The SNP is a missense variant of the gene Lon Peptidase 1 (LONP1), which is involved in mitochondrial DNA replication and mitogenesis. This effect was consistent across four brain regions analyzed and aligned with the initially reported direction in blood samples, despite no established link to Alzheimer’s disease (AD) risk.
title: Characterization of mitochondrial DNA quantity and quality in the human aged and Alzheimer’s disease brain

finding: This SNP colocalized with four T2D index variants in plasma pQTL studies, relating to increased CBLN4 levels and its pathways involved with T2D.
title: Multi-omics characterization of type 2 diabetes associated genetic variation

finding: The missense variant rs76076446-A in RAX2 was significantly associated with thinning of the outer plexiform layer (OPL), providing insight into genetic factors affecting this retinal layer.
title: Insights into human health from phenome- and genome-wide analyses of UK Biobank retinal optical coherence tomography phenotypes

finding: The rs5030775 (A18T) mutation was found to enhance stimulation of IP3 response compared to the wild type LH, indicating a potential impact on the regulation of the LH gene expression in relation to PCOS.
title: The Revelation of Novel Mutations in Human Luteinizing Hormone Beta Subunit Related to Polycystic Ovary Syndrome among Sudanese Women

finding: The rs1800447 (W28R) mutation was associated with protein glycosylation and was highlighted as significant in regulating controlled ovarian stimulation and the manifestation of PCOS symptoms.
title: The Revelation of Novel Mutations in Human Luteinizing Hormone Beta Subunit Related to Polycystic Ovary Syndrome among Sudanese Women

finding: The rs34349826 (I35T) polymorphism was reported as significantly linked to alterations in protein glycosylation which may enhance the biological activity of the LH molecule, thus affecting PCOS outcomes.
title: The Revelation of Novel Mutations in Human Luteinizing Hormone Beta Subunit Related to Polycystic Ovary Syndrome among Sudanese Women

finding: The SNP rs157580 was identified as significantly associated with the AD-linked APOE jxn1.2.2 transcript abundance and DNA methylation levels, indicating its regulatory role at the APOE locus in relation to Alzheimer's disease. The association was consistent across European and African populations, suggesting shared genetic mechanisms.
title: Identification of a specific APOE transcript and functional elements associated with Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The SNP rs139412173 located near CERS4 on 19p13.2 was significantly associated with MacTel (P=2.9×10^-8), reinforcing prior findings related to gene loci involved in the retinal pathology.
title: Identification of genetic factors influencing metabolic dysregulation and retinal support for MacTel, a retinal disorder

finding: The SNP rs34084277 demonstrated a significant association with breast cancer (BRCA) risk, acting as the lead isoQTL for the isoform ENST00000599474.5 of the gene BABAM1. It colocalized with GWAS signals, indicating that this isoform contributed to BRCA susceptibility, while no significant gene-level expression was detected.
title: Isoform-level analyses of 6 cancers uncover extensive genetic risk mechanisms undetected at the gene-level

finding: The rs429358 variant of <italic>APOE</italic>-<italic>ε</italic>4 was significantly associated with increased risk of both AD<sup>+</sup>LB<sup>−</sup> and AD<sup>+</sup>LB<sup>+</sup> pathologies compared to no pathology (AD<sup>−</sup>LB<sup>−</sup>). The odds ratios were 4.22 (P = 1.4 × 10<sup>-69</sup>) and 4.24 (P = 1.5 × 10<sup>-52</sup>), respectively. However, it did not show an association with risk for AD<sup>−</sup>LB<sup>+</sup> compared to no pathology.
title: APOE-ε4 and BIN1 increase risk of Alzheimer’s disease pathology but not specifically of Lewy body pathology

finding: The T allele of rs35866622 in the FUT2-FUT1 locus was significantly associated with decreased abundance of the genus Ruminococcus in patients with IBD. This change was measured at P = 2.43×10-8, indicating a robust genetic influence on gut microbiota composition that may augment the risk for both IBD and comorbid mental disorders (CMD). The finding suggested that the IBD-risk allele at this locus contributed to alterations in gut microbiota which can influence CMD development in IBD patients.
title: Gut microbial and human genetic signatures of inflammatory bowel disease increase risk of comorbid mental disorders

finding: The nonsense variant rs601338 in FUT2 was noted to be in high linkage disequilibrium with rs35866622 and was implicated in regulating the abundance of several IBD-associated taxa. This variant's absence of functional H antigens in the gut was associated with significant changes in microbial composition, reinforcing the genetic connection between FUT2 alleles and microbial dysbiosis in IBD patients, thereby impacting CMD risk. The presence of the rs601338 variant also suggested an important genetic mechanism that might facilitate the increase in mental health issues among IBD sufferers.
title: Gut microbial and human genetic signatures of inflammatory bowel disease increase risk of comorbid mental disorders

finding: The SNP rs7412 was one of the single nucleotide polymorphisms defining the APOE genotype, specifically contributing to the known modifying effect of APOE ε4 dosage on the relationship between fish oil supplementation and the onset of dementia.
title: Gene-diet interaction analysis in UK Biobank identified genetic loci that modify the association between fish oil supplementation and the incidence of dementia

finding: The SNP rs429358 also defined the APOE genotype and was shown to modify the relationship between fish oil supplementation and dementia onset in a manner similar to rs7412.
title: Gene-diet interaction analysis in UK Biobank identified genetic loci that modify the association between fish oil supplementation and the incidence of dementia

finding: The SNP rs6511720 in the LDLR locus was found to influence absolute biomarker change with a beta of -0.103 and a p-value of 1.29e-09 in the LDL-C response to statins GWAS.
title: Leveraging large-scale biobank EHRs to enhance pharmacogenetics of cardiometabolic disease medications

finding: The SNP rs7412 in the APOE locus was shown to exhibit a pharmacogenetic effect with a beta of 0.254 and a p-value of 2.08e-31, influencing relative biomarker change.
title: Leveraging large-scale biobank EHRs to enhance pharmacogenetics of cardiometabolic disease medications

finding: Mapped to NIBAN3 and was part of a significant combinatorial association with mt.2706 in the context of PD-risk, while being previously associated with cerebrovascular disease.
title: Interactions between nuclear and mitochondrial SNPs and Parkinson’s disease risk

finding: The SNP rs2233678 was associated with a reduced risk of cancer, as indicated in a meta-analysis involving the PIN1 promoter region. This finding was crucial as it linked genetic variation to cancer susceptibility, informing further investigations into genetic factors affecting cancer and potentially its association with dementia.
title: Association between cancer and dementia risk in the UK Biobank: evidence of diagnostic bias

finding: The SNP rs280501 linked to TYK2 was identified as a specific meQTL risk locus in naïve CD4+ T cells, suggesting its role in T cell activation relevant to lupus.
title: Hypomethylation of miR-17-92 cluster in lupus T cells and no significant role for genetic factors in the lupus-associated DNA methylation signature

finding: SNP rs628271 at locus 19p13.3 was notably associated with the cleft palate (CLP) subtype, particularly showing a larger effect size for the CLP subgroup than for other family-based subsets, indicating its relevance in the genetic landscape of OFCs.
title: Genome-wide association study of multiethnic non-syndromic orofacial cleft families identifies novel loci specific to family and phenotypic subtypes

finding: The variant rs61752561 was identified as influencing glycosylation and the functional properties of prostate-specific antigen (PSA), indicating its role as a significant causal variant for prostate cancer.
title: A novel Bayesian fine-mapping model using a continuous global-local shrinkage prior with applications in prostate cancer analysis

finding: rs1808382 had been associated with retinal vessel tortuosity and shared a genetic basis with Coronary Artery Disease, being linked to the ACTN4/CAPN12 genes. This association underlined the utility of retinal vascular traits as biomarkers for cardiovascular diseases.
title: Genome-Wide Association Studies of retinal vessel tortuosity identify 173 novel loci, capturing genes and pathways associated with disease and vascular tissue pathomechanics

finding: Evidence indicated rs12610448 was associated with TIMM44 expression and the regulation of IFNB1, further validating its role in Mtb-induced responses.
title: Mycobacterium tuberculosis-dependent Monocyte Expression Quantitative Trait Loci and Tuberculosis Pathogenesis

finding: In the ancestry-specific GWAS, a significant association was found in the AFR ancestry cohort at locus rs146660284, demonstrating a notable effect size (P=2.5 x 10^-8, beta=0.67), which was not detected in the non-Finnish European (NFE) analyses. This finding highlighted the importance of including diverse ancestry groups in genetic studies.
title: Genetic architecture of telomere length in 462,675 UK Biobank whole-genome sequences

finding: The rs429358 variant in the APOE ε4 locus was strongly associated with Alzheimer's disease and was found to decrease functional connectivity specifically in the visual cortex across both resting and task fMRI. It exhibited shared genetic influences with Alzheimer's disease, particularly in the secondary visual network, showcasing a significant link between this SNP and the development of visual deficits in Alzheimer’s patients.
title: Genetic influences on the intrinsic and extrinsic functional organizations of the cerebral cortex

finding: The SNP rs429358 was linked to the APOE genotype, specifically causing an amino acid substitution of Cys to Arg at residue 112. The APOE4 haplotype, characterized by this SNP, was found to predispose individuals to Alzheimer's disease (AD) with an odds ratio (OR) of 2 to 4 for heterozygous carriers.
title: Trans-ethnic Genomic Informed Risk Assessment for Alzheimer’s disease: An International Hundred K+ Cohorts Consortium Study

finding: The SNP rs7412 was associated with the APOE isoforms, leading to an amino acid substitution of Arg to Cys at residue 158. The presence of the APOE2 haplotype, which includes this SNP, was shown to be protective against AD.
title: Trans-ethnic Genomic Informed Risk Assessment for Alzheimer’s disease: An International Hundred K+ Cohorts Consortium Study

finding: The SNP designated as chr19:44908684:T:C corresponds to rs429358 which was noted to influence the risk of AD through its association with the APOE haplotypes.
title: Trans-ethnic Genomic Informed Risk Assessment for Alzheimer’s disease: An International Hundred K+ Cohorts Consortium Study

finding: The SNP chr19:44908822:C:T aligns with rs7412, and its association with the APOE2 haplotype was described as protective against AD.
title: Trans-ethnic Genomic Informed Risk Assessment for Alzheimer’s disease: An International Hundred K+ Cohorts Consortium Study

finding: The study identified that the APOE genotype, which included the SNP rs7412, was classified into risk categories for dementia: E2 for low risk, E3 for neutral risk, and E4 for high risk. This classification provided insights into the genetic risk associated with dementia development.
title: Associations of Midlife Diet Quality with Incident Dementia and Brain Structure: Findings from the UK Biobank Study

finding: Similarly, the SNP rs429358 was part of the APOE genotype classification, which indicated a high risk for dementia when categorized as E4. The findings underscored the impact of these genetic factors on the risk of developing dementia.
title: Associations of Midlife Diet Quality with Incident Dementia and Brain Structure: Findings from the UK Biobank Study

finding: The lead variant rs73005873:G>A in MUC16 was also an intronic variant that increased the risk for SARS-CoV-2 infection (OR = 1.03, 95% CI = 1.02–1.04, P = 6.4 × 10−10).
title: A second update on mapping the human genetic architecture of COVID-19

finding: The rs429358 SNP, associated with APOE4 status, accounted for 3.6% of the variation in cortical tau. It was observed to have additive effects alongside rs2113389, suggesting a synergistic influence on tau deposition in AD.
title: Novel CYP1B1-RMDN2 Alzheimer’s disease locus identified by genome-wide association analysis of cerebral tau deposition on PET

finding: The variant rs429358 in the APOE gene was noted as the only robustly replicated genome-wide variant associated with BMI change over time.
title: Association between plausible genetic factors and weight loss from GLP1-RA and bariatric surgery: a multi-ancestry study in 10 960 individuals from 9 biobanks

finding: The rs12610495 variant was significantly associated with severe COVID-19 at the chr19:4717660:A:G locus, revealing trends for association particularly in younger individuals.
title: Detailed stratified GWAS analysis for severe COVID-19 in four European populations

finding: The rs1405655 variant was found at the chr19:50379362:T:C locus, newly identified as significant for severe COVID-19 (P=3.25×10^-8, OR=1.09).
title: Detailed stratified GWAS analysis for severe COVID-19 in four European populations

finding: Relay of the discovery related to rs687289, further consolidating the association with severe COVID-19.
title: Detailed stratified GWAS analysis for severe COVID-19 in four European populations

finding: With ties to rs12610495, associations were advised particularly amongst the middle-aged and older demographics.
title: Detailed stratified GWAS analysis for severe COVID-19 in four European populations

finding: Newly identified locus at 19q13.33 associated with COVID-19 severity, representing an important breakthrough in genetic research.
title: Detailed stratified GWAS analysis for severe COVID-19 in four European populations

finding: The rs7412 SNP was part of the evaluation of APOE haplotypes, which were determined to influence dementia risk. Specifically, the findings indicated that the presence of the APOE ε4 allele, which can be linked to the rs7412 variant, exacerbated the risk effect on dementia, highlighting its significant role in the genetic assessment of dementia across diverse populations.
title: Modifiable risk factors, APOE and risk of Alzheimer disease: one size does not fit all

finding: This novel intronic variant in CACNG7 was found associated with AUDIT-C and has previous links to intelligence.
title: Genetic underpinnings of the transition from alcohol consumption to alcohol use disorder: shared and unique genetic architectures in a cross-ancestry sample

finding: Located near LILRB1, it exhibited direct effects on AUD.
title: Genetic underpinnings of the transition from alcohol consumption to alcohol use disorder: shared and unique genetic architectures in a cross-ancestry sample

finding: The SNP rs59774409 at the FCGRT locus was found significant with a p-value of 2.4 × 10<sup>−8</sup> in European individuals. It was associated with serum albumin and lipids and identified as a cis-pQTL for the protein IRF3.
title: Characterizing common and rare variations in non-traditional glycemic biomarkers using multivariate approaches on multi-ancestry ARIC study

finding: The variant rs1047781 (p.I140F) in the FUT2 locus was found to be an East Asian-specific common variant (MAF = 0.439) and correlated with non-secretor status. It had an odds ratio of 1.17 (P = 2.9 × 10−11), indicating a higher risk of PUD in non-secretors.
title: East Asian-specific and cross-ancestry genome-wide meta-analyses provide mechanistic insights into peptic ulcer disease

finding: The SNP rs1221971156, which is another inframe deletion in LDLR, also showed a high OR over 20 for hyperlipidaemia risk, with a strong association as 6 out of 7 carriers were cases.
title: Weighted burden analysis of rare coding variants in 470,000 exome-sequenced UK Biobank subject characterises effects on hyperlipidaemia risk

finding: The SNP rs72658867, located in the splice region, was found to be associated with reduced risk of hyperlipidaemia with an odds ratio (OR) of 0.82, driven by its minor allele frequencies (MAF) observed in controls (0.0126) compared to cases (0.0096), and was previously reported to lower HDL cholesterol.
title: Weighted burden analysis of rare coding variants in 470,000 exome-sequenced UK Biobank subject characterises effects on hyperlipidaemia risk

finding: The study demonstrated that the variant TOMM40:rs11556505-T increased the risk of Alzheimer's disease (AD) in APOE ε4 carriers, particularly among European populations.
title: Biobank-scale characterization of Alzheimer’s disease and related dementias identifies potential disease-causing variants, risk factors, and genetic modifiers across diverse ancestries

finding: APOE:rs449647-T was reported to have a modifying effect where it decreased the risk of AD among European APOE ε4 carriers, while it increased the risk in African APOE ε4 carriers.
title: Biobank-scale characterization of Alzheimer’s disease and related dementias identifies potential disease-causing variants, risk factors, and genetic modifiers across diverse ancestries

finding: The variant 19q13.31:rs10423769-A was shown to reduce the risk of AD specifically in individuals of African ancestry, highlighting its role as a disease-modifying locus.
title: Biobank-scale characterization of Alzheimer’s disease and related dementias identifies potential disease-causing variants, risk factors, and genetic modifiers across diverse ancestries

finding: ABCA7:rs72973581-A was identified as a protective variant across the studied ancestries.
title: Biobank-scale characterization of Alzheimer’s disease and related dementias identifies potential disease-causing variants, risk factors, and genetic modifiers across diverse ancestries

finding: NFIC:rs9749589-A was noted for its potential resilience.
title: Biobank-scale characterization of Alzheimer’s disease and related dementias identifies potential disease-causing variants, risk factors, and genetic modifiers across diverse ancestries

finding: APOE3 Christchurch:rs121918393-A was classified as a resilient variant.
title: Biobank-scale characterization of Alzheimer’s disease and related dementias identifies potential disease-causing variants, risk factors, and genetic modifiers across diverse ancestries

finding: The variant rs12459249 on chromosome 19 was found to be associated with the nicotine metabolite ratio (NMR) in a study involving approximately 1000 African-American participants, demonstrating its significance in nicotine metabolism.
title: Genetic insights into smoking behaviours in 10,558 men of African ancestry from continental Africa and the UK

finding: Similar to rs12459249, rs111645190 was also associated with the nicotine metabolite ratio (NMR) in the same study of 1000 African-American participants, indicating its role in nicotine processing.
title: Genetic insights into smoking behaviours in 10,558 men of African ancestry from continental Africa and the UK

finding: In the same analysis of around 1000 African-American participants, rs185430475 was additionally associated with the nicotine metabolite ratio (NMR), emphasizing its importance in smoking-related traits.
title: Genetic insights into smoking behaviours in 10,558 men of African ancestry from continental Africa and the UK

finding: The SNP rs429358, part of the APOE gene, demonstrated robust positive associations specifically for cholesterol-related traits. The study highlighted that the presence of the APOE4 isoform, inferred from the genetic risk scores that included this SNP, significantly influenced levels of low-density lipoprotein cholesterol (LDL-C) across various age groups.
title: Effects of genetic liability to Alzheimer’s disease on circulating metabolites across the life course

finding: The SNP rs7412, also a component of the APOE gene impacting the APOE4 isoform, was associated with heightening the genetic risk score for Alzheimer's disease. This association contributed to the notable positive effects recorded on lipid traits, especially in relation to cholesterol levels.
title: Effects of genetic liability to Alzheimer’s disease on circulating metabolites across the life course

finding: The SNP rs2108622 was analyzed in relation to genetically determined higher absolute α-tocopherol levels and was suggestively associated with a reduced risk of schizophrenia (SCZ). In the analysis, the odds ratio (OR) per unit increase in log-transformed α-tocopherol values was 0.71 with a 95% confidence interval (CI) of 0.53 to 0.95 (P = 0.023), indicating a marginal protective effect.
title: Investigating Causal Associations of Diet-Derived Circulating Antioxidants with Risk of Six Major Mental Disorders: A Mendelian Randomization Study

finding: The SNP rs2075650 was identified through a phenome-wide association study (PheWAS) showing significant associations with hyperlipidemia (HLD), Alzheimer's disease (AD), and cholesterol levels. It was part of a shared locus linked to both HLD and AD, supporting a causal relationship evidenced by colocalization analyses that indicated a connection with the APOE protein. This SNP was notably highlighted in networks that integrated electronic health records (EHRs) and pointed to a broader biological significance regarding AD risk.
title: Leveraging Electronic Medical Records and Knowledge Networks to Predict Disease Onset and Gain Biological Insight Into Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The rs25487 polymorphism in XRCC1 was implicated as a factor associated with severe oral mucositis and poor treatment response after radiotherapy for oropharyngeal carcinoma, revealing the connection between DNA repair mechanisms and pain severity post-RT.
title: Systematic Review of Genetic Polymorphisms Associated with Acute Pain and Relevant Acute Toxicities Induced by Radiotherapy for Head and Neck Cancer

finding: The SNP rs11670056, located in the ELL gene on chromosome 19, was identified as the top SNP after filtering in the latent MDD-CVD factor analysis. It was previously associated with multiple cardiovascular diseases, blood traits, body mass index (BMI), and educational attainment, indicating its relevance to both MDD and CVD.
title: Distinct biological signature and modifiable risk factors underly the comorbidity between major depressive disorder and cardiovascular disease

finding: The SNP rs7412 was also analyzed for its role in determining APOE genotype status. Participants carrying the APOE-ε2 allele, identified by this SNP, exhibited different dementia risk patterns. The presence of the APOE-ε2 genotype was noted as a potential protective factor against dementia in the context of the findings.
title: Association between anticholinergic burden and dementia in UK Biobank

finding: The variant rs34536443 was associated with seven autoimmune traits, indicating its involvement in multiple autoimmune disorders and suggesting a high degree of pleiotropy.
title: 3D chromatin-based variant-to-gene maps across 57 human cell types reveal the cellular and genetic architecture of autoimmune disease susceptibility

finding: The rs12979860 SNP within the IFNL4 gene was significantly associated with COVID-19 susceptibility. The study showed that the presence of the CC allele of rs12979860 was lower in COVID-19 patients compared to non-COVID-19 controls (38% vs 55%, p<0.0001). This suggests that the CC allele may confer protection against COVID-19, aligning with previously reported protective effects during HCV and upper respiratory viral infections.
title: Genetic variation of IFNL4 is associated with COVID-19

finding: Although initially indicated as rs12979860, the study often referred to it as rs12979680. The findings related to this SNP indicated a similar correlation to that of rs12979860 and suggested a protective effect of the CC genotype against COVID-19, with a significant difference observed between patients and controls (38% vs 55%, p=0.0001). This SNP was tied to protective mechanisms previously identified in HCV infection.
title: Genetic variation of IFNL4 is associated with COVID-19

finding: The SNP rs11548193 was identified as a cis-pQTL for BCAT2, associated with COVID-19 infection, showing a P value of 3.09×10−69. This association supported the identification of BCAT2 as a causal plasma biomarker for COVID-19 infection.
title: Plasma proteomics of SARS-CoV-2 infection and severity reveals impact on Alzheimer and coronary disease pathways

finding: SNP rs4802507 was analyzed for its potential association with BCAT2, linking it to COVID-19 infection outcomes; however, detailed findings related to rs4802507 were not explicitly detailed in the provided text.
title: Plasma proteomics of SARS-CoV-2 infection and severity reveals impact on Alzheimer and coronary disease pathways

finding: The SNP rs3752246 in the ABCA7 gene was significantly associated with lactosylceramides (LacCers), specifically LacCer (d18:1/24:1), demonstrating a Pearson correlation coefficient of -0.53 with a p-value of 7.16 x 10^-44. This association suggested that the risk of Alzheimer's disease (AD) potentially involves alterations in LacCer metabolism, mediated by functional variations in ABCA7. Additionally, it was found that rs3752246 was one of ten independent variants at ABCA7 linked to significant metabolic features related to cognitive performance, highlighting its relevance in AD pathology.
title: Metabolome-wide association study on ABCA7 demonstrates a role for ceramide metabolism in impaired cognitive performance and Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The SNP rs62117206, an intronic variant to BCL3, was found to colocalize with the CpG cg27087650. This finding linked DNA methylation at this locus to coronary artery disease, demonstrating a potential biological pathway influenced by BCL3 expression.
title: Elucidating the genetic architecture of DNA methylation to identify promising molecular mechanisms of disease

finding: The SNP rs4803750 was in linkage disequilibrium with rs62117206 and also associated with the CpG cg27087650 (BCL3). The strong association indicates a significant role of methylation at this site in relation to coronary artery disease.
title: Elucidating the genetic architecture of DNA methylation to identify promising molecular mechanisms of disease

finding: The study identified the missense variant rs35033974 as being associated with specific proteins related to TEX101 in human spermatozoa. This finding was significant as it demonstrated a linkage between the SNP and the functionality of testicular proteins that might be relevant in the context of non-obstructive azoospermia treatment and diagnostics.
title: Germ cell-specific proteins ACRV1 and AKAP4 facilitate identification of rare spermatozoa in semen of non-obstructive azoospermia patients

finding: SNP rs429358 showed a positive association with atherosclerotic outcomes, with an OR<sub>IVW</sub> of 1.005, 95% CI from 1.003 to 1.007, and a p-value <0.001, implicating it in the risk of atherosclerosis.
title: Causality of Genetically Determined Monounsaturated Fatty Acids on Risk of Cardiovascular Disease: A Mendelian Randomization Study

finding: The rs56289821 SNP was associated with atherosclerosis, evidenced by an OR<sub>IVW</sub> of 1.005 and a significant p-value <0.001, indicating its possible role in the genetic risk of atherosclerotic disease.
title: Causality of Genetically Determined Monounsaturated Fatty Acids on Risk of Cardiovascular Disease: A Mendelian Randomization Study

finding: The variant rs56113850 was previously identified as the top-ranked variant for urinary nicotine metabolite ratio (uNMR) across all ethnic groups tested. It was associated with nicotine metabolism and significant in analyses examining nicotine biomarkers, particularly pointing to its location in the fourth intron of CYP2A6 with a marginal result of β = 0.40 and P = 5.4E-48.
title: Multiethnic Prediction of Nicotine Biomarkers and Association with Nicotine Dependence

finding: Variant rs12459249 was identified as a proximal trained variant associated with TNE modeling and was previously recognized as the top-ranked variant for laboratory-based nicotine metabolite ratio studies. The associations reflected its significant roles in tobacco exposure across different ethnicities.
title: Multiethnic Prediction of Nicotine Biomarkers and Association with Nicotine Dependence

finding: This SNP was part of a credible set for the causal variant associated with two high-confidence effector genes, APOE and WSCD2. It highlighted the genetic link considering its implication in Alzheimer's disease and its functional relevance to type 2 diabetes.
title: Insights into the comorbidity between type 2 diabetes and osteoarthritis

finding: The missense variant rs1058587 (p.H202D) was identified as a major contributor to the heterogeneity observed in GWAS results of GDF15 plasma levels. Its association was previously linked to hyperemesis gravidarum and it is suggested that its impact may confound results based on the assay methodology employed. This variant was crucial in highlighting the potential for epitope-binding artefacts in studies assessing GDF15 levels.
title: Integrated Analyses of Growth Differentiation Factor-15 Concentration and Cardiometabolic Diseases in Humans

finding: This SNP showed a strengthened signal in the combined meta-analysis with an association to GDF15 plasma levels, reinforcing its potential importance at the GDF15 locus.
title: Integrated Analyses of Growth Differentiation Factor-15 Concentration and Cardiometabolic Diseases in Humans

finding: Rs1227734 was described as the strongest association in a region fine-mapped after conditioning on rs1058587, with a very significant p-value, suggesting a potential role in influencing GDF15 levels.
title: Integrated Analyses of Growth Differentiation Factor-15 Concentration and Cardiometabolic Diseases in Humans

finding: This variant was highlighted in the top configuration of the conditioned meta-analysis with a significant association, potentially contributing to the genetic architecture of GDF15 plasma levels.
title: Integrated Analyses of Growth Differentiation Factor-15 Concentration and Cardiometabolic Diseases in Humans

finding: Found in the top configuration of the fine-mapped association signals, rs138515339 contributed to understanding the genetic determinants of GDF15 plasma levels.
title: Integrated Analyses of Growth Differentiation Factor-15 Concentration and Cardiometabolic Diseases in Humans

finding: Identified in the top configuration of the fine-mapping analysis, suggesting a notable impact on GDF15 plasma levels.
title: Integrated Analyses of Growth Differentiation Factor-15 Concentration and Cardiometabolic Diseases in Humans

finding: The SNP rs10713223 on chromosome 19 was replicated in various cohorts, with a P-value of 1.45 × 10^-27, associating it with vestibulocochlear disorders.
title: GWAS of Chronic Dizziness in the Elderly Identifies Significant Loci Implicating MLLT10, BPTF, LINC01225, and ROS1

finding: The <italic>APOC1</italic> variant rs72654445 was identified as a significant driver in at least one multi-disease cluster, suggesting its role in the genetic overlap seen across neurodegenerative diseases.
title: Genetic risk factor clustering within and across neurodegenerative diseases

finding: The variant rs112952132, which is part of the <italic>CEACAM16/AS1</italic> locus, demonstrated high importance in differentiating genetic clusters C0 and C1 from C2, indicating its utility in understanding genetic risk variants.
title: Genetic risk factor clustering within and across neurodegenerative diseases

finding: For the variant rs111278137 also localized to the <italic>CEACAM16/AS1</italic> locus, it was significant in clustering analysis, showing its relevance to the genetic profile of the studied neurodegenerative diseases.
title: Genetic risk factor clustering within and across neurodegenerative diseases

finding: The likely pathogenic variant p.R352C in NLRP12 was significantly enriched in the Qatari subpopulations of European (AF 12.5%) and South Asian (AF 0.8%), showcasing absence in the 1000 genomes and very low frequencies in global databases.
title: Genetic landscape of rare autoinflammatory disease variants in Qatar and Middle Eastern populations through the integration of whole-genome and exome datasets

finding: The study established that rs117824875 was significantly associated with diabetic kidney disease (DKD) with an odds ratio (OR) of 2.4 and p-value of 0.04. This variant, a nonsynonymous mutation in the ARHGEF18 gene, obstructed normal protein degradation mechanisms, leading to increased protein stability and dysfunction in podocytes, which are crucial for kidney function. Furthermore, individuals carrying the homozygous mutation (A/A) had a notable prevalence of this variant, indicating it as the first unique disease-causing genetic variant identified that influences renal health through altering cytoskeletal dynamics.
title: Deep learning on electronic medical records identifies distinct subphenotypes of diabetic kidney disease driven by genetic variations in the Rho pathway

finding: The SNP rs429358, associated with the APOE e4 allele, was strongly linked with 13 of the 17 Alzheimer’s disease endophenotypes, particularly indicating a significant relationship with measures of amyloid-β, tau, glucose metabolism, and overall cognitive memory score.
title: Genome Wide Analysis Across Alzheimer’s Disease Endophenotypes: Main Effects and Stage Specific Interactions

finding: The SNP rs429358 associated with the APOE ε4 haplotype exhibited a protective effect against PSP (p = 5.71 × 10^-18, beta = -0.60).
title: Whole-Genome Sequencing Analysis Reveals New Susceptibility Loci and Structural Variants Associated with Progressive Supranuclear Palsy

finding: The SNP rs7412 associated with the APOE ε2 haplotype was linked to an increased risk of PSP, yielding p = 9.57 × 10^-16.
title: Whole-Genome Sequencing Analysis Reveals New Susceptibility Loci and Structural Variants Associated with Progressive Supranuclear Palsy

finding: The lead SNP rs4420638 showed significance in association with PSP (p = 2.91 × 10^-19) and was linked to the protective effect seen from the ε4 allele.
title: Whole-Genome Sequencing Analysis Reveals New Susceptibility Loci and Structural Variants Associated with Progressive Supranuclear Palsy

finding: The SNP rs2075650 displayed genome-wide significance for PSP (p = 3.39 × 10^-13), with an associated beta value of -0.51.
title: Whole-Genome Sequencing Analysis Reveals New Susceptibility Loci and Structural Variants Associated with Progressive Supranuclear Palsy

finding: The SNP rs56251816 in FCHO1/MAP1S reached significance at p = 6.57 × 10^-8, showing a beta value of 0.35.
title: Whole-Genome Sequencing Analysis Reveals New Susceptibility Loci and Structural Variants Associated with Progressive Supranuclear Palsy

finding: The SNP rs429358 showed a significant association with Alzheimer's disease (AD), with an effect size comparable to the TREM2.pR47H variant. The false discovery rate associated with this finding was highly significant, noted as Q = 1.8×10^-6.
title: Polygenic risk score analysis identifies deleterious protein-coding variants in novel immune pathway genes ATP8B4, FCGR1A, and LILRB1 that associate with Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The SNP rs12610495 in the DPP9 gene was associated with risk for IPF with an OR of 1.29 (95% CI 1.21-1.37), indicating a genetic predisposition linked to this variant.
title: Genetic landscape of idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis: A systematic review, meta-analysis and epidemiological evidence of case-control studies

finding: The coding variant rs1800470 in TGF-β1 showed a nominal association with IPF, with an OR of 1.08 (95% CI 0.82-1.34), implying potential involvement in IPF risk.
title: Genetic landscape of idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis: A systematic review, meta-analysis and epidemiological evidence of case-control studies

finding: The SNP rs429358 was significantly associated with an increased risk of late-onset Alzheimer’s disease (OR = 3.49, p = 4.94e-324). Additionally, it was associated with an increased risk of brain microbleeds (OR = 1.29, p = 7.48e-10).
title: The Neurodegenerative Disease Knowledge Portal: Propelling Discovery Through the Sharing of Neurodegenerative Disease Genomic Resources

finding: The SNP rs11556505 was significantly associated with an increased risk of Alzheimer’s disease with a p-value of 4.94e-324, identified within a region significantly linked to neurodegenerative processes.
title: The Neurodegenerative Disease Knowledge Portal: Propelling Discovery Through the Sharing of Neurodegenerative Disease Genomic Resources

finding: The SNP rs769449 was associated with an increased risk of brain microbleeds, showing a significant association with a p-value of 2.52e-10, indicating its relevance in neurovascular damage observed in neurodegenerative diseases.
title: The Neurodegenerative Disease Knowledge Portal: Propelling Discovery Through the Sharing of Neurodegenerative Disease Genomic Resources

finding: The study found that rs140808909 (p.E262K) exhibited a statistically significant association with Alzheimer’s disease (AD), with a protective effect (P_Bonferroni = 3.63E-02, OR (95% CI) = 0.70 (0.54–0.92)). This variant was also considered part of the e7 allele, which was in complete linkage disequilibrium with rs190853081.
title: Association of rare APOE missense variants with Alzheimer’s disease in the Japanese population

finding: rs190853081 (p.E263K) showed a significant association with Alzheimer's disease, demonstrating protective effects as evidenced by the results (P_Bonferroni = 3.63E-02, OR (95% CI) = 0.70 (0.54–0.92)). It is linked in complete linkage disequilibrium with rs140808909, defining it as part of the e7 allele.
title: Association of rare APOE missense variants with Alzheimer’s disease in the Japanese population

finding: The SNP rs16939 was one of the original findings related to the DMPK gene haplotype that includes CTG repeat sizes associated with myotonic dystrophy type 1. It was identified as a polymorphism marking the haplotype linked to the pathogenic CTG repeats in the 18-35 range.
title: High Throughput Screening for Expanded CTG repeats in Myotonic Dystrophy Type 1 Using Melt Curve Analysis

finding: The SNP rs10415988 was also listed as an original finding in the context of the DMPK gene haplotype characterization. It served as a key polymorphism linked to the common haplotypes relevant to CTG repeat expansions causing DM1.
title: High Throughput Screening for Expanded CTG repeats in Myotonic Dystrophy Type 1 Using Melt Curve Analysis

finding: The SNP rs4802275 was in complete linkage disequilibrium (LD) with an Alu structural variant and tagged the DMPK haplotype associated with CTG repeat lengths. Its identification contributed to understanding the distribution of repeat sizes crucial for DM1 diagnostics.
title: High Throughput Screening for Expanded CTG repeats in Myotonic Dystrophy Type 1 Using Melt Curve Analysis

finding: The findings reported a correlation between the rs8103163 variant of the ZNF208 gene and an increased likelihood of developing laryngeal cancer. This association was specifically observed in the Northwestern Chinese Han male population, making it a noteworthy genetic variant related to cancer susceptibility.
title: A retrospective case-control study for Clinical Validation of mutated ZNF208 as a novel biomarker of fatal blast crisis in Chronic Myeloid Leukemia

finding: The research indicated that the rs7248488 allele within the ZNF208 gene was associated with a heightened risk of laryngeal cancer. This variant was examined alongside rs8103163 and demonstrated significant relevance in cancer predisposition within the same demographic.
title: A retrospective case-control study for Clinical Validation of mutated ZNF208 as a novel biomarker of fatal blast crisis in Chronic Myeloid Leukemia

finding: The SNP rs429358 was identified as being related to the Apolipoprotein E (APOE) ε4 carrier status. The study found that individuals with one or two APOE ε4 alleles had a high genetic risk for dementia. The findings indicated a 63% increased risk of developing dementia associated with multimorbidity, and this risk highlighted the relevance of APOE ε4 status in understanding dementia incidence.
title: Multimorbidity and risk of incident dementia: role of disease clusters and genetic risk for dementia in a cohort of 206,960 participants

finding: The SNP rs7412 was also linked to the Apolipoprotein E (APOE) ε4 carrier status. It was reported alongside rs429358, indicating that both SNPs were crucial for determining genetic predisposition to dementia. As with rs429358, the presence of one or two APOE ε4 alleles indicated a greater risk of incident dementia, particularly when patients had multimorbidity.
title: Multimorbidity and risk of incident dementia: role of disease clusters and genetic risk for dementia in a cohort of 206,960 participants

finding: The SNP rs429358 was associated with the E4 variant of apolipoprotein E (APOE4), identified as having significant neurodegenerative effects on the hippocampal system starting in individuals' seventh decade. The homozygotic carriers of APOE4 were found to demonstrate reduced hippocampal volume, entorhinal thickness, and decreased integrity of the hippocampal cingulum. Furthermore, it characterized the separation between Alzheimer's disease (AD) and cerebral amyloid angiopathy (CAA) patterns, suggesting its role in distinguishing neurodegenerative processes related to Alzheimer's disease.
title: Exploration of Alzheimer’s Disease MRI Biomarkers Using APOE4 Carrier Status in the UK Biobank

finding: Linked to the contrast of COVID-19 positive vs. negative or unknown cases, with MAF at 31%, OR of 1.06, and significant P-value of 10^(-4). This SNP did not show an association with disease severity.
title: Common genetic variants identify therapeutic targets for COVID-19 and individuals at high risk of severe disease

finding: Found in association with worse disease outcomes near FPR1, the SNP had MAF of 35%, OR of 1.18, and P-value of 10^(-8). It was also overrepresented in hospitalized COVID-19 cases.
title: Common genetic variants identify therapeutic targets for COVID-19 and individuals at high risk of severe disease

finding: The SNP rs1808382, which maps to the ACTN4 gene, was found to be significantly associated with retinal vessel tortuosity with a p-value below 5·10−8. This lead SNP was also independently associated with Coronary Artery Disease, highlighting its importance in linking retinal vascular traits to cardiovascular diseases.
title: GWAS of Retinal Vessel Tortuosity Identifies 173 Novel Loci Revealing Genes and Pathways Associated with Vascular Pathomechanics and Diseases

finding: This SNP was involved in a Mendelian randomization (MR) analysis which indicated that inhibition of C3, genetically proxied by this SNP, significantly reduced the risk of periodontitis, with an odds ratio of 0.91.
title: Using human genetics to validate complement C3 as a drug target in periodontitis

finding: Similar to rs141552034, this SNP was part of the MR analysis demonstrating that genetically proxied C3 blockade reduces periodontitis risk, contributing to an odds ratio of 0.91 per standard deviation decrease in C3.
title: Using human genetics to validate complement C3 as a drug target in periodontitis

finding: This SNP was also utilized in the MR analysis that found a protective effect against periodontitis through C3 inhibition, highlighting an odds ratio of 0.91.
title: Using human genetics to validate complement C3 as a drug target in periodontitis

finding: The SNP rs67397200, located in the ABHD8 gene at 19p13.11, was discovered in a genome-wide association study (GWAS) for estrogen receptor-negative (ER-negative) breast cancer. It was associated with an increased case-case risk of luminal B and triple negative intrinsic-like subtypes, while showing a decreased risk for the luminal A subtype. This association was significant in relation to the ROR-P score and therefore indicated that individuals carrying this variant may have a worse prognosis due to the aggressive nature of certain breast cancer subtypes.
title: Development and testing of a polygenic risk score for breast cancer aggressiveness

finding: The locus rs78631167 showed an association with early-onset AMI, being located upstream of PLAUR, which is involved in fibrinolysis. The association had an OR of 0.473 and a p-value of 2.93 × 10−6.
title: Genome-wide analyses of early-onset acute myocardial infarction identify 29 novel loci by whole genome sequencing

finding: The rs7412 variant at the APOE locus was recognized as a major genetic risk factor for Alzheimer's disease, showing higher PAR estimates in Black/African American and East Asian populations compared to Europeans.
title: Multi-ancestry population attributable risk assessment of common genetic variation in Alzheimer’s and Parkinson’s diseases

finding: The rs429358 variant at the APOE locus consistently exhibited high PAR estimates across all ancestries examined for Alzheimer's disease, particularly in Black/African American and East Asian populations.
title: Multi-ancestry population attributable risk assessment of common genetic variation in Alzheimer’s and Parkinson’s diseases
