finding: The intronic variant rs10419397, located at 19p13, was strongly associated with LA risk (OR: 1.13, 95% CI: 1.10, 1.17; p=1.21×10^-14).
title: Cross-ancestral GWAS identifies 29 novel variants across Head and Neck Cancer subsites

finding: The rs429358 SNP, associated with the APOE ε4 allele, was linked to variations in cerebrospinal fluid total tau (t-tau) levels in Alzheimer’s disease (AD) patients. The findings indicated that individuals with the ε4 allele exhibited distinct impairments in neuronal plasticity, correlating with increased CSF concentrations of plasticity proteins that are regulated by gene repression factors SUZ12 and REST.
title: Cerebrospinal fluid total tau levels indicate aberrant neuronal plasticity in Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The rs7412 SNP, associated with the APOE ε2 allele, contributed to the overall evaluation of APOE genotypes, which were shown to influence CSF t-tau levels in Alzheimer’s disease. Specifically, this SNP was involved in understanding how normal t-tau levels corresponded with decreased concentrations of plasticity proteins and an increase in proteins indicative of blood-brain and blood CSF-barrier dysfunction.
title: Cerebrospinal fluid total tau levels indicate aberrant neuronal plasticity in Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The SNP rs116843064, which corresponds to the ANGPTL4 p.E40K loss-of-function variant, was found to abolish ANGPTL4 function. It was associated with down-regulation of several biological pathways implicated in cancer during gene set enrichment analysis of differential gene expression in normal colon tissue. Specifically, analysis indicated that genetically-proxied circulating ANGPTL4 inhibition was associated with a reduced risk of colorectal cancer, demonstrating a protective role of lower circulating ANGPTL4 concentrations in colorectal cancer risk.
title: Proteogenomic and observational evidence implicate ANGPTL4 as a potential therapeutic target for colorectal cancer prevention

finding: The SNP rs429358, located in the APOE gene, was established as a pathogenic variant associated with Alzheimer’s disease (AD) based on its prevalence in accordance with the APOE-e4 risk isoform.
title: Novel Alzheimer’s disease genes and epistasis identified using machine learning GWAS platform

finding: Similar to rs10735079, the SNP rs2109069 was identified as one of the top robust associations in the GWAS for COVID-19 severity. Its presence in the IGVC indicates that it may contribute to the genetic risk for developing severe COVID-19 outcomes in Indian populations.
title: Genetic risk prediction of COVID-19 susceptibility and severity in the Indian population

finding: Individuals homozygous for the 'C' allele at both APOE rs429358 and rs7412 had a higher genetic risk for Alzheimer's disease, identified as having two copies of the APOE-ε4 allele.
title: Gut-Brain Nexus: Mapping Multi-Modal Links to Neurodegeneration at Biobank Scale

finding: In conjunction with rs429358, having the 'C' allele at rs7412 indicated a higher genetic risk for Alzheimer's disease, as these individuals carried two copies of the APOE-ε4 allele.
title: Gut-Brain Nexus: Mapping Multi-Modal Links to Neurodegeneration at Biobank Scale

finding: The SNP rs429358, which is an allele variant associated with the APOE gene, was assessed for interaction with the polygenic score for sleep duration regarding Alzheimer’s disease risk. The study reported evidence supporting this interaction, suggesting that genetic predisposition seen with rs429358 may influence the relationship between sleep duration and Alzheimer’s disease.
title: Polygenic score for sleep duration in relation to risk of Alzheimer’s disease: results from the UK Biobank

finding: Similar to rs429358, the SNP rs7412 was analyzed for its interaction with the polygenic score related to sleep duration in the context of Alzheimer’s disease risk. Findings indicated that this SNP was relevant in understanding how sleep duration could potentially affect the risk of developing Alzheimer’s disease.
title: Polygenic score for sleep duration in relation to risk of Alzheimer’s disease: results from the UK Biobank

finding: rs72654445, localized to the APOC1 gene, was identified as an important variant influencing membership in clusters C0 and C1. It was associated with overlapping neurological conditions, showcasing a shared genetic etiology related to neurodegenerative diseases.
title: Genetic risk factor clustering within and across neurodegenerative diseases

finding: rs112952132, associated with CEACAM16/AS1, was found to significantly contribute to the differentiation of cluster C2 from C0 and C1, highlighting its role in the genetic landscape of neurodegenerative diseases.
title: Genetic risk factor clustering within and across neurodegenerative diseases

finding: Similar to rs112952132, rs111278137 linked to CEACAM16/AS1, was recognized as a significant determinant in differentiating patients in clusters C0 and C1 from C2, suggesting its relevance in neurodegenerative disease genetic studies.
title: Genetic risk factor clustering within and across neurodegenerative diseases

finding: RS41290102, a variant in the NECTIN2 gene, was found to play a crucial role in separating clusters C0 and C1 from C2, indicating its importance in conferring risk across neurodegenerative diseases.
title: Genetic risk factor clustering within and across neurodegenerative diseases

finding: The SNP rs79701229, also located in NECTIN2, was highlighted for its significant impact on the distinction between C0, C1, and C2 clusters, addressing its contribution to the shared genetic basis of neurodegenerative disorders.
title: Genetic risk factor clustering within and across neurodegenerative diseases

finding: The SNP rs8887 was prioritized for its association with obesity and was linked to enQTL-colocalized events for the TNFAIP8L1 gene, showing connections to 5 hematopoietic traits.
title: Genetic determinants of gene expression noise and its role in complex trait variation

finding: The SNP rs7412, associated with cardiovascular disease and lipid metabolism, was identified from enQTL-colocalized events linked to a novel lncRNA, CTB-129P6.11, in CD8 cells.
title: Genetic determinants of gene expression noise and its role in complex trait variation

finding: The FUT2 stop gained variant rs601338 was linked to a 'putative novel oxylipin,' illustrating its contribution to the genetic component of oxylipin metabolism.
title: Genome-wide association study reveals shared and distinct genetic architecture underlying fatty acid and bioactive oxylipin metabolites in the Hispanic Community Health Study/Study of Latinos (HCHS/SOL)

finding: SNP rs10422256 was linked to LDLR plasma protein levels only in STEMI patients at 24 hours post-event, with a genotype x time interaction showing a beta of -0.29 and a p-value of 0.022. This finding underscored the importance of timing in the effects of genetic variation on molecular phenotypes after STEMI.
title: Single-cell dissection of the immune response after acute myocardial infarction

finding: Similar to rs10735079, rs2109069 was also reported among the top eight robust SNP associations linked to COVID-19 severity in the UK cohort, indicating its relevance to the severity of the disease.
title: Genetic risk prediction of COVID-19 susceptibility and severity in the Indian population

finding: The SNP rs61729813 was identified as the most significantly associated variant with dermatophytosis in the GWAS. It is a missense variant located within an exon of the KLK3 gene, representing alleles C > G, with a minor allele frequency (MAF) of 0.012. The analysis revealed that 0.1% of subjects with the CC genotype experienced dermatophytosis, while 0.3% with the CG genotype were affected, with no individuals homozygous for the GG genotype. The Fisher exact test indicated statistical significance with a p-value less than 0.001. Additionally, carriers of the G allele were found to have an increased odds ratio (O.R.) of 2.321 for developing dermatophytosis.
title: Association of Kallikrein Related Peptidase 3 (KLK3) Gene with Dermatophytosis in the UK Biobank cohort

finding: The SNP rs7412, which is part of the APOE genotypes, was associated with a larger LDL cholesterol lowering response to statins. This finding was derived from a genome-wide association study focusing on individuals treated with statins.
title: The Triangulation WIthin A STudy (TWIST) framework for causal inference within Pharmacogenetic research

finding: The SNP rs429358 was included in determining the APOE genotype distribution, which was relevant for analyzing the LDL cholesterol response to statins. The study indicated that this SNP contributed to the categorization of individuals into various APOE genotypes.
title: The Triangulation WIthin A STudy (TWIST) framework for causal inference within Pharmacogenetic research

finding: The <italic>APOE</italic> rs429358 risk allele C was positively correlated with the proinflammatory genus <italic>Collinsella</italic>, identified as a risk factor for Alzheimer's disease (AD). This correlation was found to be statistically significant in both discovery and replication samples, suggesting that higher abundance of <italic>Collinsella</italic> was associated with the presence of the rs429358 risk allele in AD patients.
title: Genetic correlations between gut microbiota genera and Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The study indicated that the rs7412 SNP was closely related to the defining <italic>APOE</italic> genotype. Specifically, carriers of the <italic>APOE</italic> <epsilon>4 allele, which included individuals with either the <epsilon>2/<epsilon>4, <epsilon>3/<epsilon>4, or <epsilon>4/<epsilon>4 genotypes, displayed a heightened risk of progressing to dementia.
title: The Role of Genomic-Informed Risk Assessments in Predicting Dementia Outcomes

finding: The rs429358 SNP was also used to define the <italic>APOE</italic> genotype in this study. Similar to the rs7412 finding, carriers of the <italic>APOE</italic> <epsilon>4 allele associated with this SNP exhibited significant risk indicators for progressing to dementia, which were noted to be prevalent among participants in memory and aging clinics.
title: The Role of Genomic-Informed Risk Assessments in Predicting Dementia Outcomes

finding: The study provided evidence associating the rs2233154 SNP with MIA protein levels and cognitive decline in Parkinson's Disease (PD) individuals. Specifically, carriers of one or more minor (T) alleles at rs2233154 demonstrated significantly higher MIA expression and a more rapid decline in MoCA scores over five years. In the combined Replication and Validation Cohorts, carriers of T alleles experienced an additional 0.445 points/year decline in MoCA, and there was a trend towards increased rates of incident Mild Cognitive Impairment (MCI) or dementia for these carriers.
title: Plasma MIA, CRP, and albumin predict cognitive decline in Parkinson’s Disease

finding: The variant rs492602 (FUT2 locus) was linked with a stop codon gain mutation, which was found to be protective against life-threatening COVID-19 based on the non-secretor phenotype.
title: Whole genome sequencing identifies multiple loci for critical illness caused by COVID-19

finding: The SNP rs492602 linked to the non-secretor phenotype was highlighted as protective against severe COVID-19 infection.
title: Whole genome sequencing identifies multiple loci for critical illness caused by COVID-19

finding: This stop-gain mutation was associated with the non-secretor phenotype, indicating its role in protective responses to critical COVID-19.
title: Whole genome sequencing identifies multiple loci for critical illness caused by COVID-19

finding: The SNP rs8192726, located in the nicotine metabolizing gene CYP2A6, was found to be associated with the number of cigarettes smoked per day and with methylation at cg18820595 (LTBP4) specifically among smokers (P=8.2×10^-6), indicating a significant regulatory impact related to smoking behaviors.
title: Smoking-informed methylation and expression QTLs in human brain and colocalization with smoking-associated genetic loci

finding: The SNP rs8099917 was evaluated for its impact on treatment response to the direct-acting antivirals Sovaldi, Daklinza, and Ribavirin in Egyptian patients with chronic HCV infection. The study found that the presence of the IL28B polymorphism (rs8099917) was associated with a significant alteration in treatment outcomes. Specifically, certain genotypes of this SNP were linked to improved responses to the antiviral therapy, indicating its potential utility as a predictive biomarker for treatment efficacy.
title: Direct-acting antivirals for chronic hepatitis C infection: a protocol for a systematic review of observational studies

finding: This SNP was previously associated with retinal vessel tortuosity and showed a shared genetic basis with Coronary Artery Disease, implicating it within the ACTN4/CAPN12 genes. Its association underlined the potential of using retinal vascular traits as biomarkers for cardiovascular diseases.
title: Genome-Wide Association Studies of retinal vessel tortuosity identify 173 novel loci, capturing genes and pathways associated with disease and vascular tissue pathomechanics

finding: The rs429358 SNP was analyzed in the context of APOE risk for Alzheimer's disease. It was part of an artificial SNP calculation representing combinations of the alleles. This SNP contributed to understanding the risk associated with different APOE genotypes and indicated significant associations with Alzheimer's disease, particularly in relation to different allelic combinations (e.g., ε3/ε4).
title: Contributions of rare and common variation to early-onset and atypical dementia risk

finding: The rs7412 SNP was similarly included in the analysis of APOE risk factors, calculated along with rs429358 to represent the APOE status. This SNP also demonstrated a significant relationship to the risk of developing Alzheimer's disease when analyzed in combination with other alleles, underlining its importance in the understanding of Alzheimer's genetic predisposition.
title: Contributions of rare and common variation to early-onset and atypical dementia risk

finding: The rs1800472 SNP, a low-producing TGF-β1 polymorphism, was significantly associated with increased risk of graft loss in kidney transplantation. The presence of the T-allele in donor kidneys nearly doubled the risk of graft loss, with incidence rates showing 16.4% in the CC-genotype group compared to 28.9% in the CT-genotype group. This finding illustrated a protective effect of higher TGF-β1 levels on long-term graft survival.
title: A functional TGFB1 polymorphism in the donor associates with long-term graft survival after kidney transplantation

finding: The missense variant TM6SF2 p.Leu156Pro (rs187429064) was associated with a decreased likelihood of being prescribed statins (Odds Ratio 0.86, p-value 3.8 x 10^-13), but it indicated an increased likelihood for insulin medication for diabetes (OR 1.17, p-value 8.2 x 10^-11) and Type 2 Diabetes (OR 1.15, p-value 2.6 x 10^-8). It also presented a strong association with an increased risk of hepatocellular carcinoma (OR 3.7, p-value 5.9 x 10^-10).
title: FinnGen: Unique genetic insights from combining isolated population and national health register data

finding: The missense variant TM6SF2 p.Gly167Lys (rs58542926) was reported to lead to decreased LDL and total cholesterol levels. Additionally, this variant was associated with liver diseases, including non-alcoholic fatty liver disease, alcohol-related cirrhosis, hepatocellular carcinoma, and incident Type 2 Diabetes, linked to its effect on increased protein turnover and reduced cellular protein levels.
title: FinnGen: Unique genetic insights from combining isolated population and national health register data

finding: The rs35081008 variant was confirmed to be a causative genetic variant associated with increased expression of the ZNF329 gene after editing, which also led to increased cellular LDL-C uptake. This was supported by its functionality as a liver eQTL.
title: Joint genotypic and phenotypic outcome modeling improves base editing variant effect quantification

finding: The rs201672011 variant, p.Glu57Lys in APOE, was associated with serum apoB levels (p=3.5×10^-4), highlighting its importance in lipid metabolism.
title: Novel protein-altering variants associated with serum apolipoprotein and lipid levels

finding: The SNP rs710160 was noted in an earlier study on associations with <italic>LTBP4</italic>, showing a significant original finding tied to modifying effects on LOA in patients with DMD.
title: A genome-wide association analysis of loss of ambulation in dystrophinopathy patients suggests multiple candidate modifiers of disease severity

finding: The interaction between FUT2 rs281379 and TREH rs12225548 affected alkaline phosphatase levels, indicating a gene-gene interaction.
title: Hypothesis-free detection of gene-interaction effects on biomarker concentration in UK Biobank using variance prioritisation

finding: APOE rs1065853 showed an interaction with sex affecting low-density lipoprotein (LDL) levels, replicating known effects.
title: Hypothesis-free detection of gene-interaction effects on biomarker concentration in UK Biobank using variance prioritisation

finding: TM6SF2 rs58542926 exhibited an interaction with BMI on alanine aminotransferase (ALT), confirming previous findings.
title: Hypothesis-free detection of gene-interaction effects on biomarker concentration in UK Biobank using variance prioritisation

finding: The rs429358 SNP, part of the APOE gene, was identified as a crucial genetic variant associated with the APOE-ε4 genotype. This genotype was correlated with an increased risk for Alzheimer's disease (AD). During the study, the association with male APOE4 carriers was highlighted, showing greater reductions in network functional connectivity between the cingulo-opercular and posterior multimodal networks.
title: The Interaction Effects of Age, Sex, APOE and Common Health Risk Factors on Human Brain Functions

finding: The rs7412 SNP, like rs429358, is part of the APOE gene and contributes to the definition of the APOE genotypes. Its association with the APOE-ε4 allele linked it to a higher risk of Alzheimer's disease (AD), further reaffirming the findings around the negative interaction observed in male carriers of the APOE-ε4 genotype, specifically the reductions in network functional connectivity.
title: The Interaction Effects of Age, Sex, APOE and Common Health Risk Factors on Human Brain Functions

finding: The SNP rs2032905 was found near the TSHZ3 gene, crucial for corticostriatal circuitry development after birth and also associated with sporadic miscarriage.
title: Trans-ancestral Genome Wide Association Study of Sporadic and Recurrent Miscarriage

finding: The SNP rs10419397, located near the gene USHBP1, was found to have a significant association in the EUR cohort (βA allele = 0.047, p = 8.69 × 10⁻⁷), indicating a positive finding and replication of previous work.
title: The genetic and phenotypic correlates of mtDNA copy number in a multi-ancestry cohort

finding: This SNP was associated with mortality in PD, with a p-value of 4.0 x 10^-10, and was identified as tagging the APOE ε4 allele, known for its strong association with mortality.
title: Genome-wide determinants of mortality and motor progression in Parkinson’s disease

finding: The SNP rs58542926 located in the TM6SF2 gene was found to influence hepatic fibrosis progression in patients with NAFLD, emphasizing its role as a significant genetic modifier in the disease.
title: Quantitative genome-scale analysis of human liver reveals dysregulation of glycosphingolipid pathways in progressive nonalcoholic fatty liver disease

finding: The study reported that rs768563000, associated with the gene LDLR and corresponding to the variant NM_000527.5(LDLR):c.718G>T (p.Glu240Ter), was among three likely pathogenic or pathogenic LDLR variants identified for the study's pilot participants. This SNP was confirmed as pathogenic in one of the participants who enrolled in the MVP-ROAR-FH study.
title: Introducing return of results in the Million Veteran Program: Design and pilot results of the MVP-ROAR Familial Hypercholesterolemia Study

finding: The SNP rs145787161, identified as NM_000527.5(LDLR):c.2140+1G>A, was selected for participant testing in the pilot phase of the MVP-ROAR-FH study due to its likely pathogenic classification. This finding contributed to understanding of genetic factors related to familial hypercholesterolemia.
title: Introducing return of results in the Million Veteran Program: Design and pilot results of the MVP-ROAR Familial Hypercholesterolemia Study

finding: The SNP rs377271627, which corresponds to NM_000527.5(LDLR):c.296C>G (p.Ser99Ter), was classified as likely pathogenic and was part of the initial assessment for the return of actionable results to participants in the MVP-ROAR-FH study.
title: Introducing return of results in the Million Veteran Program: Design and pilot results of the MVP-ROAR Familial Hypercholesterolemia Study

finding: The SNP rs2455069 was identified as associated with Alzheimer's disease through a Mendelian randomization framework. It was validated as a protein quantitative trait locus (pQTL) influencing the protein CD33, where the G allele led to a missense mutation changing the amino acid at position 69 from Arginine to Glycine (R69G). This alteration was predicted to affect the 3D structure of CD33, which is overexpressed in microglial cells, and potentially contribute to AD by influencing amyloid plaque accumulation.
title: Deciphering causal protein biomarkers in Alzheimer’s disease: Integrating a novel robust Mendelian randomization method for proteomics data analysis and AlphaFold3 for predicting 3D structural alterations

finding: The SNP rs429358 was associated with over 70 traits, indicating a significant pleiotropic effect and emphasizing its importance in various biological processes.
title: Exploiting collider bias to apply two-sample summary data Mendelian randomization methods to one-sample individual level data

finding: The missense variant E354Q (rs1800437) in GIPR was associated with a higher risk of overall breast cancer (Odds Ratio: 1.05, 95% Confidence Interval: 1.03-1.06, P=4.23×10−9) and luminal A-like breast cancer (Odds Ratio: 1.05, 95% Confidence Interval: 1.03-1.06, P=6.02×10−7). Replication analyses corroborated these findings with an Odds Ratio of 1.06 (95% Confidence Interval: 1.02-1.08, P=1.09×10−3) for breast cancer risk. The colocalisation analysis indicated a greater than 99.9% posterior probability that circulating GIP concentrations shared a causal variant with both overall and luminal A-like breast cancer in relation to GIPR. However, E354Q was not associated with the risk of the other cancers examined (colorectal, endometrial, lung, pancreatic, and renal). Mechanistic analysis revealed that this variant was linked to higher postprandial glucose concentrations, reduced insulin secretion, and lower testosterone concentrations.
title: Genetically-proxied impaired GIPR signalling and risk of 6 cancers

finding: The SNP rs429358 identified in the APOE gene on chromosome 19 demonstrated a significant association with the development of dementia in patients with Parkinson’s disease. The odds ratio was reported at 1.36 (95% CI = 1.31 - 1.41, P = 3.25e-57). This finding highlighted the role of APOE as a known genetic risk factor for dementia, further validating its implications in the disease.
title: Investigation of the genetic aetiology of Lewy body diseases with and without dementia

finding: The study confirmed that the SNP rs7412, which is part of the APOE gene, was crucial in categorizing individuals into APOE-ε4 carriers and non-carriers. APOE-ε4 carriers had a significantly elevated genetic risk for Alzheimer's disease influenced by non-APOE variants, especially when they adhered to fewer healthy lifestyle factors.
title: Mid-to-Late Life Healthy Lifestyle Modifies Genetic Risk for Longitudinal Cognitive Aging among Asymptomatic Individuals

finding: Similar to rs7412, the SNP rs429358 was utilized to determine APOE genotype and contributed to identifying APOE-ε4 carriers. The association was highlighted where APOE-ε4 carriers faced greater cognitive decline relative to their adherence to healthy lifestyle choices, underscoring the role of this SNP in Alzheimer's genetic risk.
title: Mid-to-Late Life Healthy Lifestyle Modifies Genetic Risk for Longitudinal Cognitive Aging among Asymptomatic Individuals

finding: The SNP rs281380 in the SPHK2 gene showed a significant association with increased brain glucose metabolism in the bilateral frontal, parietal, and temporal lobes, indicating its potential impact on metabolic changes related to Alzheimer's disease.
title: Multi-Omic Analyses Characterize the Ceramide/Sphingomyelin Pathway as a Therapeutic Target in Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The rs200157007 SNP, which corresponds to the se302 mutation (P101L), was associated with individuals being phenotypically non-secretors. This mutation contributed to a reduced co-occurrence of Lactobacillus species with other microbial taxa in non-secretors, influencing their vaginal microbiota and gestational length.
title: The effect of secretor status and the vaginal microbiome on birth outcome

finding: The rs1047781 SNP, linked to the se385 mutation (I129F), also categorized individuals as phenotypically non-secretors. It was noted that non-secretors with depleted vaginal microbiota had significantly shorter gestational lengths compared to those with Lactobacillus-dominated microbiota.
title: The effect of secretor status and the vaginal microbiome on birth outcome

finding: The rs601338 SNP, representing the se428 mutation (W413X), was identified as a non-secretor mutation. Its presence was part of the analysis indicating the relationship between secretor status and adverse pregnancy outcomes, particularly the occurrence of preterm birth.
title: The effect of secretor status and the vaginal microbiome on birth outcome

finding: The SNP rs826323, mapping to ZNF420, reached GWS status with a p-value of 1.39×10^-08 in the cross-ancestry meta-analysis, indicating its association with MaxAlc.
title: Genome-wide investigation of maximum habitual alcohol intake (MaxAlc) in 247,755 European and African Ancestry U.S. Veterans informs the relationship between habitual alcohol consumption and alcohol use disorder

finding: The SNP rs445925, mapping to the APOC1 gene, showed significant interaction with HMG that was dependent on statin intake in a cohort of over 1840 individuals. This interaction indicated that carrying at least one copy of the minor allele was linked to an increase in HMG levels specifically in statin users, aligning with previously established associations with statin response.
title: Heterogeneity in statin responses explained by variation in the human gut microbiome

finding: The SNP rs7412, linked to the APOE gene, similarly demonstrated a significant association with HMG, contingent on statin use. Those with at least one minor allele exhibited an increase in HMG levels in the context of statin therapy, reinforcing the earlier findings related to its influence on statin response.
title: Heterogeneity in statin responses explained by variation in the human gut microbiome

finding: The SNP rs2303744, located in exon 5 of the PLA2G4C gene, was identified as significantly associated with multiple system atrophy (MSA) in a genome-wide association study (GWAS) among Japanese samples. The initial suggestive association was noted with a p-value of 6.5 × 10^-7, which was replicated in additional Japanese samples as well as Korean and Chinese populations. The meta-analysis including East Asian populations revealed a highly significant association with a p-value of 5.0 × 10^-15, leading to an odds ratio of 1.49. Functional studies indicated that the minor allele (G) resulted in an amino acid substitution affecting the enzyme activity of cPLA2γ, which is believed to influence membrane phospholipid metabolism and alpha-synuclein biology. Furthermore, significant associations between rs2303744 and MSA were observed in specific subtypes (MSA-C and MSA-P) and were correlated with younger ages at onset of the disease.
title: Genome-wide association study identifies a new susceptibility locus in PLA2G4C for Multiple System Atrophy

finding: This SNP showed a genome-wide significant association with a PACC score in individuals aged 60 and older, with a P-value of 1.8 x 10^{-8}. It is associated with the risk of dementia and Alzheimer’s disease, indicating its relevance in cognitive decline.
title: Vitamin D and the preclinical Alzheimer cognitive composite cognition (PACC) score: a two-sample mendelian randomization study

finding: The SNP rs45524632 at the KEAP1 locus identified significant effect size heterogeneity for heel bone mineral density T-score, demonstrating a beta of -0.042 and a p-value of 2.59×10^-5. The finding indicates an association that could be relevant in understanding genetic predispositions linked to COVID-19 outcomes.
title: Host genetic liability for severe COVID-19 overlaps with alcohol drinking behavior and diabetic outcomes in over 1 million participants

finding: The rs584007 SNP was identified as a cis-pQTL associated with Apo E plasma levels, located within an ApoE enhancer, indicating a regulatory role in gene expression.
title: Integrative genetic and immune cell analysis of plasma proteins in healthy donors identifies novel associations involving primary immune deficiency genes

finding: The rs3826688 SNP associated in cis with plasma levels of Apo C1, similar to rs584007, and was located within the same ApoE enhancer.
title: Integrative genetic and immune cell analysis of plasma proteins in healthy donors identifies novel associations involving primary immune deficiency genes

finding: Identified as associated with cholesterol metrics, the rs1122608 variant was 7.7 times more frequent in UKB-EUR (0.254) than in UKB-AFR (0.033) and not replicated in UKB-AFR, reflecting significant trait association.
title: Mapping Epigenetic Gene Variant Dynamics: Comparative Analysis of Frequency, Functional Impact and Trait Associations in African and European Populations

finding: SNP rs62117206, located intronically within the <BCL3> gene, was associated with the CpG cg27087650 and was identified as a <cis>-mQTL variant. It had a significant association with coronary artery disease, with a PP of 3.6e-15, demonstrating a clear genetic pathway linking methylation levels to disease.
title: Elucidating the genetic architecture of DNA methylation to identify promising molecular mechanisms of disease

finding: The SNP rs4803750, which is in linkage disequilibrium with rs62117206, was illustrated to have an association with the CpG cg27087650 (<BCL3>). It shared a strong <cis>-mQTL relationship, emphasizing its role in regulating transcriptional processes related to cardiovascular diseases.
title: Elucidating the genetic architecture of DNA methylation to identify promising molecular mechanisms of disease

finding: The SNP rs7412 was associated with the ApoE genotype classifications, where carriers of ApoE ε4 (either heterozygotes or homozygotes) were coded differently compared to non-carriers. This finding played a critical role in the predictive modeling addressing Alzheimer's disease, particularly in identifying risk levels associated with cognitive decline.
title: Machine learning-based classification of Alzheimer’s disease and its at-risk states using personality traits, anxiety, and depression

finding: The SNP rs429358 was also a determinant for the ApoE genotypes, contributing to the classification of individuals into different risk categories for Alzheimer's disease. This marked its importance in the multivariate analysis where ApoE genotype was evaluated alongside other cognitive and biochemical predictors.
title: Machine learning-based classification of Alzheimer’s disease and its at-risk states using personality traits, anxiety, and depression

finding: The rs11085720 SNP located in the intron of the DNMT1 gene was identified as genome-wide significant in both the two and one degree of freedom meta-analyses (p-value<sub>min</sub> = 2.3 × 10<sup>−12</sup>). It highlighted the potential role of DNA methylation in influencing birth weight, although it was not significant in the earlier deCODE meta-analysis.
title: Direct and INdirect effects analysis of Genetic lOci (DINGO): A software package to increase the power of locus discovery in GWAS meta-analyses of perinatal phenotypes and traits influenced by indirect genetic effects

finding: The SNP rs1801272 was identified as being associated with lung cancer, contributing to the meta-analysis findings at the 19q13.2 locus.
title: Genetic analysis of lung cancer reveals novel susceptibility loci and germline impact on somatic mutation burden

finding: The SNP rs429358 was the leading SNP of the third most significant locus (locus 19) in the GWAS, found in the APOE gene on chromosome 19. It is notable for determining one of the APOE haplotypes.
title: Genome-wide Association Study of Traumatic Brain Injury in U.S. Military Veterans Enrolled in the VA Million Veteran Program

finding: SNP rs492602 was associated with VTE at the FUT2 gene on chromosome 19, although its specific contribution to COVID-19 traits was not elaborated.
title: Shared genetic etiology and causality between COVID-19 and venous thromboembolism: evidence from genome-wide cross trait analysis and bi-directional Mendelian randomization study

finding: The SNP rs28362459 (p.Leu20Arg) was associated with gallbladder polyp and cholelithiasis. It showed an odds ratio of 1.46 for gallbladder polyp (P = 5.1 × 10^-11) and an odds ratio of 1.11 for cholelithiasis (P = 7.3 × 10^-9), indicating its potential role in these conditions.
title: A global atlas of genetic associations of 220 deep phenotypes

finding: The SNP rs6859 located in the NECTIN2 gene was associated with heterogeneous trajectories of cognitive changes in older adults, suggesting its potential relevance to cognitive decline and neurodegenerative processes. This finding highlighted the genetic factors influencing cognitive health in the context of aging.
title: Elevated blood glucose levels are associated with the progression of brain hypometabolism, and HDL-C and APOE4 add to this association

finding: The SNP rs7412, which encodes the apolipoprotein E (APOE) ε2 allele, was identified as contributing to reduced risk for Alzheimer's disease (AD). This finding highlighted the protective genetic effect of the ε2 allele in contrast to the increased risk associated with the ε4 allele, thus emphasizing the importance of considering different APOE alleles in Alzheimer's disease risk assessment.
title: Neuropathology-based APOE genetic risk score better quantifies Alzheimer’s risk

finding: The SNP rs429358 was shown to encode the APOE ε4 allele and was associated with increased risk for Alzheimer's disease (AD). This study reinforced the association between the ε4 allele and higher vulnerability to AD, indicating that the ε4 allele acts as a significant genetic risk factor in Alzheimer's pathology.
title: Neuropathology-based APOE genetic risk score better quantifies Alzheimer’s risk

finding: The SNP rs62119267, located in the IGSF23 intron, demonstrated a significant interaction with corticosteroid use, with a P-value of 2.1 x 10^-8, indicating it was below the genome-wide significance threshold. Among carriers of the C allele, 18.2% of corticosteroid users developed breast cancer, compared to 5.1% of non-users, resulting in a hazard ratio of 3.41, emphasizing the clinical relevance of this interaction.
title: A polygenic score-based approach to identify gene-drug interactions stratifying breast cancer risk

finding: The study identified that individuals with a heterozygous genotype (rs429358-TC) for ApoE were classified as late-onset Alzheimer's Disease (LOAD) carriers. This allele was noted to correlate with an increased risk for AD pathogenesis, marking the importance of understanding its implications in neurodegenerative disease etiologies.
title: Apolipoprotein E-Genotyping and MRI Study for Alzheimer’s Disease Classification: PCR-RFLP and Restricted Enzymes AfIII for RS429358 and HaeII for RS7412

finding: Additionally, the rs7412 allele was associated with the same heterozygous condition (rs7412-TC) in individuals diagnosed with Alzheimer's Disease. This identification further solidified the genetic profile that contributes to late-onset Alzheimer’s, emphasizing the genetic factors' role in the disease's manifestation.
title: Apolipoprotein E-Genotyping and MRI Study for Alzheimer’s Disease Classification: PCR-RFLP and Restricted Enzymes AfIII for RS429358 and HaeII for RS7412

finding: This SNP was found at 19p12, upstream of the ZNF492 gene, and was linked to T2D with an odds ratio of 2.26 (95% CI: 1.60-3.20; P=4.1x10^-6) in the discovery data and replicated in AFR survivors. It exhibited genome-wide significance with an odds ratio of 2.43 (95% CI: 1.80-3.28; P=5.7x10^-9).
title: Trans-ancestral genetic study of diabetes mellitus risk in survivors of childhood cancer: a report from the St. Jude Lifetime Cohort and the Childhood Cancer Survivor Study

finding: The study involved the investigation of the rs7412 SNP as part of the APOE genotyping, which is a critical factor in Alzheimer's disease (AD) pathology. This SNP is associated with variations in the risk of developing Alzheimer's, especially in the presence of subjective cognitive decline (SCD), linking it to the neuropsychological assessments and clinical characterizations of the enrolled patients.
title: Towards the development of a management protocol for Subjective Cognitive Decline: insights from a cross-sectional and longitudinal analyses of multimodal data from a memory clinic

finding: Similar to rs7412, the rs429358 SNP was also part of the APOE genotyping conducted in the study. It has been established that this SNP contributes to Alzheimer's disease risk profiles, thus supporting the overall findings regarding the importance of APOE genetic variations in the analysis of SCD and its progression to more severe cognitive impairments.
title: Towards the development of a management protocol for Subjective Cognitive Decline: insights from a cross-sectional and longitudinal analyses of multimodal data from a memory clinic

finding: The SNP rs2108622, a missense variant in the CYP4F2 gene, was associated with greater change in plasma vitamin E (ΔvitE) after 3 years of vitamin E supplementation in a population of healthy male participants. Individuals with each additional T minor allele exhibited a 2.36 μmol/L greater increase in ΔvitE compared to those with the C major allele (P=0.0032). This association was significant and passed the Bonferroni-corrected threshold for replication, indicating that genetic variation may contribute to the inter-individual differences in ΔvitE levels.
title: Change in Plasma Alpha-Tocopherol Associations with Attenuated Pulmonary Function Decline and with CYP4F2 Missense Variation

finding: The variant rs429358 was associated with frailty in this study, representing the strongest signal for the loci on chromosome 19. This variant was linked to increased risk of frailty, similar to its established influence on cognitive traits and was supported by previous studies demonstrating its pivotal role in the APOE gene.
title: Large-scale genome-wide analyses with proteomics integration reveal novel loci and biological insights into frailty

finding: The SNP rs4420638, located within the APOC1 gene, was identified as a lipid-level-increasing variant associated with frailty. This association highlighted the role of lipid metabolism in frailty-related pathways, although it was noted that lipid-associated variants were not abundant in the overall signals.
title: Large-scale genome-wide analyses with proteomics integration reveal novel loci and biological insights into frailty

finding: The rs429358 SNP, which is associated with the APOE4 allele, was significantly linked to various neurodegenerative disorders including PD-MCI, PDD, DLB, FTD, and AD. The study reported a particularly high relative risk for AD (RR = 5.59) among the ethnic Bengali population, indicating that this SNP had a strong influence on the prevalence of these conditions.
title: Evaluation of Apolipoprotein e4 allele as susceptible factor for neurodegenerative diseases among Eastern Indians

finding: The rs7412 SNP, which is associated with the APOE genotype, revealed a significant association with neurodegenerative diseases such as PD-MCI, PDD, DLB, FTD, and AD, similar to the findings for rs429358. Given that both SNPs contribute to the APOE4 allele, this SNP also exhibited enhanced risk for these disorders, confirming its relevance in the context of dementia-related outcomes.
title: Evaluation of Apolipoprotein e4 allele as susceptible factor for neurodegenerative diseases among Eastern Indians

finding: The <italic>APOE-ε4</italic> variant was significantly associated with increased risk for both AD<sup>+</sup>LB<sup>−</sup> and AD<sup>+</sup>LB<sup>+</sup> pathologies compared to AD<sup>−</sup>LB<sup>−</sup> pathology, with odds ratios of 4.44 (95% CI 3.70–5.34, P = 8.5 × 10<sup>−47</sup>) and 4.30 (95% CI 3.49–5.31, P = 1.3 × 10<sup>−42</sup>) respectively. However, it was not associated with risk for AD<sup>−</sup>LB<sup>+</sup> compared to AD<sup>−</sup>LB<sup>−</sup> (OR = 1.01, 95% CI 0.61–1.67, P = 0.98) or AD<sup>+</sup>LB<sup>+</sup> compared to AD<sup>+</sup>LB<sup>−</sup> (OR = 1.00, 95% CI 0.89–1.13, P = 0.94).
title: APOE-ε4 and BIN1 increase risk of Alzheimer’s disease pathology but not specifically of Lewy body pathology

finding: The rs4760 SNP in the PLAUR gene was the lead SNP associated with Endoglin plasma levels (p = 1.14 x 10^-158), underscoring its relevance in the genetic regulation of Endoglin.
title: Non-canonical regulation of Endoglin by rare and common variants: new molecular and clinical perspectives for Hereditary Hemorrhagic Telangiectasia and beyond

finding: The SNP rs284660, located in B3GNT8, was associated with Endoglin plasma levels (p = 8.46 x 10^-10), illustrating its contribution to genetic regulation.
title: Non-canonical regulation of Endoglin by rare and common variants: new molecular and clinical perspectives for Hereditary Hemorrhagic Telangiectasia and beyond

finding: The rs4760 SNP at the PLAUR locus served as the lead SNP with a strong association (p=1.14e-158) to Endoglin plasma levels in the GWAS analysis, indicating its involvement in Endoglin regulation.
title: Unveiling Endoglin non canonical regulation: spotlight on the new role of the uPAR pathway

finding: The rs284660 SNP at the B3GNT8 locus exhibited a significant association (p=8.46e-10) with Endoglin plasma levels, suggesting its potential impact on the biological functionality of Endoglin.
title: Unveiling Endoglin non canonical regulation: spotlight on the new role of the uPAR pathway

finding: The rs7412 polymorphism was analyzed in the context of the ApoE genotype, which is a well-known risk factor for Alzheimer's disease (AD). The finding indicated that genotypes associated with this SNP were identified and showed relationships with cognitive performance and associated neuropsychological test outcomes.
title: Single-value fMRI scores reflect both stage and risk across the Alzheimer’s disease continuum

finding: The rs429358 polymorphism was also analyzed within the framework of the ApoE genotype. Similar to rs7412, genotypes for this SNP were identified and demonstrated associations with AD risk factors, particularly in relation to cognitive performance, supporting its relevance in the context of Alzheimer's disease.
title: Single-value fMRI scores reflect both stage and risk across the Alzheimer’s disease continuum

finding: The allele corresponding to rs429358, which designates the APOE ɛ4 haplotype, was noted for its protective effect against PSP (p = 5.71 × 10^-18, beta = -0.60), despite its typical risk association with Alzheimer's disease.
title: Whole-Genome Sequencing Analysis Reveals New Susceptibility Loci and Structural Variants Associated with Progressive Supranuclear Palsy

finding: The APOE ɛ2 haplotype linked with rs7412 was significantly associated with elevated risk for PSP (p = 9.57 × 10^-16, beta = 0.87), which is contrary to its protective association in Alzheimer's.
title: Whole-Genome Sequencing Analysis Reveals New Susceptibility Loci and Structural Variants Associated with Progressive Supranuclear Palsy

finding: The SNP rs4420638 was identified to have a protective role against PSP (p = 2.91 × 10^-19, beta = -0.57), similarly placed within the APOE gene region.
title: Whole-Genome Sequencing Analysis Reveals New Susceptibility Loci and Structural Variants Associated with Progressive Supranuclear Palsy

finding: The SNP rs2075650 reached genome-wide significance in association with PSP (p = 3.39 × 10^-13, beta = -0.51), highlighting its influence despite typically being related to Alzheimer’s risk.
title: Whole-Genome Sequencing Analysis Reveals New Susceptibility Loci and Structural Variants Associated with Progressive Supranuclear Palsy

finding: The intronic SNP rs56251816 in FCHO1 observed an association with PSP (p = 6.57 × 10^-8, beta = 0.35), indicating its possible role as an eQTL in the disease mechanisms.
title: Whole-Genome Sequencing Analysis Reveals New Susceptibility Loci and Structural Variants Associated with Progressive Supranuclear Palsy

finding: The rs28875253 variant was significantly linked with FSH-F levels (β = -0.0599, P = 9.90E-23) suggesting its influence on female reproductive hormone levels.
title: Genome-wide analyses identify 21 infertility loci and over 400 reproductive hormone loci across the allele frequency spectrum

finding: The variant rs11668309 showed association with LH-F in reproductive hormones (β = 0.0519, P = 3.91E-13), indicating its potential relevance in fertility regulation.
title: Genome-wide analyses identify 21 infertility loci and over 400 reproductive hormone loci across the allele frequency spectrum

finding: The APOE variant rs429358 was initially noted as associated with Covid-19 susceptibility (OR of 1.38 and P-value of 1.80×10⁻⁹). Its significance diminished over time, becoming suggestively linked to Covid-19 severity (OR of 1.42; P=4.36×10⁻⁷) and death (OR of 1.45; P=4.62×10⁻⁷).
title: A year of COVID-19 GWAS results from the GRASP portal reveals potential SARS-CoV-2 modifiers

finding: The ADGRE1 insertion-deletion variant rs770180814 was significantly linked to Covid-19 severity in European women with an OR of 1.78 and a P-value of 4.51×10⁻⁸.
title: A year of COVID-19 GWAS results from the GRASP portal reveals potential SARS-CoV-2 modifiers

finding: This SNP was associated with a strong linkage disequilibrium (LD) (r² = 0.82) with a lead variant in the TYK2 locus, which was noted for protective associations against autoimmune diseases. This connection was elucidated through the meta-analysis of the COVID-19 Host Genetics Initiative.
title: Meta-analysis fine-mapping is often miscalibrated at single-variant resolution

finding: This known missense variant (p.Gly337Val) in ZSCAN5A was reported to increase monocyte count and was recognized in the context of asthma fine-mapping, showcasing its relevance.
title: Meta-analysis fine-mapping is often miscalibrated at single-variant resolution

finding: The LDLR variant (rs730882082), which poses a high risk of familial hypercholesterolemia, was associated with altered expression of three plasma proteins including FGF-21, GDNF, and IL-4.
title: Genetic regulation of the plasma proteome and its link to cardiometabolic disease in Greenlandic Inuit

finding: The SNP rs483082 was found to be adversely associated with increased AD risk independently of the ε4 allele, indicating its significant role in altering susceptibility to AD.
title: Inter- and intra-chromosomal modulators of the APOE ε2 and ε4 effects on the Alzheimer’s disease risk

finding: The missense variant in TYK2 was associated with reduced risk of rheumatoid arthritis, suggesting its therapeutic implications for autoimmune conditions.
title: Genetic associations of protein-coding variants in human disease

finding: Part of the top-ranking GWAS SNPs, this SNP was associated with hypertension, thereby supporting its relevance.
title: An individualized Bayesian method for estimating genomic variants of hypertension

finding: Identified as another significant lead SNP within the pleiotropic loci connected to ocular disorders, indicating its potential contribution to the genetic risks of these diseases.
title: Genome-wide analysis of genetic pleiotropy and causal genes across three age-related ocular disorders

finding: SNP rs351973 was highlighted due to its location near the PTBP1 gene, which has effects on Müller glia and retinal ganglion cells, indicating its potential relevance in ocular health.
title: Genome-wide analysis of genetic pleiotropy and causal genes across three age-related ocular disorders

finding: For rs74956615 near the TYK2 gene, ten phenotypes showed significant association including lower odds of psoriatic arthropathy (OR 0.31, 95% CI 0.20-0.47, q=4.5×10⁻⁵) and rheumatoid arthritis (OR 0.83, 95% CI 0.64-0.83, p=1.4×10⁻⁶). Notably, these results indicated a protective effect of the A risk allele against autoimmune disorders.
title: A Phenome Wide Association Study of Severe COVID-19 Genetic Risk Variants

finding: Subject 1, a carrier of rs777551553, exhibited resistance to amyloid pathology despite being aged over 90 and carrying the ε3/ε4 genotype. This variant was determined to create a truncated peptide that resulted in an effective ε3/- genotype. Subject 2 also carried rs777551553 and remained cognitively normal at the age of 79, with confirmed normal amyloid and tau levels.
title: APOE loss-of-function variants: Compatible with longevity and associated with resistance to Alzheimer’s Disease pathology

finding: The rs7412 SNP within the APOE region exhibited strong evidence of shared causal variants with CAD. It specifically showed strong associations with CE(18:1) lipid species, indicating its significance in the genetic architecture related to CAD risk.
title: Comprehensive genetic analysis of the human lipidome identifies novel loci controlling lipid homeostasis with links to coronary artery disease

finding: The rs74956615:T>A variant in the TYK2 gene conferred increased risk for both critical illness (OR = 1.43) and hospitalization (OR = 1.27) due to COVID-19.
title: Mapping the human genetic architecture of COVID-19 by worldwide meta-analysis

finding: The missense variant rs34536443:G>C (p.Pro1104Ala) located in the TYK2 gene was associated with critical illness and was correlated with risk of other autoimmune diseases.
title: Mapping the human genetic architecture of COVID-19 by worldwide meta-analysis

finding: The intronic variant rs2304256:C>A in TYK2 was also linked to critical illness (OR = 1.17) and had a significant association with COVID-19 severity.
title: Mapping the human genetic architecture of COVID-19 by worldwide meta-analysis

finding: The variant rs4801778 in the PPP1R15A gene was associated with reported SARS-CoV-2 infection, acting as a modifier of gene expression linked to lung function.
title: Mapping the human genetic architecture of COVID-19 by worldwide meta-analysis

finding: The rs11541192:G>A alteration in PPP1R15A was correlated with gene expression modifications linked to increased reticulocyte fraction.
title: Mapping the human genetic architecture of COVID-19 by worldwide meta-analysis

finding: The lead variant rs56104184:C>T displayed a significant association with reticulocyte fraction (OR = 1.03), supporting its role in COVID-19 pathology.
title: Mapping the human genetic architecture of COVID-19 by worldwide meta-analysis

finding: The intronic variant rs2109069:G>A in DPP9 was positively associated with critical illness due to COVID-19 and reported risk for interstitial lung disease.
title: Mapping the human genetic architecture of COVID-19 by worldwide meta-analysis

finding: Tagging variant rs12610495:A>G in the DPP9 locus showed risk association with interstitial lung disease, relevant to COVID-19 severity.
title: Mapping the human genetic architecture of COVID-19 by worldwide meta-analysis

finding: The emVar rs1871047 was located within a putative enhancer of the NEC-TIN2 locus and promoted IRF2 binding, resulting in increased expression of NECTIN2 in response to LPS+IFNγ treatment.
title: Deciphering the functional impact of Alzheimer’s Disease-associated variants in resting and proinflammatory immune cells

finding: The emVar rs12721109 at the APOE locus showed a strong connection with APOE expression via ABC modeling, with the risk allele G linked to increased expression in AD context.
title: Deciphering the functional impact of Alzheimer’s Disease-associated variants in resting and proinflammatory immune cells

finding: The SNP rs116843064 was associated with the protein ANGL4, which shared variants linked to MI risk based on the colocalization analysis.
title: Proteome-wide Mendelian Randomization Analysis Identified Potential Drug Targets for Myocardial Infarction

finding: The analysis revealed that individuals who were homozygous for the 'C' allele at both APOE rs429358 and rs7412 had two copies of the APOE-ε4 allele. This configuration was associated with a higher genetic risk for Alzheimer's disease (AD), indicating a significant genetic influence on AD predisposition.
title: Gut-Brain Nexus: Mapping Multi-Modal Links to Neurodegeneration at Biobank Scale

finding: Similar to rs429358, the presence of the 'C' allele and its association with APOE-ε4 significantly contributed to increased genetic risk for Alzheimer's disease (AD). This evidence confirmed the role of APOE genotypes in AD risk assessment.
title: Gut-Brain Nexus: Mapping Multi-Modal Links to Neurodegeneration at Biobank Scale

finding: The rs58542926 variant within the TM6SF2 gene showed strong evidence of association with liver fat accumulation, highlighting its role in hepatic steatosis independent of body weight.
title: Potential causal links between genetic variants in SAMM50, SUGP1, MAU2, and GATAD2A and liver fat in individuals with normal weight

finding: Identified in the SUGP1 gene, rs200210321 displayed the strongest evidence of association in the quantitative trait GWAS, contributing to the understanding of genetic factors influencing hepatic fat levels.
title: Potential causal links between genetic variants in SAMM50, SUGP1, MAU2, and GATAD2A and liver fat in individuals with normal weight

finding: The variant rs60204587 in the TMC4 gene was significantly associated in the QT-GWAS, indicating its potential role in liver fat content.
title: Potential causal links between genetic variants in SAMM50, SUGP1, MAU2, and GATAD2A and liver fat in individuals with normal weight

finding: The rs57009615 variant in GATAD2A was identified as a potential causal variant linked to hepatic fat, suggesting its regulatory role in liver metabolism.
title: Potential causal links between genetic variants in SAMM50, SUGP1, MAU2, and GATAD2A and liver fat in individuals with normal weight

finding: Located in the SUGP1 gene, the rs2240117 SNP was identified as having a causal relationship with hepatic fat accumulation.
title: Potential causal links between genetic variants in SAMM50, SUGP1, MAU2, and GATAD2A and liver fat in individuals with normal weight

finding: The rs2285628 variant located in the MAU2 gene demonstrated a causal association with hepatic fat, contributing to the genetic understanding of MASLD.
title: Potential causal links between genetic variants in SAMM50, SUGP1, MAU2, and GATAD2A and liver fat in individuals with normal weight

finding: The rs10401969 variant in SUGP1 was linked to cholesterol metabolism and showed a nominal association with hepatic fat in severely obese individuals.
title: Potential causal links between genetic variants in SAMM50, SUGP1, MAU2, and GATAD2A and liver fat in individuals with normal weight

finding: The SNP rs10401969 was determined to have a substantial effect on transcription factor binding as evidenced by its significant RBD score. This finding indicated its potential involvement in regulatory mechanisms influencing MAFLD and cardiovascular disease risks.
title: Genome-wide insights into the shared genetic landscape between metabolic dysfunction-associated fatty liver disease and cardiovascular diseases

finding: The SNP rs56113850 in the 19q13.2 region associated with the CYP2A6 gene exhibited higher frequencies and substantial effects in the white population, marking it as another important smoking-related locus contributing to lung cancer risk.
title: Ethnic differences of genetic risk and smoking in lung cancer: two prospective cohort studies

finding: The missense variant rs201680145 in NOTCH3 was associated with various DTI parameters, with effects ranging from -1.50 to 1.70 s.d. units and a P-value less than 2.5 × 10^-10, linking it to neurodegenerative disease features.
title: Mapping rare protein-coding variants on multi-organ imaging traits

finding: Associated with COVID-19 hospitalization, this SNP exhibited effects linked to upregulation of <italic>ZBTB7A</italic>.
title: Novel risk loci for COVID-19 hospitalization among admixed American populations

finding: An intronic variant of CYP2A6, it was associated with coffee intake and also implicated in smoking traits and metabolism.
title: Genome-Wide Association Studies of Coffee Intake in UK/US Participants of European Ancestry Uncover Gene-Cohort Influences

finding: The SNP rs2108622 was associated with lower stroke risk through Mendelian randomisation, validating the drug target of warfarin use as it relates to circulating phylloquinone (vitamin K1) levels.
title: An Informatics Consult approach for generating clinical evidence for treatment decisions

finding: This SNP was identified in the <italic>UNC13A</italic> gene and was associated with disease susceptibility and shorter survival. In the cohort, three participants who tested positive for the pathogenic <italic>C9orf72</italic> expansion also harbored the <italic>UNC13A</italic> rs12608932 C/C variant.
title: Genetics of Motor Neuron Disease in New Zealand

finding: The SNP <italic>TM6SF2</italic> rs58542926, particularly in its TT homozygous form, was also associated with an increased risk of liver fibrosis. While the sample size for the TT homozygous variant was small, a trend indicated that it could amplify the risk of hospitalization or death from heart failure when assessed in conjunction with liver fibrosis scores.
title: Liver fibrosis assessed using non-invasive markers and genetic polymorphisms (PNPLA3 and TM6SF2) predisposing to liver fibrosis, is associated with hospitalization or death from heart failure: a prospective UK Biobank study

finding: The rs11878277 in HDGFL2 was significantly linked to entinostat response (p=4.94x10-7). HDGFL2 is involved in gene expression regulation and was discussed in the context of Mixed Lineage Leukemia.
title: Exome-wide association study reveals 7 functional variants associated with ex-vivo drug response in acute myeloid leukaemia patients

finding: This variant was associated with asthma (p = 2.4×10^-8) and pointed to the ZSCAN5A gene, which has been linked to monocyte count.
title: Multi-ancestry meta-analysis of asthma identifies novel associations and highlights the value of increased power and diversity

finding: Related to asthma with a p-value of 7.98×10^-9, this SNP was associated with the FCGRT gene, which regulates IgG recycling and could be targeted in autoimmune neurological disease therapies.
title: Multi-ancestry meta-analysis of asthma identifies novel associations and highlights the value of increased power and diversity

finding: The damaging missense variant in <italic>ABCA7</italic> (chr19:1056493:G:C) completely co-segregated with the common variant within AD-FBS families, indicating its potential role in Alzheimer's disease.
title: Identification of Rare Damaging Missense and Loss of Function Variants in GWAS Loci Using Genome Sequencing Data from Two Cohorts of Familial Late-Onset Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: This SNP implicated ZSCAN5A, which was previously linked to monocyte count. This association might suggest a role in immune response pathways related to asthma.
title: Multi-ancestry meta-analysis of asthma identifies novel associations and highlights the value of increased power and diversity

finding: This SNP was associated with FCGRT, which regulates IgG recycling and could represent a potential drug target for autoimmune neurological diseases, revealing connections between asthma and autoimmune pathways.
title: Multi-ancestry meta-analysis of asthma identifies novel associations and highlights the value of increased power and diversity

finding: This SNP indicated a strong association with asthma (p<sub>meta-analysis</sub> = 2.4×10<sup>−8</sup>) and was linked to <italic>ZSCAN5A</italic>, which is associated with monocyte count.
title: Multi-ancestry meta-analysis of asthma identifies novel associations and highlights the value of increased power and diversity

finding: Associated with asthma (p<sub>meta-analysis</sub> = 7.98×10<sup>−9</sup>), this SNP implicated <italic>FCGRT</italic>, a gene that regulates IgG recycling, indicating potential relevance in autoimmune disease therapies.
title: Multi-ancestry meta-analysis of asthma identifies novel associations and highlights the value of increased power and diversity

finding: The lead variant rs56344893 was identified as associated with an increased risk of both estrogen receptor positive (ER+) breast cancer (odds ratio 1.07; P = 2.26E-17) and estrogen receptor negative (ER-) breast cancer (odds ratio 1.07; P = 6.81E-8). This finding highlighted the significance of this locus at 19q13.31 in breast cancer risk.
title: The potential of Senicapoc, a KCNN4 inhibitor, for the prevention and treatment of breast cancer

finding: The risk-associated allele at rs62116961 was found to be associated with increased KCNN4 expression in whole blood samples from female donors (P = 5.9E-23; n = 254), with strong evidence of colocalization between GWAS and expression quantitative trait loci (eQTL) signals (Posterior Probability = 0.983). This suggested a possible biological mechanism linking this SNP to breast cancer risk through KCNN4 regulation.
title: The potential of Senicapoc, a KCNN4 inhibitor, for the prevention and treatment of breast cancer

finding: The rs429358 SNP was associated with Alzheimer's disease (AD) pathology as part of the study where APOE genotyping was performed. The study demonstrated that variants at this locus contributed to differential expression patterns of genes linked to neurodegeneration.
title: Disease specific alterations in the olfactory mucosa of patients with Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The rs7412 SNP was also identified in the context of Alzheimer’s disease within the study's focus on APOE genotyping. Similar to rs429358, this SNP was linked to variations in genetic expression and disease-related traits observed in olfactory mucosa cultures from patients with AD.
title: Disease specific alterations in the olfactory mucosa of patients with Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The SNP rs373201614 represented a very rare human polymorphism in the ZNF528 gene. There was a significant amino acid variation at this position; it was a Glutamine in humans and a Histidine in bonobos, which was suggested to impact the interaction of ZNF528 with transposable elements (TEs). This polymorphism was found to be under positive selection in humans, Denisovans, and Neanderthals, indicating its potential relevance in human evolution.
title: Regulatory networks of KRAB zinc finger genes and transposable elements changed during human brain evolution and disease

finding: The SNP rs10406644, within the KCTD15/LSM14A gene, exhibited significant 1df interactions with short sleep duration (STST) in the primary analysis with 62,969 individuals, which was confirmed in the follow-up cohort of 59,296 individuals. The gene KCTD15 is linked to neurodevelopmental processes and metabolic traits, indicating that the effects of short sleep on body weight and metabolism could amplify its influence on blood pressure regulation.
title: Multi-ancestry genome-wide gene-sleep interactions identify novel loci for blood pressure

finding: The SNP rs1065853 was the top-ranked and most significantly associated SNP for the immature red blood cell percentage blood trait. It resided in an intergenic region between APOE and APOC1, with APOE being the closest gene and previously linked to lipid metabolism. Upon testing, both APOE (log2 fold-change = -0.63, SCEPTRE p-value = 2.8×10^-6) and APOC1 (log2 fold-change = -0.27, SCEPTRE p-value = 3.5×10^-6) showed decreased expression.
title: Discovery of target genes and pathways of blood trait loci using pooled CRISPR screens and single cell RNA sequencing

finding: The SNP rs3764640 was found to be associated with the protein ratio STK11/USP8, showing a significant p-gain. This intragenic SNP in the STK11 gene was linked to the presence versus absence of psychosis in Alzheimer's cases. It suggested a role of STK11 in AD pathology, providing insights into biological pathways for potential drug targeting.
title: Genetic associations with ratios between protein levels detect new pQTLs and reveal protein-protein interactions

finding: The SNP rs1065853 was identified in linkage disequilibrium (LD) with coding SNP rs7412 in APOE. It showed a strong association with the ratio of LDLR and PCSK9 protein levels, with a significant p-gain. This relationship highlighted the regulatory mechanism where PCSK9 degrades LDLR, implying a genetic influence on cholesterol metabolism.
title: Genetic associations with ratios between protein levels detect new pQTLs and reveal protein-protein interactions

finding: Linked to rs1065853, SNP rs7412 was involved in the ratio between LDLR and PCSK9, emphasizing its role in cholesterol metabolism. Its relationship with apolipoprotein B levels indicated its significance in genetic variations affecting LDL receptor degradation.
title: Genetic associations with ratios between protein levels detect new pQTLs and reveal protein-protein interactions

finding: The SNP rs1077667 was associated with increased accessibility and contact with the promoters of GPR108 and TRIP10 at 8 hours post activation in CD4+ T cells. This SNP was linked to multiple sclerosis and resulted in increased expression of the connected genes upon T cell activation.
title: Chromatin conformation dynamics during CD4+ T cell activation implicates autoimmune disease-associated genes and regulatory elements

finding: The SNP rs2289865 on chromosome 19 was also identified for HDL cholesterol by the univariate gge test. Similar to rs10278, it did not represent an independent locus because it was in linkage disequilibrium with other SNPs.
title: A multivariate approach to joint testing of main genetic and gene-environment interaction effects

finding: The missense variant rs7412, which encodes the APOE e2 allele, was identified as a strong candidate for HDL, leveraging information from LDL and TC. Homozygous carriers of this variant showed a predisposition to Type III hyperlipoproteinemia and were reported to have altered efficacy in Atorvastatin treatment, affecting cardiovascular risk.
title: Flashfm: A Flexible and Shared Information Fine-mapping Approach for Multiple Quantitative Traits

finding: The SNP rs429358 was confirmed as a significant finding associated with LDL and TC, having been identified as a member of group L in the models produced by both FINEMAP and flashfm, which target LDL and TC.
title: Flashfm: A Flexible and Shared Information Fine-mapping Approach for Multiple Quantitative Traits

finding: The variant rs2251034 (A>G, 3’ UTR) was found to be negatively associated with peptides originally belonging to Norwalk virus polyproteins. This finding related to FUT2 secretor status, which controls the secretion of the H-antigen, relevant to infection susceptibility.
title: Genetic, environmental and intrinsic determinants of the human antibody epitope repertoire

finding: rs601338 (A>G, R2 = 0.85) was involved in high linkage with rs2251034 and was also associated with the secretion of the H-antigen. Its association provided context for infection susceptibility, particularly with Norwalk virus, which relies on H-type oligosaccharide for cell surface attachment.
title: Genetic, environmental and intrinsic determinants of the human antibody epitope repertoire

finding: The rs7412 variant was replicated from the UK Biobank for its association with LDL levels. This finding confirmed its relevance in a Russian cohort.
title: Understanding Complex Trait Susceptibilities and Ethnical Diversity in a Sample of 4,145 Russians Through Analysis of Clinical and Genetic Data

finding: The rs74800719 variant passed the Bonferroni-adjusted threshold for replication, showing an association with increased risk of Alzheimer disease and apolipoprotein B levels in both FinnGen and the Russian cohort.
title: Understanding Complex Trait Susceptibilities and Ethnical Diversity in a Sample of 4,145 Russians Through Analysis of Clinical and Genetic Data

finding: The rs3745198 SNP was mentioned as linked to differences in cancer susceptibility among populations, specifically noted for its role in regulatory variants.
title: Signatures of genetic variation in human microRNAs point to processes of positive selection related to population-specific disease risks

finding: This SNP was significantly associated with the risk of overall breast cancer according to the analysis, indicating a notable implication for breast cancer genetics.
title: Circulating concentrations of micro-nutrients and risk of breast cancer: A Mendelian randomization study

finding: The presence of the AD risk allele APOE E4 was confirmed in the cell lines NCRM1 and NCRM5, which is relevant for Alzheimer's Disease risk evaluation.
title: A reference induced pluripotent stem cell line for large-scale collaborative studies

finding: This SNP, along with rs429358, was screened to assess associations with Alzheimer's risk, aiding in understanding the genetic composition related to Alzheimer's Disease.
title: A reference induced pluripotent stem cell line for large-scale collaborative studies

finding: The rs7412 SNP of the APOE gene was found to co-segregate with the E4 allele, which was associated with decreased oxidative phosphorylation and increased aerobic glycolysis in astrocytes of E4-expressing mice. This metabolic shift was linked to a decreased rate of glucose oxidation and heightened lactate production, mirroring phenomena observed in young E4 human carriers.
title: APOE4 Lowers Energy Expenditure and Impairs Glucose Oxidation by Increasing Flux through Aerobic Glycolysis

finding: The rs429358 SNP, which also defines the APOE allele, exhibited positive findings in conjunction with rs7412. It was implicated in the decrease in energy expenditure and oxygen consumption among young female carriers of the E4 allele. The resulting metabolic profile indicated a similar shift toward aerobic glycolysis, suggesting an early metabolic reprogramming that may precede the clinical manifestation of Alzheimer’s disease.
title: APOE4 Lowers Energy Expenditure and Impairs Glucose Oxidation by Increasing Flux through Aerobic Glycolysis

finding: The SNP rs429358 was linked to the APOE epsilon 4 allele, which is recognized as the primary genetic risk factor for late onset Alzheimer's Disease (AD). The context of the finding was based on the analysis of cognitive and neuroimaging data from a cohort of cognitively normal individuals, where significant age-by-genotype interactions were noted in brain structure, specifically right hippocampal volume, prior to adjusting for future diagnosis of mild cognitive impairment (MCI) and AD.
title: APOE ε4 effects on hippocampal atrophy in the healthy elderly reflect future cognitive decline

finding: The SNP rs7412 was associated with the APOE epsilon 4 allele, contributing to the risk of Alzheimer's Disease (AD). This finding stemmed from a study examining longitudinal differences in hippocampal atrophy across different APOE genotypes among cognitively normal older individuals. Upon consideration of future diagnoses, the effect attributed to the genotype was diminished, supporting the prodromal hypothesis relating to changes in brain structure.
title: APOE ε4 effects on hippocampal atrophy in the healthy elderly reflect future cognitive decline

finding: The study demonstrated that the editing of the rs429358 variant in the APOE gene was successful in converting the APOE3 variant to the APOE4 genotype using Prime Editing (PE). In the high fraction of cells sorted based on PE expression, Sanger sequencing indicated a 23.6% rate of correctly edited alleles, corroborated by droplet digital PCR (ddPCR), which reported a 21.3% correct edit rate. This finding illustrated the efficiency of PE at high expression levels and its capacity to control allelic editing outcomes.
title: Enrichment of allelic editing outcomes by Prime Editing in iPS cells

finding: The research involved the rs7412 variant in the APOE gene, showing that it, along with rs429358, was part of the clonal distribution analysis of allelic editing outcomes. Although specific edit rates for rs7412 were not detailed, it was part of the experiments comparing the efficacy of PE and its influence on editing both rs429358 and the neighboring variants, highlighting the systematic approach to editing in the context of Alzheimer’s disease risk assessment.
title: Enrichment of allelic editing outcomes by Prime Editing in iPS cells

finding: This SNP was tagged as the top variant (19BM1) at the POLD1 locus, showing a genome-wide significant association with delayed age at TFC6 (p=6.6E-10), but it was not significant for age at motor onset (p=5.1E-04).
title: Genetic modifiers of somatic expansion and clinical phenotypes in Huntington’s disease reveal shared and tissue-specific effects

finding: This missense variant was identified as part of a second modifier effect (19BM2) at POLD1, achieving suggestive significance for both age at TFC6 and age at motor onset (p=3.4E-06 and p=3.1E-06, respectively).
title: Genetic modifiers of somatic expansion and clinical phenotypes in Huntington’s disease reveal shared and tissue-specific effects

finding: This SNV in the LIG1 region strongly correlated with clinical outcomes following extensive analysis.
title: Genetic modifiers of somatic expansion and clinical phenotypes in Huntington’s disease reveal shared and tissue-specific effects

finding: This SNV suggested significant influence in LIG1, accentuating its relevance in modification studies.
title: Genetic modifiers of somatic expansion and clinical phenotypes in Huntington’s disease reveal shared and tissue-specific effects

finding: SNP rs58542926 in TM6SF2 was previously linked to NAFLD and showed associations with liver fat in the study context, underlining its established role in hepatic lipid metabolism.
title: Genetic architecture of 11 abdominal organ traits derived from abdominal MRI using deep learning

finding: The SNP rs429358 in APOE was previously associated with NAFLD and was found to correlate significantly with liver fat in this study, reaffirming its importance in metabolic diseases.
title: Genetic architecture of 11 abdominal organ traits derived from abdominal MRI using deep learning

finding: SNP rs188247550, a missense variant in TM6SF2, was linked to hyperlipidemia and established connections to alcohol-induced cirrhosis, substantiating its role in both liver health and metabolic traits.
title: Genetic architecture of 11 abdominal organ traits derived from abdominal MRI using deep learning

finding: The context indicated that the rs12979860 SNP, located in the IL28B gene, was notable for having a CC genotype in the human hepatocyte donor used in the study. This genotype was included in the experimental design to assess its effect on hepatitis B treatment outcomes, particularly in how it may influence the antiviral efficacy of treatment protocols involving pegIFN and lamivudine in HBV-infected models.
title: Understanding hepatitis B virus dynamics and the antiviral effect of interferon-α treatment in humanized chimeric mice

finding: The variant rs3093105, designated as CYP4F2*2, exhibited an approximate frequency of 40% in the Fulani and Hausa ethnolinguistic groups compared to around 30% in the Yoruba group. This polymorphism was implicated in altered warfarin sensitivity and metabolism, highlighting its significance in pharmacogenomics across different African populations.
title: Whole-genome sequencing across 449 samples spanning 47 ethnolinguistic groups provides insights into genetic diversity in Nigeria

finding: The variant rs2108622, classified as CYP4F2*3, showed elevated frequencies of 15-17% in the Fulani and Hausa groups versus approximately 5% in the Yoruba group. This allele was associated with reduced enzymatic levels of cytochrome P450 4F2 involved in vitamin K metabolism and was included in pharmacogenomic assessments, although its impact on warfarin dosage response had not been well characterized in African populations prior to this study.
title: Whole-genome sequencing across 449 samples spanning 47 ethnolinguistic groups provides insights into genetic diversity in Nigeria

finding: The SNP rs7412 was identified as the single most significant SNV for LDL-C with a P-value less than 1×10^-316. It was predicted to be functional based on MACIE-protein and MACIE-conserved scores exceeding 0.95, indicating multiple functional roles.
title: A multi-dimensional integrative scoring framework for predicting functional variants in the human genome

finding: The SNP rs1065853, which was in extremely high linkage disequilibrium with rs7412, exhibited a MACIE-regulatory score greater than 0.99. This suggested it might possess regulatory roles and could be causally linked to LDL-C levels.
title: A multi-dimensional integrative scoring framework for predicting functional variants in the human genome

finding: This SNP was part of the CEACAM1-LIPE-AS1 core haplotype in Oceanic groups and displayed archaic-like branching events, suggesting an influence on genetic traits.
title: Exploring adaptive introgression in modern human circadian rhythm genes

finding: The minor allele (T) of this variant was associated with increased expression of ZNF329, functioning as a repressor of ZNF329 in both K562 and HepG2 cells.
title: Functional dissection of complex and molecular trait variants at single nucleotide resolution

finding: Disrupted a motif for the strong hepatocyte activator HNF1 specifically in HepG2 cells, revealing its role in regulating ZNF329 expression and LDL cholesterol levels.
title: Functional dissection of complex and molecular trait variants at single nucleotide resolution
