finding: The SNP rs7412 in the APOE gene was highlighted in the GWAS for high cholesterol, showing a genome-wide significant non-additive effect with a p-value of 1.640e-19. The association suggested latent interactions with other SNPs, particularly those nearby.
title: Detecting latent gene-environment interaction when analyzing binary traits

finding: The SNP rs7254892, mapped to NECTIN2, exhibited the smallest p-value of the interaction analysis with rs7412 (p-value = 1.713e-07). It showed strong linkage disequilibrium with other SNPs that define the classic APOE haplotypes, indicating its potential role in cholesterol level interactions.
title: Detecting latent gene-environment interaction when analyzing binary traits

finding: The SNP rs7412 was identified as a polymorphic site associated with the APOE gene, particularly relevant for determining e4 carrier status, which has implications in aging and cognitive decline. This finding helped clarify the relationship between brain atrophy and cognitive abilities in older adults.
title: Three major dimensions of human brain cortical ageing in relation to cognitive decline across the 8th decade of life

finding: The SNP rs429358 was analyzed as another polymorphic site in the APOE gene, influencing the classification into e2, e3, and e4 alleles. This variation was critically associated with patterns of age-related brain changes and cognitive decline as noted in the longitudinal study.
title: Three major dimensions of human brain cortical ageing in relation to cognitive decline across the 8th decade of life

finding: The SNP rs601338, associated with the FUT2 gene, was identified in a study linking it to celiac disease and inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) in the Finnish population. The study suggested a relationship between the genetic variant and the susceptibility to IBD, as well as highlighting its influence on the expression of blood group antigens that may impact gut health and viral interactions related to diseases such as Crohn's disease (CD) and ulcerative colitis (UC). This SNP was significant in the context of understanding immune responses in IBD due to its role in determining the availability of specific gastrointestinal antigens.
title: Specific norovirus interaction with Lewis x and Lewis a on human intestinal inflammatory mucosa during refractory inflammatory bowel disease

finding: The SNP rs35866622 showed association with the abundance of the Ruminococcus torques group (P=2.21×10−8) and was closely related to the FUT2 gene, which is pivotal in the secretion of fucosylated mucus glycans, indicating a potential link between genetic variants and gut microbiome composition.
title: Large-scale association analyses identify host factors influencing human gut microbiome composition

finding: At the R3HDM4 locus, rs1683587 was identified as a lead-associated SNP within the intron, indicating regulatory function. It was part of a broader analysis involving rare CNVs, SNPs, and indel PTVs that contributed to reticulocyte counts.
title: Influences of rare copy number variation on human complex traits

finding: The SNP rs737337, linked to the gene DOCK6, exhibited consistently positive associations with M-HDL-P, L-HDL-P, XL-HDL-P, HDL-D, ApoA1, and HDL-C, alongside a negative association with CAD.
title: A Mendelian randomization study of the role of lipoprotein subfractions in coronary artery disease

finding: This SNP was associated with Alzheimer's disease (AD) in African American populations. The deletion was a 44 bp variant located in exon 14 of the ABCA7 gene, leading to a frameshift mutation (p.Arg578 fs). This finding was validated through Sanger sequencing.
title: A comparative study of structural variant calling strategies using the Alzheimer’s Disease Sequencing Project’s whole genome family data

finding: An association was found between the SNP rs3865444 and the Siglec-3 protein, which is related to Alzheimer's disease. The findings supported the hypothesis that obesity in midlife could increase the risk of developing Alzheimer's in later life.
title: A Bayesian joint pQTL study sheds light on the genetic architecture of obesity

finding: This SNP was found to be under positive selection and served as an eQTL for CYP4F12 in adipose tissue, with a negative effect size indicating reduced expression, highlighting its regulatory role in the CYP4F cluster.
title: Signatures of co-evolution and co-regulation in the CYP3A and CYP4F genes in humans

finding: Found under positive selection, rs62115147 was associated with CYP4F3 expression in brain and nerve tissue, contributing to the understanding of gene expression dynamics in this gene cluster.
title: Signatures of co-evolution and co-regulation in the CYP3A and CYP4F genes in humans

finding: The SNP rs344812 was identified as a risk factor for AD with an odds ratio of 1.14, and it increased expression of MARK4 in cortical areas as per the eQTL analysis.
title: Immediate-Early Genes as Influencers in Genetic Networks and their Role in Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The variant rs1800437 (p.Glu354Gln) in the GIPR gene showed associations with multiple food intake phenotypes, including fresh fruit intake (p=4.2×10^-9, beta=0.017). The alternate Gln allele was associated with diminished receptor signaling in multiple pathways.
title: Medical relevance of common protein-altering variants in GPCR genes across 337,205 individuals in the UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs429358 was known to determine the allele type of APOE, a gene widely recognized as a major causal factor in Alzheimer's disease.
title: GenEpi: Gene-based Epistasis Discovery Using Machine Learning

finding: The SNP rs7412, in conjunction with rs429358, was confirmed as a significant genetic determinant of APOE and its connection to Alzheimer's disease.
title: GenEpi: Gene-based Epistasis Discovery Using Machine Learning

finding: The SNP rs12610506, within the CLEC4M gene, decreased in frequency from sub-Saharan Africa to Latin America, indicating its potential role in population-level immune response differences.
title: Hypothetical Human Immune Genome Complex Gradient May Help to Explain the Congenital Zika Symdrome Catastrophe in Brazil: A New Theory

finding: The SNP rs4804801 located in the CD209 gene also showed a decreasing trend in frequency from sub-Saharan Africa to Latin America, underscoring its potential influence on Zika virus susceptibility.
title: Hypothetical Human Immune Genome Complex Gradient May Help to Explain the Congenital Zika Symdrome Catastrophe in Brazil: A New Theory

finding: The SNP rs62128466, found in the PCSK4 gene on chr19:1487562 with a minor allele frequency of 0.00003, was among the most critical features across both exome and phenotypic datasets. Its high expression in the thalamus linked it to the development and diagnosis of developmental dyslexia.
title: A data-fusion approach to identifying developmental dyslexia from multi-omics datasets

finding: SNP rs11668477 from the LDLR locus was associated with SM16:0, with a significant P-value of 0.0002 reported in the GWAS results.
title: Genome-wide association study of plasma triglycerides, phospholipids and relation to cardio-metabolic risk factors

finding: This SNP near the MAU2 gene was associated with PC34:4, presenting suggestive evidence through linkage to rs3794991, which had a notable P-value of 9.3 x 10^-7.
title: Genome-wide association study of plasma triglycerides, phospholipids and relation to cardio-metabolic risk factors

finding: Located in strong linkage disequilibrium with rs73001065, this SNP was significantly associated with PC34:4 in the EUROSPAN dataset.
title: Genome-wide association study of plasma triglycerides, phospholipids and relation to cardio-metabolic risk factors

finding: The common SNP rs3729836 located at the upstream 3′ splice site of human TNNI3 exon 3 decreased the 3′ MaxEnt splice strength score from 4.26 to 3.69, resulting in a reduced likelihood of exon 3 inclusion to approximately 57%. This SNP also disrupted the branch point consensus sequence in pre-mRNA, indicating a predisposition to alternative splicing in this exon. Therefore, while TNNI3 exon 3 alternative splicing was not known to occur in humans, this genetic variant presented evidence suggesting that it might induce exon 3 skipping in future genetic interventions.
title: Parallel genetic excisions of the cardiac troponin I N-terminal extension in tachycardic mammals

finding: The lead SNP rs1465697, located on chromosome 19, was identified as having a significant association with multiple sclerosis (MS), reflected by a p-value of 3.02x10^-18. This SNP was the most prioritized variant out of 21 SNPs in a 95% credible set, having a posterior probability of 15%. It was found to be an expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL) for the gene TEAD2 specifically in naive B cells. Furthermore, the SNP was involved in chromatin interactions with TEAD2 and another gene, DKKL1, indicating a potential causal role for TEAD2 in the genetic predisposition to MS.
title: Dissection of multiple sclerosis genetics identifies B and CD4+ T cells as driver cell subsets

finding: The study found that individuals carrying the APOE-ε4 allele, which is linked to the SNP rs429358, demonstrated lower beta peak frequencies in their EEG measures. This finding related to cognitive performance, particularly in the context of age-related cognitive decline.
title: Resting EEG power spectra across middle to late life: Associations with age, cognition, APOE-ε4 carriage and cardiometabolic burden

finding: Similar to rs429358, the SNP rs7412 was part of the criteria to classify participants as APOE-ε4 carriers. These carriers exhibited lower beta peak frequencies, suggesting a significant relationship between this SNP and cognitive performance, emphasizing its relevance to late-life cognitive impairment.
title: Resting EEG power spectra across middle to late life: Associations with age, cognition, APOE-ε4 carriage and cardiometabolic burden

finding: The rs75621460 variant was implicated in osteoarthritis and located within a cCRE that was predominantly accessible in immune cell types. This variant was predicted to affect the immunosuppressive cytokine gene TGFB1 and disrupted a binding site for the zinc-finger transcription factor ERG1, highlighting its potential molecular role in the regulation of immune functions.
title: A cell atlas of chromatin accessibility across 25 adult human tissues

finding: The sentinel variant in the APOE gene region (chr19:44908822, rs7412) demonstrated a significant association with a P value of 7.1×10−55. This variant was identified in the context of examining conditional associations related to the APOE gene.
title: StocSum: stochastic summary statistics for whole genome sequencing studies

finding: The secondary association variant chr19:44908684 (rs429358) showed a conditional P value of 8.2×10−15 after conditioning on the sentinel variant rs7412. This finding indicated that rs429358 is an important variant in the same APOE gene region.
title: StocSum: stochastic summary statistics for whole genome sequencing studies

finding: At the APOE locus, the SNP rs6857 was found associated with inferred disease stage in the Mayo Clinic cohort (p = 9.18 x 10^-6). This variant is known to play a critical role in the genetic susceptibility to Alzheimer's disease.
title: Molecular estimation of neurodegeneration pseudotime in older brains

finding: Located at the LDLR locus, SNP rs11668477 was found to be significantly associated with the sphingomyelin SM16:0 and previously established to affect LDL cholesterol levels.
title: Genome-wide association study of plasma lipids

finding: The SNP rs73001065 near the MAU2 gene was associated with the phospholipid PC34:4, showing a suggestive association based on strong linkage disequilibrium with rs3794991.
title: Genome-wide association study of plasma lipids

finding: This SNP was significantly associated with PC34:4 in the EUROSPAN dataset, providing evidence for its role in lipid metabolism.
title: Genome-wide association study of plasma lipids

finding: The finding related to the study conducted by Calviño-Cancela and Martín-Herrero in 2016 indicated significant spectral discrimination of vegetation classes in ice-free areas of Antarctica, which likely included mapping relevant to the identification of different vegetation types.
title: Mapping vegetation types in Antarctic Peninsula and South Shetlands islands using Sentinel-2 images and Google Earth Engine cloud computing

finding: The SNP rs429358 was identified as a proximal mod-QTL for the M42 matrisome module, located within the APOE locus, which is crucial in determining APOE genotype status. This was evident at a genome-wide level of significance, and it was the only module observed to vary by APOE genotype. The expression of the M42 matrisome module was found to be influenced by the APOE ε4 genotype independently of diagnosis, particularly noted in the asymptomatic stage of Alzheimer's disease.
title: Large-Scale Deep Multi-Layer Analysis of Alzheimer’s Disease Brain Reveals Strong Proteomic Disease-Related Changes Not Observed at the RNA Level

finding: The SNP rs58542926 in TM6SF2 demonstrated a strong association with liver fat (p-value = 9.6e-117, beta = 0.333) and has been previously linked to non-alcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD).
title: Systematic quantification of health parameters from UK Biobank abdominal MRI using deep learning

finding: The SNP rs429358 in APOE was significantly associated with liver fat, with a p-value of 1.1e-30 and a beta of -0.123, and has been implicated in NAFLD.
title: Systematic quantification of health parameters from UK Biobank abdominal MRI using deep learning

finding: The missense SNP rs188247550 in TM6SF2 was associated with liver fat, showing a p-value of 4.79e-26 and a beta of 0.35, and has connections to hyperlipidemia and alcohol-induced cirrhosis.
title: Systematic quantification of health parameters from UK Biobank abdominal MRI using deep learning

finding: The lead SNP rs10422861 was associated with pancreatic fat (p-value = 1.80e-22, beta = 0.087), with implications for body fat percentage.
title: Systematic quantification of health parameters from UK Biobank abdominal MRI using deep learning

finding: The second signal at the PEPD locus, denoted by rs118005033, indicated a conditional relationship with pancreatic fat (p-value = 5.71e-10, conditional beta = 0.087).
title: Systematic quantification of health parameters from UK Biobank abdominal MRI using deep learning

finding: SNP rs1005731 was found to correlate with pancreatic iron presence (p-value = 5.9e-10, beta = 0.06), adding evidence to metabolic functions.
title: Systematic quantification of health parameters from UK Biobank abdominal MRI using deep learning

finding: The SNP rs153701 showed an association indicating a potential link to VAT volume (p-value = 2.9e-11, beta = -0.04), independent from other fat-related signals.
title: Systematic quantification of health parameters from UK Biobank abdominal MRI using deep learning

finding: The rs9973235 SNP was associated with a non-synonymous polymorphism in the protein Perilipin-3. The peptide identified using the MetaNovo/UniProt approach corresponded to this SNP, and it had been previously detected in a proteogenomics study of the SH-SY5Y neuroblastoma cell line. The identification was supported by 100% sequence identity with an orthologous protein in Macaca mulatta and a slightly lower identity (94.7%) with the same protein in Homo sapiens, indicating potential human variant identification.
title: MetaNovo: a probabilistic approach to peptide and polymorphism discovery in complex mass spectrometry datasets

finding: The SNP rs10412176 was linked to greater SA in BD, emphasizing its role in brain structural variations.
title: The overlapping genetic architecture of psychiatric disorders and cortical brain structure

finding: Linked to cortical structure variations in SCZ and BD, this SNP is suggestive of shared neurogenetic pathways.
title: The overlapping genetic architecture of psychiatric disorders and cortical brain structure

finding: This SNP was associated with significant cortical overlaps in BD and SCZ, demonstrating genetic connections.
title: The overlapping genetic architecture of psychiatric disorders and cortical brain structure

finding: SNP rs12459419 was also linked to reduced AD risk and characterized as a functional SNP which increases D2-CD33 levels. This finding developed a hypothesis that it may represent a gain of function that contributes to AD protection, contrary to the previously thought loss of function.
title: Pseudogene-mediated gene conversion after CRISPR-Cas9 editing demonstrated by partial CD33 conversion with SIGLEC22P

finding: SNP rs3987761 was identified through sequencing of edited cell lines and resulted in a change in an amino acid (p.N20K). This SNP, along with two others, was associated with the KIR-CD33 isoform which retains CD33 functionality on the cell surface.
title: Pseudogene-mediated gene conversion after CRISPR-Cas9 editing demonstrated by partial CD33 conversion with SIGLEC22P

finding: Similar to rs3987761, SNP rs3987760 caused a missense mutation (p.F21I) and was part of the KIR-CD33 SNPs identified in the edited cells.
title: Pseudogene-mediated gene conversion after CRISPR-Cas9 editing demonstrated by partial CD33 conversion with SIGLEC22P

finding: The SNP rs35814802 was linked to a missense mutation (p.W22R) in the KIR-CD33 and was also indexed in dbSNP, reinforcing the characterization of previously noted SNPs.
title: Pseudogene-mediated gene conversion after CRISPR-Cas9 editing demonstrated by partial CD33 conversion with SIGLEC22P

finding: The SNP rs1122608, located in intron 29 of the SMARCA4 gene, was identified as a lead SNP in Genome Wide Association Studies (GWAS) related to atherosclerosis and cardiovascular disease (CVD). This SNP was shown to be significantly associated with expression levels of SMARCA4, suggesting its role as an independent risk factor for atherosclerosis by influencing the gene's activity in various tissues.
title: Hemin-driven chromatin remodelling by atherosclerotic risk gene SMARCA4 switches human blood-derived macrophages from leukocyte disposal to erythrocyte disposal

finding: The study revealed that rs117961479 was significantly associated with cholesterol (CHOL) levels in the HCHS/SoL cohort, showing a genome-wide significant signal with a p-value of 1.5×10^-9. This SNP was in linkage disequilibrium with rs199768142, which is previously implicated in total cholesterol levels.
title: Genetically regulated gene expression underlies lipid traits in Hispanic cohorts

finding: Linked with rs117961479, rs199768142 had relevant findings concerning total cholesterol levels and was part of the significant findings in lipid variation due to its substantial linkage with rs117961479.
title: Genetically regulated gene expression underlies lipid traits in Hispanic cohorts

finding: The exonic polymorphism rs5498 in the ICAM1 gene demonstrated a significant association where carriers of the G allele exhibited higher levels of triacylglycerols, which ultimately increases the risk for coronary artery disease. The study also highlighted its connection with HDL levels and the biological mechanism behind this association.
title: Genetically regulated gene expression underlies lipid traits in Hispanic cohorts

finding: The SNP rs3752246, associated with the ABCA7 locus, indicated LOAD-specific decreased chromatin accessibility in female non-neuronal cells. This was corroborated by the expression analysis, where 23 genes displayed differential expression patterns aligning with reduced chromatin accessibility in the vicinity of this SNP.
title: Sex dependent glial-specific changes in the chromatin accessibility landscape in late-onset Alzheimer’s disease brains

finding: The study demonstrated that individuals with the APOE4 allele (which is determined by SNP rs429358) had impaired response inhibition associated with blunted cerebrovascular response (CVR). However, APOE4 carriers with higher CVR exhibited better performance in response inhibition despite their greater deposition of amyloid-beta (Aβ). This suggests a significant interaction between the APOE genotype and cognitive function in older adults.
title: Cerebrovascular response to exercise interacts with individual genotype and amyloid-beta deposition to influence response inhibition with aging

finding: The presence of the APOE4 allele, confirmed by SNP rs7412, was linked to impaired response inhibition due to blunted cerebrovascular response. Just like SNP rs429358, this finding highlighted the importance of the APOE genotype in cognitive dysfunction, especially in the context of cerebrovascular health and amyloid-beta deposition.
title: Cerebrovascular response to exercise interacts with individual genotype and amyloid-beta deposition to influence response inhibition with aging

finding: This SNP exhibited a protective effect on carcinoembryonic antigen (CEA; P = 1.07×10⁻⁸) and an increased risk for carbohydrate antigen 19-9 (CA 19-9; P = 5.81×10⁻⁵), linking it to cancer-related markers.
title: Phenome-wide association study of a comprehensive health check-up database in a Korea population: Clinical application & trans-ethnic comparison

finding: This splice donor variant was significantly associated with coronary vessel calcium scoring (P = 4.29×10⁻⁵), and it was noted to be related to Phospholipase D3 (PLD3), which has been linked to Alzheimer's disease.
title: Phenome-wide association study of a comprehensive health check-up database in a Korea population: Clinical application & trans-ethnic comparison

finding: The A49V variant was shown to abolish recognition by the Opa74 strain of <italic>Neisseria</italic>, indicating a specific alteration in bacterial adherence attributable to this high-frequency polymorphism.
title: Evolution of host-microbe cell adherence by receptor domain shuffling

finding: The Q89H variant was found to abrogate binding to both Opa52 and Opa74 strains of <italic>Neisseria</italic>. This suggests that the presence of this variant can significantly influence bacterial adherence and thereby impact colonization or infection outcomes.
title: Evolution of host-microbe cell adherence by receptor domain shuffling

finding: The study determined that the presence of the APOE-ε4 allele, identified by genotyping rs7412, was associated with distinct changes in the plasma proteome. These changes were linked to pathways relevant to Alzheimer's disease pathogenesis, notably atherosclerosis and synaptogenesis signaling.
title: APOE genotype or presence of brain amyloid alters the plasma proteome in cognitively normal, elderly subjects

finding: Similarly, the allele status determined by rs429358 also indicated that subjects with the APOE-ε4 variant exhibited specific proteomic profiles. These profiles were connected to lipid transport and extracellular matrix pathways, reinforcing the relationship between APOE genotype and systemic biochemical changes that may contribute to Alzheimer's disease.
title: APOE genotype or presence of brain amyloid alters the plasma proteome in cognitively normal, elderly subjects

finding: The SNP rs429358 was recognized for its significant role in Alzheimer’s disease through a major missense mutation in the APOE gene. It was notably correlated (r² = 0.97) with another SNP located between APOE and APOC1, which was recently identified as an independent association with Alzheimer’s and over 40 other traits, suggesting complex genetic interactions leading to these phenotypes.
title: On the contribution of genetic heterogeneity to complex traits

finding: The SNP rs429358 was associated with Alzheimer's Disease as it influenced the presence of the ApoE4 allele, which was linked to increased protein oxidation and higher levels of the ferritin light chain (FTL) in the prefrontal cortex. This association further correlated with neurodegenerative changes, emphasizing the role of iron accumulation in cognitive decline.
title: Alzheimer’s Disease associations of ferritin and glutathione with oxidative damage and neuronal loss

finding: SNP rs7412 was also involved in the modulation of ApoE alleles within Alzheimer’s Disease contexts. It contributed to the overall findings regarding iron metabolism abnormalities, lipid peroxidation repair impairment, and the subsequent neurodegeneration observed, further linking it to altered antioxidant defenses in the disease.
title: Alzheimer’s Disease associations of ferritin and glutathione with oxidative damage and neuronal loss

finding: The SNP rs3211371 in CYP2B6 (25505C>T) was described as having significant functional effects that were detrimental to enzyme activity, with a moderate frequency of around 0.1.
title: Non-additivity of the functional properties of individual P450 species and its manifestation in the effects of alcohol consumption on the metabolism of ketamine and amitriptyline

finding: The SNP rs2279343 in CYP2B6 (18053A>G) was identified to considerably increase the turnover rate and change substrate specificity, making it functionally significant with a frequency around 0.15.
title: Non-additivity of the functional properties of individual P450 species and its manifestation in the effects of alcohol consumption on the metabolism of ketamine and amitriptyline

finding: The SNP rs3745274 in CYP2B6 (15631G>T) was detrimental to enzyme activity and was notable for its significant functional effects, with a frequency around 0.3.
title: Non-additivity of the functional properties of individual P450 species and its manifestation in the effects of alcohol consumption on the metabolism of ketamine and amitriptyline

finding: This SNP was found to have strong associations with triglycerides and total cholesterol, indicating its relevance in lipid phenotypes.
title: A method to map and interpret pleiotropic loci using summary statistics of multiple traits

finding: The study reported that the rs56113850 SNP was significantly associated with the caffeine metabolite paraxanthine, indicated by a p-value of 2.2 × 10^-19. In contrast, the association for 1-methylurate at the same SNP did not reach significance in the single metabolite analysis, showing a p-value of only 0.0013. However, using the new DrFARM approach, the association for 1-methylurate at rs56113850 was enhanced to a p-value of 3.9 × 10^-13, which was attributed to the phenotypic correlation between the caffeine metabolites and the role of the CYP2A6 enzyme in their metabolism.
title: DrFARM: Identification and inference for pleiotropic gene in GWAS

finding: The SNP rs2109069 was identified on 19p13.2 near the gene TYK2 in critically ill COVID-19 patients, showing a significant association with disease severity.
title: Human genetic variants associated with COVID-19 severity are enriched in immune and epithelium regulatory networks

finding: The intronic variant rs192943660 in CPAMD8 was shown to be genome-wide significant in retinal detachment, marking it as a notable new association.
title: Insight into the genetic aetiology of retinal detachment by combining small clinical and large population-based datasets

finding: The study identified rs35033974 as a missense variant associated with TEX101, which is relevant to proteomic measurements of human spermatozoa. This finding contributed to understanding the genetic factors influencing fertility markers.
title: Identification and quantification of human relaxin proteins by immunoaffinity-mass spectrometry

finding: The SNP rs10420324 in the AMPA receptor auxiliary subunit TARP gamma-8 was reported to regulate the susceptibility to antisocial personality disorder. This finding highlighted a genetic basis for behavioral variations linked to complex brain functions, particularly within the prefrontal cortex (PFC), which is crucial for emotional regulation and executive action.
title: Understanding prefrontal cortex functions by decoding its molecular, cellular and circuit organization

finding: The SNP rs8100011 located in the ZNF45 gene showed a near genome-wide significance association with BMI. This variant acted as a strong cis-expression quantitative trait locus (cis-eQTL), and the risk allele was associated with decreased expression of ZNF45, reflecting an inverse correlation with BMI in skeletal muscle.
title: Multifaceted genome-wide study identifies novel regulatory loci for body mass index in Indians

finding: This SNP was identified in the intronic region of SUGP1 on chr 19p13.11. It was prioritized by DEPICT to investigate its role in triglyceride-associated vascular atherogenic traits. Mutations caused alterations in lipid metabolism and increased early-stage atherosclerosis risk, suggesting a complex relationship where reduced expression of genes associated with this SNP could lower circulating lipids but increase atherosclerosis risk.
title: Zebrafish larvae as a model system for systematic characterization of drugs and genes in dyslipidemia and atherosclerosis

finding: This SNP was linked to the GATAD2A gene and demonstrated a consistent association with glucose metabolism. Mutated alleles in zebrafish resulted in lower glucose levels, paralleling findings that the minor T allele was associated with higher expression of GATAD2A in humans and an increased risk of type-2 diabetes. This SNP was crucial in demonstrating the SNP's role in metabolic pathways influencing diabetes risk.
title: Zebrafish larvae as a model system for systematic characterization of drugs and genes in dyslipidemia and atherosclerosis

finding: The SNP rs429358, located within the APOE gene, was found to be a significant Q finding related to cognitive traits. It was mainly associated with cognitive aging as indicated by its significant correlation with genetic g, except for its negligible null association with VNR, which is a cognitive test exhibiting minimal age-related differences in the UK Biobank data. This highlighted that while rs429358 had implications for general cognitive ability, its relevance was particularly marked in the context of aging and related cognitive decline.
title: Genetic “General Intelligence,” Objectively Determined and Measured

finding: It was recognized as a genome-wide significant signal of selection, further detailing the genetic landscape of the population.
title: Scalable probabilistic PCA for large-scale genetic variation data

finding: This SNP was linked to the APOC1 gene and was significantly associated with TG/HDL (p < 10^{-48}). Its interaction with SNP rs1800775, as identified by G2PT, indicated that both SNPs modulated HDL levels, with rs483082 reducing expression of APOC1, an inhibitor of CETP.
title: Mechanistic genotype-phenotype translation using hierarchical transformers

finding: The variant rs138303849-C was associated with increased risk of vasculitis characterized by autoantibodies against proteinase-3 (PR3). This variant was also identified as an eQTL in whole blood, leading to increased PR3 concentrations in plasma. It was noted to influence various neutrophil traits, including SSC (granularity) and SFL (nucleic acid), demonstrating a connection between the genetic risk and structural properties of neutrophils.
title: Genetic Analyses of Blood Cell Structure for Biological and Pharmacological Inference

finding: This SNP was located in the 3' UTR region of the gene APOC1, which was identified as a GWAS signal for total cholesterol levels. The association between the GReX of ZC3H12B and Alzheimer's dementia was completely driven by trans-eQTL including this SNP.
title: Bayesian Genome-wide TWAS method to leverage both cis- and trans- eQTL information through summary statistics

finding: This SNP was located downstream of APOC1 and was found to be in linkage disequilibrium with the APOE-E4 allele (rs429358). It was identified as a GWAS signal for various blood lipid measurements and for Alzheimer's disease. Its association also contributed to the driving trans-eQTL effects seen with ZC3H12B.
title: Bayesian Genome-wide TWAS method to leverage both cis- and trans- eQTL information through summary statistics

finding: Located downstream of APOC1, this SNP was identified as a GWAS signal for Alzheimer's disease. It played a role in the trans-eQTL associations affecting gene expression levels of ZC3H12B linked with Alzheimer's dementia.
title: Bayesian Genome-wide TWAS method to leverage both cis- and trans- eQTL information through summary statistics

finding: This SNP was found in the regulatory region of APOC1 and was identified as a GWAS signal for Alzheimer's disease. It contributed to the trans-eQTL influences observed in the gene expression levels of ZC3H12B associated with Alzheimer's dementia.
title: Bayesian Genome-wide TWAS method to leverage both cis- and trans- eQTL information through summary statistics

finding: This SNP was implicated as a synonymous QTL for BSG (basigin) expression. Its strong association with <italic>P. falciparum</italic> growth underscored its potential role in the efficacy of parasite invasion, given that basigin has previously been linked to <italic>P. falciparum</italic> invasion processes.
title: Malaria parasite fitness in healthy human red cells is driven by common host variation

finding: This SNP in TM6SF2 was associated with liver fat and previously linked to NAFLD in multiple studies.
title: Systematic quantification of health parameters from UK Biobank abdominal MRI

finding: This SNP in APOE was associated with liver fat, having been previously identified in studies related to fat accumulation.
title: Systematic quantification of health parameters from UK Biobank abdominal MRI

finding: This missense SNP in TM6SF2 was associated with hepatic conditions and hyperlipidemia, showing its impact on liver health.
title: Systematic quantification of health parameters from UK Biobank abdominal MRI

finding: Intronic to PEPD, this SNP was associated with pancreatic fat and various metabolic phenotypes.
title: Systematic quantification of health parameters from UK Biobank abdominal MRI

finding: This SNP near CEBPA showed association with major metabolic traits including triglycerides.
title: Systematic quantification of health parameters from UK Biobank abdominal MRI

finding: The SNP rs773902, located at 16,889,821 bp on chromosome 19, was found to be associated with platelet function. It explained 48% of the variability in PAR4 reactivity. Despite showing no correlation with PAR4 protein levels, it was implicated in platelet aggregation and reactivity via its influence on DNA methylation at the F2RL3 locus, indicating potential pleiotropic effects between methylation and PAR4 functionality.
title: Epigenetic regulation of PAR4-related platelet activation: mechanistic links between environmental exposure and cardiovascular disease

finding: This nonsense mutation (Trp154Ter) in FUT2 was pivotal in inferring the secretor and non-secretor phenotypes in the Lewis blood group, achieving a 96% concordance.
title: Characterization of Blood Group Variants in an Omani Population by Comparison of Whole Genome Sequencing and Serology

finding: The SNP rs28362459 (Leu20Arg) was part of the inference for the Lewis null phenotype, contributing to an increase in concordance when additional SNVs were included.
title: Characterization of Blood Group Variants in an Omani Population by Comparison of Whole Genome Sequencing and Serology

finding: The variant rs812936 (Arg68Trp) was utilized for Lewis blood group characterize and was implicated in concordance with other variants.
title: Characterization of Blood Group Variants in an Omani Population by Comparison of Whole Genome Sequencing and Serology

finding: The variant rs778986 (Met105Thr) played a role in inferring the Lewis null phenotype in combination with other variants, allowing for higher concordance.
title: Characterization of Blood Group Variants in an Omani Population by Comparison of Whole Genome Sequencing and Serology

finding: The additional SNV rs3894326 (Ile356Lys) found in some Omani individuals significantly improved concordance to 99% and is commonly used for genotyping FUT3.
title: Characterization of Blood Group Variants in an Omani Population by Comparison of Whole Genome Sequencing and Serology

finding: This unique SNP (Ala335Thr) identified may represent a new weak secretor allele affecting Lewis blood group typing.
title: Characterization of Blood Group Variants in an Omani Population by Comparison of Whole Genome Sequencing and Serology

finding: The variant rs1047781 (Ile140Phe) was noted for its role as a weak secretor allele affecting the Lewis blood group phenotype.
title: Characterization of Blood Group Variants in an Omani Population by Comparison of Whole Genome Sequencing and Serology

finding: The variant rs532253708 (Met99Leu) was also associated with the rare weak secretor allele in the Lewis blood group.
title: Characterization of Blood Group Variants in an Omani Population by Comparison of Whole Genome Sequencing and Serology

finding: The rs28399653 (Arg77His) variant indicated high concordance (99%) for Lutheran blood group antigen expression.
title: Characterization of Blood Group Variants in an Omani Population by Comparison of Whole Genome Sequencing and Serology

finding: The SNP rs112481437 was identified as being linked to the putative target gene APOE in the context of Alzheimer's disease (AD). It was found within an active enhancer of astrocytes and was connected to the transcription start site (TSS) of APOE through an astrocyte-specific chromatin loop.
title: SnapHiC: a computational pipeline to map chromatin contacts from single cell Hi-C data

finding: The SNP rs138137383 was identified as being associated with the gene APOE specifically in astrocytes, similarly linked to AD. Like rs112481437, it resided in an active enhancer and was involved in the chromatin loop connecting to the TSS of APOE.
title: SnapHiC: a computational pipeline to map chromatin contacts from single cell Hi-C data

finding: This SNP was also marked as a potential outlier for ER-negative breast cancer.
title: Coffee consumption and risk of breast cancer: a Mendelian Randomization study

finding: The SNP rs429358 was part of the APOE genotyping that distinguished between the epsilon 2, epsilon 3, and epsilon 4 alleles. This locus has been significantly associated with Alzheimer's disease (AD) risk due to its role in amyloid plaque formation and neurodegeneration.
title: Mitochondrial pathway polygenic risk scores are associated with Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The SNP rs7412 was also part of the APOE genotyping process, which is critical for differentiating the epsilon alleles. Similar to rs429358, it has been linked to increased risk of Alzheimer's disease through mechanisms related to cholesterol metabolism and synaptic functions.
title: Mitochondrial pathway polygenic risk scores are associated with Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The SNP rs769449 was associated with high cholesterol (p < 1e-100) and revealed a new association with hypertension after conditioning on high cholesterol (p = 1.43e-8). This indicated its role in a causal pathway where high cholesterol acts as a collider, demonstrating a potential new link between rs769449 and hypertension and suggesting its involvement in additional phenotypes such as erythrocyte distribution width.
title: Constraint-based analysis for causal discovery in population-based biobanks

finding: The SNP rs405509 was associated with Alzheimer's disease (AD) risk, particularly in carriers of the apolipoprotein E (APOE)-ε4 allele. Studies indicated that individuals with this SNP variant exhibited detectable brain differences compared to control subjects, suggesting its role in the early stages of AD pathology as well as its influence on cognitive decline.
title: Brain connectivity during Alzheimer’s disease progression and its cognitive impact in a transgenic rat model

finding: The common variant rs6511720 in the LDLR intron was associated with increased LDLR expression and a reduction in LDL-C, with a significant p-value indicating its potential as a functional variant.
title: Whole genome sequence analysis of blood lipid levels in >66,000 individuals

finding: The SNP rs9973235 was associated with a non-synonymous polymorphism in the protein Perilipin-3. It was identified through the MetaNovo analysis in a human neuroblastoma cell-line sample, corroborating findings from a previous proteogenomics study on the same cell-line. The peptide corresponding to this SNP shared 100.0% sequence identity with an orthologous protein in Macaca mulatta (Rhesus macaque), indicating that the identification was precise and relevant within the context of human protein variations.
title: MetaNovo: a probabilistic approach to peptide and polymorphism discovery in complex metaproteomic datasets

finding: This variant was recognized for overlapping GWAS variants associated with inflammatory responses and its effect on EID2 expression.
title: Shared and distinct molecular effects of regulatory genetic variants provide insight into mechanisms of distal enhancer-promoter communication

finding: The SNP rs9973235 was linked to a non-canonical peptide sequence identified in human neuroblastoma cell-line samples. This peptide was previously identified in a proteogenomics study related to the same cell-line and was determined to correspond to a non-synonymous polymorphism in the protein Perilipin-3. The identification showed 100% sequence identity with an orthologous protein from Macaca mulatta, indicating its relevance as a potential human variant.
title: MetaNovo: a probabilistic approach to peptide and polymorphism discovery in complex mass spectrometry datasets

finding: The variant rs373201614 was identified as a rare human polymorphism, which was under positive selection in humans, including Denisovans and Neanderthals. This specific SNP relates to an amino acid difference at position 588 of the ZNF528 zinc finger domain, where a Histidine in bonobos was replaced by a Glutamine in humans. This change was hypothesized to influence the interaction of ZNF528 with transposable elements (TEs), resulting in a less negative correlation with TEs compared to the bonobo counterpart.
title: Regulatory networks of KRAB zinc finger genes and transposable elements changed during human brain evolution and disease

finding: The SNP rs80336323 was identified as a stop loss variant in the gene PSPN (persephin neurothropic factor). This finding contributed to the understanding of gene regulation and expression across various human tissues, particularly highlighting its association with traits regulated by the neural mechanisms.
title: Modern human alleles differentially regulate gene expression in brain tissues: implications for brain evolution

finding: The SNP rs58542926 was reported to be associated with liver fat (p=9.6e-117, beta=0.333) in this study and has previously been linked to NAFLD.
title: Systematic quantification of health parameters from UK Biobank abdominal MRI using deep learning

finding: The SNP rs429358 showed a strong association with liver fat (p=1.1e-30, beta=-0.123), which is in line with previous literature linking it to various lipid traits.
title: Systematic quantification of health parameters from UK Biobank abdominal MRI using deep learning

finding: The SNP rs188247550 was found to be associated with liver fat (p=4.79e-26, beta=0.35) and has prior links to alcohol-induced cirrhosis and hyperlipidemia.
title: Systematic quantification of health parameters from UK Biobank abdominal MRI using deep learning

finding: The SNP rs10422861 was linked (p=1.80e-22, beta=0.087) to pancreatic fat, relevant to body fat percentage and insulin sensitivity.
title: Systematic quantification of health parameters from UK Biobank abdominal MRI using deep learning

finding: The SNP rs118005033 had evidence of secondary signals for pancreatic fat indicating multifactorial influences.
title: Systematic quantification of health parameters from UK Biobank abdominal MRI using deep learning

finding: The SNP rs1005731 was linked (p=5.9e-10, beta=0.06) specifically to pancreatic iron.
title: Systematic quantification of health parameters from UK Biobank abdominal MRI using deep learning

finding: The SNP rs153701 was associated (p=2.9e-11, beta=-0.04) with VAT volume, suggesting importance in fat distribution.
title: Systematic quantification of health parameters from UK Biobank abdominal MRI using deep learning

finding: The AA genotype of rs769449 was associated with increased ADAS13 scores and linked to Alzheimer's Disease (AD) and Late Mild Cognitive Impairment (LMCI). This SNP contributed more than expected variance to the first component, indicating a significant association with neurodegenerative processes.
title: A generalization of partial least squares regression and correspondence analysis for categorical and mixed data: An application with the ADNI data

finding: The GG genotype of rs2075650 was found to be more associated with AD and LMCI than other groups. It also contributed significantly to the first component in the analysis, indicating a potential role in the progression of Alzheimer's pathology.
title: A generalization of partial least squares regression and correspondence analysis for categorical and mixed data: An application with the ADNI data

finding: The TT genotype of rs405697 was more associated with the control (CN) group, suggesting potential protective effects against Alzheimer’s Disease, including lower ADAS13 scores.
title: A generalization of partial least squares regression and correspondence analysis for categorical and mixed data: An application with the ADNI data

finding: The TT genotype of rs439401 was noted to be more associated with the CN group compared to others, suggestive of a protective influence against cognitive decline.
title: A generalization of partial least squares regression and correspondence analysis for categorical and mixed data: An application with the ADNI data

finding: The GG genotype of rs4420638 was linked to increased AV45 uptake and higher ADAS13 scores, indicating an association with more severe Alzheimer-like symptoms.
title: A generalization of partial least squares regression and correspondence analysis for categorical and mixed data: An application with the ADNI data

finding: The AA genotype of rs157582 was correlated with increased AV45 uptake and higher ADAS13 scores, which highlighted its association with pathological changes seen in AD.
title: A generalization of partial least squares regression and correspondence analysis for categorical and mixed data: An application with the ADNI data

finding: The GG genotype of rs157580 was associated with decreased ADAS13 scores, suggesting a potential protective mechanism against cognitive impairment.
title: A generalization of partial least squares regression and correspondence analysis for categorical and mixed data: An application with the ADNI data

finding: The TC and TT genotypes of rs7412 were found to be more associated with control group traits, highlighting possible protective characteristics against Alzheimer's disease.
title: A generalization of partial least squares regression and correspondence analysis for categorical and mixed data: An application with the ADNI data

finding: The GG genotype of rs6859 was associated with lower ADAS13 scores, indicating potential protective effects in the context of Alzheimer's disease.
title: A generalization of partial least squares regression and correspondence analysis for categorical and mixed data: An application with the ADNI data

finding: Located between MAP1S and FCHO1, this variant was characterized as a macrophage caQTL with significant functional implications for CAD.
title: Cell-specific chromatin landscape of human coronary artery resolves regulatory mechanisms of disease risk

finding: The SNP rs1985157 was assigned to the LRRC25 gene through TWAS analysis as it demonstrated a strong correlation (r2 = 0.863) with predicted gene expression, while being associated with neutrophil count and percentage. This assignment was notable, especially since neither VEP nor coloc assigned it to a target gene, highlighting the effectiveness of TWAS in identifying relevant variants.
title: Transcriptome-wide association study in UK Biobank Europeans identifies associations with blood cell traits

finding: The rs121918393 variant (APOE3-R136S, Christchurch) demonstrated significant protective effects in models of Alzheimer's disease, specifically enhancing Disease-Associated Microglia (DAM) reactivity in 5xFAD mice by reducing plaque load and neurodegeneration. In contrast, it reduced the inflammatory microglial response in PS19 mice without affecting tau accumulation, potentially highlighting its multifaceted role in modulating responses to different types of Alzheimer's pathology.
title: APOE Christchurch enhances a disease-associated microglial response to plaque but suppresses response to tau pathology

finding: The variant rs3093105, which affects warfarin response, showed a frequency of approximately 40% in the Fulani and Hausa ethnolinguistic groups (ELGs). This frequency was comparatively higher than the approximately 30% frequency observed in the Yoruba ancestry group, indicating a potential increased risk for adverse drug reactions within these northern Nigerian ELGs.
title: Whole-genome sequencing across 449 samples spanning 47 ethnolinguistic groups provides insights into genetic diversity in Nigeria

finding: The variant rs2108622 was found to have elevated frequencies of 15-17% in the Fulani and Hausa ELGs, while it was closer to 5% in the Yoruba (YRI) group. This variant is also associated with warfarin metabolism, further suggesting a higher risk for adverse drug reactions in the Fulani and Hausa populations.
title: Whole-genome sequencing across 449 samples spanning 47 ethnolinguistic groups provides insights into genetic diversity in Nigeria

finding: The rs321909 SNP was implicated in affecting the gene ARID3A when adjusting for East Asian ancestry in the context of TB patients versus healthy controls.
title: cis-eQTL mapping of TB-T2D comorbidity elucidates the involvement of African ancestry in TB susceptibility

finding: This SNP affected ARID3A and was identified in assessing TB vs. healthy controls whilst accounting for East Asian ancestry.
title: cis-eQTL mapping of TB-T2D comorbidity elucidates the involvement of African ancestry in TB susceptibility

finding: SNP rs346066, of Khoe-San ancestry origin, was associated with the expression of LINC01002 and was identified while using LocalAA analysis.
title: cis-eQTL mapping of TB-T2D comorbidity elucidates the involvement of African ancestry in TB susceptibility

finding: This SNP affected the expression of ARID3A and was highlighted when comparing TB-T2D to T2D patients with adjustments for Khoe-San ancestry.
title: cis-eQTL mapping of TB-T2D comorbidity elucidates the involvement of African ancestry in TB susceptibility

finding: SNP rs2571075 was identified while comparing TB-T2D patients to T2D patients and affected ABCA7 with adjustments made for East Asian ancestry.
title: cis-eQTL mapping of TB-T2D comorbidity elucidates the involvement of African ancestry in TB susceptibility

finding: The variant rs429358 was identified as pathogenic and had a high allele frequency (AF) in both unadjusted and adjusted gnomAD African/African American samples. It was one of the two variants that define the APOE-ε4 allele, which is known to increase the risk of Alzheimer's Disease across various ancestries including European and African populations. The finding was expected given the variant's established role in Alzheimer's risk, though heterogeneity in effect size and allele frequency was noted across different ancestries.
title: Summix: A method for detecting and adjusting for population structure in genetic summary data

finding: The analysis revealed a very strong relationship between total gene expression and allele counts for the marker rs2972574 in the context of gene RPS28. Specifically, as the number of minor alleles increased, there was a modest relative increase in the usage of exon 3, while there was a consistent low relative usage of exon 1 across all genotype values and a corresponding decrease in the usage of exon 2. This finding provided significant insight into the allele-specific expression patterns linked to this genetic marker.
title: Marker-Trait Complete Analysis

finding: The SNP rs9973235 was associated with a non-synonymous polymorphism in the protein Perilipin-3. This finding was located within the context of a proteogenomics study conducted on the SH-SY5Y human neuroblastoma cell line, where it was identified as a non-canonical peptide sequence. Additionally, this peptide demonstrated 100.0% sequence identity with the orthologous protein from Macaca mulatta (Rhesus macaque), indicating potential evolutionary similarities. The peptide sequence corresponding to this SNP was also validated through identification in previous studies, increasing the reliability of the finding as a true human variant.
title: MetaNovo: a probabilistic approach to peptide and polymorphism discovery in complex mass spectrometry datasets

finding: The SNP rs12463023 led to a substitution of serine at residue 39 (S39) to proline (P39) in the CARD8 protein. This variation created a cleavage site for the 3C protease from select picornaviruses. The presence of P39 altered CARD8's ability to sense coronavirus 3CL proteases, resulting instead in a responsive interaction with 3C proteases. This finding indicated significant implications for CARD8’s role in inflammatory responses during viral infections.
title: Host specific sensing of coronaviruses and picornaviruses by the CARD8 inflammasome

finding: The SNP rs601338 in the FUT2 gene was found to be significantly associated with celiac disease and inflammatory bowel disease in the Finnish population, highlighting its relevance in the pathogenesis of these conditions, which may be linked to the fucosylation processes involving H antigen.
title: Normal development and fertility of Fut1, Fut2, and Sec1 triple knockout mice

finding: The SNP rs4030945 was linked to the expression of embryonic liver development genes in the context of hepatitis C induced cirrhosis and hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC). This association highlighted its role in liver pathology and suggested that variations at this locus could impact the development and progression of HCC, providing insights into poor prognostic outcomes.
title: Modelling liver cancer microenvironment: novel 3D culture system as a potential anti-cancer drug screening tool

finding: The variant rs3786897 was associated with the regulation of PEPD in adipose tissue, contributing to the discordant association of increased abdominal obesity while providing protective effects for type 2 diabetes.
title: Predicting mechanisms of action at genetic loci associated with discordant effects on type 2 diabetes and abdominal fat accumulation

finding: Represented as a trans pQTL, this SNP linked to TYK2 challenges indicated partial loss of function.
title: Genetic regulation of the human plasma proteome in 54,306 UK Biobank participants

finding: This variant defined secretor status and facilitated a long-range gene-by-gene interaction effect pertaining to ABO blood type and FUT2 locus olfactory processing.
title: Genetic regulation of the human plasma proteome in 54,306 UK Biobank participants

finding: The SNP rs429358 was found to be associated with the R2 dimension, which represents focal medial temporal lobe (MTL) atrophy, in patients with mild cognitive impairment (MCI) and Alzheimer's disease (AD). The study reported a minor allele frequency for C at this locus with a P-value of 1.05 × 10^-11. This association underlines its significance as a known genetic risk factor for AD and reflects its role in the brain atrophy patterns observed in affected individuals.
title: Genetic, clinical underpinnings of subtle early brain change along Alzheimer’s dimensions

finding: The A54T variant in the MARCH2 gene was identified as having a high minor allele frequency in European (0.2922) and American (0.272) populations. This SNP was shown to impart a gain-of-function on MARCH2, enhancing its capability to reduce the incorporation of HIV-1 envelope proteins in nascent virions and subsequently decreasing HIV-1 infectivity.
title: Determining the antiviral mechanism of MARCH2

finding: The R219P variant in the MARCH2 gene emerged with a significant minor allele frequency in South Asian populations (0.174). Similar to the A54T variant, R219P also conferred a gain-of-function effect, leading to decreased levels of HIV-1 envelope proteins in virions and resulting in reduced infectivity of HIV-1.
title: Determining the antiviral mechanism of MARCH2

finding: The tuberculosis risk variant rs34536443 was confirmed to exhibit negative selection due to its association with diseases and displayed similar selection intensity around 0.015 in a recent time frame.
title: Deep estimation of the intensity and timing of selection from ancient genomes

finding: The analysis identified that the SNP rs1490425955, corresponding to the human AP1M1 gene, was an orthologous variant ('OrthoVar') with the <italic>C. elegans</italic> UNC-101 gene, exhibiting the same amino acid substitution of p.P375S in humans and p.P362S in <italic>C. elegans</italic>. This finding indicated that the amino acid residue change at this specific position was conserved between the two species, suggesting its potential relevance in functional consequence assessments of human genetic variants.
title: ConVarT: a search tool for orthologous variants: A method and server for functional inference of human genetic variants

finding: The research indicated that the rs429358 SNP, part of the APOE locus, was significantly associated with protein levels of Apo E in plasma. The findings highlighted that after adjusting for both rs429358 and rs7412 SNPs that define the APOE haplotypes, associations with protein-traits failed to achieve Bonferroni significance. This suggested that the APOE haplotypes were primarily driving the protein-trait associations observed, thus emphasizing the importance of this locus in the context of various complex traits, notably Alzheimer's disease and cholesterol-related phenotypes.
title: Protein prediction for trait mapping in diverse populations

finding: Similar to rs429358, the rs7412 SNP was integral to the associations observed with lipid-related traits and protein abundance of Apo E. The study showed that when adjustments were made for the missense SNPs rs429358 and rs7412, the protein-trait associations generally did not achieve Bonferroni significance, reinforcing the conclusion that these SNPs define the APOE haplotypes that are influential in several complex traits, particularly in relation to Alzheimer's disease.
title: Protein prediction for trait mapping in diverse populations

finding: The SNP rs72973581 (MAF circa 0.6) was identified to be associated with a decreased risk for Alzheimer's disease (OR=0.57, 95% CI: 0.41-0.80). This genetic variant likely also influenced lipid-related pathways and might interact with other risk factors such as APOE, contributing to the pathogenesis of Alzheimer's disease.
title: A single-cell atlas of ABCA7 loss-of-function reveals lipid disruptions, mitochondrial dysfunction and DNA damage in neurons

finding: The SNP rs8736 in the MBOAT7 gene was previously reported to be associated with human blood metabolites and alcohol related cirrhosis of the liver.
title: MetaPhat: Detecting and decomposing multivariate associations from univariate genome-wide association statistics

finding: The missense variant rs7412 in the APOE gene was highlighted in the multivariate GWAS as being associated with lipidomics (P = 4.2e-13), showing that it was driven by traits CE14 and PCO23.
title: MetaPhat: Detecting and decomposing multivariate associations from univariate genome-wide association statistics

finding: The SNP rs1077667 was identified as a multiple sclerosis-associated variant. It exhibited increased chromatin accessibility and contact with the promoters of GPR108 and TRIP10 at 8 hours post T cell activation, correlating with increased gene expression.
title: Dynamic chromatin architecture identifies new autoimmune-associated enhancers for IL2 and novel genes regulating CD4+ T cell activation

finding: The SNP rs7412, known as the APOE ε2 allele, was identified by the BEATRICE framework as a high PIP variant (> 0.9) within the first clump that includes gene loci TOMM40, APOC1, and APOE. This SNP has been consistently associated with Alzheimer's disease as a notable risk factor, highlighting its importance in the genetic landscape of the disease.
title: BEATRICE: Bayesian Fine-mapping from Summary Data using Deep Variational Inference

finding: The SNP rs11670056 was identified within the enhancer region of the ELL gene in PDGF-treated CASMC. Similar to rs6031431, it was associated with cardiovascular traits as per the GWAS catalog. The presence of this SNP in the enhancer underlined its significance in the context of smooth muscle cell behavior and cardiovascular pathology.
title: Epigenetic Remodeling in Human Coronary Artery Smooth Muscle Cell Phenotypic Switching

finding: The SNP rs7412 contributed to the <italic>APOE</italic> genotype categorization, which revealed that <italic>APOE</italic> ε4 carriers experienced lower white matter integrity compared to ε3ε3 individuals. This finding suggests a potential link between rs7412, <italic>APOE</italic> genotype, and preclinical processes of Alzheimer's disease.
title: A comprehensive analysis of APOE genotype effects on human brain structure in the UK Biobank

finding: SNP rs8012 was identified as a significant metabolomic-QTL (met-QTL) for glutarylcarnitine levels, with a very low p-value (p=1.24×10^-43). This SNP was located 8kb from the GCDH gene, which encodes an enzyme involved in the metabolism of glutaryl-CoA, indicating that GCDH was a likely causal gene mediating the effects of rs8012 on glutarylcarnitine levels. In the GTEx analysis, rs8012 was found to be a cis-eQTL for GCDH across 31 tissues, and also influenced the expression of nearby genes such as HOOK2, SYCE2, FARSA, AD000092.3, and CALR. Importantly, the signals for cis-eQTL and met-QTL for rs8012 showed colocalization in at least one tissue, although the analysis acknowledged the complications arising from multiple nearby genes that could serve as plausible candidates.
title: A multi-tissue transcriptome analysis of human metabolites guides the interpretability of associations based on multi-SNP models for gene expression

finding: The polymorphism rs11666254 was significantly associated with sepsis in trauma patients. This finding indicated that reduced expression of FPR2 was correlated with elevated levels of TNF-α in peripheral blood leukocytes stimulated by LPS, suggesting an important role of this SNP in immune dysregulation and increased risk of sepsis.
title: Novel regulator Fpr2 controls immune homeostasis via CCL4-dependent neutrophils

finding: Indicated a causal relationship where increased plasma PVR levels were associated with a higher risk of Alzheimer's disease; the analysis provided significant results with a beta of 0.17.
title: Genetic and epigenetic architectures of neurological protein biomarkers in the Lothian Birth Cohort 1936

finding: The rs2278426 (R59W) variant in ANGPTL8 was associated with increased circulatory levels of TNFα and IL7 in both the discovery cohort of Arab individuals and an independent replication cohort. The association was significant in the context of inflammation, highlighting the variant's impact on inflammatory markers and its role in metabolic processes related to conditions such as obesity and type 2 diabetes.
title: ANGPTL8 R59W variant influences inflammation through modulating NF-κB pathway under TNFα stimulation

finding: The SNP rs117961479 was associated with total cholesterol levels in the HCHS/SoL cohort, revealing a genome-wide significant signal with a p-value of 1.5×10−9. This association was significant despite this SNP having a minor allele frequency (MAF) less than 0.01 in European populations, indicating relevance within the Hispanic population studied.
title: Genetically regulated gene expression underlies lipid traits in Hispanic cohorts

finding: The SNP rs641738, located in the MBOAT7-TMC4 gene, was reported to increase the risk of nonalcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD) in individuals of European descent. This finding was established in a study conducted by Mancina et al. in 2016, which highlighted the genetic predisposition to NAFLD associated with this particular variant.
title: Dual targeting of hepatocyte DGAT2 and stellate cell FASN alleviates nonalcoholic steatohepatitis in mice

finding: This missense variant was associated with decreased protein expression of SIGLEC9 in plasma. It was hypothesized that this may reflect an evolutionary response to pathogen burden. This variant was more common in African populations and not significantly noted in European ancestries.
title: A survey of proteomic variation across two ethnic groups in Nigeria and its relationship to obesity risk

finding: This variant was associated with CD33 protein expression in the dataset analyzed, although it did not show significant marginal p-values in the ARiC dataset. Its strong association in this new dataset provides insight into immune response regulation.
title: A survey of proteomic variation across two ethnic groups in Nigeria and its relationship to obesity risk

finding: The SNP rs10424191 on chromosome 19, found within the gene ZNF536, was associated with the postcentral gyrus and regional grey matter volume.
title: Genetic signatures of human brain structure: A comparison between GWAS and relatedness-based regression

finding: This SNP was connected to various metabolic factors and showed associations in the context of lipid metabolism.
title: The impact of evolutionary processes in shaping the genetics of complex traits in East Asia and Europe: a specific contribution from Denisovan and Neanderthal introgression

finding: This SNP, in high LD with a GWAS peak for multiple sclerosis, displayed significant ASM, supporting its role in disease susceptibility.
title: Allele-specific DNA methylation is increased in cancers and its dense mapping in normal plus neoplastic cells increases the yield of disease-associated regulatory SNPs

finding: The missense variant rs3752246 was associated with the metabolite lactosyl-N-nervonoyl-sphingosine (d18:1/24:1), with a very strong significance (P = 8.5 × 10^-26). This variant was also noted for its connection to late-onset Alzheimer’s disease, suggesting a shared genetic architecture.
title: Genome-microbiome interplay provides insight into the determinants of the human blood metabolome

finding: Variant rs12979724, located near CNN2, was associated with lactosylceramide lactosyl-N-nervonoyl-sphingosine (d18:1/24:1) (P = 8.5 × 10^-12). This association indicated a potential link between this metabolic trait and Alzheimer's disease.
title: Genome-microbiome interplay provides insight into the determinants of the human blood metabolome

finding: The SNP rs12459419, associated with the common CD33 allele (C) leading to the production of the long isoform CD33M, was reported to increase susceptibility to Alzheimer's disease relative to the minor T allele. This association implicates rs12459419 as a significant genetic factor in modulating microglial response in the context of AD.
title: Alzheimer’s disease associated isoforms of human CD33 distinctively modulate microglial cell responses in 5XFAD mice

finding: The SNP rs429358 was determined to be one of the defining SNPs for the APOE ε4/ε2 haplotypes. It was associated with differential methylation patterns, specifically with increased methylation at positions within the APOE locus in ε4 carriers.
title: Identification of epigenome-wide DNA methylation differences between carriers of APOE ε4 and APOE ε2

finding: The SNP rs7412 was identified as one of the defining SNPs for the APOE ε2/ε3/ε4 haplotypes. It was linked to a significant meQTL with 23 CpGs associated, and it was shown to influence methylation levels in the APOE locus as well as neighboring genes.
title: Identification of epigenome-wide DNA methylation differences between carriers of APOE ε4 and APOE ε2

finding: The SNP rs41290120 was found to be an intronic SNP within PVRL2, which was in high linkage disequilibrium with rs7412. It was reported as part of the meQTL analyses showing significant associations with methylation in multiple CpGs, highlighting its role in the methylation landscape in relation to the APOE locus.
title: Identification of epigenome-wide DNA methylation differences between carriers of APOE ε4 and APOE ε2

finding: The SNP rs7412 was found to be significantly associated with Lp(a) concentration with a beta value of 0.15 and a p-value of 0.008, confirming prior findings from a large GWAS. The association with Lp(a) serum levels validated previous research regarding its role in lipid metabolism.
title: Cohort profile: The LipidCardio Study - Role of Lipoproteins in Cardiovascular Disease

finding: The SNP rs6510896 was found to encompass the long noncoding RNA CTB-180A7. This lncRNA exhibited enhancer-like activity for the gene ALKBH7, which was indicated to play a role in neurodevelopment and was associated with ASD. Furthermore, deletion in the region of lncRNA CTB-180A7 was significantly observed in ASD cases compared to controls.
title: Evidence for enhancer noncoding RNAs (enhancer-ncRNAs) with gene regulatory functions relevant to neurodevelopmental disorders

finding: The study found that the 'AA' and 'AG' genotypes of rs769449 were associated with Alzheimer's Disease (AD) and Late Mild Cognitive Impairment (LMCI) compared to other groups.
title: A generalization of partial least squares regression and correspondence analysis for categorical and mixed data: An application with the ADNI data

finding: The 'GG' genotype of rs2075650 was identified as more associated with Alzheimer's Disease (AD) and Late Mild Cognitive Impairment (LMCI) rather than with control groups.
title: A generalization of partial least squares regression and correspondence analysis for categorical and mixed data: An application with the ADNI data

finding: The 'TT' genotype of rs405697 was more associated with the control (CN) group, suggesting potential protective effects against Alzheimer's disease.
title: A generalization of partial least squares regression and correspondence analysis for categorical and mixed data: An application with the ADNI data

finding: The 'TT' genotype of rs439401 was noted for being associated with the control group, implying potential protective aspects against Alzheimer's Disease.
title: A generalization of partial least squares regression and correspondence analysis for categorical and mixed data: An application with the ADNI data

finding: The findings highlighted that the 'GG' genotype of rs4420638 was linked with increased ADAS13 scores, suggesting an association with poorer cognitive outcomes.
title: A generalization of partial least squares regression and correspondence analysis for categorical and mixed data: An application with the ADNI data

finding: The 'AA' genotype of rs157582 exhibited increased scores on ADAS13, indicating a connection to Alzheimer's Disease.
title: A generalization of partial least squares regression and correspondence analysis for categorical and mixed data: An application with the ADNI data

finding: The 'GG' genotype of rs157580 was indicated to have associations with protective effects in control groups.
title: A generalization of partial least squares regression and correspondence analysis for categorical and mixed data: An application with the ADNI data

finding: The TC and TT genotypes of rs7412 were recognized for being associated with control groups, indicating potential protective effects.
title: A generalization of partial least squares regression and correspondence analysis for categorical and mixed data: An application with the ADNI data

finding: The 'GG' genotype of rs6859 was documented as being more associated with protective effects in control groups.
title: A generalization of partial least squares regression and correspondence analysis for categorical and mixed data: An application with the ADNI data

finding: SNP rs429358 was identified as a crucial genetic marker associated with the APOE-ε4 variant, which has been linked to an increased risk of late-onset Alzheimer's disease. The analysis demonstrated that this SNP could yield genotype information even after just two uploads of strategically designed datasets, revealing whether an individual carried the APOE-ε4 variant.
title: Attacks on genetic privacy via uploads to genealogical databases

finding: SNP rs7412 was discussed in connection to rs429358 in determining the presence of the APOE-ε4 allele. It is noted that if a haplotype contains a C at both rs429358 and rs7412, it indicates harboring the APOE-ε4 allele, increasing the associated risk for Alzheimer's disease.
title: Attacks on genetic privacy via uploads to genealogical databases

finding: The SNP rs4804833 on human chromosome 19 was associated with the gene MAP2K7, confirmed by synteny analysis, emphasizing its role in traits related to adiposity as indicated in earlier GWAS reports.
title: Genome-wide analysis of promoter contacts identifies novel regulators of late-stage adipogenesis

finding: In the LDL analysis, BANNs replicated the association of rs10402271 found in the intergenic region between the BCAM and PVRL2 genes, confirming its relevance.
title: Multi-scale Inference of Genetic Trait Architecture using Biologically Annotated Neural Networks

finding: The SNP rs372349612 was noted as being exceptionally rare, occurring in less than 0.001% of samples, and was associated with a change from phenylalanine (F) to leucine (L) at position 783 in the RFX1 protein. This SNP overlaps a critical region involved in PP1c binding, which is significant because a peptide display screen demonstrated that the leucine residue could be tolerated at this position, indicating that this interaction may be crucial for the regulatory functions that RFX1 performs. This finding highlights the importance of the PP1c interaction in the functionality of RFX1, suggesting that alterations due to this SNP might impact the transcriptional regulation mechanisms of RFX1.
title: Recruitment of the protein phosphatase-1 catalytic subunit to promoters by the dual-function transcription factor RFX1

finding: The variant rs4806787 was identified as a SARS-CoV-2-specific reQTL influencing the immune mediator LILRB1 in plasmacytoid dendritic cells.
title: Environmental and genetic drivers of population differences in SARS-CoV-2 immune responses

finding: This SNP demonstrated chromatin contacts with NECTIN2, relating to immune responses in the context of AD risk.
title: A Semi-Supervised Ensemble Approach to Rank Potential Causal Variants and Their Target Genes in Microglia for Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: This variant also showed significant contacts with NECTIN2, indicating its potential role in immune-related mechanisms of AD.
title: A Semi-Supervised Ensemble Approach to Rank Potential Causal Variants and Their Target Genes in Microglia for Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: It had chromatin contacts with NECTIN2, further supporting the relevance of this gene to AD pathology.
title: A Semi-Supervised Ensemble Approach to Rank Potential Causal Variants and Their Target Genes in Microglia for Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: This SNP showed contacts with NECTIN2, emphasizing its involvement in immune-related pathways associated with AD.
title: A Semi-Supervised Ensemble Approach to Rank Potential Causal Variants and Their Target Genes in Microglia for Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: It demonstrated association with NECTIN2, reinforcing the role of immune responses in AD development.
title: A Semi-Supervised Ensemble Approach to Rank Potential Causal Variants and Their Target Genes in Microglia for Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The SNP rs2739412 was identified as a pb-sQTL for the KLK5 gene in skin, exhibiting different effects on isoform abundance between European American (EA) and African American (AA) individuals. In EA individuals, the C allele correlated with increased KLK5-203 abundance and decreased KLK5-201 and KLK5-202 abundances. The finding highlighted the importance of considering ancestry in splicing QTL analyses.
title: A fast non-parametric test of association for multiple traits

finding: An association was established between rs1800437 in GIPR and fresh fruit intake (p=4.2×10⁻⁹, β=0.017, 95% CI: 0.011-0.023), linking this variant to dietary behavior.
title: Medical relevance of common protein-altering variants in GPCR genes across 337,205 individuals in the UK Biobank study

finding: The SNP rs1339188502, a missense A to G mutation located near the CD33 gene, was associated with the highest predicted variant effect in a CAR-T cell therapy study. It was found to decrease the predicted 1 bp insertion probability by 45.8%, and alter the frequencies of 1 bp and 2 bp frameshifts by decreasing them by 30.2% and increasing them by 22.5%, respectively.
title: Widespread impact of natural genetic variations in CRISPR/Cas9 outcomes

finding: The study found that the rs7412 SNP, which is part of the APOE gene, indicated significant differences in brain structural asymmetry linked to aging. Specifically, homozygous APOE2 carriers (associated with this SNP) exhibited protective effects against age-related neurodegenerative changes compared to homozygous APOE4 carriers, which are linked to increased risk of Alzheimer's disease (AD). This finding contributed to understanding the genotype's influence on typical brain aging trajectories.
title: Global brain asymmetry and its variations in aging and related diseases

finding: The rs429358 SNP, also part of the APOE gene, was identified as a major genetic risk factor for Alzheimer's disease. The study highlighted significant differences in brain structure based on the presence of this SNP, particularly in homozygous APOE4 carriers, who were shown to experience greater structural asymmetry and more pronounced aging-related changes in brain function compared to those with APOE2 genotypes. This finding further solidified the link between genetic risk factors and age-related brain disorders.
title: Global brain asymmetry and its variations in aging and related diseases

finding: The SNP rs7412 was associated with genetic risk for Alzheimer's disease (AD) in the study. Specifically, the analysis revealed that the presence of this SNP, as part of the APOE gene, influenced brain aging trajectories in women who were carriers, suggesting a link between this genetic factor and vulnerability to AD.
title: Women’s brain aging: effects of sex-hormone exposure, pregnancies, and genetic risk for Alzheimer’s disease

finding: Similar to rs7412, the SNP rs429358 was implicated in the genetic risk for Alzheimer's disease.
