Findings indicated that both the rs429358 and rs7412 SNPs contributed to defining APOE e4 status, which was related to notable effects on brain aging in women, underscoring the role of these SNPs in shaping genetic predisposition to Alzheimer's.
title: Women’s brain aging: effects of sex-hormone exposure, pregnancies, and genetic risk for Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The SNP rs8110787, located at chr19:12,999,458 (hg19), was linked to the gene CALR, associated with various red blood cell traits such as hematocrit (HCT), mean corpuscular hemoglobin (MCH), mean corpuscular volume (MCV), and red blood cell counts (RBC). This link was confirmed through a CRISPRi-FlowFISH experiment, with a significant regulatory relationship established with CALR (adjusted p-value of 1.9E-7). Furthermore, rs8110787 was characterized as an eQTL influencing CALR expression, with strong statistical significance in multiple datasets.
title: From GWAS Variant to Function: a Study of ~148,000 Variants for Blood Cell Traits

finding: The SNP rs429358, related to the APOE gene, was identified as a significant AD-risk locus through both pcMTSCCA and hocMTSCCA methods, highlighting its relevance in Alzheimer's disease risk.
title: inMTSCCA: An Integrated Multi-task Sparse Canonical Correlation Analysis for Multi-omics Brain Imaging Genetics

finding: The SNP rs56131196, associated with APOC1, was found to be a relevant AD-risk locus using the pcMTSCCA and hocMTSCCA methods, indicating its importance in Alzheimer's disease.
title: inMTSCCA: An Integrated Multi-task Sparse Canonical Correlation Analysis for Multi-omics Brain Imaging Genetics

finding: The SNP rs4420638, also linked to APOC1, was classified as a significant AD-risk locus by both analysis methods, underlining its role in increasing Alzheimer's disease risk.
title: inMTSCCA: An Integrated Multi-task Sparse Canonical Correlation Analysis for Multi-omics Brain Imaging Genetics

finding: The SNP rs7412 in the APOE gene was recognized as a critical AD-risk locus by pcMTSCCA and hocMTSCCA, further asserting its influence in the development of Alzheimer's disease.
title: inMTSCCA: An Integrated Multi-task Sparse Canonical Correlation Analysis for Multi-omics Brain Imaging Genetics

finding: The SNP rs440446, connected to the APOE gene, was identified as an important AD-risk locus through the recent analysis methods, reinforcing its contribution to Alzheimer's disease susceptibility.
title: inMTSCCA: An Integrated Multi-task Sparse Canonical Correlation Analysis for Multi-omics Brain Imaging Genetics

finding: SNP associated with hyperlipidemia and diabetes mellitus, reflecting complications linked to OSA.
title: Characterization of Genetic and Phenotypic Heterogeneity of Obstructive Sleep Apnea Using Electronic Health Records

finding: The SNP rs58542926 was associated with the progression of hepatic fibrosis in patients with non-alcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD). This finding indicated that variations in the TM6SF2 gene influenced the severity of liver damage, suggesting a genetic predisposition to metabolic dysfunction and related liver diseases.
title: Mitochondrial topoisomerase I (Top1MT) prevents the onset of metabolic dysfunction-associated steatohepatitis (MASH) in mice

finding: The rs429358 SNP was edited to create APOE34 and APOE44 isogenic lines from APOE33 human embryonic stem cells. This editing resulted in a thymine to cytosine change and a corresponding Cys112Arg substitution in the APOE protein, indicating its crucial role in differentiating the APOE genotypes associated with Alzheimer's disease risk.
title: Upregulated NF-κB pathway proteins may underlie APOE44 associated astrocyte phenotypes in sporadic Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The SNP rs41290120 was identified within a significant association region for sdLDL-c, associated with a region-based p-value of 1.31 x 10^-9 and genome-wise p-value of 0.0445, as detected using the SCANG method in the ARIC study. This SNP was highlighted as a pQTL of apolipoprotein E and was shown to have a p-value less than 1 x 10^-6.
title: Dynamic Scan Procedure for Detecting Rare-Variant Association Regions in Whole Genome Sequencing Studies

finding: The SNP rs283808 was also found within the significant association region for sdLDL-c detected by SCANG, which covered a range from 45,382,398 to 45,387,034 bp on chromosome 19. Although it contributed to the significant findings, its individual p-value was reported as 5.71 x 10^-7, indicating a strong association with lipid traits.
title: Dynamic Scan Procedure for Detecting Rare-Variant Association Regions in Whole Genome Sequencing Studies

finding: The missense variant rs149307620 in NOTCH3 showed association with LOAD, as 10 cases carried this variant while no controls did, suggesting a possible risk factor for Alzheimer's disease.
title: Weighted burden analysis of exome-sequenced late onset Alzheimer’s cases and controls provides further evidence for a role for PSEN1 and suggests involvement of the PI3K/Akt/GSK-3β and WNT signalling pathways

finding: The SNP rs7258891 served as an age imeQTL for the CpG site cg06953865, with strong evidence for mediation indicating that age influenced its effect through changes in cell type composition differences, specifically neutrophil percentage. This SNP has been associated with various phenotypes related to cell counts, reflecting its role in age-related molecular dynamics.
title: Interaction molecular QTL mapping discovers cellular and environmental modifiers of genetic regulatory effects

finding: SNP rs113631324 was associated with promoter POU2F2 linked to gene PHGDH, exhibiting a low p-value of 3.80e-8, indicating its role in promoting mechanisms linked to prostate cancer progression.
title: The PENGUIN approach to reconstruct protein interactions at enhancer-promoter regions and its application to prostate cancer

finding: The rs4420638 polymorphism on APOC1 was found to increase the accumulation of homocysteine, affecting Alzheimer's disease (AD) risk. This SNP is linked to the pathology of AD through its role in cholesterol metabolism.
title: A Penalized Linear Mixed Model with Generalized Method of Moments for Complex Phenotype Prediction

finding: The rs2075650 polymorphism on TOMM40 was reported to be highly associated with late-onset Alzheimer's disease. Studies indicated that this SNP can influence oxidative damage, thereby affecting the onset and progression of AD.
title: A Penalized Linear Mixed Model with Generalized Method of Moments for Complex Phenotype Prediction

finding: This SNP was confirmed to be associated with gastric cancer risk in a different context and therefore validated as significant.
title: Ability of known colorectal cancer susceptibility SNPs to predict colorectal cancer risk: A cohort study within the UK Biobank

finding: Findings indicated that rs2304130, located in the second intron of the ZNF101 gene, was associated with reduced levels of plasma cholesterol, LDL-C, apoB, and triglycerides, suggesting contributions of the ZNF101 locus to plasma lipid regulation.
title: MicroRNA-541-3p alters lipoproteins to reduce atherosclerosis by degrading Znf101 and Casz1 transcription factors

finding: The rs2304256 polymorphism in the TYK2 gene was associated with protection against type 1 diabetes (T1D). This finding indicated a potential genetic basis for resilience to the autoimmune responses involved in T1D.
title: Pharmacological inhibition of tyrosine protein-kinase 2 reduces islet inflammation and delays type 1 diabetes onset in mice

finding: The C-allele at rs117558072 was found to significantly reduce muscle CERS1 expression, which was linked to impaired overall health and grip strength according to Mendelian randomization analysis in the UK biobank cohort.
title: Inhibition of CERS1 in skeletal muscle exacerbates age-related muscle dysfunction

finding: The G-allele at rs1122821 was identified as a variant that decreases muscle CERS1 expression, contributing to reduced overall health and grip strength as demonstrated through Mendelian randomization analysis.
title: Inhibition of CERS1 in skeletal muscle exacerbates age-related muscle dysfunction

finding: The T-allele at rs71332140 increased muscle CERS1 expression, and the analysis supported a linear relationship between this eQTL and improvements in overall health and grip strength.
title: Inhibition of CERS1 in skeletal muscle exacerbates age-related muscle dysfunction

finding: Showed reduced PPP5C expression and was connected to IBD protection, suggesting a regulatory role in T cell function.
title: Linking candidate causal autoimmune variants to T cell networks using genetic and epigenetic screens in primary human T cells

finding: This variant exhibited allelic skew and affected PPP5C expression, also linked to IBD protection in T cells.
title: Linking candidate causal autoimmune variants to T cell networks using genetic and epigenetic screens in primary human T cells

finding: The study analyzed an informative SNP rs2014377 in exon 3 of SIX5, demonstrating that in undifferentiated hESCs, there was a significant allele imbalance favoring the normal allele before gene editing. After excision of the CTG repeat, this imbalance reversed, showing a difference of 1.2 to 1.3 favoring the alleles from which the CTG expansion was removed. This indicated that demethylation improved SIX5 expression, linking methylation changes with the reduction in SIX5 transcription related to DM1 pathology.
title: Deletion of the CTG Expansion in Myotonic Dystrophy Type 1 Reverses DMPK Aberrant Methylation in Human Embryonic Stem Cells but not Affected Myoblasts

finding: The SNP rs635299 was utilized to perform allele-specific methylation analysis in affected myoblasts. Despite the deletion of the CTG2600 repeat, methylation levels remained at 100% for the expanded alleles in treated clones, indicating that once heterochromatin was induced by large repeat expansions, normal epigenetic resetting could not occur, contrasting with observations in undifferentiated hESCs.
title: Deletion of the CTG Expansion in Myotonic Dystrophy Type 1 Reverses DMPK Aberrant Methylation in Human Embryonic Stem Cells but not Affected Myoblasts

finding: The variant rs10415777 was associated with enhancer-promoter contacts for the genes TFPT and OSCAR, demonstrating a shared genetic control of these two genes with a significant positive correlation between their expression levels (Pearson’s correlation r = 0.54, p value = 0.001).
title: Shared and distinct molecular effects of regulatory genetic variants provide insight into mechanisms of distal enhancer-promoter communication

finding: The variant rs35154518 was linked to the expression levels of OSCAR, and was found in tight linkage disequilibrium with rs10415777, which was associated with enhancer-promoter contacts of TFPT.
title: Shared and distinct molecular effects of regulatory genetic variants provide insight into mechanisms of distal enhancer-promoter communication

finding: Associated with the EID2 gene and overlapping with GWAS variants, rs1865092 exhibited relevance in immune response traits and inflammation.
title: Shared and distinct molecular effects of regulatory genetic variants provide insight into mechanisms of distal enhancer-promoter communication

finding: The SNP rs138137383 was found to be located within the enhancer EH2, which is situated in an Astro-specific sub-TLD boundary. The enhancer is associated with Alzheimer's disease (AD) through its interaction with the APOE promoter. It was noted that the loop linking EH2 to the APOE promoter is specific to Astro cells, which are known to have a relation to AD. The findings suggested that the hierarchical structure of TADs, particularly the relationship involving this SNP, could play a significant role in the regulation of cellular functions related to AD.
title: DeDoc2 identifies and characterizes the hierarchy and dynamics of chromatin TAD-like domains in the single cells

finding: The SNP rs4804833 near the gene MAP2K7 was engaged in a cluster of distal interactions, further supporting previous genomic association studies regarding its role in obesity.
title: Genome-wide analysis of promoter contacts identifies novel regulators of late-stage adipogenesis

finding: The SNP rs58542926, located in the TM6SF2 gene, was previously associated with hepatic fibrosis progression in patients with non-alcoholic fatty liver disease.
title: G-quadruplex formation in GCK and TM6SF2 are targets for differential DNA methylation in metabolic dysfunction-associated fatty liver disease and type II diabetes mellitus patients

finding: The rs641738C>T allele variant of MBOAT7 was associated with an increased risk of fibrosis in various liver diseases. It was shown that a loss of MBOAT7 function contributed to liver fibrosis, highlighting the significance of this SNP in hepatic pathophysiology. The study indicated that MBOAT7 had the highest expression in hepatic stellate cells (hHSCs), which are critical in fibrogenesis, suggesting a potential mechanistic role for this SNP in the development of liver fibrosis.
title: Dynamic human liver proteome atlas reveals functional insights into disease pathways

finding: The e4 allele (encoded by rs429358) was associated with various clinical measures of cholesterol and related inflammation markers. Specifically, it positively correlated with levels of PLA2G7 and CD28 proteins, consistent with their roles in cardiovascular risk and inflammation, and showed associations with diacylglycerol metabolites in blood.
title: Manifestations of genetic risk for Alzheimer’s Disease in the blood: a cross-sectional multi-omic analysis in healthy adults aged 18-90+

finding: Carriers of the AD-risk allele of rs3752246 exhibited lower levels of lactosylceramide metabolites and higher levels of DEFA1, linking this SNP within ABCA7 to lipid regulation and an inflammatory response related to AD.
title: Manifestations of genetic risk for Alzheimer’s Disease in the blood: a cross-sectional multi-omic analysis in healthy adults aged 18-90+

finding: The SNP rs12979860 in the IFNL4 gene was significantly associated with treatment response in chronic HCV patients receiving sofosbuvir. Male gender and non-CC genotype of this SNP were linked with increased rates of treatment failure. The p-value for the non-CC genotype's association with treatment failure reached 6.4×10^-3, indicating a substantial impact on SVR rates, particularly among patients who were non-cirrhotic.
title: Viral genome wide association study identifies novel hepatitis C virus polymorphisms associated with sofosbuvir treatment failure

finding: The SNP rs429358 was associated with the APOE gene, which determines the presence of ε3 and ε4 alleles. This SNP was linked to Alzheimer's disease risk factors, with the ε4 allele being particularly disruptive to neuronal lipid uptake mechanisms.
title: Interaction of sortilin with apolipoprotein E3 enables neurons to use long-chain fatty acids as alternative metabolic fuel

finding: The SNP rs429358 was identified as having a significant association with human ageing traits, specifically linked to self-rated health and resilience, with a statistical significance of P = 2×10^-40. It was located nearest to the gene APOE, which has been previously validated for its impact on similar traits in an external cohort.
title: Genetically independent phenotype analysis identifies LPA and VCAM1 as drug targets for human ageing

finding: The RNA editing QTL rs769450, located in the APOE gene, exhibited significant negative associations with two RNA editing events in TOMM40. The analysis revealed that these editing events had abnormally higher frequencies in Alzheimer's disease (AD) cases compared to controls. This down-regulation was interpreted as an alleviation role in neurodegeneration and supported by linkage disequilibrium relationships between APOE and TOMM40.
title: Genetic control of RNA editing in Neurodegenerative disease

finding: The rs12608932 SNP within the UNC13A gene was identified as a validated genetic modifier of ALS survival. In a study involving 5,498 patients, predictions of survival were generated using an optimum ensemble model. Subsequently, the impact of the rs12608932(C) allele on these predicted survival outcomes was analyzed using Cox regression, resulting in a significant negative effect (coef=+0.05, p=0.02). This finding indicated that predictions from the model could enhance the discovery of molecular mechanisms related to ALS survival, especially in cases where actual survival data was absent.
title: predicTTE: An accessible and optimal tool for time-to-event prediction in neurological diseases

finding: The rs58542926 variant, which causes a non-synonymous E167K mutation in the TM6SF2 gene, was associated with higher hepatic lipid content. It was identified as a strong genetic risk factor for nonalcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD), fibrosis, and cirrhosis. The research highlighted that individuals with this variant demonstrated increased hepatic lipid accumulation, aligning with observed mechanisms in overexpression and knockdown studies involving TM6SF2.
title: Perturbation of transmembrane 6 superfamily member 2 expression alters lipid metabolism in a human liver cell line

finding: This SNP served as a Tier 2 AFR_high anc-eQTL for the TRAPPC6A gene, confirmed by fine-mapping to be significant in the AFR_high group (PP>0.80) while having a posterior probability of zero in the AFR_low group.
title: Gene expression in African Americans and Latinos reveals ancestry-specific patterns of genetic architecture

finding: Detected as an eQTL for TRAPPC6A in the AFR_low group, rs7247764 was identified in the analysis showing non-overlapping credible sets with rs12460041 in different ancestry populations.
title: Gene expression in African Americans and Latinos reveals ancestry-specific patterns of genetic architecture

finding: The SNP rs429358 was identified as a crucial genetic risk factor for late-onset Alzheimer's disease (AD). It is a defining SNP of the APOE epsilon4 variant, which is known to considerably increase the risk of late-onset AD. The C/C allele arrangement was correlated negatively, mapping to a z-score that aligned with the association of this variant to higher age and increased risk of AD.
title: Frisky CALF sometimes outruns LASSO

finding: The rs601338 SNP in the FUT2 gene was associated with secretor status, which is relevant for understanding gut microbiota composition in infants. This association was analyzed in relation to maternal consumption of artificially sweetened beverages (ASB) during pregnancy and its subsequent effect on the infant gut microbial community and body mass index (BMI) at one year of age. The finding indicated that secretor status could influence the way infant gut bacteria responded to maternal dietary choices.
title: Consumption of artificially sweetened beverages during pregnancy impacts infant gut microbiota and body mass index

finding: The rs2288904-A SNP in SLC44A2, found in 22% of the population, caused an R154Q substitution that significantly impaired neutrophil and activated alpha IIb beta 3 integrin binding. This SNP was protective against venous thrombosis (VTE), evidenced by lower frequencies of the homozygous protective allele (A/A) compared to healthy controls. Neutrophils homozygous for the protective allele exhibited around 75% reduced binding to VWF-primed platelets, supporting its role in mitigating VTE risk.
title: Activated αIIbβ3 on platelets mediates flow-dependent NETosis via SLC44A2

finding: The SNP rs1054972, located at chr19:1,852,582, was implicated in the KLF16 gene within an exon, which affects DNA-binding transcription factor activity and neurite outgrowth. While its effect size suggested an impact on schizophrenia, it had not reached significance in previous analyses. The analysis implied that it may contribute to the pathomechanism of schizophrenia.
title: Identifying loci with different allele frequencies among cases of eight psychiatric disorders using CC-GWAS

finding: Related to coding changes in RASAL3, implicating it in lymphocyte count variation.
title: Variant-to-function dissection of rare non-coding GWAS loci with high impact on blood traits

finding: This variant was associated with regulation of RASAL3, reflecting its importance in immune traits.
title: Variant-to-function dissection of rare non-coding GWAS loci with high impact on blood traits

finding: Exhibited ATU events in RASAL3, indicating regulatory changes influencing immune cell types.
title: Variant-to-function dissection of rare non-coding GWAS loci with high impact on blood traits

finding: The study demonstrated that for rs142572000, the TOPMed imputation resulted in high certainty in imputed genotypes, with dosages closer to 0, 1, or 2. However, this high imputed genotype certainty led to an overestimation of the Rsq, indicating potential inaccuracies in the imputation despite a high value of Rsq. The findings were contextualized as part of the analysis to highlight the relationship between imputed genotype certainty and the accuracy of genetic association studies.
title: Genotype imputation accuracy and the quality metrics of the minor ancestry in multi-ancestry reference panels

finding: The SNP rs10410162 was used to illustrate that as the template switching rate (θ) decreased, there was a corresponding increase in Rsq and MARE, indicating higher imputed allele certainty. This illustrated the sensitivity of Rsq to changes in the θ value and indicated that lower θ values could lead to overconfident estimations in imputed dosages, while dosage r2 remained relatively insensitive to these changes. This highlighted significant implications for genotype imputation quality.
title: Genotype imputation accuracy and the quality metrics of the minor ancestry in multi-ancestry reference panels

finding: Located at 19q13.32, rs429358 was significantly associated with amplitude traits, making it one of the genetic variants influencing intrinsic brain activity and related disorders.
title: Common variants contribute to intrinsic functional architecture of human brain

finding: Identified as a Finnish enriched variant with suggested causal association to benign neoplasms of meninges, indicated by an odds ratio of 6.4 and a p-value of 4.9×10^-5.
title: An expanded analysis framework for multivariate GWAS connects inflammatory biomarkers to functional variants and disease

finding: The SNP rs2228367 was identified as a replicated GWAS hit for three platelet-related phenotypes: mean platelet volume (MPV), platelet count (PLT), and platelet distribution width (PDW). It was additionally recognized as an expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL) in whole blood across multiple studies. This particular SNP was associated with tropomyosin 4, an actin-binding protein known to have significant roles in platelet diseases.
title: Sparse matrix factorization of GWAS summary statistics robust to sample sharing improves detection and interpretation of factors with diverse genetic architectures

finding: The SNP rs10524523 was associated with a T STR linked to CAGE signals in several FANTOM libraries. This variant was found to influence the age of onset of cognitive decline, Alzheimer’s disease, and sporadic inclusion body myositis. Furthermore, TOMM40 mRNA brain expression correlated with the length of the T STR; longer variants led to higher expression levels.
title: Evidence of transcription at polyT short tandem repeats

finding: The missense variant rs149307620 in NOTCH3 was found in 10 cases and no controls, suggestive of an association with late onset Alzheimer's disease.
title: Weighted burden analysis of exome-sequenced late onset Alzheimer’s cases and controls provides further evidence for a role for PSEN1 and suggests involvement of the PI3K/Akt/GSK-3β and WNT signalling pathways

finding: The SNP rs429358, located within the APOE gene, was a significant finding associated with cognitive traits, particularly in the context of the general factor of intelligence (g). It displayed a close association with multiple cognitive traits, aligning with the degree to which those traits represented genetic g, except for verbal-numerical reasoning (VNR), where it showed a negligible null association (p=0.142). This indicated that APOE is specifically relevant for cognitive aging.
title: Genetic “General Intelligence,” Objectively Determined and Measured

finding: The SNP rs7412 was associated with the ApoE2 allele of the APOE gene, influencing the stability of APOE isoforms and serving as a risk factor for coronary heart disease.
title: Proteome-Wide Association Studies for Blood Lipids and Comparison with Transcriptome-Wide Association Studies

finding: SNP rs4420638 had a significant association with elevated total cholesterol (TC), triglycerides (TG), and high-density lipoprotein cholesterol (HDL), indicating its potential role in lipid metabolism.
title: Proteome-Wide Association Studies for Blood Lipids and Comparison with Transcriptome-Wide Association Studies

finding: The SNP rs373201614 represented a very rare human polymorphism that was found to be under positive selection in humans, including Denisovans and Neanderthals. This SNP involved a specific amino acid difference at the -1 position of the 15th zinc finger domain of ZNF528, where Glutamine in human ZNF528 replaced Histidine in bonobo ZNF528. This variation potentially impacted the repressor potency of ZNF528, leading to a less negative correlation with transposable elements (TEs) in humans compared to bonobos.
title: Regulatory networks of KRAB zinc finger genes and transposable elements changed during human brain evolution and disease

finding: The SNP rs410852 was identified as an eQTL for LILRA3, affecting its expression across different immune cell types specifically, indicating its role in immune regulation.
title: Germline variants that influence the tumor immune microenvironment also drive response to immunotherapy

finding: The SNP rs2098952 was associated with LILRB4 expression and poor prognosis in rectum adenocarcinoma, connecting SNP variation with tumor immune microenvironment adaptation.
title: Germline variants that influence the tumor immune microenvironment also drive response to immunotherapy

finding: The risk allele demonstrated significantly higher transcriptional activity relative to the normal allele in LNCaP cells, suggesting a positive role in gene regulation.
title: A dinucleotide tag-based parallel reporter gene assay method

finding: The variant rs1160558441 was identified as creating an out-of-frame (OOF) upstream start codon (uAUG) within an in-frame (IF) upstream open reading frame (uORF) of the ETHE1 gene. It was predicted to be functionally silent by Optimus 5-Prime; however, the presence of this OOF uAUG has a repressive effect on translation. The Scrambler network identified both OOF uAUG and IF uORF interpretations due to its training parameters. Specifically, with a low entropy penalty, it detected both elements, whereas with a higher penalty it focused on the OOF uAUG, illustrating the complexity of interpreting variants in the 5' UTRs.
title: Interpreting Neural Networks for Biological Sequences by Learning Stochastic Masks

finding: The MBOAT7 rs641738 polymorphism was associated with non-alcoholic fatty liver in overweight or obese children, highlighting its potential link to metabolic factors that affect cardiovascular health.
title: Identification of biomarkers, pathways and potential therapeutic targets for heart failure using bioinformatics analysis

finding: The TGFB1 functional polymorphism rs1800469 was implicated in susceptibility to atrial fibrillation, a condition closely related to heart failure.
title: Identification of biomarkers, pathways and potential therapeutic targets for heart failure using bioinformatics analysis

finding: The SNP rs516246 was identified as the strongest locus associated with E-cadherin levels in two large cohorts, SPIROMICS and COPDGene, showing significant p-values of 8.95x10^-16 and 1.21x10^-16, respectively. This SNP functioned as a trans pQTL for E-cadherin, mapping to an intronic region in the FUT2 gene. Additionally, it was found to be a significant eQTL for FUT2 transcript levels, indicating that individuals with heterozygous alleles had decreased FUT2 mRNA levels in lung tissue.
title: Decreased fucosylation impacts epithelial integrity and increases risk for COPD

finding: The SNP rs601338 was revealed to be in complete linkage disequilibrium with rs516246 and was previously associated with a lack of fucosyltransferase-2 expression. This connection implies that both SNPs contribute to understanding the regulatory mechanisms associated with FUT2 and its influence on E-cadherin in relation to COPD pathology.
title: Decreased fucosylation impacts epithelial integrity and increases risk for COPD

finding: The association signal for telomere length (TL) on chromosome 19, represented by rs8105767, showed strong evidence of co-localization with an eQTL affecting expression of ZNF257 in eight tissue types, including skin (sun exposed), transverse colon, and stomach. This finding indicated that the SNP influences TL through the regulation of gene expression, particularly involving genes related to telomere maintenance.
title: Determinants of telomere length across human tissues

finding: As a well-known AD risk allele in APOE ε4, rs429358 was confirmed to significantly increase the likelihood of developing AD earlier, reinforcing its established role in AD risk.
title: Exome-wide age-of-onset analysis reveals exonic variants in ERN1, TACR3 and SPPL2C associated with Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The SNP rs7412 was significantly related to the APOE e4 carrier status, which influenced the association between estrogen exposure and brain aging. Specifically, earlier hormone replacement therapy began before menopause was associated with less evident brain aging exclusively in APOE e4 carriers, whereas in non-carriers, this relationship was not observed.
title: Cumulative estrogen exposure, APOE genotype, and women’s brain aging - a population-based neuroimaging study

finding: Similar to rs7412, the SNP rs429358 was also associated with the APOE e4 carrier status. It was found that higher circulating estradiol levels during menopause were linked to different effects on brain aging in relation to APOE status, being more evident in carriers and less evident in non-carriers, highlighting the significant interaction between these genetic variants and hormonal factors.
title: Cumulative estrogen exposure, APOE genotype, and women’s brain aging - a population-based neuroimaging study

finding: The SNP rs157580 was identified as an intron variant of the gene TOMM40. It was previously reported to be significantly associated with Alzheimer's Disease (AD), as highlighted in a study referenced (PMID: 21867541). This suggests its relevance in AD risk.
title: PGSbuilder: An end-to-end platform for human genome association analysis and polygenic risk score predictions

finding: The SNP rs67412075 was utilized in the expression model for the gene ANKLE1, identified as significantly associated with the risk of high-grade serous ovarian cancer (HGSOC) and luminal-A-like breast cancer. Its association indicated a strong genetic susceptibility link for both cancer types.
title: Cis- and trans-eQTL TWAS of breast and ovarian cancer identify more than 100 risk associated genes in the BCAC and OCAC consortia

finding: The SNP rs635299 was found to lie within a NEUROG3-binding site at the promoter of SIX5, which is linked to T2DM risk, showing the potential for regulatory impacts of NEUROG3.
title: Extensive NEUROG3 occupancy in the human pancreatic endocrine gene regulatory network

finding: The SNP rs7245708 was discovered at the bi-directional promoter of QPCTL and SNRPD2, both of which have relevance in T2DM pathways and are under the influence of NEUROG3.
title: Extensive NEUROG3 occupancy in the human pancreatic endocrine gene regulatory network

finding: The SNP rs61729907 was associated with androstenone intensity and pleasantness in both the discovery cohort (intensity p<1.07×10⁻⁷, pleasantness p<9.56×10⁻⁶) and validation cohort (pleasantness p<0.017), confirming its role in olfactory perception.
title: From musk to body odor: decoding olfaction through genetic variation

finding: The SNP rs5020278 was part of the RT/WM haplotype associated with androstenone perception, replicating its association with intensity and pleasantness in both cohorts (intensity p<1.07×10⁻⁷, pleasantness p<9.56×10⁻⁶ in discovery).
title: From musk to body odor: decoding olfaction through genetic variation

finding: The SNP rs61732668 showed clear associations with androstenone perception in the validation cohort (intensity p<3.53×10⁻⁴, pleasantness p<6.88×10⁻³), confirming previously reported findings on its impact on olfactory perception.
title: From musk to body odor: decoding olfaction through genetic variation

finding: The rs429358 SNP at the APOE locus was the most significant SNP for multiple traits including Aβ40 in the TX and FA fractions, demonstrating a strong association with AD risk and biochemical measures.
title: Genome-wide association study of brain biochemical phenotypes reveals distinct genetic architecture of Alzheimer’s Disease related proteins

finding: The rs34805055 located in STRN4 was significantly associated with Aβ40 levels in the TX fraction and impacted the gene expression of PRKD2.
title: Genome-wide association study of brain biochemical phenotypes reveals distinct genetic architecture of Alzheimer’s Disease related proteins

finding: The rs483082 SNP in the intergenic region between APOE and APOC1 was significantly associated with Aβ40/42 levels in the TX fraction.
title: Genome-wide association study of brain biochemical phenotypes reveals distinct genetic architecture of Alzheimer’s Disease related proteins

finding: The intronic rs283815 in NECTIN2 was associated with soluble APOE levels and splicing of TOMM40, supporting its role in AD pathology.
title: Genome-wide association study of brain biochemical phenotypes reveals distinct genetic architecture of Alzheimer’s Disease related proteins

finding: The SNP rs429358, associated with the gene APOE, was identified as a significant AD-risk locus through both pcMTSCCA and hocMTSCCA methods, indicating its relevance in Alzheimer's disease risk.
title: inMTSCCA: An Integrated Multi-task Sparse Canonical Correlation Analysis for Multi-omics Brain Imaging Genetics

finding: The SNP rs56131196 located in APOC1 was confirmed as an AD-risk locus, having shown strong correlation with endophenotypes in the analysis conducted by pcMTSCCA and hocMTSCCA.
title: inMTSCCA: An Integrated Multi-task Sparse Canonical Correlation Analysis for Multi-omics Brain Imaging Genetics

finding: The SNP rs4420638, also in the APOC1 region, was recognized as a relevant AD-risk locus, supported by its co-occurrence with other significant markers in predictive models.
title: inMTSCCA: An Integrated Multi-task Sparse Canonical Correlation Analysis for Multi-omics Brain Imaging Genetics

finding: The SNP rs7412 within the APOE gene was highlighted as an important locus impacting Alzheimer's disease risk, having been overlooked by other methods yet confirmed by significant associations in this study.
title: inMTSCCA: An Integrated Multi-task Sparse Canonical Correlation Analysis for Multi-omics Brain Imaging Genetics

finding: The SNP rs440446, another variant of the APOE gene, was identified as a key AD-risk locus through multi-omics analyses, emphasizing its contribution to genetic risk factors for Alzheimer's disease.
title: inMTSCCA: An Integrated Multi-task Sparse Canonical Correlation Analysis for Multi-omics Brain Imaging Genetics

finding: The SNP rs12608932 was associated with the emergence of cryptic exons in the context of TDP-43 loss of function (LOF). This polymorphism was proposed to enhance the treatment potential of correcting a cryptic exon in UNC13A, suggesting that individuals with this SNP might experience a distinct neurodegenerative response linked to TDP-43 LOF.
title: Differential exon usage and cryptic exon profiles of TDP-43 loss of function in amyotrophic lateral sclerosis brain tissue

finding: Similar to rs12608932, SNP rs12973192 was implicated in potentiating cryptic exon emergence due to TDP-43 LOF. The presence of this SNP was also suggested to contribute to the therapeutic efficacy of correcting a cryptic exon in UNC13A, highlighting its role in the variable clinical presentation of ALS/FTD related to TDP-43 dysfunction.
title: Differential exon usage and cryptic exon profiles of TDP-43 loss of function in amyotrophic lateral sclerosis brain tissue

finding: The variant rs601338 in the FUT2 gene was reported to confer a relative protective effect against norovirus infection depending on the pathogen genotype, highlighting its role in immunity and selection.
title: Prioritising Autoimmunity Risk Variants for Functional Analyses by Fine-Mapping Mutations Under Natural Selection

finding: The C-allele at rs117558072 was found to reduce muscle CERS1 expression. This reduction was linked to impaired overall health ratings and decreased grip strength in the UK Biobank cohort, underlining its relevance in age-related muscle function.
title: Inhibition of CERS1 in skeletal muscle exacerbates age-related muscle dysfunction

finding: The G-allele at rs1122821 also decreased muscle CERS1 expression. Its presence was associated with negative impacts on overall health and both right and left grip strength, indicating a significant correlation with muscle-related traits in older adults.
title: Inhibition of CERS1 in skeletal muscle exacerbates age-related muscle dysfunction

finding: The T-allele at rs71332140 was shown to increase muscle CERS1 expression. However, it was one of the variant alleles studied, and the overall analysis on health showed that reducing CERS1 expression via other alleles impaired muscle function, thereby linking it back to the broader conclusions about age-related muscle health.
title: Inhibition of CERS1 in skeletal muscle exacerbates age-related muscle dysfunction

finding: The SNP rs601338 in the FUT2 gene was linked to various gastrointestinal conditions, specifically celiac disease and inflammatory bowel disease, within the Finnish population. The study demonstrated a significant association which suggested that individuals with certain alleles of rs601338 were more likely to exhibit these conditions, thus indicating the critical role of this SNP in modulating susceptibility to intestinal diseases.
title: Intestinal norovirus binding patterns in non-secretor individuals

finding: The SNP rs429358, located on chromosome 19, was positively associated with the R2 dimension of brain atrophy, which is characterized by focal medial temporal lobe atrophy. This finding related to well-established genetic risk factors for Alzheimer's disease, particularly in patients with mild cognitive impairment (MCI) and Alzheimer's disease (AD) at baseline. Additionally, while the R1 dimension showed widespread brain atrophy, it was not associated with this SNP.
title: Genetic, clinical underpinnings of subtle early brain change along Alzheimer’s dimensions

finding: The nonsense CD177 SNP 263K>* (rs201821720) was identified as the primary genetic determinant for CD177 null and expression variations. All homozygous individuals carrying this 263*>431G genotype were found to be CD177 deficient.
title: CD177 is a novel IgG Fc receptor and CD177 genetic variants affect IgG-mediated function

finding: The CD177 SNP 431G>R (rs78718189) was shown to lead to low CD177 expression on neutrophils. Homozygous individuals with the 263K431R genotype exhibited significantly lower CD177 density on neutrophils compared to those with the 263K431G genotype.
title: CD177 is a novel IgG Fc receptor and CD177 genetic variants affect IgG-mediated function

finding: The A allele of rs4803042 significantly increased burst frequency while decreasing burst size in gene ASB1. This variant was associated with preferential binding of transcription factor PORL2A, which was confirmed by binding affinity predictions.
title: Allelic Transcription Factor binding shape transcriptional kinetics observed with scRNA-seq in human cell lines

finding: The SNP rs4420638 was associated with total cholesterol (TC), high-density lipoprotein (HDL), and triglycerides (TG) in the Samoan population. It showed genome-wide significance with <italic>P</italic><sub>D</sub> values of 2.67 × 10<sup>−16</sup> for TC, 9.07 × 10<sup>−9</sup> for HDL, and 7.44 × 10<sup>−10</sup> for TG.
title: Genome-wide association studies in Samoans give insight into the genetic architecture of fasting serum lipid levels.

finding: SNP rs1160985 was identified as the peak SNP for low-density lipoprotein (LDL) and total cholesterol (TC) with genome-wide significance: <italic>P</italic><sub>D</sub> = 2.61 × 10<sup>−20</sup> for LDL and it was confirmed in the replication cohort.
title: Genome-wide association studies in Samoans give insight into the genetic architecture of fasting serum lipid levels.

finding: The study provided further evidence supporting the association between the SNP rs1064395 in the NCAN gene and the phenotype of bipolar disorder. This finding was significant as it connected the role of Neurocan, an astrocyte-secreted protein, to this neuropsychiatric condition.
title: Astrocyte-Secreted Neurocan Controls Inhibitory Synapse Formation and Function

finding: The sentinel variant rs2108622 at the CYP4F2 locus was strongly associated with plasma levels of N-oleoyl-leucine (p-value = 5.7 x 10^-16, beta 0.44) and N-oleoyl-phenylalanine (p-value = 2.9 x 10^-19, beta 0.47). This variant, resulting in the V433M substitution and abrogating CYP4F2 hydroxylation activity, has been previously associated with cardiometabolic phenotypes such as total cholesterol levels and diastolic blood pressure, indicating its key role in lipid metabolism and cardiovascular health.
title: CYP4F2 is a human-specific determinant of circulating N-acyl amino acid levels

finding: The variant rs76589360 showed a notable selection coefficient (s = 0.015) and experienced a significant increase in frequency in Emiratis within the past 6,000 years. It was associated with erythrocyte distribution, indicating its adaptive significance in the region.
title: The Genomic History of the Middle East

finding: The missense variant rs17850995 was detected as an eQTL for SLC44A2 and exhibited strong selection (s = 0.011) in Saudis, with associations to high cholesterol levels. This indicated novelty and potential adaptation to local environmental pressures.
title: The Genomic History of the Middle East

finding: This SNP corresponds to the APOE E4 allele identified in iPSC lines NCRM1 and NCRM5, which increases the risk for Alzheimer's disease (AD). This finding contributed to the polygenic risk calculation for AD.
title: A reference induced pluripotent stem cell line for large-scale collaborative studies

finding: This SNP is another APOE variant identified in the same lines as rs429358, which, along with other genetic factors, was involved in calculating polygenic risk scores for AD.
title: A reference induced pluripotent stem cell line for large-scale collaborative studies

finding: The SNP rs374399247, which represented a serine to proline change at position 86 in the KIR3DL3 protein, was found to be a variant associated with reduced cell surface expression of KIR3DL3*039 compared to KIR3DL3*003. Experimental data showed significantly decreased extracellular expression of KIR3DL3*039 in comparison to KIR3DL3*003, suggesting that this polymorphism negatively impacted receptor expression.
title: Polymorphic KIR3DL3 expression modulates tissue-resident and innate-like T cells

finding: The SNP rs111269305 was observed in the KIR3DL3 proximal promoter region, specifically at position -110 (C=rs111269305). It was found that mutations at this site completely ablated proximal promoter activity (p < 0.001). This mutation was noted to segregate across populations and indicated the potential for significant variability in KIR3DL3 expression levels among individuals.
title: Polymorphic KIR3DL3 expression modulates tissue-resident and innate-like T cells

finding: The SNP rs7258891 was identified as an age interaction QTL (imeQTL) for the CpG site cg06953865. It showed strong evidence for mediation, indicating that changes in cell type composition, specifically neutrophil percentage, may mediate the relationship between age and methylation levels. This SNP has been associated with various cell count phenotypes, including neutrophil percentage.
title: Interaction molecular QTL mapping discovers cellular and environmental modifiers of genetic regulatory effects

finding: IFI30 gene rs11554159 showed an association with multiple sclerosis onset and severity, indicating that inflammatory pathways could overlap with metabolic diseases, including T2DM.
title: Analysis of key genes and pathways associated with the pathogenesis of Type 2 diabetes mellitus

finding: This SNP was flagged in the 2013 GWAS, highlighting its connection as a risk locus associated with Alzheimer's disease.
title: Multi-Modal Data Analysis for Alzheimer’s Disease Diagnosis: An Ensemble Model Using Imagery and Genetic Features

finding: The SNP rs549267286 was part of a cluster termed LILRB3-4SNPs, which were associated with death censored graft loss (DCGL) in African American kidney transplant recipients. This cluster was significant for its high prevalence in the AA subpopulation and its role in encoding missense mutations affecting the LILRB3 gene.
title: Genetic polymorphisms of Leukocyte Immunoglobulin-Like Receptor B3 (LILRB3) gene in African American kidney transplant recipients are associated with post-transplant graft failure

finding: SNP rs139094141 was identified within the LILRB3-4SNPs cluster and exhibited a strong association with DCGL. This association was critical in understanding graft loss in AA kidney transplant recipients.
title: Genetic polymorphisms of Leukocyte Immunoglobulin-Like Receptor B3 (LILRB3) gene in African American kidney transplant recipients are associated with post-transplant graft failure

finding: SNP rs567676351 was part of the LILRB3-4SNPs cluster, which displayed significant correlation with DCGL and contributed to the understanding of immune response mechanisms in AA kidney transplant recipients.
title: Genetic polymorphisms of Leukocyte Immunoglobulin-Like Receptor B3 (LILRB3) gene in African American kidney transplant recipients are associated with post-transplant graft failure

finding: SNP rs761515451 was included in the LILRB3-4SNPs cluster, linked to DCGL. This cluster's association highlighted the role of these SNPs in the immune response and their impact on graft survival.
title: Genetic polymorphisms of Leukocyte Immunoglobulin-Like Receptor B3 (LILRB3) gene in African American kidney transplant recipients are associated with post-transplant graft failure

finding: The reQTL for FARSA was previously associated with hematocrit levels, showing significant effects in perturbation scenarios under CA context.
title: Modeling heterogeneity in single-cell perturbation states enhances detection of response eQTLs

finding: This SNP, located in the ANGPTL4 gene, was confirmed to be associated with HDL-C levels, aligning with earlier identified lipid variant associations.
title: Role of Rare and Low Frequency Variants in Gene-Alcohol Interactions on Plasma Lipid Levels

finding: The study highlighted the role of the APOE4 variant (rs429358) in Alzheimer’s disease, suggesting that individuals carrying this variant may have an increased risk of developing dementia. This was supported by findings related to amyloid plaques and tau accumulation in individuals with Down syndrome, as those with the APOE4 genotype exhibited earlier onset and more severe neuropathological features associated with Alzheimer's disease.
title: Altered Relationship between Soluble TREM2 and Inflammatory Markers in Young Adults with Down Syndrome

finding: The rs7412 SNP, another variant of the APOE gene associated with Alzheimer’s disease risk, was also investigated in the context of individuals with Down syndrome. It further contributed to understanding the genetic predisposition in younger adults with Down syndrome regarding Alzheimer's-related neuropathology and inflammatory responses observed prior to developing dementia symptoms.
title: Altered Relationship between Soluble TREM2 and Inflammatory Markers in Young Adults with Down Syndrome

finding: SNP rs78073763 was identified as interrupting multiple binding sites of the transcription factor SPI1 in the hippocampus and of RARA in the lateral temporal lobe.
title: Integrative analysis of multi-omics reveals gene regulatory networks across brain regions from risk variants to phenotypes of Alzheimer’s disease and Covid-19

finding: The SNP rs17643262 significantly disrupted SPI1 regulation of DMPK in the hippocampus, which was associated with severe AD progression.
title: Integrative analysis of multi-omics reveals gene regulatory networks across brain regions from risk variants to phenotypes of Alzheimer’s disease and Covid-19

finding: SNP rs2041262 was another significant disruptor of SPI1 regulation, also affecting DMPK in the hippocampus, associated with cognitive impairment in AD.
title: Integrative analysis of multi-omics reveals gene regulatory networks across brain regions from risk variants to phenotypes of Alzheimer’s disease and Covid-19

finding: This SNP was associated with FOXC2 and POU2F2 regulation of KCNN4 expression in the hippocampus.
title: Integrative analysis of multi-omics reveals gene regulatory networks across brain regions from risk variants to phenotypes of Alzheimer’s disease and Covid-19

finding: The SNP rs4802200 affected E2F7 regulation of KCNN4 in the lateral temporal lobe.
title: Integrative analysis of multi-omics reveals gene regulatory networks across brain regions from risk variants to phenotypes of Alzheimer’s disease and Covid-19

finding: The rs429358 variant, a missense variant in the APOE locus, was identified as significantly associated with lifespan in the FinnGen study, with a p-value of 1.01 x 10^-14. This variant is well-known for its relationship with lifespan, cardiovascular diseases, stroke, and Alzheimer’s disease. The finding was replicated in the UK Biobank analysis, with a p-value of 1.92 x 10^-5 and a meta-analysis p-value of 4.04 x 10^-17.
title: An efficient and accurate frailty model approach for genome-wide survival association analysis controlling for population structure and relatedness in large-scale biobanks

finding: The rs157592 variant, located in the intergenic region and shown to have a mild linkage disequilibrium (r^2 = 0.7) with rs429358, was found to be associated with lifespan in the UK Biobank analysis, exhibiting a p-value of 1.87 x 10^-8. However, this variant did not demonstrate any in-silico functions according to the FAVOR functional annotation.
title: An efficient and accurate frailty model approach for genome-wide survival association analysis controlling for population structure and relatedness in large-scale biobanks

finding: The missense variant rs116843064 in ANGPTL4 was significantly associated with incident coronary heart disease (CHD), previously shown to impact lipid levels and CHD risk.
title: Genetic loci associated with prevalent and incident myocardial infarction and coronary heart disease in the Cohorts for Heart and Aging Research in Genomic Epidemiology (CHARGE) Consortium

finding: This coding variant in FUT6 was discovered to be associated with alkaline phosphatase (ALP), suggesting its ancestral significance in serum biomarker pathways.
title: Analyses of Biomarker Traits in Diverse UK Biobank Participants Identify Associations Missed by European-centric Analysis Strategies

finding: The rs2304256 polymorphism in the TYK2 gene was found to be associated with protection against type 1 diabetes (T1D). This finding highlighted the role of TYK2 in the inflammatory signaling processes related to T1D, confirming that individuals with this polymorphism may have a lower risk of developing the disease.
title: Pharmacological inhibition of tyrosine protein-kinase 2 reduces islet inflammation and delays type 1 diabetes onset in mice

finding: The SNP rs2599553 was associated with reading disability, with a P-value of 3.13 x 10^-8, and demonstrated that minor alleles persisted in causing underperformance in reading skills throughout Grades 1 to 5. Children with at least one minor allele consistently underperformed by 0.33 to 0.5 standard deviations on non-word decoding and reading fluency assessments. Furthermore, it was noted that age moderated the effect of this SNP on reading performance, indicating differing impacts at various age intervals of 7 to 16 years.
title: Genome Wide Association Study in the New Haven Lexinome Project Identifies GARRE1 as a Novel Gene for Reading Performance

finding: The variant rs11371265 defined the presence of either a full-length KIR2DL4 protein (10A allele) or a truncated version (9A allele). In the Brazilian sample, 43.86% frequency was observed for the truncated protein, with a higher occurrence among individuals of European descent (P = 0.0230). This variant was absent in the 1000Genomes dataset, indicating potential genotyping errors in that dataset.
title: KIR2DL4 genetic diversity in a Brazilian population sample: implications for transcription regulation and protein diversity in samples with different ancestry backgrounds

finding: In sample S013, the 5814C>T variant (rs61736504) was present alongside another non-catalogued variant. Like rs143170489, it contributed to the new subvariant designation of *41.004 in the classification of CYP2D6 alleles.
title: Nanopore sequencing of the pharmacogene CYP2D6 allows simultaneous haplotyping and detection of duplications

finding: Showed significant effects on RASAL3 with implications for immune responses.
title: Variant-to-function dissection of rare non-coding GWAS loci with high impact on blood traits

finding: Exhibited significant regulatory interactions impacting RASAL3 transcript levels.
title: Variant-to-function dissection of rare non-coding GWAS loci with high impact on blood traits

finding: The rs641738 C>T variant in the MBOAT7 locus was associated with reduced hepatic expression of MBOAT7, which caused changes in phosphoinositide (PI) species towards saturated ones. This alteration favored fat accumulation and contributed to the development of non-alcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD). Furthermore, its co-presence with the I148M PNPLA3 and E167K TM6SF2 variants was shown to impact NAFLD progression, severity of liver injury, and increased risk of hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC).
title: TM6SF2/PNPLA3/MBOAT7 loss-of-function genetic variants impact on NAFLD development and progression both in patients and in in vitro models

finding: The E167K variant (rs58542926 C>T) in TM6SF2 was linked to the retention of very low-density lipoprotein (VLDL) in the liver, which led to increased intrahepatic triacylglycerol content. While the variant conferred a protective effect against cardiovascular complications, it was associated with liver disease exacerbation and a higher likelihood of developing HCC, particularly in combination with the I148M variant in PNPLA3 and the rs641738 variant in MBOAT7.
title: TM6SF2/PNPLA3/MBOAT7 loss-of-function genetic variants impact on NAFLD development and progression both in patients and in in vitro models

finding: The SNP rs429358, located on chromosome 19, was positively associated with the R2 dimension of brain atrophy in Alzheimer's disease (AD) patients. This finding indicated that rs429358 was connected to widely acknowledged sporadic AD genetic risk factors in individuals with mild cognitive impairment (MCI) and AD at baseline, specifically reflecting in its substantial P-value of 1.05 × 10<sup>-11</sup>. Furthermore, the R2 dimension's association with this SNP suggested its relevance in understanding the extent of focal medial temporal lobe (MTL) atrophy in these patients.
title: Genetic, Clinical Underpinnings of Brain Change Along Two Neuroanatomical Dimensions of Clinically-defined Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The variant rs429358, part of the APOE ε4 allele, was previously established as strongly associated with both AD status and earlier age of onset, confirming its significance in AD risk.
title: Exome-wide age-of-onset analysis reveals exonic variants in ERN1, TACR3 and SPPL2C associated with Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The SNP rs117385980 was associated with longevity and healthy aging in Finnish men, highlighting its relevance in the context of aging-related studies. This finding underscored the importance of genetic factors in promoting health during aging, connecting with the broader implications of SIRT6 in intervertebral disc health as observed in the study.
title: SIRT6 loss causes intervertebral disc degeneration in mice by promoting senescence and SASP status

finding: The study identified rs429358, located in the APOE locus, as a proximal mod-QTL for the M42 matrisome module. It was found that the expression level of this module was influenced by the APOE e4 allele, and this finding was independent of the genotype's effect on ApoE protein levels. The M42 module was uniquely associated with the APOE genotype and showed significant alterations related to Alzheimer's disease cognitive decline, despite not affecting ApoE protein levels directly.
title: Large-Scale Deep Multi-Layer Analysis of Alzheimer’s Disease Brain Reveals Strong Proteomic Disease-Related Changes Not Observed at the RNA Level

finding: The SNP rs1560707 was co-located with the Solute Carrier Family 44 Member 2 (SLC44A2) gene, identified as an expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL) in OA tissue, suggesting a significant association with osteoarthritis through altered gene expression.
title: 3D Chromatin Structure in Chondrocytes Identifies Putative Osteoarthritis Risk Genes

finding: The study found that carriers of the rs429358 variant, corresponding to the APOE4 allele, exhibited increased survival outcomes in human melanoma compared to APOE3 homozygotes.
title: Germline genetic determination of cancer progression and survival

finding: The rs7412 variant, which corresponds to the APOE2 allele, was associated with shorter survival outcomes relative to APOE3 homozygotes, indicating a differential impact of APOE variants on melanoma progression.
title: Germline genetic determination of cancer progression and survival

finding: This SNP was associated with obesity-related traits, and also formed part of the 83 SNPs related to intelligence or cognitive ability.
title: Comprehensive genomic analysis of dietary habits in UK Biobank identifies hundreds of genetic loci and establishes causal relationships between educational attainment and healthy eating

finding: The SNP rs7249925 was associated with the induction of the NOSIP gene in the esophagus. The alternative G allele expanded a GGGGGG stretch, which was predicted to increase G-quadruplex (G4) activity. This finding illustrated how a specific SNP could enhance G4 formation and potentially influence gene expression.
title: DeepG4 : A deep learning approach to predict active G-quadruplexes from DNA

finding: The SNP rs147110934 was identified as having a significant effect on adult height, with a reported P-value of 1 × 10^-20 when using the gene-level association method gene-ε, which was applied to summary statistics from the UK Biobank study. This finding was notable given that ZNF628, the gene associated with this SNP, was not previously mapped to height in the GWAS catalog. The analysis highlighted the effectiveness of gene-ε in detecting rare variants that contribute meaningfully to the variation of complex traits like height.
title: Estimation of Non-null SNP Effect Size Distributions Enables the Detection of Enriched Genes Underlying Complex Traits

finding: The risk of Alzheimer disease (AD) in the Peruvian population was significantly associated with the presence of the ApoE ε4 allele, genotyped by the SNP rs429358, revealing a high-risk effect with an odds ratio of 5.02. This association was noted after adjustments for age, gender, and population substructure.
title: Dissecting the role of Amerindian genetic ancestry and ApoE ε4 allele on Alzheimer disease in an admixed Peruvian population

finding: Similar to rs429358, the SNP rs7412 was implicated as part of the ApoE gene's variation affecting the risk of Alzheimer disease (AD) in the Peruvian population, indicating a compelling genetic link and risk association for AD attributable to the ApoE ε4 allele.
title: Dissecting the role of Amerindian genetic ancestry and ApoE ε4 allele on Alzheimer disease in an admixed Peruvian population

finding: It was strongly associated with risk of triple-negative (TN) disease, having an odds ratio (OR) of 1.27 (95% CI 1.23 to 1.31) and a p-value of 1.07×10^-50.
title: Common variants in breast cancer risk loci predispose to distinct tumor subtypes

finding: The analysis indicated that rs2228367 was the second lead variant in the GLEANR factor F4, which was associated with mean platelet volume (MPV), platelet count (PCT), and platelet distribution width (PDW). This SNP served as a replicated GWAS hit for all three phenotypes and was identified as an expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL) in whole blood across multiple studies. Its significance was linked to tropomyosin 4, an actin-binding protein known to have important effects in platelet diseases.
title: Sparse matrix factorization robust to sample sharing across GWAS reveals interpretable genetic components

finding: The SNP rs12151321 in the PRKCG gene was identified as associated with differing levels of PKCγ mRNA expression in the hippocampus. A-allele carriers had significantly lower PKCγ mRNA levels than CC-genotype carriers. However, despite this association with gene expression, no differences in age-associated delayed recall performance or episodic memory-related hippocampal activity were observed in relation to this SNP.
title: KIBRA-PKCγ signaling pathway modulates memory performance in mice and humans

finding: The variant rs7412 was identified as an established causal variant for lipid levels, pivotal in multi-trait fine-mapping for high-density lipoprotein (HDL) cholesterol. It was not prioritized in single-trait fine-mapping but was confirmed as the probable causal variant in larger meta-analysis involving >125,000 participants.
title: Improved genetic discovery and fine-mapping resolution through multivariate latent factor analysis of high-dimensional traits

finding: The rs1799815 variant, a synonymous variant within the INSR gene, was identified as likely causal for fasting insulin (FI). It was supported by its association with expression of INSR in adipose tissue, consistent with its role in insulin signaling.
title: The Trans-Ancestral Genomic Architecture of Glycaemic Traits

finding: This SNP was associated with the expression of a distal gene, EPS15L, confirmed through multiplexed CRISPR perturbations, further demonstrating its regulatory capabilities.
title: Endogenous fine-mapping of functional regulatory elements in complex genetic loci

finding: The SNP rs147110934, which resides within the gene ZNF628, was identified as significantly associated with adult height, underscoring its relevance in the context of complex traits. The P-value for this association was remarkably low at 9.65 × 10⁻¹⁴, indicating substantial evidence for its effect. This finding was particularly notable because ZNF628 had not previously been mapped to height in the GWAS catalog, suggesting that gene-ε could discover connections between rare variants and phenotypes that traditional methods might overlook.
title: Epsilon-Genic Effects Bridge the Gap Between Polygenic and Omnigenic Complex Traits

finding: The SNP rs536121979 was noted in patient 109 and was believed to affect a binding site possibly occupied by SP1, SP2, SP3, or SP4 transcription factors. This finding was significant as it related to the identification of rare variants within regulatory gene modules important for CVID.
title: Decoding mutational hotspots in human disease through the gene modules governing thymic regulatory T cells

finding: The SNP rs429358, part of the APOE4 variant, was identified as the strongest genetic risk factor for AD with a p-value of 1e-91. This finding emphasized its association with increased hazards of AD and was found to be slightly less significant among a multi-ethnic sample compared to the Caucasian sample alone.
title: Genome-wide association analysis of age-at-onset traits using Cox mixed-effects models

finding: The research indicated that the loss-of-function variant rs34536443 in TYK2 was associated with a lower risk of autoimmune diseases, including type 1 diabetes (T1D). This finding aligned with the demonstration that Tyk2-mediated signaling plays a critical role in developing autoreactive CD8+ CTLs and autoimmune T1D pathogenesis, thereby supporting the notion that Tyk2 is involved in the disease process.
title: Tyk2-mediated signaling promotes the development of autoreactive CD8+ CTLs and autoimmune type 1 diabetes

finding: SNP rs1800471 in the TGFB1 gene was significantly associated with chronic kidney disease and hypertension, both of which have implications for metabolic and gestational diabetes contexts.
title: Identification of differentially expressed genes and signaling pathways in gestational diabetes mellitus by integrated bioinformatics analysis

finding: The SNP rs1122608 was significantly associated with the risk of MI and correlated with the time of MI diagnosis in individuals from the Han Chinese population, highlighting its potential clinical relevance.
title: In-silico analysis of Myocardial Infarction-related missense SNPs to identify novel biomarkers to predict susceptibility

finding: The minor allele association was replicated, showing a risk reduction for gallstones and lower plasma levels of SULT2A1 (P=10-415; effect=-0.38 SD).
title: Large-scale comparison of immunoassay- and aptamer-based plasma proteomics through genetics and disease

finding: The SNP rs12721051 was located in the 3' UTR region of the APOC1 gene and was identified as a GWAS signal for total cholesterol levels. It was part of the top trans-eQTLs driving the expression of the gene ZC3H12B, which is implicated in Alzheimer's dementia.
title: Bayesian Genome-wide TWAS method to leverage both cis- and trans-eQTL information through summary statistics

finding: The SNP rs4420638 was located downstream of the APOC1 gene and was in linkage disequilibrium (LD) with the APOE-E4 allele. It served as a GWAS signal for numerous blood lipid measurements and Alzheimer's dementia and was identified as one of the top trans-eQTLs influencing ZC3H12B expression.
title: Bayesian Genome-wide TWAS method to leverage both cis- and trans-eQTL information through summary statistics

finding: The SNP rs56131196 was identified as a GWAS signal for Alzheimer's dementia and was located downstream of the APOC1 gene. It was also one of the key trans-eQTLs driving the GReX of ZC3H12B.
title: Bayesian Genome-wide TWAS method to leverage both cis- and trans-eQTL information through summary statistics

finding: The SNP rs157592 was situated in the regulatory region of the APOC1 gene and was considered a GWAS signal for Alzheimer's dementia. It was listed among the top trans-eQTLs that mediated the expression of gene ZC3H12B.
title: Bayesian Genome-wide TWAS method to leverage both cis- and trans-eQTL information through summary statistics

finding: The rs1799782 variant was associated with Lung Non-small Cell Carcinoma and showed an increased response rate to chemotherapy. It had a much higher minor allele frequency (MAF) in Hong Kong Cantonese (30.50%) and gnomAD East Asian (EAS) populations (30.52%) compared to the worldwide distribution (9.46%). This highlighted its relevance in pharmacogenetics within this specific population.
title: HKG: An open genetic variant database of 205 Hong Kong Cantonese exomes

finding: An intronic variant of the HPN gene, rs1688030 showed the strongest associations to triglycerides and total cholesterol among lipid phenotypes.
title: A method to map and interpret pleiotropic loci using summary statistics of multiple traits

finding: The G allele of rs67397200 was found to be associated with increased breast and ovarian cancer risk. This allele was also associated with higher expression of the ANKLE1 gene in breast tissue, indicating a potential shared causal variant between ANKLE1 expression and breast cancer susceptibility.
title: ANKLE1 cleaves mitochondrial DNA and contributes to cancer risk by driving the Warburg effect and apoptosis resistance

finding: The A allele of rs2288464 was associated with increased mitochondrial DNA (mtDNA) levels in human blood. This variant correlated with decreased expression of the ANKLE1 gene, suggesting an inverse relationship between ANKLE1 expression and mtDNA levels.
title: ANKLE1 cleaves mitochondrial DNA and contributes to cancer risk by driving the Warburg effect and apoptosis resistance

finding: The rs5516 SNP, specifically the KLK1 G allele, was positively associated with aortic aneurysm and atherosclerotic stenosis according to findings reported by Zhang et al. (2016). This association suggested a link between the genetic variation at this locus and the risk of developing vascular pathology related to atherosclerosis.
title: Changes of urinary proteome in high-fat diet ApoE-/- mice

finding: The rs641738 (C>T) SNP located near the MBOAT7 gene was associated with increased susceptibility to non-alcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD) and related liver diseases. This SNP was crucial in linking MBOAT7 loss-of-function to NAFLD progression, with various studies highlighting its impact on metabolic diseases. In particular, it was shown that antisense oligonucleotide-mediated knockdown of Mboat7 led to exacerbated high-fat diet-induced hepatic steatosis, hyperinsulinemia, and insulin resistance. Several genome-wide association studies pointed to this SNP as a risk allele for NAFLD, emphasizing its role in abnormal lipid metabolism related to liver injury.
title: Membrane Bound O-Acyltransferase 7 (MBOAT7)-Driven Lysophosphatidylinositol (LPI) Acylation in Adipocytes Contributes to Systemic Glucose Homeostasis

finding: The SNP rs111689747 was recognized as the lead SNP for a novel locus on Chromosome 19, associated with cIMT, adding to the catalogue of genetic loci relevant to cardiovascular conditions.
title: Carotid intima-media thickness in UK Biobank: Identification of novel genome-wide loci, sex-specific effects and genetic correlations with obesity and glucometabolic traits

finding: The SNP rs1065853 was linked to cIMT and fell in the same category as another previously reported SNP on Chromosome 19, contributing to the understanding of genetic influences on cardiovascular disease.
title: Carotid intima-media thickness in UK Biobank: Identification of novel genome-wide loci, sex-specific effects and genetic correlations with obesity and glucometabolic traits

finding: The SNP rs7412 was recorded for its associations with triglyceride levels and cIMT, with unique implications for understanding sex differences in cardiovascular disease traits.
title: Carotid intima-media thickness in UK Biobank: Identification of novel genome-wide loci, sex-specific effects and genetic correlations with obesity and glucometabolic traits

finding: The SNP rs429358 was identified as a significant variant associated with the ApoE4 allele in Alzheimer's Disease (AD) research. This SNP's presence was correlated with increased levels of iron storage protein ferritin light chain (FTL) and higher levels of HNE, a marker of lipid peroxidation. In studies conducted on postmortem brain samples, individuals with the ApoE4 allele showed a 50% increase in HNE levels in the prefrontal cortex, indicating a link between this genotype and neurodegenerative processes in AD.
title: Alzheimer’s disease ferroptotic associations with oxidative damage and neuronal loss

finding: The SNP rs7412 was also analyzed alongside rs429358 and determined to be associated with the ApoE alleles in Alzheimer's Disease contexts. Similar to rs429358, this SNP was present in samples genotyped for ApoE alleles, which revealed associations with iron metabolism alterations and impaired antioxidant defenses in the brains affected by AD, highlighting the significance of these SNPs in the pathology of neurodegeneration.
title: Alzheimer’s disease ferroptotic associations with oxidative damage and neuronal loss

finding: The polymorphism rs3746319 located in the KRAB-ZNF gene ZNF224 was associated with global Alzheimer’s disease (AD) neuropathology and cognitive functions. This finding indicated that ZNF224 may play a significant role in influencing intermediate phenotypes related to the progression of AD.
title: Regulatory networks of KRAB zinc finger genes and transposable elements changed during human brain evolution and disease

finding: This variant in the APOE gene was replicated as negatively associated with age. The study noted that the APOEe4 haplotype associated with Alzheimer's disease decreased in frequency with age.
title: Exome-wide association studies in general and long-lived populations identify genetic variants related to human age

finding: Similar to rs429358, this APOE variant was identified as negatively associated with age and passed Bonferroni-adjusted significance thresholds.
title: Exome-wide association studies in general and long-lived populations identify genetic variants related to human age

finding: This additional APOE variant was also replicated as negatively associated with age.
title: Exome-wide association studies in general and long-lived populations identify genetic variants related to human age

finding: Another variant within the APOE locus linked to aging demonstrated significance in the context of longevity among Ashkenazi Jews.
title: Exome-wide association studies in general and long-lived populations identify genetic variants related to human age

finding: This APOE variant was relevant in assessing the haplotype frequencies in long-lived individuals, supporting its role in human longevity.
title: Exome-wide association studies in general and long-lived populations identify genetic variants related to human age

finding: The SNP rs3865444 located in the promoter region of huCD33 was associated with the elimination of the terminal V-set domain through alternative splicing, affecting Sia-binding functionality. This finding was crucial in understanding the differential expression of the isoforms CD33M and D2-CD33, both linked to cognitive health.
title: Evolution of Human-specific Alleles Protecting Cognitive Function of Grandmothers

finding: The SNP rs12459419, located within exon 2 of huCD33, also contributed to the alternative splicing mechanisms that resulted in the generation of different isoforms. Its role in modifying the immune response linked to cognitive decline was significant.
title: Evolution of Human-specific Alleles Protecting Cognitive Function of Grandmothers

finding: The SNP rs1077667 was linked to multiple sclerosis and was found to be connected to the promoters of the genes GPR108 and TRIP10. Its accessibility and chromatin contact with these promoters increased following T cell activation, suggesting its role in T cell activation dynamics.
title: Dynamic chromatin architecture identifies new autoimmune-associated enhancers for IL2 and novel genes regulating CD4+ T cell activation

finding: The study highlighted the role of TM6SF2 rs58542926 in the pathogenesis of nonalcoholic pediatric fatty liver disease. This finding indicated a significant association between the SNP and the development of NAFLD in adolescents, marking it as a crucial genetic factor in understanding the disease's mechanisms.
title: Comparative Analysis of Global Hepatic Gene Expression in Adolescents and Adults with Non-alcoholic Fatty Liver Disease

finding: The SNP rs429358 was identified as the most significant SNP affecting Alzheimer's disease. It was located at position 45411941 on chromosome 19 and associated with a p-raw value of 1.66E-28. This SNP is known as the APOE E4 determinant, indicating its critical role in the genetic predisposition to Alzheimer's disease.
title: Detecting time-varying genetic effects in Alzheimer’s disease using a longitudinal GWAS model

finding: The SNP rs8110787 was linked to the gene CALR and associated with several red blood cell traits, including hematocrit (HCT), mean corpuscular hemoglobin (MCH), mean corpuscular volume (MCV), and red blood cell counts (RBC). Functional validation using CRISPRi-FlowFISH confirmed that the CRE region chr19:12,996,905-12,998,745 regulated CALR with a significant adjusted p-value of 1.9E-7. Additionally, rs8110787 displayed significant interactions with the CALR promoter region in K562 cells (p < 1E-120), indicating it is a potential target gene. It served as an eQTL for CALR with p-values of 9.4E-16 and 1.0E-25 from independent datasets, further supporting its connection.
title: VAMPIRE: A model blood cell trait focused annotation tool for interpretation and prioritization of complex trait genome-wide association study results

finding: The SNP rs7412 was part of the genotyping for the APOE genotypes ɛ2, ɛ3, and ɛ4. It was found that individuals with the APOE4 genotype were included in the high-risk group for Alzheimer's Disease (AD), which was linked to the absence of a hub in the right paracentral lobule.
title: Dementia risk factors modify hubs but leave other connectivity measures unchanged in asymptomatic individuals: a graph theoretical analysis

finding: The SNP rs429358 was identified in conjunction with the SNP rs7412 in determining APOE genotypes. Similar to rs7412, the presence of the APOE4 allele related to the high-risk group, resulting in a hub in the right paracentral lobule, absent in low-risk individuals.
title: Dementia risk factors modify hubs but leave other connectivity measures unchanged in asymptomatic individuals: a graph theoretical analysis

finding: The SNP rs405509 was mentioned as an AD-related polymorphism that influences the transcriptional activity of the APOE gene. Its interaction with age affected cortical thickness in the paracentral lobule area, linking it to risk factors associated with cognitive decline.
title: Dementia risk factors modify hubs but leave other connectivity measures unchanged in asymptomatic individuals: a graph theoretical analysis

finding: The SNP rs1108551, located near the FFAR2 (GPR43) gene, was associated with increased expression of GPR43. Carriers of the C allele had a lower prevalence of hypertension, with a significant difference reported (37.3% in homozygous carriers compared to 38% in others, P=0.00763). This finding indicated a protective effect against hypertension attributed to GPR43 expression.
title: GPR41/43 regulates blood pressure by improving gut epithelial barrier integrity to prevent TLR4 activation and renal inflammation
