finding: The SNP rs2106448, located near the FFAR3 (GPR41) gene, demonstrated a similar association where carriers of the G allele showed increased GPR41 expression and a lower prevalence of hypertension. This aligns with findings that point to a protective role of increased GPR41 expression against hypertension, supporting the hypothesis that combined increased expression of both GPR41 and GPR43 might be an important factor in the development of hypertension.
title: GPR41/43 regulates blood pressure by improving gut epithelial barrier integrity to prevent TLR4 activation and renal inflammation

finding: The SNP rs7412 was found to play a crucial role in determining the counts of APOE ε4 alleles, which were modeled directly in relation to Alzheimer’s disease (AD) risk. This indicated that individuals with varying copies of the ε4 allele displayed differences in hippocampal volume, thereby establishing a connection between genetic predisposition and phenotypic outcomes in terms of hippocampal size.
title: Genetic risk for Alzheimer’s disease predicts hippocampal volume through the lifespan

finding: Similar to rs7412, the SNP rs429358 was instrumental in the modeling of APOE ε4 alleles' counts. This SNP also contributed significantly to the understanding of how genetic factors influence hippocampal volume among carriers, further linking its presence with increased risk for Alzheimer’s disease as evidenced by the measured decrease in hippocampal size.
title: Genetic risk for Alzheimer’s disease predicts hippocampal volume through the lifespan

finding: The SNP rs3729836 was found to be located at the upstream 3' splice site of human TNNI3 exon 3. It exhibited a gnomAD frequency of 35.1% and a TOPMed frequency of 37.8%. This SNP was associated with a reduction in the 3' MaxEnt score from 4.26 to 3.69, which further lowered the likelihood of exon 3 inclusion to approximately 57%. It specifically disrupted the human branch point consensus sequence within the pre-mRNA, suggesting a predisposition for alternative splicing. These findings indicated that even though TNNI3 exon 3 alternative splicing was not naturally used in humans, the genetic signatures from the SNP suggested its potential for induction of exon 3 skipping.
title: Genetic excision of the regulatory cardiac troponin I extension in high heart rate mammal clades

finding: The SNP rs429358, which is part of the APOE gene, was manually genotyped to assess APOE ε4 status. Findings related to this SNP indicated that individuals with the APOE ε4 allele had an increased risk for Alzheimer’s disease, as assessed in a genetic subsample of participants over 44 years of age.
title: Sleep Efficiency Relates to Hippocampal Integrity Decline in β-Amyloid Positive Adults

finding: The SNP rs7412, in conjunction with rs429358, was used to derive APOE haplotypes to determine APOE ε4 counts. This analysis reinforced the relationship between the APOE ε4 allele and increased risk for Alzheimer’s disease within the context of sleep efficiency and hippocampal integrity.
title: Sleep Efficiency Relates to Hippocampal Integrity Decline in β-Amyloid Positive Adults

finding: The SNP rs10415219, located in the ACTN4 locus, demonstrated a clear association with retinal venular tortuosity visible in images associated with the A-allele. This SNP had a minor allele frequency of 0.486 and its findings were consistent with previously mentioned associations in linkage disequilibrium with rs1808382.
title: transferGWAS: GWAS of images using deep transfer learning

finding: The allele variant rs429358 related to the APOE gene was found in NCRM1 and NCRM5, indicating its presence as an Alzheimer’s disease (AD) risk factor.
title: A reference induced pluripotent stem cell line for large-scale collaborative studies

finding: Alongside rs429358, this SNP in the APOE gene was screened for and identified as an AD risk factor across the relevant iPSC lines.
title: A reference induced pluripotent stem cell line for large-scale collaborative studies

finding: This SNP had contrasting effects on the LILRA1 eGene in microglia and oligodendrocytes, confirming its classification as a stress-interactive eQTL in those cell types.
title: Common genetic variation impacts stress response in the brain

finding: The SNP rs641738 was associated with an increased risk of liver inflammation and progression to fibrosis in the context of chronic hepatitis C. This finding highlighted the significance of the MBOAT7 gene, which encodes a phospholipid acyltransferase, similar to Mboat2 mentioned in the study of neural stem cell (NSC) aging. Therefore, the study suggested a broader functional role for MBOAT family genes in age-related and disease-related changes in lipid metabolism.
title: Lipidomic profiling reveals age-dependent changes in complex plasma membrane lipids that regulate neural stem cell aging

finding: The SNP rs9973235 corresponded to a non-synonymous polymorphism in the protein Perilipin-3. This polymorphism was identified in a peptide that had previously been predicted and found in a proteogenomic study, confirming its relevance as a true human variant. The sequence associated with this SNP had previously been identified in whole genome sequencing.
title: MetaNovo: a probabilistic approach to peptide and polymorphism discovery in complex mass spectrometry datasets

finding: The common missense variant rs167479 in the RGL3 gene was found to be independently associated with systolic blood pressure. The allele frequency of this variant was reported to be 47%. Conditioning analyses suggested it did not confound the effects of a low-frequency deletion, allowing it to become the lead variant at this locus with an R2 of 0.005.
title: Hidden protein-altering variants influence diverse human phenotypes

finding: The intronic SNP rs55670943, located 76kb downstream of RGL3, was identified as the best tag for a low-frequency 1.1kb deletion in RGL3 with an R2 of 0.66. This finding supported the association of RGL3 coding variants with hypertension risk.
title: Hidden protein-altering variants influence diverse human phenotypes

finding: The SNP rs429358 was analyzed as a positive control for assessing age effects in the 23andMe data, which revealed a highly significant association with lifespan, with a p-value of 1.2x10^-211, confirming its established effects on Alzheimer's disease risk.
title: Human loss-of-function variants suggest that partial LRRK2 inhibition is a safe therapeutic strategy for Parkinson’s disease

finding: The rs6857 SNP located at the APOE locus was significantly associated with inferred disease stage in the Mayo Clinic cohort (p = 9.18 × 10^-6). This variant is known for its association with late-onset Alzheimer's disease (LOAD) susceptibility.
title: Molecular estimation of neurodegeneration pseudotime in older brains

finding: The SNP rs10411630 coincided with a GWAS peak associated with multiple sclerosis, disrupting a crucial EGR1 transcription factor binding motif, indicating its potential role in neurodegenerative disease susceptibility.
title: Allele-specific DNA methylation is increased in cancers and its dense mapping in normal plus neoplastic cells increases the yield of disease-associated regulatory SNPs

finding: The SNP rs2303759 was implicated in multiple sclerosis as a GWAS peak. It was shown that rs10411630, in high LD with this SNP, could disrupt transcription factors potentially involved in disease mechanisms.
title: Allele-specific DNA methylation is increased in cancers and its dense mapping in normal plus neoplastic cells increases the yield of disease-associated regulatory SNPs

finding: The SNP rs2278426 was identified as a new lead SNP within the gene DOCK6 and ANGPTL8, being 20kb downstream from previously identified loci. This variant, a missense mutation, was associated with cholesterol regulation and exhibited a high posterior inclusion probability in fine-mapping studies across diverse populations, illustrating its potential role in lipid metabolism.
title: Tractor: A framework allowing for improved inclusion of admixed individuals in large-scale association studies

finding: The SNP rs11554159 in the IFI30 gene was found to be linked with multiple sclerosis onset and severity, indicating its potential as a genetic risk factor for the disease.
title: Identification of candidate biomarkers and pathways associated with multiple sclerosis using bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The SNP rs10421768 in the Hepcidin gene was associated with the onset of multiple sclerosis, indicating a possible genetic influence on disease susceptibility.
title: Identification of candidate biomarkers and pathways associated with multiple sclerosis using bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The SNP rs9973235 was associated with a non-synonymous polymorphism in the protein Perilipin-3. It was identified through the MetaNovo approach in peptide sequence analysis of the human neuroblastoma cell-line samples. This peptide shared a high level of sequence identity (100.0%) with an orthologous protein in Macaca mulatta, indicating its potential significance in the context of human genetic variation.
title: MetaNovo: a probabilistic approach to peptide and polymorphism discovery in complex metaproteomic datasets

finding: This exonic variant at the ICAM1 locus was one of five distinct signals and was specifically notable for commonality in African ancestry populations.
title: Whole Genome Sequencing Based Analysis of Inflammation Biomarkers in the Trans-Omics for Precision Medicine (TOPMed) Consortium

finding: Found as one of four conditionally distinct noncoding variants at the ICAM1 locus, indicating complex genetic architecture concerning inflammatory responses.
title: Whole Genome Sequencing Based Analysis of Inflammation Biomarkers in the Trans-Omics for Precision Medicine (TOPMed) Consortium

finding: Identified as a significant missense rare variant at the ICAM1 locus, maintaining its significance even under rigorous conditioning suggesting its impactful role in inflammatory conditions.
title: Whole Genome Sequencing Based Analysis of Inflammation Biomarkers in the Trans-Omics for Precision Medicine (TOPMed) Consortium

finding: This was flagged as a distinct signal in the ICAM1 locus, observed previously in studies analyzing relationships with inflammatory biomarkers.
title: Whole Genome Sequencing Based Analysis of Inflammation Biomarkers in the Trans-Omics for Precision Medicine (TOPMed) Consortium

finding: Recognized as an additional variant at the ICAM1 locus, suggesting its contributory role in inflammation biomarkers via its conditionally significant status.
title: Whole Genome Sequencing Based Analysis of Inflammation Biomarkers in the Trans-Omics for Precision Medicine (TOPMed) Consortium

finding: This well-known SNP at the APOE locus was associated with various traits, confirming its pleiotropic impact across metabolic pathways.
title: Whole Genome Sequencing Based Analysis of Inflammation Biomarkers in the Trans-Omics for Precision Medicine (TOPMed) Consortium

finding: Associated with prominent genetic traits including Alzheimer's disease, establishing strong significance in analyses conducted within TOPMed populations.
title: Whole Genome Sequencing Based Analysis of Inflammation Biomarkers in the Trans-Omics for Precision Medicine (TOPMed) Consortium

finding: A distinguished SNP associated with significant findings in E-selectin analysis, furthering knowledge on genetic links to inflammation.
title: Whole Genome Sequencing Based Analysis of Inflammation Biomarkers in the Trans-Omics for Precision Medicine (TOPMed) Consortium

finding: The SNP rs1490425955 corresponded to an amino acid substitution (p.P375S) in the human AP1M1 gene, which matched an equivalent amino acid change (p.P362S) in the <italic>C. elegans</italic> UNC-101 gene. This finding highlighted the conservation of the residue substitution across species and indicated relevance to functional analyses of similar variants in the context of human disease.
title: ConVarT: a search engine for matching human genetic variants with variants from non-human species

finding: The study involved determining the Apolipoprotein E (APOE) haplotype status, which included the SNP rs7412. This SNP was part of the characterization of participants' genetic predisposition to cognitive decline, particularly in the context of Alzheimer's disease.
title: Free-water metrics in medial temporal lobe white matter tract projections relate to longitudinal cognitive decline

finding: The SNP rs429358 was also analyzed in relation to the APOE haplotype status. Similar to rs7412, it contributed to understanding the genetic factors impacting cognitive impairment and decline among participants in the Vanderbilt Memory & Aging Project.
title: Free-water metrics in medial temporal lobe white matter tract projections relate to longitudinal cognitive decline

finding: The SNP rs429358, associated with the APOE4 allele, was found in Tsimane forager-farmers to be linked with a 30% lower level of C-reactive protein, which indicates a reduction in baseline innate inflammation. Moreover, carriers of this allele maintained higher levels of total and LDL cholesterol, which suggested a beneficial role in pathogen-driven immune responses.
title: APOE4 is associated with elevated blood lipids and lower levels of innate immune biomarkers in a tropical Amerindian subsistence population

finding: The SNP rs7412, also linked to the APOE4 allele, contributed to the same findings as rs429358, where carriers exhibited elevated total cholesterol and oxidized-LDL levels with minimal associated cardiovascular risk in the active subsistence lifestyle of the Tsimane population.
title: APOE4 is associated with elevated blood lipids and lower levels of innate immune biomarkers in a tropical Amerindian subsistence population

finding: The SNV rs429358 in the APOE gene was prominently linked to Alzheimer’s disease (AD) predictions, being the sole feature selected in various feature selection methods and folds. Its presence was significantly associated with increased risk for AD, with the (C;C) alleles showing the highest risk.
title: Machine learning methods applied to classify complex diseases using genomic data

finding: The SNP rs35033974 was associated with a missense variant that impacted TEX101-associated proteins in human spermatozoa. The study indicated a substantial connection between this variant and specific proteomic measurements, highlighting its relevance in understanding sperm biology and potential clinical implications.
title: APPRIS principal isoforms and MANE Select transcripts in clinical variant interpretation

finding: The SNP rs12721051 was located in the 3’ UTR region of the gene APOC1 and identified as a GWAS signal for total cholesterol levels. This SNP was part of the top driven trans-eQTLs for the gene ZC3H12B, which was associated with Alzheimer’s dementia (AD) phenotypes, indicating its relevance in the mediation of the associations with AD.
title: Novel Bayesian transcriptome-wide association study method leveraging both cis- and trans- eQTL information through summary statistics

finding: The SNP rs4420638, located downstream of APOC1, was in linkage disequilibrium with the APOE E4 allele (rs429358) and identified as a GWAS signal for various blood lipid measurements as well as AD. It was among the trans-eQTLs influencing ZC3H12B, highlighting its significant role in AD and lipid profiles.
title: Novel Bayesian transcriptome-wide association study method leveraging both cis- and trans- eQTL information through summary statistics

finding: The SNP rs56131196, located downstream of APOC1, was identified as a GWAS signal associated with AD independent of the APOE-E4. This SNP was also one of the trans-eQTLs for ZC3H12B, further supporting its involvement in AD pathology.
title: Novel Bayesian transcriptome-wide association study method leveraging both cis- and trans- eQTL information through summary statistics

finding: The SNP rs157592, located in the regulatory region of APOC1, was recognized as a GWAS signal for AD. It served as a trans-eQTL for ZC3H12B, reinforcing its implications in the genetic architecture of AD.
title: Novel Bayesian transcriptome-wide association study method leveraging both cis- and trans- eQTL information through summary statistics

finding: The SNP rs34536443, known as TYK2P1104A, was identified as providing protection against several autoimmune diseases, including Type 1 diabetes (T1D), particularly in the Finnish population. This association was validated in a study where it was found that rs34536443 conferred significant protection in a cohort of 5,928 T1D cases compared to 183,185 controls, with a p-value of less than 1.16x10^-5. The protective mechanism was hypothesized to involve the dampening of IFN-I, IL-12, and IL-23 signaling, which are critical contributors to the pathogenesis of T1D.
title: The type 1 diabetes gene TYK2 regulates β-cell development and its responses to interferon-α

finding: The SNP rs1064395 in the Ncan gene was identified as a risk factor for schizophrenia and bipolar disorder. This association was supported by findings from Miró et al. (2012), where behavioral abnormalities such as hyperactivity were noted in both human subjects and Ncan knockout mice. Additionally, this SNP was linked to reduced hippocampus-dependent memory functioning and variations in prefrontal cortex structure and ECM composition in healthy individuals and bipolar disorder patients, as reported by Assmann et al. (2020) and Cichon et al. (2011) respectively.
title: Depletion of neurocan in the prefrontal cortex impairs temporal order recognition, cognitive flexibility and perisomatic GABAergic innervation

finding: The SNP rs4252548-T, a missense variant causing a p.Arg112His change in the IL11 protein, was associated with reduced function of IL11, thus predisposing individuals to osteoarthritis. This variant was also linked to increased IL11 protein levels and proposed as a therapeutic strategy for treating osteoarthritis.
title: RNA sequencing reveals interacting key determinants of osteoarthritis acting in subchondral bone and articular cartilage

finding: The rs2547235 association with 5alpha-androstan-3beta linked to <italic>SULT2A1</italic> provided further evidence of this known gene's metabolic roles.
title: Genetic Architecture and Analysis Practices of Circulating Metabolites in the NHLBI Trans-Omics for Precision Medicine (TOPMed) Program

finding: Found in the LDLR gene, rs879255211 was a stop-gain variant with an exceedingly high odds ratio for CAD at 4.97 (P = 5.5 x 10−6). It was highlighted for its significant impact on serum total cholesterol levels as well.
title: Population-specific and transethnic genome-wide analyses reveal distinct and shared genetic risks of coronary artery disease

finding: The rs58542926 SNP, which causes a nonsynonymous E167K mutation in the TM6SF2 protein, was found to be a strong genetic risk factor for nonalcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD). Carriers of this variant exhibited increased hepatic lipid content and had associations with NAFLD progression toward fibrosis and cirrhosis.
title: Perturbation of transmembrane 6 superfamily member 2 expression alters lipid metabolism in a human liver cell line

finding: The SNP rs3814995, associated with the NPHS1 gene, was linked to Nephrotic syndrome type 1. This SNP was also contained within a small credible set, supporting its relevance to kidney function.
title: Discovery and prioritization of variants and genes for kidney function in >1.2 million individuals

finding: The rs2075650 variant was identified as contributing to higher enhancer activity in the European/Japanese APOEε4 haplotype compared to the African haplotype. This variant was determined to differentially affect binding sites for the transcription factor SP1, which has been shown to be dysregulated in Alzheimer disease (AD).
title: Converging evidence for differential regulatory control of APOEε4 on African versus European haplotypes

finding: The rs157581 variant was noted for its potential synergistic effect with rs2075650, showing significant regulatory activity in the context of higher enhancer activity in the European/Japanese haplotypes, thereby influencing APOE expression related to Alzheimer disease risk.
title: Converging evidence for differential regulatory control of APOEε4 on African versus European haplotypes

finding: The rs59007384 variant was discovered to drive higher regulatory activity in the European haplotype in one of the enhancer fragments analyzed. Its difference in frequency between the Japanese and African APOEε4 haplotypes was particularly relevant in the study of Alzheimer's disease.
title: Converging evidence for differential regulatory control of APOEε4 on African versus European haplotypes

finding: The GIPR-Q354 variant (rs1800437) was linked to enhanced glucose tolerance and lower BMI. Homozygous individuals displayed a reduced C-peptide excursion in response to an oral glucose tolerance test, along with lower GIP and insulin concentrations, highlighting its effect on beta cell biology. Additionally, it was associated with a higher propensity towards resistance to diet-induced obesity.
title: A common human variant of GIPR improves systemic glucose homeostasis in a sexual dimorphic manner

finding: The SNP rs405509, associated with the apolipoprotein E (APOE)-ε4 allele, was linked to detectable brain differences in populations at risk for Alzheimer's disease (AD), particularly in elderly and middle-aged individuals. These differences were observed in studies that highlighted the role of APOE-ε4 in the neurodegenerative processes and cognitive impairments related to AD, confirming its relevance in understanding the disease's continuum and progression.
title: Brain connectivity during Alzheimer’s disease progression and its cognitive impact in a transgenic rat model

finding: The SNP rs492602 in the FUT2 gene was found to be associated with both DrnkWk and total AUDIT score, thus supporting the findings of the meta-analysis regarding problematic alcohol use.
title: Meta-analysis of problematic alcohol use in 435,563 individuals identifies 29 risk variants and yields insights into biology, pleiotropy and causality

finding: The SNP rs12608932 (C/C) was associated with increased susceptibility to amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS) and a higher risk of comorbid frontotemporal dementia (FTD) when TDP-43 knocked down. This variant was found to lead to increased inclusion of the cryptic exon 20-21 and the retention of the distant intron 31 in UNC13A.
title: Novel and known transcriptional targets of ALS/FTD protein TDP-43: Meta-analysis and interactive graphical databases

finding: The SNP rs12973192 was associated with increased ALS risk. Similar to rs12608932, this SNP also contributed to the inclusion of exon 20-21 and the retention of intron 31 in UNC13A amidst TDP-43 knockdown, indicating its significance in the pathogenesis of the disease.
title: Novel and known transcriptional targets of ALS/FTD protein TDP-43: Meta-analysis and interactive graphical databases

finding: The SNP rs7412 was associated with the <italic>APOE</italic> genotype classification, where it was part of determining whether individuals carried the <italic>APOE</italic> ε4 allele. This classification was significant in assessing the interactive effects between <italic>APOE</italic> and central obesity on hippocampal health among cognitively healthy adults.
title: Apolipoprotein ε4 modifies obesity-related atrophy in the hippocampal formation of cognitively healthy adults

finding: The SNP rs429358 contributed to the classification of <italic>APOE</italic> genotypes, being crucial for identifying carriers of the <italic>APOE</italic> ε4 allele. This finding helped elucidate the role of <italic>APOE</italic> in modifying the effects of obesity on hippocampal size and complexity in a population that was otherwise cognitively healthy.
title: Apolipoprotein ε4 modifies obesity-related atrophy in the hippocampal formation of cognitively healthy adults

finding: Carried by iPSC lines NCRM1 and NCRM5, it was associated with increased risk for Alzheimer’s disease (AD).
title: A reference induced pluripotent stem cell line for large-scale collaborative studies

finding: Also carried by iPSC lines NCRM1 and NCRM5, it was associated with increased risk for Alzheimer’s disease (AD).
title: A reference induced pluripotent stem cell line for large-scale collaborative studies

finding: The rs641738 variant was found to be associated with increased susceptibility to non-alcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD), alcohol-associated liver disease (ALD), and liver fibrosis, particularly in individuals with chronic hepatitis infections. Multiple genome-wide association studies (GWAS) since 2015 confirmed that this SNP influenced liver injury, and it was noted that the T-allele was linked to an approximate 43% frequency in individuals of European descent. This SNP was implicated in various liver conditions across different studies, reinforcing its relevance in liver disease progression.
title: Membrane Bound O-Acyltransferase 7 (MBOAT7) Shapes Lysosomal Lipid Homeostasis and Function to Control Alcohol-Associated Liver Injury

finding: A low-frequency coding variant in ANGPTL4 was associated with HDL and triglycerides among 42K individuals of European ancestry, supporting the connection to decreased fasting triglyceride levels and reduced odds of coronary artery disease.
title: An allelic series rare variant association test for candidate gene discovery

finding: The study identified that lithium carbonate showed no overall clinical benefit for ALS patients. However, a genetic subgroup analysis suggested that it was beneficial specifically for patients who were homozygous for the C allele of rs12608932 in the UNC13A gene. This finding related to the response of ALS patients to lithium treatment indicates a potential genetic influence on treatment efficacy.
title: PP2A and GSK3 act as modifiers of FUS-ALS by modulating mitochondrial transport

finding: The rs1077667 MS effect on chromosome 19 colocalized with the cis-mQTL effect for cg23071186, situated in the TNFSF14 gene, suggesting that this SNP influences both MS susceptibility and the methylation status of nearby CpGs.
title: Impact of genetic susceptibility to multiple sclerosis on the T cell epigenome: proximal and distal effects

finding: The SNP rs35866622 within the FUT1/FUT2 locus was associated with the Ruminococcus torques group and dietary traits, suggesting a significant role in host-microbiome interactions.
title: Genetics of human gut microbiome composition

finding: The SNP rs12459419 was associated with a polymorphism that resulted in the substitution of C for T, changing Alanine 14 to Valine (A14V). This variant was linked to increased expression of a shorter isoform of CD33 (CD33<delta>2) and reduced translation of the full-length CD33 (CD33<sup>FL</sup>). Analysis indicated that individuals with the CC genotype had greater CD33 expression on AML blasts, leading to a lower risk of relapse and higher survival rates.
title: Multiplex Base Editing to Protect from CD33-Directed Therapy: Implications for Immune and Gene Therapy

finding: The SNP rs3814995 associated with the gene NPHS1, related to nephrotic syndrome type 1. This variant was also found in a small credible set with only 2 variants, supporting the gene's relevance to kidney phenotypes in the general population.
title: Discovery and prioritization of variants and genes for kidney function in >1.2 million individuals

finding: The SNP rs429358 was found to be associated with Alzheimer's disease, as indicated by its correlation with the APOE allele types determined during the study. Individuals with specific variants of this SNP exhibited differential gene expression patterns linked to neurodegenerative features.
title: Disease specific alterations in the olfactory mucosa of patients with Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The SNP rs7412 was also identified as a significant marker for Alzheimer's disease within the study context. Similar to rs429358, the findings suggested that particular genotypes of this SNP contributed to the pathology observed in olfactory mucosal cells of affected individuals.
title: Disease specific alterations in the olfactory mucosa of patients with Alzheimer’s disease

finding: This SNP was found to be one of the signals associated with liver fat, previously linked to NAFLD.
title: Systematic quantification of health parameters from UK Biobank abdominal MRI

finding: This SNP was also among those associated with liver fat and had previous associations with NAFLD.
title: Systematic quantification of health parameters from UK Biobank abdominal MRI

finding: This missense SNP in TM6SF2 correlated with hyperlipidemia and prior links to alcohol-induced cirrhosis.
title: Systematic quantification of health parameters from UK Biobank abdominal MRI

finding: The study referenced by Tejedor et al. (2014) established that the rs7412 variant of the apolipoprotein E (APOE) polymorphism was associated with body fatness in middle-aged men, showing that it influenced body fat levels independently of plasma lipids. This finding highlighted the metabolic implications of the APOE genotype, particularly relevant in the context of Alzheimer's disease.
title: Predictive link between systemic metabolism and cytokine signatures in the brain of apolipoprotein E ε4 mice

finding: This SNP showed a significant association with the gene TCEA1, which is located within a genomic desert previously reported, suggesting regulatory effects influenced by Neandertal DNA.
title: Long-range regulatory effects of Neandertal DNA in modern humans

finding: This SNP was found to be significantly associated with HDL, demonstrating a strong association with a p value of 9.7e-26.
title: PheGWAS: A new dimension to visualize GWAS across multiple phenotypes

finding: This SNP was significantly associated with LDL, with a p value of 1.6e-320. It was noted to be in linkage disequilibrium with several SNPs including rs3208856 and rs283813.
title: PheGWAS: A new dimension to visualize GWAS across multiple phenotypes

finding: This SNP was significantly associated with TOTAL CHOLESTEROL, with a p value of 1.6e-283, and was in linkage disequilibrium with SNPs such as rs6859 and rs7254892.
title: PheGWAS: A new dimension to visualize GWAS across multiple phenotypes

finding: This SNP was found to be significantly associated with TRIGS, demonstrating a strong association with a p value of 1.4e-66.
title: PheGWAS: A new dimension to visualize GWAS across multiple phenotypes

finding: The variant rs10119 was identified as a top-ranked causal variant associated with Alzheimer's disease. It was located in a chromatin loop structure, where significant transcriptional regulators, including REST, EGR1, RELA, and STAT1, were found to bind upstream and downstream. This variant was regulated by multiple super-enhancers linked to important nearby genes such as APOE, TOMM40, and APOC1, all of which significantly influence the onset of Alzheimer's disease. Furthermore, the epigenetic landscape, as indicated by H3K27ac signals, was notably higher at the rs10119 site in disease and elderly cohorts compared to younger, disease-free individuals, suggesting its crucial role in the disease mechanism.
title: TRAPT: A multi-stage fused deep learning framework for transcriptional regulators prediction via integrating large-scale epigenomic data

finding: This SNP, located in the ANKLE1 gene, was replicated across both study cohorts and associated with lower expression of the ABHD8 gene, potentially impacting invasiveness in cancer, thus demonstrating its pleiotropic effects.
title: Genetic differences between extreme and composite constitution types from whole exome sequences reveal actionable variations

finding: This SNP is in strong linkage disequilibrium with rs8100241 in ANKLE1, showcasing its association with breast and ovarian cancer, among other phenotypes.
title: Genetic differences between extreme and composite constitution types from whole exome sequences reveal actionable variations

finding: The SNP rs769450 was significantly associated with Alzheimer's disease, showing an empirical p-value of 1.65 × 10⁻⁶ when all 310 AD patients were analyzed. Its significance increased dramatically within cluster analysis, reaching a p-value of 2.08 × 10⁻⁸ in a module of 80 AD patients, indicating a strong connection to the disease, particularly as it mapped to the second intron of the APOE gene.
title: Module analysis using single-patient differential expression signatures improve the power of association study for Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The study identified a successful edit at the rs429358 locus which resulted in a thymine to cytosine change and a corresponding Cys112Arg substitution in the Apolipoprotein E (ApoE) protein product. This edit was associated with the generation of APOE44 alleles from parental APOE33 cells using CRISPR/Cas9 gene-editing technology. The implications of this SNP were significant since the resulting APOE44 genotype is known to be a stronger genetic risk factor for sporadic Alzheimer’s disease (sAD), contributing to the understanding of the pathogenic mechanisms associated with the disease.
title: Upregulated NF-κB pathway proteins may underlie APOE44 associated astrocyte phenotypes in sporadic Alzheimer’s disease

finding: This variant was associated with increased levels of TNFSF14 expression in killer T cells. It promoted ZNF449 binding to the TNFSF14 coding exon, thus being linked with multiple sclerosis risk. The study indicated that the variant was one of the true causal variants in comparison with the GWAS lead variant, rs1077667.
title: Functional variants in hematopoietic transcription factor footprints and their roles in the risk of immune system diseases

finding: A low-frequency coding variant rs116843064 in ANGPTL4 was associated with decreased levels of HDL and triglycerides among 42K individuals of European ancestry and among 66K individuals of multiple ancestries. Additionally, a meta-analysis of 50K individuals associated rs116843064 with fasting triglyceride levels. Rare inactivating mutations in ANGPTL4 were also associated with reduced levels of fasting triglycerides and reduced odds of coronary artery disease. In the current study, 25 of 27 rare variants in ANGPTL4, including all protein-truncating variants (PTVs), were marginally associated with decreased triglyceride levels.
title: An allelic series rare variant association test for candidate gene discovery

finding: The SNP rs2227376 corresponded to the PAR4-P310L variant, which significantly reduced PAR4-mediated calcium signaling in response to thrombin in HEK293 cells. The finding was linked to a decreased receptor function that led to hypo-reactive platelet responses, contributing to an understanding of the mechanisms underlying thrombin signaling and platelet reactivity.
title: A Mouse Model of the Protease Activated Receptor 4 (PAR4) Pro310Leu Variant has Reduced Platelet Reactivity

finding: The SNP rs773902, which indicated the PAR4-120A/T variant, resulted in a threonine at position 120 that made PAR4 more sensitive to agonists than the alanine variant. This variant was implicated in worse stroke outcomes due to its impact on receptor sensitivity, particularly in populations of African ancestry.
title: A Mouse Model of the Protease Activated Receptor 4 (PAR4) Pro310Leu Variant has Reduced Platelet Reactivity

finding: The SNP rs2227346 denoted the PAR4-296F/V variant, which was exclusively observed in black individuals. This variant abolished receptor hyperactivation related to PAR4-Thr120. The finding highlighted the impact of this SNP on PAR4-mediated platelet activation and its relevance in clinical scenarios.
title: A Mouse Model of the Protease Activated Receptor 4 (PAR4) Pro310Leu Variant has Reduced Platelet Reactivity

finding: The SNP rs373201614 was identified as a rare human polymorphism located at position 588 in the zinc finger domain of ZNF528. It was speculated to be under positive selection in humans and closely related species such as Denisovans and Neanderthals. The context of its finding relates to ZNF528's interaction with transposable elements (TEs), where variations in this position may contribute to differences in repressor potency compared to its bonobo counterpart. This finding likely indicates a functional change impacting susceptibility to TEs in humans.
title: Regulatory networks of KRAB zinc finger genes and transposable elements changed during human brain evolution and disease

finding: The SNP rs167479, associated with the circadian gene RGL3, was identified as pleiotropic with both systolic and diastolic blood pressure as well as cardiovascular disease.
title: Causal inference for multiple risk factors and diseases from genomics data

finding: SNP rs73046792 in SNRNP70 was pleiotropic for smoking and systolic blood pressure, indicating a genetic overlap between these two traits.
title: Causal inference for multiple risk factors and diseases from genomics data

finding: Located in the gene CERS4 at locus 19p13.2, this exonic non-synonymous SNP was closely linked with potential contributions to sphingolipid biosynthesis, implicating metabolic dysregulation in MacTel pathology.
title: Genetic Disruption of Serine Biosynthesis is a Key Driver of Macular Telangiectasia Type 2 Etiology and Progression

finding: The SNP rs10411210, located in 19q13.11, showed significant association with osteoporosis (P<sub>GWAS</sub> = 1.6E-119) and was correlated with gene expression changes in <italic>RHPN2</italic> (P<sub>TWAS</sub> = 4.4E-73), indicating that this variant may have a causal role in the disease.
title: Integrating genome-wide association and transcriptome predicted model identify novel target genes with osteoporosis

finding: The SNP rs11085226 was associated with a negative effect on glucose-stimulated insulin secretion as reported by Heni et al. (2012). This finding related to the gene encoding for Polypyrimidine Tract-Binding Protein 1, linking how genetic variation in this RBP could potentially impact insulin biosynthesis and secretion in relation to glucose levels.
title: Insulin mRNA is stored in RNA granules in resting beta cells

finding: As a lead signal variant for total cholesterol, rs34003091 displayed allelic bias only in AICAR- and palmitate-stimulated states, with the reference allele (T) being more active. Its role in lipid metabolism was emphasized by its linkage to LDL cholesterol variants, indicating its relevance in metabolic disorder contexts.
title: Functional dissection of metabolic trait-associated gene regulation in steady state and stimulated human skeletal muscle cells

finding: This SNP was identified in association with the SRS and neutrophil magnifier eQTL. It was related to a reduction in the expression of OCEL1, implicating it in the differences in transcriptomic responses observed across SRS groups.
title: eQTLs identify regulatory networks and drivers of variation in the individual response to sepsis

finding: The SNP rs201821720, which corresponds to the nonsense mutation 263K>*, was identified as the primary genetic determinant for CD177 null and expression variations. This SNP was found to result in a complete lack of CD177 expression on the cell surface.
title: CD177 is a novel IgG Fc receptor and CD177 genetic variants affect IgG-mediated function

finding: The SNP rs78718189, which results in the 431G>R mutation, was associated with low CD177 expression on neutrophils. It was identified through haplotype analysis demonstrating a link between this SNP and reduced CD177 density, indicating its role in the functional expression of CD177.
title: CD177 is a novel IgG Fc receptor and CD177 genetic variants affect IgG-mediated function

finding: The study found that the rs12979860 SNP in the IFNL4 gene was the strongest predictor of minimum folding energy difference (MFED) values in individuals infected with hepatitis C virus (HCV). Individuals with the TT genotype exhibited significantly higher MFED values, indicating greater RNA structure formation compared to those with the CC genotype. Additionally, this SNP was associated with enhanced viral control, lower viral load, and reduced UpA dinucleotide frequencies. The evidence suggested that individuals with TT genotypes had a better quality of interferon lambda (IFNλ) expression, which affected both RNA structure and viral diversity, and these associations were consistent across different HCV genotypes.
title: Impact of virus subtype and host IFNL4 genotype on large-scale RNA structure formation in the genome of hepatitis C virus

finding: The SNP rs10411210 was found to have a significant association with colorectal cancer as detailed in a study published in 2015. This association was identified through the analysis of large-scale samples, highlighting the potential role of this polymorphism in the etiology of the disease.
title: The timing of human adaptation from Neanderthal introgression

finding: The Sanger sequencing of rs429358 confirmed the APOE4/4 status in TOB0002, TOB0064, and TOB0121 cell lines, indicating that these lines had a higher genetic predisposition to developing Alzheimer's disease due to their APOE genotype.
title: Investigating the role of APOE: limitations of human pluripotent stem cell-derived cerebral organoids

finding: Similar to rs429358, the Sanger sequencing of rs7412 also confirmed the APOE4/4 status in TOB0002, TOB0064, and TOB0121, reinforcing the understanding that individuals with this genotype are at increased risk for late-onset Alzheimer's disease.
title: Investigating the role of APOE: limitations of human pluripotent stem cell-derived cerebral organoids

finding: The SNP rs117316645 was identified as a highly significant risk variant for Alzheimer's disease (AD), with a p-value of less than 4.8×10^{-24}. It was specifically located within an open chromatin peak region of the chr19:44,950,000-44,960,000 genomic bin, which connects to the APOE gene locus approximately 50 kb downstream. This finding indicated a potential disruption in astrocyte function related to amyloid-beta clearance, highlighting the relevance of this SNP in the context of AD pathology.
title: Efficient pre-processing of Single-cell ATAC-seq data

finding: This variant localized in the promoter of C3 and affected chromatin activity, gene expression of C3, and to a lesser extent TNFSF14 in lymphoblastoid cell lines. It was confirmed as a PU.1 binding QTL.
title: Non-coding variants impact cis-regulatory coordination in a cell type-specific manner

finding: The rs7247241 variant was found to significantly associate with changes in SPINT2 gene expression in the 22Rv1 cell line. This SNP had previously been validated for affecting proximal genome methylation.
title: Identify Regulatory eQTLs by Multiome Sequencing in Prostate Single Cells

finding: The SNP rs11672691 was identified as being associated with oncogenic regulatory circuits that drive prostate cancer aggressiveness. This finding was significant because it highlighted how genetic variations in the 19q13 region may contribute to the severity and progression of prostate cancer.
title: A live cell protein complementation assay for ORFeome-wide probing of human HOX interactomes

finding: The SNP rs4803217 in the IFNL3 gene was found to affect virus infection in hepatitis C, providing insights into its role in the immune response against viruses.
title: Synonymous SNPs of viral genes facilitate virus to escape host antiviral RNAi immunity

finding: The TM6SF2 rs58542926 variant was linked to advanced liver fibrosis in relation to type 2 diabetes, indicating potential overlap with DKD pathology.
title: Screening and identification of key biomarkers in diabetic kidney disease and its complications: Evidence from bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: SNP rs138596065 located on chromosome 19 demonstrated a significant association with vertical brain asymmetry measures. It had a MAF of 8.28% and an additive effect indicating that increasing GC alleles correlated with a decrease in the measure, observed as a t-value of -5.50 and a p-value of 3.74e-08. This locus is associated with the DPY19L3 gene.
title: Handedness and Other Variables Associated with Human Brain Asymmetrical Skew

finding: Variant rs3786897 was linked to the regulation of the gene PEPD in adipose tissue, which has implications for adipogenesis, triglyceride accumulation, and insulin sensitivity.
title: Predicting mechanisms of action at genetic loci associated with discordant effects on type 2 diabetes and abdominal fat accumulation

finding: The polymorphism rs11085226 in the gene encoding Polypyrimidine Tract-Binding Protein 1 was found to negatively affect glucose-stimulated insulin secretion. This finding highlighted the role of RBPs in insulin mRNA regulation and dynamics in response to glucose levels.
title: Insulin mRNA is stored in RNA granules in resting beta cells

finding: This missense variant in NOTCH3 was noted to occur in 10 cases and no controls, indicating a potential role in increasing the risk for LOAD.
title: Weighted burden analysis of exome-sequenced late onset Alzheimer’s cases and controls provides further evidence for a role for PSEN1 and suggest involvement of the PI3K/Akt/GSK-3β and WNT signalling pathways

finding: The study indicated that the SNP rs7412, which is associated with the APOE gene, was found to be correlated with body fatness independent of plasma lipid levels in middle-aged men. This finding is significant as it emphasizes the role of the APOE polymorphism in metabolic processes, linking the genetic risk factor to obesity and fat accumulation, wherein the presence of the APOE4 allele (which includes the rs7412 variant) could influence body fat metrics.
title: Predictive link between systemic metabolism and immune signaling in the brain of APOE4 mice

finding: This SNP was associated with peptic ulcer disease (PUD) and was statistically significant in both UKB and GERA GWAS analyses. It was located in the FUT2 gene, which has been implicated in susceptibility to Helicobacter pylori infection, indicating its role in the etiology of PUD.
title: Genome-wide association study of gastrointestinal disorders reinforces the link between the digestive tract and the nervous system

finding: This SNP was linked to GP+M and previously associated with esophageal diseases, highlighting its significance in the genetic architecture of gastroesophageal conditions.
title: Genome-wide association study of gastrointestinal disorders reinforces the link between the digestive tract and the nervous system

finding: The SNP rs429358 was identified as a missense mutation in the APOE gene, associated with participation in mental health surveys (MHQ). The analysis indicated that participants with more copies of the APOE-ε4 allele were less likely to participate, with an odds ratio (OR) of 1.029±0.0057 for each additional ε4 copy. This finding highlighted a genetic correlation between the APOE-ε4 genotype and lower engagement in follow-up mental health assessments, connecting it to broader implications in psychological distress and educational attainment.
title: Factors associated with sharing email information and mental health survey participation in large population cohorts

finding: The SNP rs581623 served as a lead regulatory variant associated with a large trans regulatory network affecting multiple genes from the KIR region (19q13.4). It underlying regulatory effects were evident, showcasing its master regulatory properties in NK cells.
title: Natural Killer cells demonstrate distinct eQTL and transcriptome-wide disease associations, highlighting their role in autoimmunity

finding: The variant rs429358, located in the APOE ε4 locus on 19q13.32, was associated with the function of the default mode, central executive, attention, and visual networks. It was noted for its established link to Alzheimer’s disease and cognitive decline, suggesting shared genetic influences between intrinsic neuronal activity and Alzheimer's disease-related brain atrophy.
title: Common variants contribute to intrinsic human brain functional networks

finding: In the same region as rs429358 within 19q13.32, this TOMM40 variant contributed to amplitude functionality in brain networks of interest.
title: Common variants contribute to intrinsic human brain functional networks

finding: This SNP located in TOMM40 demonstrated associations with intrinsic brain activity amplitude, emphasizing potential implications for cognitive health.
title: Common variants contribute to intrinsic human brain functional networks

finding: Also in the TOMM40 region, this variant was part of the recognized cluster influencing brain activity relevant to cognitive faculties.
title: Common variants contribute to intrinsic human brain functional networks

finding: The SNP rs492602 was linked to the gene FUT2, which is similarly implicated in psoriasis GWAS hits, establishing a significant role for this SNP in relation to gene regulation associated with psoriasis.
title: BaseQTL: a Bayesian method to detect eQTLs from RNA-seq data with or without genotypes

finding: The SNP rs281379 was also reported as a proxy (r²=0.8) of previously identified eQTLs in the context of psoriasis, further emphasizing its connection to gene regulation associated with psoriasis.
title: BaseQTL: a Bayesian method to detect eQTLs from RNA-seq data with or without genotypes

finding: The study highlighted the successful editing of the ApoE4 gene to ApoE3 using CRISPR technology specifically targeting the SNP rs429358, which involves a cytosine to thymine substitution that changes the amino acid from arginine in ApoE4 to cysteine in ApoE3. This editing was associated with functional expression of ApoE3 mRNA in brain and liver tissues of treated mice, signifying its potential role in alleviating Alzheimer's disease phenotypes.
title: Successful Gene Editing of Apolipoprotein E4 to E3 in Brain of Alzheimer Model Mice After a Single IV Dose of Synthetic Exosome-Delivered CRISPR

finding: The SNP rs3865444 was associated with Siglec-3 protein levels and indicated connections to Alzheimer's disease, potentially impacting the understanding of genetic risks related to obesity and dementia.
title: A large-scale multivariate pQTL study sheds light on the genetic architecture of obesity

finding: The SNP rs2227376, which results in a C to T base substitution leading to a proline to leucine change at position 310 (PAR4-P310L), was associated with a lower risk for venous thromboembolism (VTE), specifically a 15% risk reduction. The leucine allele was found to decrease PAR4 activity, leading to reduced platelet activation and aggregation, as well as impaired thrombosis in studies conducted using a mouse model (PAR4-P322L) with a homologous mutation.
title: Mice with Reduced PAR4 Reactivity show Decreased Venous Thrombosis and Platelet Procoagulant Activity

finding: This SNP was associated with Limb-girdle muscular dystrophy and was identified in the ORF CATP00000063293.1. The SNP represented an intron/5' UTR variant that changed the start codon of a protein sequence from ATG to ATA. A strong PhyloCSF signal was observed using an ORF-origin-aware approach, with a phenotypic score of 69, which was in the 87th percentile of all ORFs screened. This indicated a significant functional role for the microprotein.
title: De novo birth of functional, human-specific microproteins

finding: The SNP rs12973192 was found to lie 16 base pairs inside a cryptic exon (CE) of the UNC13A gene and was shown to significantly increase CE levels in cases that were homozygous for this risk allele. This increase was linked to the presence of amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS) and frontotemporal dementia (FTD), indicating a strong connection between this variant and neurodegenerative disease mechanisms.
title: Common ALS/FTD risk variants in UNC13A exacerbate its cryptic splicing and loss upon TDP-43 mislocalization

finding: The intronic SNP rs12608932, located 534 base pairs downstream of the donor splice site of the CE in UNC13A, also showed a significant association with increased CE levels in homozygous risk cases, thus suggesting that both this SNP and rs12973192 promote cryptic splicing of UNC13A transcripts. This alteration was correlated with an increased risk of ALS and FTD, providing insights into the genetic basis of these diseases.
title: Common ALS/FTD risk variants in UNC13A exacerbate its cryptic splicing and loss upon TDP-43 mislocalization

finding: This SNP was linked to the ASE of CD33, primarily in monocytes, confirming its role as a splicing variant affecting exon 2 of CD33.
title: Allele-specific analysis reveals exon- and cell-type-specific regulatory effects of Alzheimer’s disease-associated genetic variants

finding: rs429358, associated with the APOE ε4 variant, reduced APOE expression across all examined brain regions.
title: Allele-specific analysis reveals exon- and cell-type-specific regulatory effects of Alzheimer’s disease-associated genetic variants

finding: Associated with CD33 expression in monocytes, confirming its role in regulatory mechanisms previously identified.
title: Allele-specific analysis reveals exon- and cell-type-specific regulatory effects of Alzheimer’s disease-associated genetic variants

finding: Found significant linkage to CD33, reinforcing exonic influences in monocyte expression.
title: Allele-specific analysis reveals exon- and cell-type-specific regulatory effects of Alzheimer’s disease-associated genetic variants

finding: Found to be associated with protection from systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE) in UK families and in Finnish populations. The study revealed that this SNP promotes the inclusion of exon 8 in the TYK2 gene, impacting its functionality.
title: Two common disease-associated TYK2 variants impact exon splicing and TYK2 dosage

finding: Established as a non-synonymous variant causing an amino acid substitution (Val362Phe) in the TYK2 gene. It was associated with multiple autoimmune diseases, including SLE, psoriasis, and type 1 diabetes (T1D) in Caucasian populations. The study found that this SNP favors the inclusion of exon 8, essential for TYK2 binding to cytokine receptors, thereby impacting its role in autoimmune disease mechanisms.
title: Two common disease-associated TYK2 variants impact exon splicing and TYK2 dosage

finding: In the context of Alzheimer's disease, the rs429358 SNP is located within the APOE gene region and was associated with altered risk and phenotype expression in the derived astrocytes and microglia-like cells studied. The presence of the APOE ε4 allele, correlated with rs429358, has been widely recognized for its role in increasing the risk of Alzheimer's disease, influencing both inflammatory responses and amyloid-beta metabolism as observed in the cell types differentiated from PSEN2 (N141I) mutation bearing patients.
title: iPSC-Derived PSEN2 (N141I) Astrocytes and Microglia Exhibit a Primed Inflammatory Phenotype

finding: The rs7412 SNP, also located within the APOE gene, was shown to contribute to the risk factor landscape of Alzheimer's disease variants through its association with the production of different APOE isoforms. This SNP, along with rs429358, impacted the characteristics of the iPSC-derived astrocytes and microglia-like cells by modifying their inflammatory response and amyloid-beta handling, reflected in the exaggerated cytokine secretion profiles observed in the study.
title: iPSC-Derived PSEN2 (N141I) Astrocytes and Microglia Exhibit a Primed Inflammatory Phenotype

finding: The minor allele of SNP rs11668344 was associated with earlier age at menopause and increased age acceleration, as identified by Levine and colleagues in their study combining data from the Women's Health Initiative (WHI). This finding linked genetic variations directly to reproductive aging and biological age assessment.
title: Markers, Mechanisms and Metrics of Biological Aging: A Scoping Review

finding: The MBOAT7 rs641738 C>T variant was associated with increased NAFLD pathology, specifically leading to increased hepatic steatosis and fibrosis. This common polymorphism was identified as a loss-of-function variant that resulted in decreased MBOAT7 expression. It served as a genetic risk allele for NASH, confirming its critical role in the disease pathology.
title: Enhancing Hepatic MBOAT7 Expression Does Not Improve Nonalcoholic Steatohepatitis in Mice

finding: The rs58542926 C>T SNP in TM6SF2, leading to the E167K variant, demonstrated a strong association with decreased mitochondrial respiration and function in MASLD patients. Individuals with the TT genotype showed marked reductions in mitochondrial enzyme activities, notably in citrate synthase and complexes I and III, alongside increased oxidative stress indicators, contributing to MASLD pathology.
title: Serum mitochondrial bioenergetics as fingerprint of the hepatic one: how to monitor genetic MASLD

finding: The rs641738 C>T SNP in MBOAT7 was also confirmed as a key risk variant for MASLD. Individuals homozygous for the TT allele exhibited critical declines in mitochondrial bioenergetics and morphology, similar to those seen in carriers of multiple at-risk variants, reinforcing its role as a predictor of mitochondrial dysfunction and MASLD progression.
title: Serum mitochondrial bioenergetics as fingerprint of the hepatic one: how to monitor genetic MASLD

finding: A crucial SNP influencing APOE allele formation, this variant has strong associations with Alzheimer's disease and other cognitive and metabolic health issues.
title: Brain aging comprises multiple modes of structural and functional change with distinct genetic and biophysical associations

finding: Similarly, twins carrying the G allele of rs8103990, situated within ZNF729, also indicated higher liking for potato chips compared to individuals with the alternative allele, with statistically suggestive results reaching p < 1x10^-5.
title: Studies of human twins reveal genetic variation that affects dietary fat perception

finding: The rs429358 variant, located in the APOE gene on chromosome 19, showed significant associations with plasma Aβ1-42 levels (p=9.01×10^-13) and plasma Aβ1-42/Aβ1-40 ratio (p=6.46×10^-20). The minor allele, which denotes APOE ε4, was associated with lower levels of both plasma Aβ1-42 (effect size=-0.167 SD) and Aβ1-42/Aβ1-40 ratio (effect size=-0.212 SD). These findings were confirmed through the analysis of directly genotyped APOE ε4 status.
title: Plasma amyloid β levels are driven by genetic variants near APOE, BACE1, APP, PSEN2: A genome-wide association study in over 12,000 non-demented participants

finding: This SNP was part of the 2013 GWAS findings and was implicated in Alzheimer’s disease susceptibility.
title: Multi-Modal Data Analysis for Alzheimer’s Disease Diagnosis: An Ensemble Model Using Imagery and Genetic Features

finding: The polymorphism rs3746319, located in the KRAB-ZNF gene ZNF224, was found to have a significant association with global Alzheimer’s disease (AD) neuropathology and cognitive functions. This suggested that rs3746319 may influence intermediate phenotypes in the progression of AD, highlighting its relevance in neurodegenerative disease contexts.
title: Regulatory networks of KRAB zinc finger genes and transposable elements changed during human brain evolution and disease

finding: The rs10415488 variant C was identified as having a neuroprotective effect against early tau pathology in Alzheimer's disease. This variants presence was associated with lower levels of CSF P-tau181 and higher transcript abundance of PTPRS, revealing a correlation that indicated a significant protective role in males, delaying AD onset by about 10 months.
title: PTPRS is a novel marker for early tau pathology and synaptic integrity in Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The rs1064395 polymorphism in the human NCAN gene was identified as a genetic risk factor for bipolar disorder, particularly associated with the manic phenotype and schizophrenia. Research indicated that this SNP was correlated with slightly increased levels of Ncan and the neighboring gene HAPLN4 in the dorsolateral prefrontal cortex (PFC). Additionally, the risk variant's association with the manic phenotype mirrored behavioral outcomes seen in NCAN-deficient mice, suggesting a complex relationship where both increased and decreased Ncan levels could exert detrimental effects.
title: Neurocan regulates axon initial segment organization and neuronal activity in cultured cortical neurons

finding: An ACTN4 variant associated with reduced risk for cardiac disease in humans was reported, connecting to clinical outcomes related to heart failure.
title: A “non-muscle” α-actinin is an intrinsic component of the cardiac Z-disc and regulates sarcomere turnover, contractility, and heart remodeling

finding: The study found that carriers of the APOE e3/e4 allele, which was associated with the rs7412 SNP, showed variations in performance on the Path Integration (PI) task. This allele's influence reflected intricate interactions with age and gender, suggesting a role in spatial navigation abilities, a function tied to the entorhinal cortex.
title: Modeling the impact of genotype, age, sex, and continuous navigation on pathway integration performance

finding: Similar to rs7412, the rs429358 SNP, linked to the APOE e3/e4 allele, also demonstrated significant effects on PI task performance among participants. The variations observed in individuals carrying this allele underscored the impact of Alzheimer’s disease risk on cognitive functions related to navigation, indicating the relevance of the entorhinal cortex in these processes.
title: Modeling the impact of genotype, age, sex, and continuous navigation on pathway integration performance

finding: The rs429358 SNP, part of the Apolipoprotein E (APOE) gene, was associated with resilience to cognitive decline. In subjects with a higher cerebral amyloid burden, it was found that this SNP correlated with an increase in resilience (beta: .024 – .276; p: .000 – .036), suggesting that the presence of this allele may influence cognitive health despite amyloid presence.
title: Network efficiency predicts resilience to cognitive decline in elderly at risk for Alzheimer’s

finding: The rs7412 SNP, also associated with the APOE gene, showed a consistent finding in relation to cognitive decline resilience. Specifically, it related to lower levels of CSF tau in subjects, with associated beta values ranging from -.030 to -.074 (p: .015 – .002), indicating that this SNP may have a protective role in maintaining cognitive function in the presence of neurodegenerative changes.
title: Network efficiency predicts resilience to cognitive decline in elderly at risk for Alzheimer’s

finding: The SNP rs429358 was associated with the ApoE4 allele, which showed a significant role in Alzheimer's disease pathology, particularly in relation to decreased antioxidant defenses and increased oxidative damage in the brain.
title: Iron associated lipid peroxidation in Alzheimer’s disease is increased in lipid rafts with decreased ferroptosis suppressors, tested by chelation in mice

finding: The SNP rs7412 was related to the ApoE allele analysis and identified as a relevant genetic marker in Alzheimer's disease context, influencing brain iron metabolism and oxidative stress.
title: Iron associated lipid peroxidation in Alzheimer’s disease is increased in lipid rafts with decreased ferroptosis suppressors, tested by chelation in mice

finding: The SNP rs429358 was associated with hippocampal down-regulation neurofeedback performance. Specifically, carriers of the APOE-ε4 allele, which includes this SNP, demonstrated significant negative associations between their down-regulation performance and the presence of the allele. This finding indicated that those with the APOE-ε4 allele had less effective self-regulation capabilities in the hippocampus, which is relevant as hippocampal hyperactivity is an early marker of Alzheimer's disease.
title: The effect of APOE genotype and streamline density volume, on hippocampal CA1 down-regulation: a real-time fMRI virtual reality neurofeedback study

finding: Similar to rs429358, the SNP rs7412 was also linked to neurofeedback performance in the context of hippocampal function. Participants carrying the APOE-ε4 allele associated with this SNP exhibited poorer hippocampal down-regulation performance, highlighting the role of APOE genotyping in understanding memory function and Alzheimer's risk. This further substantiated the impact of the APOE genotype on cognitive performance in cognitively unimpaired individuals at risk for Alzheimer's disease.
title: The effect of APOE genotype and streamline density volume, on hippocampal CA1 down-regulation: a real-time fMRI virtual reality neurofeedback study

finding: The rs429358 SNP was associated with the presence of the epsilon 4 allele of Apolipoprotein E (APOE), which is a known risk factor for early Alzheimer's disease. The study noted that individuals possessing this allele faced a higher likelihood of cognitive decline and exhibited more severe neurofibrillary tau tangle deposition, particularly in contexts related to vascular contributions to cognitive impairments.
title: Alteration of perivascular spaces in early cognitive decline

finding: The rs7412 SNP was also identified as a defining SNP for the epsilon alleles of APOE. It was found that individuals with the epsilon 4 allele, characterized by this SNP, demonstrated altered perivascular space distribution in relation to early cognitive dysfunction, highlighting a potential genetic influence on neurodegeneration patterns observed in Alzheimer's disease.
title: Alteration of perivascular spaces in early cognitive decline

finding: The rs641738 variant of MBOAT7 was reported to increase inflammation and fibrosis in chronic hepatitis B, as demonstrated in a study published in 'Hepatology' in 2017. This variant also raised the risk of liver inflammation and progression to fibrosis in chronic hepatitis C, according to a 2016 publication in 'Nature Communications'. Furthermore, it was associated with an increased risk of nonalcoholic fatty liver disease in individuals of European descent, as noted in 'Gastroenterology' in the same year. Evidence from 'Journal of Hepatology' indicated that the rs641738 variant altered hepatic phosphatidylinositols, exacerbating the severity of non-alcoholic fatty liver disease. Finally, a 2017 study outlined an association between the rs641738 variant and hepatocellular carcinoma in non-cirrhotic individuals, supporting its role in liver pathology.
title: The structure, catalytic mechanism, and inhibitor identification of phosphatidylinositol remodeling MBOAT7

finding: The rs117385980 SNP, identified in the SIRT6 gene, had an original finding associated with longevity and healthy aging among Finnish men. This association suggested that genetic variations at this locus might influence the aging process, potentially impacting the regulation of lncRNAs and genomic stability in diseases like psoriasis.
title: The accumulation of lncRNAs in hybrid with DNA in patients with psoriasis reveals a decrease in the levels of RNase HII transcripts in the skin

finding: The SNP rs58542926, located in the TM6SF2 gene, was associated with significant impacts on lipid processing in the liver and small intestine, indicating its relevance in metabolic adaptations. This finding underscored its role in physiological changes that could be linked to the adaptive divergence of threespine sticklebacks in freshwater environments.
title: Evolution of spatial and temporal cis-regulatory divergence between marine and freshwater sticklebacks

finding: At the AK3 locus for Plt, the known causal missense variant rs7412 was captured only by FINEMAP-inf, indicating its association with platelet traits, while being in high linkage disequilibrium with rs1065853.
title: Improving fine-mapping by modeling infinitesimal effects

finding: The variant rs429358 was captured by SuSiE, SuSiE-inf, and FINEMAP-inf as a known causal variant at the AK3 locus, reinforcing its established role in influencing traits related to platelets.
title: Improving fine-mapping by modeling infinitesimal effects

finding: The rs6511720 locus was linked to Low-Density Lipoprotein (LDL) levels. This association was confirmed by several previous studies, highlighting its importance in cardiovascular risk assessment.
title: Leveraging allelic heterogeneity to increase power of association testing

finding: This SNP was associated with increased APOE expression specifically in microglia, which is linked to greater cerebral amyloid angiopathy but not with Alzheimer pathology. This finding accounted for the effect of the more well-known APOE ε4 variant.
title: Cell-subtype specific effects of genetic variation in the aging and Alzheimer cortex

finding: The study identified that carriers of the APOE e4 allele, determined by the SNP rs7412, were linked with significant declines in general cognitive ability, processing speed, and memory. These correlations emphasized the allele's role in cognitive aging during the 8th decade of life.
title: Three major dimensions of human brain cortical ageing in relation to cognitive decline across the 8th decade of life

finding: The SNP rs429358, also associated with the APOE e4 allele, demonstrated a similar pattern to rs7412, where individuals carrying this allele showed marked declines in cognitive functions such as processing speed and memory, further implicating the role of APOE genotypes in cortical atrophy and cognitive decline during aging.
title: Three major dimensions of human brain cortical ageing in relation to cognitive decline across the 8th decade of life

finding: The rs1985157 variant was robustly assigned to LRRC25 in association with neutrophil count and percentage, while it did not receive an assignment from coloc, demonstrating the effectiveness of TWAS methods over traditional approaches.
title: Transcriptome-wide association study in UK Biobank Europeans identifies associations with blood cell traits

finding: The study characterized the allelic variant rs429358 related to the APOE gene, revealing that individuals with the E4 allele (APOE4+) displayed a distinct risk pattern impacting white matter (WM) microstructure. Specifically, the presence of the E4 allele was linked to detrimental effects of LDL-cholesterol, correlating with cognitive performance in immediate memory.
title: Sex and APOE4-specific links between cardiometabolic risk factors and white matter alterations in individuals with a family history of Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The variant rs7412 was also examined in the context of APOE genotyping, showing that individuals carrying the E4 allele (APOE4+) experienced different risks associated with cardiometabolic factors. This SNP's association with cognitive decline and its interaction with cholesterol levels underscored its relevance in the pathology of Alzheimer's disease.
title: Sex and APOE4-specific links between cardiometabolic risk factors and white matter alterations in individuals with a family history of Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The rs7412 SNP (R158C) was introduced into the apolipoprotein E (APOE) transcript, which aimed to convert the neutral ε3 allele, common in approximately 78% of Caucasian carriers, into the protective ε2 allele. This transition was shown to significantly reduce the risk for atherosclerosis. Despite the non-preferred nature of the codon and the high GC content of the surrounding sequence, the editing yield achieved was 14%, and this still outperformed the editing efficiency of the Cas13 tool.
title: Precise and efficient C-to-U RNA Base Editing with SNAP-CDAR-S

finding: The SNP rs7412 at the APOE locus was significantly associated with biological age (ΔAge) with a p-value of 4.4×10^-33. This locus is known for its association with Alzheimer's disease and coronary heart disease, suggesting a link between aging and these health conditions.
title: A mathematical model that predicts human biological age from physiological traits identifies environmental and genetic factors that influence aging

finding: The risk allele rs492602 was noted for being a FUT2 variant in complete linkage disequilibrium with the null allele, conferring resistance to viral infections, supported by a selection estimate of 0.0015.
title: Genetic adaptation to pathogens and increased risk of inflammatory disorders in post-Neolithic Europe

finding: Finally, the TYK2 P1104A variant (rs34536443) was included among negatively selected variants, underscoring evolutionary pressures acting on genes associated with immunity.
title: Genetic adaptation to pathogens and increased risk of inflammatory disorders in post-Neolithic Europe

finding: The SNP rs429358 was targeted in the editing of cell lines to create isogenic cells with genotypes associated with different risks for Alzheimer’s disease (AD). Specifically, the aims included obtaining homozygous states for both APOE-ε4 (C/C) and APOE-ε3 (T/T) from the iPSC line BIONi010-C. While the intended edits were validated, the unintended insertion affecting the haplotype associated with APOE-ε4 (C) went undetected using standard validation methods, demonstrating the limitations of conventional approaches in identifying larger unintended edits.
title: Verification of CRISPR editing by Xdrop™ Indirect Sequence Capture followed by short- and long- read sequencing

finding: The SNP rs7412 was also targeted during the CRISPR-Cas9 editing of cell lines derived from BIONi010-C. The editing aimed to modify this SNP to create homozygous states in cell lines linked to different risks of sporadic Alzheimer’s disease (AD). Although the editing was reported as successful, an unnoticed insertion in the allele related to the APOE-ε4 haplotype (C/C) compromised the validation process, revealing challenges in assessing heterozygous versus homozygous states when using standard methodologies.
title: Verification of CRISPR editing by Xdrop™ Indirect Sequence Capture followed by short- and long- read sequencing

finding: The SNP rs139412173 located on chromosome 19 also colocalized with retinal edQTLs implicated in MacTel, potentially influencing the function of the <italic>CERS4</italic> protein involved in ceramide synthesis.
title: The retinal RNA editome is concentrated in photoreceptor-specific genes and genetically linked to vision loss

finding: The SNP rs429358 conferred the largest risk effect for Alzheimer’s disease (AD) when analyzed through the genotyping data from various consumer genomics services. Both 23AndMe and Gencove indicated higher genetic risks associated with one minor allele of rs429358, while AncestryDNA reported two reference alleles without indicating elevated risk.
title: Genotype Concordance and Polygenic Risk Score Estimation across Consumer Genetic Testing Data

finding: SNP rs7412 was utilized alongside rs429358 to determine APOE genotype. 23andMe and Gencove reported two reference alleles, suggesting the individual was likely APOE ε3/ε4. However, AncestryDNA reported a missing genotype for rs7412.
title: Genotype Concordance and Polygenic Risk Score Estimation across Consumer Genetic Testing Data

finding: The SNP rs58542926 was associated with liver fat levels and had a highly significant p-value of 8.8×10−113 in the genome-wide association study. It was mapped to the gene CD99, which is linked to inflammatory processes and cancer, thus indicating its importance in metabolic associated liver disease (MAFLD) progression.
title: The role of liver fat in cardiometabolic diseases is highlighted by genome-wide association study of MRI-derived measures of body composition

finding: The SNP rs2304205 was identified as the most plausible causal variant in a credible set associated with Schizophrenia (SCZ). This SNP showed high MetaChrom scores across almost all cell types examined in both fetal and adult stages, highlighting its regulatory potential. rs2304205 is located in the UTR regions of the genes IRF3 and BCL2L12, with IRF3 identified as the likely target gene, indicating its importance as a SCZ risk gene involved in neuronal progenitor cell development.
title: Predicting Epigenomic Functions of Genetic Variants in the Context of Neurodevelopment via Deep Transfer Learning

finding: The SNP rs641738 was identified as a significant genetic variant that increased the risk of developing nonalcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD) specifically in individuals of European descent. This finding was reported by Mancina et al. in 2016, highlighting its potential relevance in understanding the genetic predisposition to metabolic liver diseases such as MASLD.
title: MegaMASLD: An interactive platform for exploring stratified transcriptomic signatures in MASLD progression

finding: The ERCC1 rs11615 polymorphism was found to be associated with grade 1 neuropathy in CRC patients treated with oxaliplatin, suggesting a predictive value for platinum toxicity.
title: Pharmacogenomics, biomarker network and allele frequencies in colorectal cancer

finding: The ERCC2 (XPD) rs13181 polymorphism was associated with treatment effectiveness in CRC, indicating its importance in predicting therapeutic responses.
title: Pharmacogenomics, biomarker network and allele frequencies in colorectal cancer

finding: The XRCC1 variant rs25487 was suggested to affect DNA repair efficiency, potentially influencing the efficacy of oxaliplatin treatment in CRC.
title: Pharmacogenomics, biomarker network and allele frequencies in colorectal cancer

finding: The rs429358 SNP was associated with chronic pain phenotypes, particularly showing significant p-values for pain sites such as back pain (p=3.1×10⁻⁷) and knee pain (p=3.2×10⁻²), based on haplotypic effects from the APOE gene, which was found to have increased expression in microglia at chronic time points after nerve injury.
title: Single-cell RNA sequencing reveals time- and sex-specific responses of spinal cord microglia to peripheral nerve injury and links ApoE to neuropathic pain

finding: The rs7412 SNP, part of the APOE haplotypes, demonstrated significant associations with neurogenic pain conditions. Its association was evaluated in meta-analyses showing significant p-values across various chronic pain states, such as neuropathic pain (p=6.4×10⁻⁵) and the combined pain states (p=4.5×10⁻³), correlated with microglial changes noted in gender-specific responses to nerve injury.
title: Single-cell RNA sequencing reveals time- and sex-specific responses of spinal cord microglia to peripheral nerve injury and links ApoE to neuropathic pain

finding: The rs641738 SNP near the MBOAT7 gene was linked with increased susceptibility to advanced liver diseases including non-alcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD), alcohol-associated liver disease (ALD), and liver fibrosis, especially in individuals chronically infected with hepatitis B and C viruses.
