It was found that individuals carrying the T-allele of this SNP had significantly reduced circulating levels of the metabolic product of MBOAT7 (PI 38:4) and demonstrated enhanced ethanol-induced hepatic steatosis in mouse models. This variant has also been associated with liver inflammation and transition to fibrosis in chronic hepatitis infections.
title: Membrane Bound O-Acyltransferase 7 (MBOAT7) Shapes Lysosomal Lipid Homeostasis and Function to Control Alcohol-Associated Liver Injury

finding: This SNP was positively associated with the risk of low grade prostate cancer in GERA, indicating its relationship with lower Gleason score.
title: Pan-Cancer Study Detects Novel Genetic Risk Variants and Shared Genetic Basis in Two Large Cohorts

finding: The SNP rs74956940 was located within the PTGER1 gene, which regulates urine osmotic pressure, thereby impacting nephrolithiasis risk.
title: GWAS identifies nine nephrolithiasis susceptibility loci related with metabolic metabolic and crystallization pathways

finding: The SNP rs4897946 was associated with the family Barnesiellaceae in the discovery sample, showing a nominal significance level (beta=-3.81×10^-4, P=1.96×10^-3). This SNP is located in the intron region of the MIER2 gene on chromosome 19, indicating its potential role in the gut microbiota's influence on trunk fat mass.
title: Mendelian randomization analysis revealed causal effects from gut microbiota to abdominal obesity

finding: The intronic SNP rs10401969, located in the gene SUGP1 on chromosome 19p13.11, was associated with vascular atherogenic traits and triglyceride levels. Functional characterization of zebrafish orthologues for this locus revealed that the prioritized gene LPAR2 played a role in cholesterol metabolism and early-stage atherosclerosis, while GATAD2A was also implicated in cholesterol metabolism. Mutations in the lpar2a gene resulted in lower triglyceride and cholesterol levels but paradoxically increased early-stage atherosclerosis, possibly due to higher lysophosphatidic acid levels influencing vascular inflammation. This is in contrast to findings from Tm6sf2-deficient mice that showed reduced atherosclerosis.
title: Zebrafish larvae as a model system for systematic characterization of drugs and genes in dyslipidemia and atherosclerosis

finding: The rs7412 SNP was associated with the APOE gene's e4 allele, which is known to influence cognitive decline and brain atrophy in ageing populations. The study characterized brain cortical ageing across the 8th decade of life and found critical connections between APOE e4 status and cognitive performance, particularly in processing speed and memory.
title: Three major dimensions of human brain cortical ageing in relation to cognitive decline across the 8th decade of life

finding: The rs429358 SNP was also linked to the APOE e4 allele. Similar to rs7412, this finding underlined its involvement in the modulation of cognitive decline and the extent of brain atrophy with age. The correlation was particularly relevant in the context of longitudinal changes in cognitive ability.
title: Three major dimensions of human brain cortical ageing in relation to cognitive decline across the 8th decade of life

finding: The SNP rs7412 was analyzed in the context of Apolipoprotein-E (APOE) genotyping, which identified that individuals with the APOE4 genotype may have distinctive features in brain connectivity. This finding related to structural brain hubs, particularly a hub in the right paracentral lobule, identified in high-risk groups for Alzheimer's Disease (AD).
title: Dementia risk factors modify hubs but leave other connectivity measures unchanged in asymptomatic individuals: a graph theoretical analysis

finding: The SNP rs429358 was also examined through APOE genotyping. The presence of the APOE4 allele associated with this SNP was linked to the identification of a structural hub in the right paracentral lobule in high-risk individuals. This result highlighted its relevance as a potential early biomarker of cognitive decline and AD progression.
title: Dementia risk factors modify hubs but leave other connectivity measures unchanged in asymptomatic individuals: a graph theoretical analysis

finding: SNP rs405509 was noted for its regulation of the APOE gene's transcriptional activity. The interaction of this genotype with age displayed modulation of cortical thickness, including the paracentral lobule, indicating its role in risk profiling for cognitive decline. The aberrant structural connectivity associated with this polymorphism was linked to early signs of cognitive issues.
title: Dementia risk factors modify hubs but leave other connectivity measures unchanged in asymptomatic individuals: a graph theoretical analysis

finding: The SNP rs6857 at the APOE locus was significantly associated with inferred disease stage in the Mayo Clinic cohort, with a p-value of 9.18 x 10^-6. This variant is known for its established role in the pathogenesis of LOAD.
title: Molecular estimation of neurodegeneration pseudotime in older brains

finding: rs429358 was associated with the APOE gene which exhibited regulatory evidence involving a CpG island, histone modifications, promoter, and promoter flanking regions, indicating its critical role in Alzheimer's disease (AD) pathobiology.
title: A Network-based Deep Learning Framework Catalyzes GWAS and Multi-Omics Findings to Biology and Drug Repurposing for Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: rs7412 was found to have regulatory evidence related to the APOE gene, specifically within a CpG island, highlighting its relevance in the risk of developing Alzheimer's disease.
title: A Network-based Deep Learning Framework Catalyzes GWAS and Multi-Omics Findings to Biology and Drug Repurposing for Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: rs405509 was linked to histone modifications associated with the APOE gene, underscoring its involvement in Alzheimer's disease risk through gene regulation.
title: A Network-based Deep Learning Framework Catalyzes GWAS and Multi-Omics Findings to Biology and Drug Repurposing for Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: rs769449 was associated with the APOE gene, showing regulatory evidence from promoter and histone modifications which are integral to Alzheimer's disease mechanisms.
title: A Network-based Deep Learning Framework Catalyzes GWAS and Multi-Omics Findings to Biology and Drug Repurposing for Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: rs75627662 was connected to APOE gene's promoter flanking region, indicating its role in the regulation of Alzheimer's disease related pathways.
title: A Network-based Deep Learning Framework Catalyzes GWAS and Multi-Omics Findings to Biology and Drug Repurposing for Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: rs28469095 was associated with the MARK4 gene through a CpG island, enhancing its potential as a risk factor in Alzheimer's disease.
title: A Network-based Deep Learning Framework Catalyzes GWAS and Multi-Omics Findings to Biology and Drug Repurposing for Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: rs12463049 was linked to the MARK4 gene found at a CTCF binding site, suggesting regulatory implications for Alzheimer's disease.
title: A Network-based Deep Learning Framework Catalyzes GWAS and Multi-Omics Findings to Biology and Drug Repurposing for Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: rs536518226 was associated with the MARK4 gene as an enhancer, indicating its relevance in Alzheimer's disease risk.
title: A Network-based Deep Learning Framework Catalyzes GWAS and Multi-Omics Findings to Biology and Drug Repurposing for Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: rs8100183 was linked to the MARK4 gene, showcasing its connection to eQTLs and potential actions in Alzheimer's disease.
title: A Network-based Deep Learning Framework Catalyzes GWAS and Multi-Omics Findings to Biology and Drug Repurposing for Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: rs9653111 showed association with the MARK4 gene involving histone modifications, emphasizing its significance in Alzheimer's disease pathways.
title: A Network-based Deep Learning Framework Catalyzes GWAS and Multi-Omics Findings to Biology and Drug Repurposing for Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: rs10421247 was associated with histone modifications influencing MARK4, reinforcing its role in Alzheimer's disease regulatory networks.
title: A Network-based Deep Learning Framework Catalyzes GWAS and Multi-Omics Findings to Biology and Drug Repurposing for Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: rs138137383 was linked to the regulatory features of MARK4, particularly at promoter flanking regions, indicating implications for Alzheimer's disease.
title: A Network-based Deep Learning Framework Catalyzes GWAS and Multi-Omics Findings to Biology and Drug Repurposing for Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: This known causal missense variant was detected by FINEMAP-inf in the presence of low-complexity regions and corroborated findings when methods did not account for LCR.
title: Improving fine-mapping by modeling infinitesimal effects

finding: This variant was identified by SuSiE, SuSiE-inf, and FINEMAP-inf, confirming its status as a known causal variant for the trait LDLC.
title: Improving fine-mapping by modeling infinitesimal effects

finding: rs4420638 was significantly associated with C-reactive protein levels in the East Asian and Hispanic and Latin American ancestry cohorts.
title: Redefining replication in multi-ancestry genome-wide association studies

finding: rs1613662 was previously associated with mean platelet volume in a European cohort and was analyzed in the context of platelet count within African-American and East Asian ancestry cohorts.
title: Redefining replication in multi-ancestry genome-wide association studies

finding: This FUT6 variant caused a substitution from glutamic acid (E) to lysine (K), resulting in a full-length, but inactive enzyme.
title: Same role but different actors: genetic regulation of post-translational modification of two distinct proteins

finding: The variant rs7412, a missense variant in APOE, was associated with low-density lipoprotein (LDL) levels in Korea4K, displaying a significant association with a P-value of 2.86 x 10^-14. This association is well-established regarding its link to cholesterol levels, highlighting its relevance in the new findings of Korea4K.
title: Korea4K: whole genome sequences of 4,157 Koreans with 107 phenotypes derived from extensive health check-ups

finding: The SNP rs25672 was identified as a coding SNP associated with the SF3A2 locus, in strong linkage disequilibrium (LD) with the sentinel SNP rs2159213 (r² = 0.737675). It suggested a potential correlation with increased hemoglobin levels among MDS patients, albeit with an insignificant association due to limited patient cohorts. This finding indicated that variations at the SF3A2 locus could influence hemoglobin levels in individuals with myelodysplastic syndromes (MDS).
title: Gene-Centric Functional Dissection of Human Genetic Variation Uncovers Regulators of Hematopoiesis

finding: Influenced participant secretor status, this SNP's effect was shown in individuals who produce antigens at the <italic>ABO</italic> locus; taxa associations were significant only in secretors.
title: Effect of host genetics on the gut microbiome in 7,738 participants of the Dutch Microbiome Project

finding: This SNP was linked to the POU2F2 gene and associated with the promoter of PHGDH in PrCa with a low p-value of 3.80e-8, suggesting its involvement in enhancing cancer processes.
title: Reconstructing protein interactions at enhancer-promoter regions in prostate cancer

finding: The SNP rs7412 was associated with the determination of APOE genotypes, specifically identifying the presence of the ε4 allele which is linked to an increased risk for Alzheimer's Disease (AD). This identification was part of a broader analysis where individuals were assessed for genetic predispositions related to AD.
title: Dementia risk factors modify hubs but leave other connectivity measures unchanged in asymptomatic individuals: a graph theoretical analysis

finding: SNP rs429358 was also linked to the APOE genotype determination, helping to ascertain the ε4 allele's presence. The presence of this allele has been established as a significant genetic risk factor for Alzheimer’s Disease, particularly in asymptomatic individuals when associated with family history and central obesity.
title: Dementia risk factors modify hubs but leave other connectivity measures unchanged in asymptomatic individuals: a graph theoretical analysis

finding: The SNP rs405509 was discussed in relation to its role in modulating cortical thickness and structural brain connectivity among aging subjects. It regulated transcriptional activity of the APOE gene and was associated with structural brain changes in individuals with high genetic risk for AD, thereby indicating its relevance as a genetic marker in studies focusing on Alzheimer’s Disease progression.
title: Dementia risk factors modify hubs but leave other connectivity measures unchanged in asymptomatic individuals: a graph theoretical analysis

finding: The SNP rs6857 at the APOE locus was found to be significantly associated with inferred disease stage among the Mayo Clinic cohort, with a p-value of 9.18 × 10<sup>−6</sup>. This SNP is a known variant related to LOAD.
title: Molecular estimation of neurodegeneration pseudotime in older brains

finding: The G allele of rs11540855 was functionally validated as preferentially bound by hsa-miR-4707-3p, which resulted in decreased luciferase activity and reduced ABHD8 protein levels in the breast cancer cell line MCF116. This SNP was also in high linkage disequilibrium (LD) with rs8170, associated with breast cancer risk in BRCA1 mutation carriers.
title: Allele-specific miRNA-binding analysis identifies candidate target genes for breast cancer risk

finding: Located in the 3'UTR of ABHD8, the reference C allele of rs4808616 was predicted to bind hsa-miR-7705 preferentially while being the less expressed allele, suggesting a possible mechanism of increased BC risk through lower expression of ABHD8.
title: Allele-specific miRNA-binding analysis identifies candidate target genes for breast cancer risk

finding: The SNP rs12608932 was associated with increased risk of sporadic ALS and shorter survival in ALS patients. It was located in the same intron as a cryptic exon in UNC13A, and its presence was linked to the inclusion of the cryptic exon in UNC13A mRNA, especially upon loss of TDP-43 function.
title: TDP-43 represses cryptic exon inclusion in FTD/ALS gene UNC13A

finding: The SNP rs12973192, located within the cryptic exon of UNC13A, demonstrated a significant association with increased cryptic exon inclusion when TDP-43 was depleted. Patients homozygous for the risk allele showed almost complete inclusion of the cryptic exon in UNC13A mRNA.
title: TDP-43 represses cryptic exon inclusion in FTD/ALS gene UNC13A

finding: The variant rs35033974 was identified as associated with TEX101-protein interactions in a study involving human spermatozoa. This missense variant led to specific proteomic changes that were quantitatively measured, highlighting its impact on reproductive biology and potentially influencing fertility outcomes.
title: The proteomic toolbox for identification, quantification, and characterization of polyclonal antibodies

finding: The A allele at rs12462018 increased the dexamethasone suppressive effect on expression of the IRF3 gene in B cells treated with PHA+DEX. IRF3 is a transcription factor involved in type I interferon signaling, previously implicated in systemic lupus erythematosus.
title: Genetic control of the dynamic transcriptional response to immune stimuli and glucocorticoids at single cell resolution

finding: The SNP rs3865444 located in the CD33 locus was reported to be genome-wide significant in the context of late-onset Alzheimer's Disease (LOAD), with an OR of 0.92 and a p-value of 3.61 x 10^-8, showcasing its relevance in AD pathology.
title: Genome-wide association analysis of dementia and its clinical endophenotypes reveal novel loci associated with Alzheimer’s disease and three causality networks of AD: the GR@ACE project

finding: The APOE SNP rs429358 was the only marker to show genome-wide significant association with Alzheimer's Disease in the GR@ACE study. It had an OR of 2.27 and a highly significant p-value of 1.25 x 10^-62, establishing its critical role in AD susceptibility.
title: Genome-wide association analysis of dementia and its clinical endophenotypes reveal novel loci associated with Alzheimer’s disease and three causality networks of AD: the GR@ACE project

finding: The study identified SNP rs1077667 as significantly associated with multiple sclerosis and found increased accessibility and contact with the promoters of the GPR108 and TRIP10 genes at 8 hours post T cell activation. These genes were also found to be increased in expression at this time point.
title: Chromatin conformation dynamics during CD4+ T cell activation implicates autoimmune disease-associated genes and regulatory elements

finding: A significant finding was that rs7412, associated with the APOE E2 allele, had a Gencall genotype concordance rate of 90% with imputed genotypes and 85% with WGS genotypes. This indicated a reliable match for the SNP, contrasting with other SNPs that exhibited lower concordance, thus supporting its use in neurodegenerative disease research.
title: Cluster Buster: A Machine Learning Algorithm for Genotyping SNPs from Raw Data

finding: For rs429358, associated with the APOE E4 allele, the analysis revealed a Gencall genotype concordance rate of 78.9% with imputed genotypes and 68.8% with WGS genotypes. These low concordance rates between predicted genotypes and actual genotypes highlighted potential issues in genotyping accuracy, emphasizing the need for advanced imputation methods or whole-genome sequencing for accurate results.
title: Cluster Buster: A Machine Learning Algorithm for Genotyping SNPs from Raw Data

finding: The rs429358 SNP was analyzed as part of the APOE gene, specifically affecting the transition from the APOEε3 to the APOEε4 allele, resulting in an amino acid change from cysteine at position 130 to arginine. This allele was linked to the greatest genetic risk factor for Late Onset Alzheimer's Disease (LOAD) and vascular dementia.
title: APOEε3/ε4 and APOEε4/ε4 genotypes drive unique gene signatures in the cortex of young mice

finding: The rs7412 SNP was implicated in specifying the APOEε4 risk allele, contributing to arginine at amino acid position 176. This SNP was connected to increased risk for LOAD and was characterized alongside rs429358 to confirm the complete target replacement in APOEε4/ε4 mice.
title: APOEε3/ε4 and APOEε4/ε4 genotypes drive unique gene signatures in the cortex of young mice

finding: This SNP, a proxy for the FUT1/FUT2 locus, was positively associated with fish intake and negatively associated with conditions like cholelithiasis and Crohn’s disease.
title: Genetics of human gut microbiome composition

finding: The rs429358 SNP, associated with the APOE gene, was analyzed in the context of Alzheimer's Disease (AD). Genotyping using specific primer/probe combinations confirmed the presence of APOE alleles. Although the study did not show a direct association between HSV infection and aberrant amyloid beta or phosphorylated tau expression, the presence of this SNP in AD patients highlighted its relevance in understanding the genetic predisposition to Alzheimer's.
title: No evidence for aberrant expression of amyloid β and phosphorylated tau proteins in herpes simplex virus-infected human neurons in vivo

finding: Similar to rs429358, the rs7412 SNP was part of the APOE genotyping conducted for AD patients. The investigation revealed that while APOE allele variations were confirmed through PCR and Sanger sequencing, the study did not establish a direct link between HSV infection and alterations in Alzheimer's related pathology such as amyloid beta accumulations or tau phosphorylation.
title: No evidence for aberrant expression of amyloid β and phosphorylated tau proteins in herpes simplex virus-infected human neurons in vivo

finding: Located ~300bp upstream of GIPC1, the rs3760702 SNP was identified as a contributing factor to nephrolithiasis via its involvement in CaSR signaling pathways.
title: Genetic variants of calcium and vitamin D metabolism in kidney stone disease

finding: The SNP rs35033974 was related to a missense variant associated with TEX101, which was implicated in the identification of proteins linked to human spermatozoa. The study highlighted how homozygous subjects for the variant displayed altered protein interaction profiles, suggesting a functional impact of the SNP on TEX101-related pathways in reproductive biology.
title: Mapping Isoform Abundance and Interactome of the Endogenous TMPRSS2-ERG Fusion Protein with Orthogonal Immunoprecipitation-Mass Spectrometry Assays

finding: The SNP rs117961479 was significantly associated with CHOL in the GWAS, showing a genome-wide significant signal with a P-value of 1.5×10^-9 in the HCHS/SoL cohort. It was classified as a rare variant in European, African, and East Asian populations but was common in Hispanic populations (MAF = 0.060). This association is also independent of nearby genetic variants.
title: Genetically regulated gene expression underlies lipid traits in Hispanic cohorts

finding: The SNP rs17766692 was identified as a novel SNP that exhibited high correlation with previously documented lipid associations. It is an intronic variant of DOCK6, which is a gene previously implicated in lipid traits.
title: Genetically regulated gene expression underlies lipid traits in Hispanic cohorts

finding: The rs429358 SNP was associated with the presence of the APOE ε4 allele, which is a genetic risk factor for Alzheimer's disease (AD). Its presence correlated with increased susceptibility to cognitive decline and symptoms of AD due to its role in β-amyloid peptide metabolism.
title: Distinct effects of amyloid and tau deposition on eigenvector centrality during hippocampal down-regulation: a real-time fMRI virtual reality closed-loop neurofeedback study with CSF biomarkers

finding: The rs7412 SNP was identified as part of the genetic analysis for APOE alleles, specifically correlating with the APOE ε2 allele. Individuals carrying this variant exhibited a lower risk for Alzheimer's disease, contrasting with the effect of rs429358. This finding contributed to understanding the genetic predisposition to AD.
title: Distinct effects of amyloid and tau deposition on eigenvector centrality during hippocampal down-regulation: a real-time fMRI virtual reality closed-loop neurofeedback study with CSF biomarkers

finding: The variant rs641738 in MBOAT7 was found to associate positively with all-cause cirrhosis in the UK Biobank, exhibiting greater statistical significance with all-cause cirrhosis as compared to alcoholic or non-alcoholic subtypes.
title: A missense variant in Mitochondrial Amidoxime Reducing Component 1 gene and protection against liver disease

finding: The SNP rs3746319, located within the KRAB-ZNF gene ZNF224, demonstrated a significant association with global Alzheimer’s disease (AD) neuropathology and cognitive functions. This indicated that the polymorphism could influence intermediate phenotypes in the progression of AD, highlighting its relevance in the context of neurodegeneration.
title: Regulatory networks of KRAB zinc finger genes and transposable elements changed during human brain evolution and disease

finding: This SNP was identified in the MAP1S locus and was determined to be associated with regulatory effects on gene expression in vascular smooth muscle cells (SMCs). It was part of a total of 49 prioritized CAD-associated variants found through various assays, including CRISPR interference, where it showed a significant influence on the expression of nearby genes.
title: Comprehensive identification of coronary artery disease-associated variants regulating vascular smooth muscle cell gene expression

finding: The missense variant rs4760 was the most significant <italic>trans</italic> association, affecting the level of TNFRSF10C (MAF = 0.18, P = 4.60 × 10^-56).
title: Genetic determinants of plasma protein levels in the Estonian population

finding: The intronic variant rs56075200 showed one independent <italic>trans</italic> signal affecting IL27 protein levels (MAF = 0.32, P = 8.62 × 10^-35).
title: Genetic determinants of plasma protein levels in the Estonian population

finding: The missense variant rs7412 was associated with a significant number of metabolite traits and presented with a <italic>trans</italic> association for LDLR levels.
title: Genetic determinants of plasma protein levels in the Estonian population

finding: The variant rs10415777 had the most histone modification associations among pQTLs, being related to OSCAR protein levels.
title: Genetic determinants of plasma protein levels in the Estonian population

finding: This SNP, rs7246757, colocalized in CD14+ monocytes of acute COVID-19 patients for hospitalization due to severe COVID-19. The gene SNRPD2, associated with this variant, serves as a protein-protein interaction hub gene, indicating its relevance in the context of SARS-CoV-2 infection.
title: Widespread gene-environment interactions shape the immune response to SARS-CoV-2 infection in hospitalized COVID-19 patients

finding: This SNP was associated with longevity by carrying the beneficial allele T, which had a complex relationship with type 2 diabetes risk and was linked to Alzheimer’s disease risk through the alternative allele C.
title: A joint analysis of longevity and age-related disease variants for gene expression association

finding: Identified as associated with longevity by carrying the allele A, this SNP had a notable association with increased risk for Alzheimer’s disease and age-related macular degeneration through the alternative allele G.
title: A joint analysis of longevity and age-related disease variants for gene expression association

finding: The G allele of rs67397200 was associated with increased breast and ovarian cancer risk. This allele correlated with higher expression of the ANKLE1 gene in breast tissue. The genetic colocalization analysis suggested that ANKLE1 expression and breast cancer GWAS were linked and likely shared a single causal variant, supporting the conclusion that ANKLE1 was a causal cancer susceptibility gene within the chr19p13.1 locus.
title: ANKLE1 cleaves mitochondrial DNA and contributes to cancer risk by driving the Warburg effect and apoptosis resistance

finding: SNP rs8108632 was associated with the lncRNA 37844.7 located in the TGFB1 gene, which overlaps with this SNP and indicates its potential regulatory role, especially in the context of pro-differentiation traits.
title: LncRNA de novo discovery reveals noncoding RNAs as major molecular mechanism associating coronary artery disease GWAS variants with causal genes to confer disease risk

finding: The polymorphism rs12979860 was associated with the clearance of hepatitis C virus and other RNA viruses targeting the upper respiratory system. The T allele was overexpressed in COVID-19 patients, suggesting its potential as a risk factor for COVID-19.
title: Semantic and population analysis of the genetic targets related to COVID-19 and its association with genes and diseases

finding: In the SULT2A1 gene, rs2547235 demonstrated an association with 5alpha-androstan-3beta, linking it to steroid metabolism.
title: Genetic Architecture and Analysis Practices of Circulating Metabolites in the NHLBI Trans-Omics for Precision Medicine (TOPMed) Program

finding: This SNP was involved in the association with Cer 18:1;O2/24:0 in the SUGP1 gene, linking it to lipid metabolism.
title: Genetic Architecture and Analysis Practices of Circulating Metabolites in the NHLBI Trans-Omics for Precision Medicine (TOPMed) Program

finding: The SNP rs66528626 was associated with serum albumin levels (P=4.00×10^-9). A 55-bp duplication at locus 19q13.11 was identified in strong LD with this SNP, implicating the duplication as a relevant variant affecting serum albumin levels.
title: Structural variation across 138,134 samples in the TOPMed consortium

finding: SNP rs445925, located on ApoC1, was identified as having the smallest SCAMPI p-value among the analyzed SNPs, indicating a significant association with lipid-related traits.
title: SCAMPI: A scalable statistical framework for genome-wide interaction testing harnessing cross-trait correlations

finding: SNP rs2228603, associated with NCAN, was detected by SCAMPI based on its correlation with BMI and triglycerides, showing significant p-values (<10^-8), although it was not associated with the variance of either trait.
title: SCAMPI: A scalable statistical framework for genome-wide interaction testing harnessing cross-trait correlations

finding: The SNP rs58542926 located in TM6SF2 was similarly found to be significantly associated with the correlation of BMI and triglycerides but was not linked to the variance of either trait. Prior studies suggest it is a risk allele related to liver inflammation and fibrosis.
title: SCAMPI: A scalable statistical framework for genome-wide interaction testing harnessing cross-trait correlations

finding: SNP rs10415849 associated with GATAD2A was linked to the correlation of BMI and triglycerides (p <10^-8) and had implications in modifying BMI through its interaction with biological sex, though it did not show variance association.
title: SCAMPI: A scalable statistical framework for genome-wide interaction testing harnessing cross-trait correlations

finding: SNP rs519113, associated with BCL3-PVRL2-TOMM40, indicated potential gene-gene and gene-environment interactions on dyslipidemia, which is characterized by changes in HDL metabolism.
title: SCAMPI: A scalable statistical framework for genome-wide interaction testing harnessing cross-trait correlations

finding: Like rs519113, SNP rs6859 was associated with gene interactions affecting dyslipidemia, showing the role of this SNP in lipid metabolism processes.
title: SCAMPI: A scalable statistical framework for genome-wide interaction testing harnessing cross-trait correlations

finding: SNP rs440446, belonging to the APOE gene region, was analyzed along with other APOE SNPs, confirming its relevance to lipid traits after additional SCAMPI analysis.
title: SCAMPI: A scalable statistical framework for genome-wide interaction testing harnessing cross-trait correlations

finding: SNP rs769449 was one of the APOE SNPs adjusted in the analyses, further affirming its significance in the context of lipid metabolism traits.
title: SCAMPI: A scalable statistical framework for genome-wide interaction testing harnessing cross-trait correlations

finding: Similarly, SNP rs769450 from the APOE region was included in the analysis; its involvement highlights the interplay between APOE and lipid-related traits.
title: SCAMPI: A scalable statistical framework for genome-wide interaction testing harnessing cross-trait correlations

finding: The SNP rs429358, also part of the APOE region, was significant in previous studies, thus its analysis supported the understanding of genetic influences on lipid metrics.
title: SCAMPI: A scalable statistical framework for genome-wide interaction testing harnessing cross-trait correlations

finding: SNP rs7412, another APOE-associated SNP, passed SNP-level quality control, affirming its established relevance in lipid trait associations.
title: SCAMPI: A scalable statistical framework for genome-wide interaction testing harnessing cross-trait correlations

finding: The SNP rs55791371, located in an intergenic region near LDLR, had the lowest p-value in adjusted SCAMPI analyses following APOE conditioning, indicating its potential impact on lipid traits.
title: SCAMPI: A scalable statistical framework for genome-wide interaction testing harnessing cross-trait correlations

finding: The rs429358 SNP, a missense mutation in the APOE gene, was associated with lower participation rates in mental health surveys. Specifically, the presence of the rs429358-C allele correlated with a reduced likelihood of participation in the Mental Health Questionnaire (MHQ), having an odds ratio of 1.029 per additional ε4 copy. This finding was significant in the context of higher educational attainment and better health outcomes, indicating potential genetic selection biases in study cohorts.
title: Factors associated with sharing email information and mental health survey participation in large population cohorts

finding: The rs1054221 variant was associated with lower circulating levels of GDF15 in the non-pregnant state with a beta estimate of -0.34 (95% CI[-0.36, -0.31]). This SNP was found to be part of the two common haplotypes that predispose to hyperemesis gravidarum (HG). Furthermore, it was shown to influence the risk of HG in log-odds.
title: Fetally-encoded GDF15 and maternal GDF15 sensitivity are major determinants of nausea and vomiting in human pregnancy

finding: The rs45543339 variant negatively affected the levels of GDF15, with a beta estimate of -0.34 (95% CI[-0.36, -0.32]). It contributed to the strongest genome-wide association with HG, leading to reduced circulating GDF15 in the non-pregnant state, and was also associated with an increased risk of developing HG.
title: Fetally-encoded GDF15 and maternal GDF15 sensitivity are major determinants of nausea and vomiting in human pregnancy

finding: The rs1227731 variant was identified as having a colocalizing signal that was associated with two independent signals present at the GDF15 locus. The findings indicated that this variant corresponded to an increased risk of HG through association with reduced GDF15 in the non-pregnant state.
title: Fetally-encoded GDF15 and maternal GDF15 sensitivity are major determinants of nausea and vomiting in human pregnancy

finding: The rare C211G variant (rs372120002) was reported to significantly impair the secretion of GDF15 and was linked to low circulating levels in non-pregnant women. It was associated with a notable predisposition to HG, particularly when the fetus was wild-type.
title: Fetally-encoded GDF15 and maternal GDF15 sensitivity are major determinants of nausea and vomiting in human pregnancy

finding: The study noted an APOE ε4 allele frequency of 17.6% in the cohort, which was consistent with previous findings in the Spanish population. This SNP is significant as it has been previously associated with an increased risk of developing mild cognitive impairment and Alzheimer's disease.
title: Predicting the future development of mild cognitive impairment in the cognitively healthy elderly

finding: Similar to rs429358, the frequency of APOE ε4 allele, including variants such as rs7412, was identified in the study. The presence of this SNP was linked to elevated risk factors for cognitive decline, suggesting its relevance in the study of dementia in the elderly population.
title: Predicting the future development of mild cognitive impairment in the cognitively healthy elderly

finding: The SNP rs3093105, designated as CYP4F2*2, exhibited a frequency of approximately 40% in the Fulani and Hausa ethnolinguistic groups, compared to closer to 30% frequency in the Yoruba group. This variant has been linked to altered warfarin sensitivity and metabolism, thus highlighting its relevance in pharmacogenomics, particularly in populations from northern Nigeria.
title: Whole-genome sequencing across 449 samples spanning 47 ethnolinguistic groups provides insights into genetic diversity in Nigeria

finding: The variant rs2108622, designated as CYP4F2*3, showed an elevated frequency of 15-17% in the Fulani and Hausa groups, contrasting with approximately 5% in the Yoruba group. This SNP is known to reduce the enzymatic levels of cytochrome P450 4F2 and is associated with variations in warfarin response, emphasizing the importance of understanding its role in drug metabolism in diverse African populations.
title: Whole-genome sequencing across 449 samples spanning 47 ethnolinguistic groups provides insights into genetic diversity in Nigeria

finding: The study reported significant associations between the APOE e2-defining allele (rs7412) and decreased levels of LDL cholesterol among e2 homozygotes, consistent with existing literature.
title: Manifestations of genetic risk for Alzheimer’s Disease in the blood: a cross-sectional multiomic analysis in healthy adults aged 18-90+

finding: The e4 allele (rs429358) was significantly associated with higher levels of multiple cholesterol-related analytes and inflammation-related proteins, consistent with previous studies linking this SNP to cardiovascular risks and Alzheimer’s disease.
title: Manifestations of genetic risk for Alzheimer’s Disease in the blood: a cross-sectional multiomic analysis in healthy adults aged 18-90+

finding: Lower levels of lactosylceramide metabolites were seen in individuals with the AD-risk allele of rs3752246, particularly pronounced in younger age groups, suggesting a link between ABCA7 and lipid metabolism.
title: Manifestations of genetic risk for Alzheimer’s Disease in the blood: a cross-sectional multiomic analysis in healthy adults aged 18-90+

finding: The rs2032809 polymorphism in BBC3 was associated with breast cancer phenotype and prognosis.
title: The Identification of Key Genes and Biological Pathways in Polycystic Ovary Syndrome and its Complications by Next Generation Squancing (NGS) and Bioinformatics Analysis

finding: The SNP rs147711004, located near the genes BCAM-NECTIN2, showed a significant association with hsCRP levels, contributing to the understanding of genetic factors impacting inflammation.
title: A genome-wide association study of high-sensitivity C-reactive protein in a large Korean population highlights its role in cholesterol metabolism

finding: The SNP rs147400515 mapping to CTC-490E21.12 and CYP2F2P was newly linked with hsCRP levels.
title: A genome-wide association study of high-sensitivity C-reactive protein in a large Korean population highlights its role in cholesterol metabolism

finding: The novel SNP rs145031198 located in CBLC was implicated in the study for hsCRP levels.
title: A genome-wide association study of high-sensitivity C-reactive protein in a large Korean population highlights its role in cholesterol metabolism

finding: The SNP rs4599021 in PVRL2 was identified as being associated with hsCRP levels.
title: A genome-wide association study of high-sensitivity C-reactive protein in a large Korean population highlights its role in cholesterol metabolism

finding: The SNP rs429358 in APOE was significantly associated with hsCRP levels, further highlighting the interplay between inflammation and lipid metabolism.
title: A genome-wide association study of high-sensitivity C-reactive protein in a large Korean population highlights its role in cholesterol metabolism

finding: The common missense mutation rs601338 results in a premature stop codon in the FUT2 gene. This variant was linked to the regulation of antigens on epithelial cells and had associations with multiple complex phenotypes, including inflammation, cognitive decline, and lipids levels, which relate to dietary intake and metabolism.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide association meta-analysis of dietary intake identifies new loci and genetic and functional links with metabolic traits

finding: A missense variant in the APOE gene, it was associated with change rates in hippocampus and indicated faster decay for carriers of the Alzheimer's disease risk variant, showing a prominent quadratic age-dependent effect.
title: Age-dependent genetic variants associated with longitudinal changes in brain structure across the lifespan

finding: The A allele of rs10423769 was identified as a protective variant that reduced the Alzheimer's disease (AD) risk effect in APOE ε4 homozygotes by approximately 75% among individuals of African ancestry. This variant is located 2 Mb upstream of APOE, within a region of segmental duplications on chromosome 19 containing a cluster of pregnancy-specific beta-1 glycoprotein genes and a long non-coding RNA. The protective haplotype linked to this variant was confirmed across all studied African ancestry populations.
title: African origin haplotype protective for Alzheimer’s disease in APOEε4 carriers: exploring potential mechanisms

finding: The rs429358 variant in APOE was found to be significantly associated with a stronger statin selection and higher doses of atorvastatin. Carriers were more likely to require higher intensity dosing despite the variant being linked to mixed effects on LDL-c reductions.
title: LPA and APOE are associated with statin selection in the UK Biobank

finding: Lead SNP rs10415219 from the ACTN4 locus was associated with retinal venular tortuosity, a potential marker for cardiovascular diseases. It demonstrated clear signs of this condition in A-allele activating images (MAF = 0.486), and was in linkage disequilibrium with rs1808382 (R^2 = 1), which has been previously linked to increased retinal venular tortuosity.
title: TransferGWAS: GWAS of images using deep transfer learning

finding: The SNP rs429358 was identified as part of the APOE genotype categorization. Carriers of alleles leading to the APOE4 isoform showed differential lipid metabolism effects, where increased levels of metabolites LDL and VLDL correlated with decreased white matter integrity across carriers, implying a significant interaction with cognitive decline.
title: APOE4 poses opposite effects of plasma LDL on white matter integrity in older adults

finding: The SNP rs7412, also part of the APOE genotype identification, was associated with the APOE3/4 and APOE4/4 combinations. Similar to rs429358, this SNP indicated that carriers experienced a differing metabolism of plasma lipids, contributing to reduced white matter integrity, which is relevant for understanding Alzheimer's disease risk.
title: APOE4 poses opposite effects of plasma LDL on white matter integrity in older adults

finding: The SNP rs6510896 was associated with the enhancer ncRNA CTB-180A7.8, which was linked to the gene ALKBH7. This lncRNA was found within a chromosomal region significantly deleted in ASD cases compared to controls, suggesting it plays a role in neurodevelopment relevant to ASD.
title: Evidence for enhancer noncoding RNAs (enhancer-ncRNAs) with gene regulatory functions relevant to neurodevelopmental disorders

finding: The rs429358 SNP was associated with the APOE ε4 allele, which was linked to increased brain atrophy in patients with mild traumatic brain injury (mTBI). The study found that mTBI patients carrying the APOE ε4 allele exhibited severer atrophy in specific regions of the temporal lobe, correlating with cognitive decline and language dysfunction, supporting a genetic risk factor for Alzheimer's disease development.
title: Apolipoprotein E genotype modulates longitudinal atrophy at the temporal lobe after mild traumatic brain injury

finding: The rs7412 SNP was also genotyped to identify the presence of the APOE ε4 allele. Similar to the findings for rs429358, this SNP contributed to the classification of subjects into APOE ε4 carrier and non-carrier statuses, impacting the risk of neurodegenerative processes following mTBI and correlating with language fluency performance changes.
title: Apolipoprotein E genotype modulates longitudinal atrophy at the temporal lobe after mild traumatic brain injury

finding: The SNP rs1465697 was identified as an eQTL for the gene CD37, among others, and its effects on gene expression were studied in T cells. The knockout (KO) of KLF2, TNFAIP3, and ZNF217 reduced chromatin accessibility at the enhancer containing rs1465697 and decreased CD37 expression. This suggested that alterations in transcription factor binding at the enhancer, influenced by these regulators, could disrupt normal CD37 expression.
title: Systematic discovery and perturbation of regulatory genes in human T cells reveals the architecture of immune networks

finding: The study found that carriers of the APOE ε4 allele, determined by genotyping of rs429358, had a higher frequency in mixed DLB+AD compared to pure DLB. This allele was associated with a shorter disease duration, illustrating a significant role of this SNP in the context of Alzheimer's disease pathology coexisting with dementia with Lewy bodies.
title: Alzheimer’s disease copathology in dementia with Lewy bodies is associated with astroglial α-synucleinopathy

finding: Similar to rs429358, the genotyping of rs7412 also contributed to identifying the APOE alleles and was associated with the higher frequency of the APOE ε4 allele in mixed DLB+AD cases versus pure DLB cases. This finding emphasized the influence of this SNP on disease progression in the context of DLB and AD copathology.
title: Alzheimer’s disease copathology in dementia with Lewy bodies is associated with astroglial α-synucleinopathy

finding: The rs601338 SNP in the FUT2 gene was linked to the levels of certain blood proteins and was known to confer resistance to common enteric viruses leading to its classification as a positive original finding.
title: Common homozygosity for predicted loss-of-function variants reveals both redundant and advantageous effects of dispensable human genes

finding: The SNP rs147110934, located within the gene ZNF628, was found to significantly affect adult height, with a P-value of 1 × 10<sup>−20</sup>. This finding emerged from the application of the gene-ε approach, which successfully identified rare variants that traditional genome-wide association studies often miss. The study highlighted the importance of rare and low-frequency variants in explaining the variation of complex traits, such as height.
title: Recalibrating the Genome-wide Association Null Hypothesis Enables the Detection of Core Genes Underlying Complex Traits

finding: The GG genotype in SNP rs387976 was found exclusively among individuals classified as outliers, indicating a potential association with atypical patterns, despite not all outliers possessing this genotype.
title: Generalization of the minimum covariance determinant algorithm for categorical and mixed data types

finding: A combination of the GG genotype for SNP rs157580 and TT for SNP rs439401 was observed in several individuals within the outlier set, suggesting a connection to unusual clinical presentations.
title: Generalization of the minimum covariance determinant algorithm for categorical and mixed data types

finding: The TT genotype for SNP rs439401 appeared in conjunction with the GG genotype for rs157580 in multiple outlier individuals, marking a notable pattern related to atypical clinical symptoms.
title: Generalization of the minimum covariance determinant algorithm for categorical and mixed data types

finding: Associated with PPP1R14A, rs12608912 tagged a risk variant for prostate cancer and showed responsiveness to the G1/S transition of the cell cycle, underlining its role in cancer-related processes.
title: Single-cell RNA-sequencing of differentiating iPS cells reveals dynamic genetic effects on gene expression

finding: SNP rs6511720 was found to be significantly associated with LDL. The p-value reported was 3.85e-262, indicating a strong association.
title: PheGWAS: A new dimension to visualize GWAS across multiple phenotypes

finding: SNP rs10401969 exhibited a significant association with TRIGS, backed by a p-value of 9.702e-70, demonstrating its relevance to triglyceride levels.
title: PheGWAS: A new dimension to visualize GWAS across multiple phenotypes

finding: SNP rs731839 was associated significantly with TRIGS, with a p-value of 3.441e-09, supporting its connection to triglyceride levels.
title: PheGWAS: A new dimension to visualize GWAS across multiple phenotypes

finding: SNP rs2075650 showed a significant association with HDL, having a p-value of 9.716e-25, indicating its importance in HDL-related phenotypes.
title: PheGWAS: A new dimension to visualize GWAS across multiple phenotypes

finding: SNP rs103294 was identified as associated with Total Cholesterol according to the Global Lipids Genetics Consortium (GLGC) and was also linked to HDL at base pair position 54 Mb.
title: PheGWAS: A new dimension to visualize GWAS across multiple phenotypes

finding: The SNP rs2108622 was reported to be significantly correlated with susceptibility to ischemic stroke and levels of 20-Hydroxyeicosatetraenoic acid (20-HETE). This finding highlighted the interaction between CYP4F2 and CYP4A11, indicating a genetic contribution to variations in CBF autoregulation and potentially influencing the pathophysiology of ischemic stroke.
title: 20-HETE-promoted cerebral blow flow autoregulation is associated with enhanced α-smooth muscle actin positive cerebrovascular pericyte contractility

finding: The SNP rs10415777 was identified as a contact eQTL that influenced enhancer-promoter interactions for both TFPT and OSCAR, suggesting shared genetic regulation despite not reaching stringent significance for OSCAR.
title: Shared and distinct molecular effects of regulatory genetic variants provide insight into mechanisms of distal enhancer-promoter communication

finding: It was associated with EID2 and linked to immunometabolic regulation, reinforcing its relevance to disease susceptibility through its interaction with trimodal QTL dynamics.
title: Shared and distinct molecular effects of regulatory genetic variants provide insight into mechanisms of distal enhancer-promoter communication

finding: The rs2233678 polymorphism in the PIN1 promoter region was associated with a reduced risk of cancer, as demonstrated in a meta-analysis published by Li et al. in 2013. This finding indicated that alterations in the PIN1 gene, particularly in its promoter region, may influence cancer susceptibility.
title: Sulfopin, a selective covalent inhibitor of Pin1, blocks Myc-driven tumor initiation and growth in vivo

finding: The rs4682 variant in basigin (BSG) was also classified as a synonymous quantitative trait locus (QTL) and was strongly associated with the growth of Plasmodium falciparum. This finding suggested that even synonymous SNPs can impact gene expression levels, thereby modulating host susceptibility to the parasite.
title: Common host variation drives malaria parasite fitness in healthy human red cells

finding: The ABCA7 missense variant p.Ala1527Gly (rs3752246) was identified as a prevalent risk variant for Alzheimer's disease, with an associated odds ratio of 1.15, suggesting that carriers of this SNP experienced transcriptomic perturbations in excitatory neurons similar to those noted in more severe ABCA7 loss-of-function (LoF) variants. This study connected the p.Ala1527Gly variant to potential changes in lipid metabolism and neuronal signaling pathways associated with AD pathology.
title: Single-cell atlas of ABCA7 loss-of-function reveals impaired neuronal respiration via choline-dependent lipid imbalances

finding: The CD33 risk allele, rs3865444(C), was reported to instruct inclusion of exon 2 and production of the full-length protein, which has an inhibitory effect on microglial activities. Conversely, the protective allele, rs3865444(A), was associated with exon 2 skipping and production of the Δe2 CD33 isoform, which failed to suppress microglial activation and phagocytosis related to Alzheimer's disease (AD). Thus, this specific SNP was connected to differential splice variant expression that influenced the microglial response in the context of AD.
title: Novel TREM2 splicing isoform that lacks the V-set immunoglobulin domain is abundant in the human brain

finding: This SNP was found on 19p13.2 near the gene TYK2 in Erola P. C. et al.'s study, linking it to increased risk of severe COVID-19 symptoms.
title: Human genetic variants associated with COVID-19 severity are enriched in immune and epithelium regulatory networks

finding: SNP rs78073763 was identified to interrupt multiple binding sites of SPI1 in the Hippocampus and RARA in the Lateral Temporal Lobe, impacting the regulation of key AD genes.
title: Predicting gene regulatory networks from multi-omics to link genetic risk variants and neuroimmunology to Alzheimer’s disease phenotypes

finding: SNP rs17643262 disrupted SPI1 regulation of DMPK in the Hippocampus and also affected SPI1 regulation of APOC2 in the Dorsolateral Prefrontal Cortex, linking cognitive decline to AD progression.
title: Predicting gene regulatory networks from multi-omics to link genetic risk variants and neuroimmunology to Alzheimer’s disease phenotypes

finding: Similar to rs17643262, SNP rs2041262 also disrupted SPI1 regulation of DMPK and APOC2 in the associated brain regions, reinforcing the association with cognitive impairment.
title: Predicting gene regulatory networks from multi-omics to link genetic risk variants and neuroimmunology to Alzheimer’s disease phenotypes

finding: SNP rs62117780 was shown to impact FOXC2 and POU2F2 regulation of KCNN4 in the Hippocampus, demonstrating its significance in AD progression.
title: Predicting gene regulatory networks from multi-omics to link genetic risk variants and neuroimmunology to Alzheimer’s disease phenotypes

finding: This SNP affected the regulation of KCNN4 by E2F7 in the Lateral Temporal Lobe, linking KCNN4's expression to AD progression.
title: Predicting gene regulatory networks from multi-omics to link genetic risk variants and neuroimmunology to Alzheimer’s disease phenotypes

finding: The study indicated that the SNP rs8110103 was associated with high CLDN6 expression, which was linked to endometrial cancer progression and poor patient prognosis. This finding was significant as it provided insights into how cell adhesion molecules, specifically CLDN6, and their genetic variations could influence cancer biology.
title: Aberrant claudin-6–adhesion signal promotes endometrial cancer progression via estrogen receptor α

finding: This variant associated with an earlier age at menopause had an effect of -0.20 s.d. (95% CI 0.16-0.24, p = 2.0·10⁻²⁰) in the XBI cohort and was correlated to the deletion in NMRK2, which showed causal significance.
title: The sequences of 150,119 genomes in the UK biobank

finding: This SNP was found to be significant in the analysis for LDL. The study reported it as replicated from four associated SNPs, indicating its relevance in influencing LDL cholesterol.
title: Multi-scale Inference of Genetic Trait Architecture using Biologically Annotated Neural Networks

finding: The SNP rs429358 was linked to the APOE locus, where carrying a C allele at this position alongside a C allele at the nearby SNP rs7412 indicated the presence of the APOE-ε4 variant, which is associated with an increased risk of late-onset Alzheimer's disease. This finding was particularly significant as it highlighted how genetic genealogy methods could expose critical health-related genetic information.
title: Attacks on genetic privacy via uploads to genealogical databases

finding: The SNP rs7412, when combined with the C allele at SNP rs429358, confirmed the haplotype associated with the APOE-ε4 variant, implicating a higher risk for Alzheimer's disease. This SNP was crucial in the genetic analysis related to Alzheimer's and demonstrated the potential for privacy breaches in direct-to-consumer genetic testing.
title: Attacks on genetic privacy via uploads to genealogical databases

finding: SNP rs12985827 in an intron of the APC2 gene demonstrated a strong allelic bias favoring the C allele over the T allele in K562 cells. The disruption of an EGR1 binding motif was noted for the T allele, resulting in reduced regulatory activity, suggesting its impact on gene expression regulation.
title: Systematic identification of human SNPs affecting regulatory element activity

finding: The GIPR-Q354 variant (rs1800437) was associated with several metabolic traits. It was linked to a lower body mass index (BMI) (p = 2.23 x 10^-111) and reduced waist circumference (p = 3.68 x 10^-10) and waist-hip ratio (p = 4.31 x 10^-12). However, it also showed a positive association with elevated HbA1c (p = 1.70 x 10^-11) and increased risk of Type 2 Diabetes, indicating a complex relationship between this SNP and metabolic health.
title: Spatiotemporal regulation of GIPR signaling impacts glucose homeostasis as revealed in studies of a common GIPR variant

finding: The SNP rs34536443, identified as a missense variant in the TYK2 gene, was included in the original 95% credible set and represents a positive original finding.
title: Improving the coverage of credible sets in Bayesian genetic fine-mapping

finding: The rs10417143 variant was found to alter ZNF257 mRNA levels significantly (P_adj = 2.8×10^-70) and 5mC levels at 16 remote CpG sites, which were enriched in binding sites for the ZNF534 transcription factor. This highlights the role of the variant in regulating DNA methylation through its effect on a nearby transcription factor.
title: Factors Driving DNA Methylation Variation in Human Blood

finding: The SNP rs145821638, tagging the rare haplotype 19AM3, was linked to a strong delay in HD onset by approximately 7.7 years, associated with a missense change in LIG1.
title: Huntington’s disease onset is determined by length of uninterrupted CAG, not encoded polyglutamine, and is modified by DNA maintenance mechanisms

finding: The SNP rs274883 marked the onset-delaying haplotype 19AM1, contributing to delayed onset of HD and significant associations in the context of CAG expansion.
title: Huntington’s disease onset is determined by length of uninterrupted CAG, not encoded polyglutamine, and is modified by DNA maintenance mechanisms

finding: The rs12979860 SNP resulted in a frameshift mutation that ablated the production of IFNλ4. This loss-of-function variant was associated with protection from chronic hepatitis C virus (HCV) infection, highlighting its significance in the IFNL locus and the outcome of viral infections.
title: Conserved induction of distinct antiviral signalling kinetics by primate interferon lambda 4 proteins

finding: The rs117648444 SNP encoded a non-synonymous variant P70S, which changed a proline to serine at position 70. This variant reduced the potency of interferon-stimulated gene (ISG) induction by IFNλ4. Interestingly, this hypoactive allele was also associated with protection against chronic HCV infection in humans, showing its impact on antiviral responses.
title: Conserved induction of distinct antiviral signalling kinetics by primate interferon lambda 4 proteins

finding: This SNP showed significant associations in the East Asian and Hispanic and Latin American cohorts, and it was previously linked in European ancestry cohorts.
title: Enrichment analyses identify shared associations for 25 quantitative traits in over 600,000 individuals from seven diverse ancestries

finding: The SNV rs1555729452 (Cys222Tyr) within the NOTCH3 gene was identified as pathogenic in a patient with cerebral autosomal dominant arteriopathy with subcortical infarcts and leukoencephalopathy (CADASIL; MIM 125310). This finding was classified as pathogenic based on the American College of Medical Genetics and Genomics (ACMG) guidelines and accounted for the patient's clinical presentation. The case highlighted the efficacy of the Exo-C method in detecting clinically relevant pathogenic SNVs, comparable to traditional exome sequencing techniques.
title: A novel approach for simultaneous detection of structural and single-nucleotide variants based on a combination of chromosome conformation capture and exome sequencing

finding: The variant rs838133 was found to be associated with higher liking for sweet foods, consistent with previous studies indicating that the A allele of this SNP corresponds to lower levels of FGF21. This allele's association extends to a range of food preferences, suggesting a potential shift in liking from sweet to savory foods, particularly with influence over the preferences for strong-tasting vegetables and spices.
title: Large-scale genome-wide association study of food liking reveals genetic determinants and genetic correlations with distinct neurophysiological traits

finding: The TM6SF2 rs58542926 (E167K) variant was associated with an increase in the prevalence of Metabolic Disfunction-Associated Steatotic Liver Disease (MASLD). In individuals with this variant, there was a twofold higher prevalence of metabolic-associated steatohepatitis (MASH) and advanced fibrosis compared to control subjects. This variant was noted to result in significant cellular changes, including increased lipid accumulation and elevated serum cholesterol levels.
title: Human Induced Pluripotent Stem Cell based Hepatic-Modeling of Lipid metabolism associated TM6SF2 E167K variant

finding: The C3 R102G SNP (rs2230199) was identified as having a known minor allele frequency of at least 10% in several cohorts. Recipients carrying the C3 R102G polymorphism demonstrated worse chronic lung allograft dysfunction (CLAD)-free survival, notably in those who developed donor-specific antibodies (DSA). In two independent cohorts, analysis indicated that the presence of the C3 R102G variant was linked to a significant increase in risk for CLAD or death, especially among recipients with DSA.
title: Impaired complement regulation drives chronic lung allograft dysfunction after lung transplantation

finding: The SNP rs641738 was associated with platelet count and was enriched for liver enzyme levels, linking it to the NAFLD-related pathways.
title: Deciphering the genetic links between NAFLD and co-occurring conditions using a liver gene regulatory network

finding: SNP rs2576452 was associated with blood metabolite ratios and was enriched for traits related to NAFLD, particularly impacting liver function.
title: Deciphering the genetic links between NAFLD and co-occurring conditions using a liver gene regulatory network

finding: The rs449647 SNP was identified as being significantly associated with Alzheimer's disease, with the A-allele designated as the risk allele. The genetic analysis confirmed that variants in the AANCR region, including rs449647, influenced APOE expression levels, which are pertinent to Alzheimer's risk.
title: A transcriptional mechanism involving R-loop, m6A modification and RNA abasic sites regulates an enhancer RNA of APOE

finding: The rs405509 SNP was also found to have a significant association with Alzheimer's disease. Data indicated that this SNP, when analyzed alongside rs449647, contributed to individual differences in APOE expression, further influencing Alzheimer's disease susceptibility.
title: A transcriptional mechanism involving R-loop, m6A modification and RNA abasic sites regulates an enhancer RNA of APOE

finding: IFI30 rs11554159 was identified in a study by Stefanovic et al. in 2020, focusing on its association with multiple sclerosis.
title: Identification of biomarkers and pathways for focal segmental glomerulosclerosis using next generation sequencing data and bioinformatics analysis

finding: SNP rs2304204 in IRF3 was confirmed as functional, with higher expression linked to the G allele in both unstimulated and influenza-infected conditions. The allele prevalence varied between cohorts, further indicating its significance in influencing antiviral immune responses.
title: Integrated Drivers of Basal and Acute Immunity in Diverse Human Populations

finding: The study analyzed the SNP rs527221 located in exon 10 of the DMPK gene. It was found that in individuals affected by DM1 carrying the heterozygous rs527221 SNP, the guanine (G) allele was linked with the CTG expansion allele, whereas the cytosine (C) allele was associated with the normal DMPK RNA. This SNP allowed the researchers to distinguish and quantify mutant and wild-type DMPK transcripts using allele-specific probes, which provided insights into the mutant mRNA turnover in DM1.
title: Regulation of Toxic RNA Foci and Mutant DMPK Transcripts: Role of MBNL Proteins and RNA Decay Pathways

finding: The SNP rs5827412 was identified as a PU.1 motif-altering deletion associated with lower monocyte counts. It was shown to reduce the PU.1 motif score, consequently diminishing PU.1 binding and chromatin accessibility at regulatory elements surrounding the LRRC25 locus, and associated with decreased LRRC25 expression levels in monocytes.
title: Colocalization of blood cell traits GWAS associations and variation in PU.1 genomic occupancy prioritizes causal noncoding regulatory variants

finding: The study confirmed that the ApoE4 allele was generated by editing the ApoE allele from T/T to C/C at rs429358, which was associated with the alteration in intracellular transport and iron homeostasis at the blood-brain barrier in brain endothelial cells.
title: ApoE4 disrupts intracellular trafficking and iron homeostasis in an improved iPSC-based model of human brain endothelial cells

finding: The study established that the genetic variant at base position described by rs7412 was C/C, which corresponds to the Arg112 amino acid in the ApoE4/E4 genetic variant lineage, relevant in the context of Alzheimer's disease and its impact on neuronal transport processes.
title: ApoE4 disrupts intracellular trafficking and iron homeostasis in an improved iPSC-based model of human brain endothelial cells

finding: In the analysis of the genotype imputation for rs142572000, imputed genotypes demonstrated higher certainty when using the TOPMed reference panel, showing a dosage closer to 0, 1, or 2. This led to an increased variance and an overestimation of the Rsq metric, which was posited to relate to a higher mean absolute relative error (MARE). Many heterozygotes for this SNP were incorrectly imputed with a dosage of approximately 0, resulting in a higher MARE and Rsq despite a low dosage r2.
title: Characterizing the quality metric in genotype imputation

finding: The analysis of rs10410162 revealed that as the template switching rate (θ value) decreased, both Rsq and the mean absolute relative error (MARE) increased, along with the certainty of the imputed alleles. This indicated that lower θ values led to an overestimation of imputed genotype certainty, causing a deviation where Rsq was greater than the empirical Rsq. As θ values increased, the imputed allelic dosages were reduced, resulting in a more significant decrease in Rsq compared to the empirical Rsq.
title: Characterizing the quality metric in genotype imputation

finding: The SNP rs7412 located in the APOE locus showed a significant association with ΔAge, with a p-value of 4.4×10^-33. This association was relevant to its prior links with Alzheimer's disease and coronary heart disease, indicating that risk alleles at this locus may correlate with a lack of robust physiology, reflected in a higher ΔAge even in the absence of specific diagnostic criteria.
title: A Physiology Clock for Human Aging

finding: The study found significant allele-specific expression (ASE) for C3 rs2230199 in the macula RPE/choroid for normal and intermediate AMD, presenting important insights into its role in AMD pathophysiology.
title: Patterns of gene expression and allele-specific expression vary among macular tissues and clinical stages of Age-related Macular Degeneration

finding: This SNP was associated with Limb-girdle muscular dystrophy and represented a pathogenic variant. It was located upstream of ORF CATP00000063293.1 and changed the start codon of the encoded protein sequence from ATG to ATA. The ORF showed a strong PhyloCSF signal and had a very high phenotypic score (69) in K562 cells, indicating a significant functional role.
title: De novo birth of functional, human-specific microproteins

finding: The SNP rs15290 corresponded to the hcp1 gene in V. parahaemolyticus and was involved in the construction of in-frame deletions which contributed to understanding the bacterium's secretion systems and interactions.
title: Engineering a customizable antibacterial T6SS-based platform in Vibrio natriegens

finding: The rs641738 SNP was linked to increased susceptibility to advanced liver diseases, including non-alcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD), alcohol-associated liver disease (ALD), and liver fibrosis, particularly among individuals chronically infected with hepatitis B and C viruses. This SNP, specifically associated with reduced expression of the gene MBOAT7, was supported by multiple genome-wide association studies (GWAS) as a significant risk factor for various hepatic conditions.
title: Membrane Bound O-Acyltransferase 7 (MBOAT7) Shapes Lysosomal Lipid Homeostasis and Function to Control Alcohol-Associated Liver Injury

finding: The SNP rs34536443 in TYK2 was highlighted as a rare variant linked to T1D, with a minor allele frequency (MAF) recently reported as 0.04. The low frequency of individuals homozygous for the rare allele (213 per 100,000) underscored its potential role in influencing T1D risk.
title: Use of Induced Pluripotent Stem Cells to Build Isogenic Systems and Investigate Type 1 Diabetes

finding: The SNP rs3865444 was part of the 2013 GWAS study with significant findings related to Alzheimer's disease.
title: Multi-Modal Data Analysis for Alzheimer’s Disease Diagnosis: An Ensemble Model Using Imagery and Genetic Features

finding: The SNP rs2075650 was associated with Alzheimer's disease in at least nine independent GWAS studies, suggesting its importance for future functional investigations.
title: Multi-Modal Data Analysis for Alzheimer’s Disease Diagnosis: An Ensemble Model Using Imagery and Genetic Features

finding: This SNP was identified as one of the strongest risk loci for AD in African Americans, with a significant OR of 1.79.
title: How understudied populations have contributed to our understanding of Alzheimer’s disease genetics

finding: The study included the analysis of the Apolipoprotein E (APOE) genotype estimated from the single nucleotide polymorphism (SNP) rs429358. It contributed to understanding the relationship between plasma lipids and white blood cell counts in the Multi-Ethnic Study of Atherosclerosis cohort.
title: The association of plasma lipids with white blood cell counts: Results from the Multi-Ethnic Study of Atherosclerosis

finding: Similar to rs429358, the SNP rs7412 was also used to estimate APOE genotype, linking it to the study's exploration of how plasma lipids affect white blood cell counts, thereby aiding in further assessments of cardiovascular health.
title: The association of plasma lipids with white blood cell counts: Results from the Multi-Ethnic Study of Atherosclerosis

finding: The SNP rs429358 was included in the findings as it is one of the defining SNPs that determine the APOE ε4/ε2 haplotypes. The analysis revealed that two differentially methylated positions (DMPs) in the APOE gene, specifically cg16471933, were located 139bp 5' of rs429358, indicating a relationship between this SNP and methylation differences associated with Alzheimer's disease. The DMPs showed higher methylation levels in APOE ε4 carriers compared to ε2 carriers.
title: Assessment of DNA methylation differences between carriers of APOE ε4 and APOE ε2

finding: SNP rs7412, another defining SNP of the APOE haplotypes, was identified as being associated with 25 methylation quantitative trait loci (meQTLs) in the study. Among these, it was linked to associations with nine of the differentially methylated positions at the APOE locus, demonstrating its significant impact on epigenome-wide methylation differences related to lipid homeostasis.
title: Assessment of DNA methylation differences between carriers of APOE ε4 and APOE ε2

finding: The SNP rs41290120 was noted in the context of meQTL analysis and was reported to be in linkage disequilibrium (LD) with rs7412. Like rs7412, it was associated with multiple CpG sites, highlighting its involvement in the methylation changes occurring at the APOE locus, particularly in influencing lipid-related gene expression and metabolism.
title: Assessment of DNA methylation differences between carriers of APOE ε4 and APOE ε2

finding: The G allele of rs3810154 was associated with enhanced expression of the gene SLC44A2 by promoting chromatin accessibility in the region downstream of SLC44A2, indicating its role as an OA risk variant.
title: Comprehensive profiling of transcriptional regulation in cartilage reveals pathogenesis of osteoarthritis

finding: The ASCA-SNP rs3760638 was identified as having opposite correlations in the formative and primed-associated RNMs, indicating its involvement in the proportions of different pluripotency states within the hiPSC lines.
title: Unsupervised Machine Learning Identifies Chromatin Accessibility Regulatory Networks that Define Cell State Transitions in Pluripotency

finding: The A49V mutation was shown to abolish recognition by Opa74, and this finding indicated that this CEACAM1 variant can alter adherence by specific bacterial adhesins.
title: Evolution of host-microbe cell adherence by receptor domain shuffling

finding: The Q89H variant was found to abrogate binding to both Opa52 and Opa74, providing evidence that this variant significantly impairs interactions with bacterial adhesins.
title: Evolution of host-microbe cell adherence by receptor domain shuffling

finding: The A allele of rs4803042, an eQTL for the gene ASB1 in GM12878, was found to induce the preferential binding of transcription factor PORL2A. This allele was associated with a decreased burst size and increased burst frequency in transcriptional kinetics.
title: Allelic Transcription Factor binding shape transcriptional kinetics observed with scRNA-seq in human cell lines

finding: This SNP was associated with a variable nucleotide repeat expansion in the <italic>ABCA7</italic> gene, which is correlated with increased risk for Alzheimer’s disease.
title: Nanopore-based DNA long-read sequencing analysis of the aged human brain

finding: This SNP overlapped with a polymorphic AluYa8 element and was linked to various challenging-to-detect variants within risk genes for Alzheimer’s disease.
title: Nanopore-based DNA long-read sequencing analysis of the aged human brain

finding: The SNP rs7412 was identified as the single most significant SNV associated with LDL-C levels, demonstrating a strong functional prediction with MACIE-protein and MACIE-conserved scores both exceeding 0.95, indicating multiple functional roles.
title: A Multi-dimensional Integrative Scoring Framework for Predicting Functional Regions in the Human Genome

finding: rs1065853 was in extremely high linkage disequilibrium with rs7412 and was predicted to have a regulatory role with a MACIE-regulatory score greater than 0.99, suggesting it could be causally involved in LDL-C levels alongside the missense variant.
title: A Multi-dimensional Integrative Scoring Framework for Predicting Functional Regions in the Human Genome

finding: The SNP rs11671106 represented the lead SNP for the BHMG1 locus and was a missense variant predicted to be 'probably damaging', highlighting its potential role in asthma pathology.
title: Genome-wide association analysis of 350,000 Caucasians from the UK Biobank identifies novel loci for asthma, hay fever and eczema

finding: The SNP rs4420638 was validated in the study and allocated to HFpEF in the Women's Health Initiative (WHI), Jackson Heart Study (JHS), and Framingham Heart Study (FHS) populations, with a false discovery rate (FDR) adjusted q-value of less than 0.05. It was located on chromosome 19 and was close to the APOE and APOC genes.
title: Biological Pathways and Gene Networks Link Inflammation and Vascular Remodeling to Both Heart Failure with Preserved and Reduced Ejection Fraction in Women across Ethnicities

finding: The SNP rs445925 was positively identified as an eQTL that correlated with the expression levels of the genes APOE, BCAM, RYRI, and RERE. Each of these genes had literature support linking them to cholesterol. The association was particularly noted in suprapubic skin for APOE and suggested a regulatory influence on cholesterol metabolism across tissues.
title: Reconstructing the blood metabolome and genotype using long-range chromatin interactions

finding: SNP rs8103622 was identified as a candidate functional variant across four tissues: blood, breast, liver, and myeloid. It was shown to affect the binding affinity of a CTCF motif and exhibited a significant allelic imbalance with a distribution of 79% allele C and 21% allele T in MC7 cell lines. The SNP was associated with the SSBP4 tumor-suppressor gene in breast tissue.
title: funMotifs: Tissue-specific transcription factor motifs

finding: Significant allele specific expression (ASE) was detected for C3 rs2230199 in the macula RPE/choroid in both normal and intermediate AMD samples.
title: Patterns of gene expression and allele-specific expression vary among macular tissues and clinical stages of Age-related Macular Degeneration

finding: The MBOAT7 rs641738 variant was found to increase the risk of liver inflammation and fibrosis progression in chronic hepatitis C, indicating its importance in liver health.
title: The Identification of Key Genes and Biological Pathways in Cardiac Arrest by Integrated Bioinformatics and Next Generation Sequencing Data Analysis

finding: The rs12979860 SNP was found to be associated with varying degrees of liver fibrosis in patients with chronic liver diseases, both viral and non-viral. This finding highlighted the potential of the interferon-λ gene in influencing liver disease progression.
title: A systematic analysis of rodent models implicates adipogenesis and innate immunity in pathogenesis of fatty liver disease

finding: The G allele of rs67397200 was identified as associated with an increased risk of both breast and ovarian cancer, particularly linked to higher expression of the ANKLE1 gene in breast tissue. This SNP is noted for its significance in contributing to breast cancer susceptibility, with a minor allele frequency of 25%. When homozygous for the risk allele, the relative risk of developing breast cancer increased, reflected in an odds ratio of 1.17.
title: ANKLE1 cleaves mitochondrial DNA and contributes to cancer risk by promoting apoptosis resistance and metabolic dysregulation

finding: The minor allele of rs56069439 was associated with reduced mitochondrial DNA copy number and served as an eQTL for the ANKLE1 gene, indicating that this SNP's variation affected ANKLE1 expression. The findings suggested a link between this SNP's allele and the downregulation of mitochondrial content, potentially contributing to cancer susceptibility through mitochondrial dysfunction.
title: ANKLE1 cleaves mitochondrial DNA and contributes to cancer risk by promoting apoptosis resistance and metabolic dysregulation

finding: The SNP rs1490425955 was identified as an orthologous variant (OrthoVar) between humans and the model organism <italic>C. elegans</italic>. Specifically, both human AP1M1 and <italic>C. elegans</italic> UNC-101 exhibit the identical amino acid substitution at corresponding positions, with the change being at p.P375S in humans and p.P362S in <italic>C. elegans</italic>. This finding demonstrated conservation of the amino acid residue change, indicating potential functional implications for the variant in relation to the gene's role.
