title: ConVarT: a search tool for orthologous variants: A method and server for functional inference of human genetic variants

finding: The SNP rs1862513 was found to be associated with genetic susceptibility to nonalcoholic fatty liver disease, which has implications for liver health.
title: Bioinformatics and next generation data analysis reveals the potential role of inflammation in sepsis and its associated complications

finding: The SNP rs7412 was genome-wide significant for LDL-cholesterol and exhibited heterogeneity due to both ancestry and urban status.
title: Accounting for heterogeneity due to environmental sources in meta-analysis of genome-wide association studies

finding: The SNP rs138294113 exhibited allelic heterogeneity due to ancestry alone, indicating its significance in the context of LDL-cholesterol studies.
title: Accounting for heterogeneity due to environmental sources in meta-analysis of genome-wide association studies

finding: The rs2075650 SNP in the TOMM40 gene was reported to be associated with an increased risk for Alzheimer's disease (AD). This SNP's minor allele was highlighted as a significant genetic risk factor in the context of AD, linking it to the gene's role in oxidative phosphorylation and mitochondrial function.
title: Selective vulnerability and resilience to Alzheimer’s disease tauopathy as a function of genes and the connectome

finding: Located at the BHMG1 locus, rs11671106 was found to be associated with asthma. It is a missense variant predicted as 'probably damaging' by PolyPhen.
title: Genome-wide association analysis of 350,000 Caucasians from the UK Biobank identifies novel loci for asthma, hay fever and eczema

finding: The SLC44A2_19:10631494A>G substitution (rs2288904), which corresponds to the Arg152Gln difference between HNA-3a and HNA-3b antigens, exhibited high variation in allele frequencies: 96.7% in Africans, 85.2% in Americans, 71.0% in East Asians, 76.4% in Europeans, and 75.5% in South Asians for HNA-3a. HNA-3b allele frequencies were the inverse across the same subpopulations.
title: Genetic epidemiology of human neutrophil antigen variants suggest significant global variability

finding: The SLC44A2_19:10631490C>T variant (rs147820753), which affects the HNA-3a epitope and results in a Leu151Phe amino acid change, presented allele frequencies ranging from 0% to 0.4% in global populations. This variant's impact was consistent with findings that indicated it impairs HNA-3a reactivity.
title: Genetic epidemiology of human neutrophil antigen variants suggest significant global variability

finding: The APOE E4 allele, associated with increased risk for Alzheimer's disease (AD), was found in iPSC lines NCRM1 and NCRM5, highlighting a common genetic variant significant for AD risk.
title: A reference induced pluripotent stem cell line for large-scale collaborative studies

finding: Alongside rs429358, rs7412 was assessed in the context of the APOE gene, with both variants contributing to the understanding of Alzheimer's disease risk amongst multiple iPSC lines.
title: A reference induced pluripotent stem cell line for large-scale collaborative studies

finding: This variant was noted in the PGP1 line as a risk factor for Alzheimer's disease, indicating the relevance of this genetic marker in the context of AD studies.
title: A reference induced pluripotent stem cell line for large-scale collaborative studies

finding: The SNP rs7412 was analyzed in association with white matter microstructure, specifically fractional anisotropy (FA) in various brain regions. The findings indicated that individuals with the E2 allele (associated with rs7412) showed different FA levels across the lifespan when compared to E3E3 homozygotes, suggesting a beneficial effect of the E2 allele in maintaining WM integrity.
title: Lifespan reference curves for harmonizing multi-site regional brain white matter metrics from diffusion MRI

finding: For the SNP rs429358, significant associations were found between the E4 allele and reduced FA in white matter regions linked to neurodegenerative disease. The analyses demonstrated that even among healthy individuals, the presence of the E4 allele indicated diminished white matter integrity, highlighting the potential risks associated with ApoE4 across the lifespan.
title: Lifespan reference curves for harmonizing multi-site regional brain white matter metrics from diffusion MRI

finding: The lead SNP rs1054972, located within an exon of KLF16, suggested an impact on schizophrenia despite its non-significant case-control effect size at the time of analysis, representing a potential novel association not previously reported.
title: Identifying loci with different allele frequencies among cases of eight psychiatric disorders using CC-GWAS

finding: The analysis of the ApoE SNP rs7412 indicated significant associations with fractional anisotropy (FA) in white matter regions relevant to neurodegeneration. This finding contributed to understanding the effects of the E2 allele on WM microstructural variations, particularly in healthy individuals across various age groups. The analyses utilized E3E3 homozygotes as controls and adjusted for potential confounders such as age and sex.
title: Reference curves for harmonizing multi-site regional diffusion MRI metrics across the lifespan

finding: The SNP rs429358, corresponding to the E4 allele of the ApoE gene, was associated with altered FA in specific white matter regions linked to neurodegenerative diseases. The study found significant age-by-genotype interactions, indicating that the presence of E4 correlated with changes in white matter microstructure throughout the lifespan, further elucidating the role of the E4 allele as a risk factor for dementia even in healthy individuals.
title: Reference curves for harmonizing multi-site regional diffusion MRI metrics across the lifespan

finding: The SNP rs204468 was linked to the regulation of a read-through isoform transcribed from the TOMM40 locus, the most significant locus associated with Alzheimer’s disease. The study reported that the risk allele of rs204468 increased the isoform ratio of the read-through isoform among isoforms from the TOMM40 locus with a trQTL beta of 0.64, highlighting its potential involvement in the pathogenesis of Alzheimer’s disease.
title: Immune Isoform Atlas: Landscape of alternative splicing in human immune cells

finding: The variant rs429358, which determines the APOE ε4 isoform, was found to be associated with decreased neuronal proportion, supporting its role in neurodegeneration.
title: The TMEM106B rs1990621 protective variant is also associated with increased neuronal proportion

finding: The SNP rs429358 (Cys112Arg) was found to be associated with lower beta peak frequencies in APOE-ε4 carriers compared to non-carriers. This finding suggested a potential link between this SNP and cognitive performance as measured by EEG power spectra.
title: Resting EEG power spectra across middle to late life: Associations with age, cognition, APOE-ε4 carriage and cardiometabolic burden

finding: The SNP rs7412 (Arg158Cys) was investigated alongside rs429358, contributing to the classification of participants as carriers or non-carriers of the APOE-ε4 allele. The findings highlighted that carriers of this allele demonstrated lower beta peak frequencies, indicating a relationship between this SNP and cognitive function in older adults.
title: Resting EEG power spectra across middle to late life: Associations with age, cognition, APOE-ε4 carriage and cardiometabolic burden

finding: Linked to multiple sclerosis via LD with rs2303759, this SNP was found to affect functional TF binding motifs, facilitating its analysis as a candidate for neurodegenerative diseases.
title: Allele-specific DNA methylation is increased in cancers and its dense mapping in normal plus neoplastic cells increases the yield of disease-associated regulatory SNPs

finding: Co-occurring with rs10411630, this peak SNP was associated with multiple sclerosis, underpinning its relevance in neurological disorder studies.
title: Allele-specific DNA methylation is increased in cancers and its dense mapping in normal plus neoplastic cells increases the yield of disease-associated regulatory SNPs

finding: The variant rs2304256, associated with rheumatoid arthritis, regulated junction-skipping in TYK2.
title: Junction-skipping regulation in complex disease

finding: The variant rs34725611, also associated with rheumatoid arthritis, was found to regulate junction-skipping in TYK2.
title: Junction-skipping regulation in complex disease

finding: Found to be associated with mean reaction time metrics while controlling for HbA1c, indicating its role in cognitive ability assessment.
title: Exome-wide analysis reveals role of LRP1 and additional novel loci in cognition

finding: This variant, identified as intronic in <italic>GPR108</italic>, was associated with mean reaction time outcomes.
title: Exome-wide analysis reveals role of LRP1 and additional novel loci in cognition

finding: Identified as interacting with <italic>APOE</italic>, this SNP was associated with cognitive impact regarding visual attention.
title: Exome-wide analysis reveals role of LRP1 and additional novel loci in cognition

finding: The SNP rs7249925 was linked to induction of the NOSIP gene in the esophagus. Analysis revealed that the alternative allele G expanded a GGGGGG stretch, resulting in an increase in G4 activity.
title: DeepG4: A deep learning approach to predict active G-quadruplexes

finding: The SNP rs429358, located within the APOE gene, was identified as a significant Q finding, correlating closely with traits representing genetic g. Although it was associated with cognitive aging, it showed a negligible null association with VNR, suggesting its unique relevance to cognitive aging instead of general cognitive ability.
title: Genetic “General Intelligence,” Objectively Determined and Measured

finding: Associated with NECTIN2, this SNP was noted for its involvement in immune pathways relevant to Alzheimer's disease.
title: S-BEAM: A Semi-Supervised Ensemble Approach to Rank Potential Causal Variants and Their Target Genes in Microglia for Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: Demonstrated chromatin contacts with NECTIN2, supporting its relevance in the context of Alzheimer's disease.
title: S-BEAM: A Semi-Supervised Ensemble Approach to Rank Potential Causal Variants and Their Target Genes in Microglia for Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: This SNP also showed significant association with NECTIN2, reinforcing the immune-related functional relevance for Alzheimer's.
title: S-BEAM: A Semi-Supervised Ensemble Approach to Rank Potential Causal Variants and Their Target Genes in Microglia for Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: This SNP was noted for its interactions with NECTIN2, highlighting its potential role in AD-related immune mechanisms.
title: S-BEAM: A Semi-Supervised Ensemble Approach to Rank Potential Causal Variants and Their Target Genes in Microglia for Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: Exhibited chromatin contacts with NECTIN2, suggesting its functional relevance in Alzheimer's through immune pathways.
title: S-BEAM: A Semi-Supervised Ensemble Approach to Rank Potential Causal Variants and Their Target Genes in Microglia for Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The MBOAT7 rs641738 C>T variant was associated with significantly increased mt-biomass, as indicated by higher nuclear PGC-1α positivity in T allele carriers compared to noncarriers (p=0.003, adjusted p=0.02). This SNP contributed to mitochondrial regulation, notably influencing mitophagy.
title: Artificial intelligence as a ploy to delve into the intricate relationship between genetics and mitochondria in MASLD patients

finding: The TM6SF2 E167K polymorphism (rs58542926 C>T) was also found to increase mt-biomass, with significant differences in mitochondrial dynamics observed in carriers compared to noncarriers (p<0.0001 for ccf-COXIII levels). The study confirmed that this variant played a significant role in modulating mt-dynamics and activity.
title: Artificial intelligence as a ploy to delve into the intricate relationship between genetics and mitochondria in MASLD patients

finding: The SNP rs123698-G was correlated with elevated levels of C-reactive protein (CRP), which serves as a marker of systemic inflammatory responses. The findings suggest a possible link between this SNP and inflammation-related risk factors in atherosclerosis, particularly given the role of Ptbp1 in endothelial activation and plaque development.
title: Splice Factor Polypyrimidine tract-binding protein 1 (Ptbp1) is Required for Immune Priming of the Endothelium in Atherogenic Disturbed Flow Conditions

finding: The SNP rs429358, which tags the <italic>APOE</italic> E4 allele, was associated with lower MMSE (Beta -0.20 [−0.33, −0.07], P-value = 2.8E-3) and lower MoCA (Beta -0.52 [−0.86, -0.17], P-value = 3.4E-3). The association indicated potential cognitive deficits among patients carrying this allele.
title: Genome-wide association study of Parkinson’s disease progression biomarkers in 12 longitudinal patients’ cohorts

finding: The pQTL rs2241714, a proxy for rs1800469, was shown to affect the serum levels of proteins B3GNT2, B3GNT8, and TGFB1, confirming its association with colorectal cancer, and thus indicating its potential relevance in cancer biology.
title: Human serum proteome profoundly overlaps with genetic signatures of disease

finding: As a proxy for the colorectal cancer variant rs1800469, rs2241714 was associated with serum levels of B3GNT2, B3GNT8, and TGFB1, underscoring its role in the genetic architecture of colorectal cancer.
title: Human serum proteome profoundly overlaps with genetic signatures of disease

finding: The SNP rs10424191 on chromosome 19, located in the gene ZNF536, was associated with the postcentral gyrus relevant to regional gray matter volume.
title: Genetic signatures of human brain structure: A comparison between GWAS and relatedness-based regression

finding: The single nucleotide polymorphism (rs1001281) in the AP2A1 gene was associated with 'MaxDrinks', a heritable trait and a risk factor for developing Alcohol Use Disorder (AUD). This finding indicated that variation in the AP2A1 gene could influence alcohol consumption behaviors, which was further supported by experimental data showing that Ap2a1 expression correlated significantly with voluntary alcohol drinking in both control and alcohol-dependent mouse strains.
title: Adaptor protein complex 2 in the orbitofrontal cortex predicts alcohol use disorder

finding: The SNP rs3810154 linked to SLC44A2 expression by altering chromatin accessibility, showing association with osteoarthritis susceptibility through regulatory mechanisms.
title: Comprehensive profiling of transcriptional regulation in cartilage reveals pathogenesis of osteoarthritis

finding: The ApoE4 allele (rs429358) showed selective pressures favoring other alleles instead, with possible introduction by early hunter-gatherers, linked to increased Alzheimer’s disease risk in present populations.
title: The Selection Landscape and Genetic Legacy of Ancient Eurasians

finding: The ApoE2 allele (rs7412), which reduces the risk of Alzheimer’s disease, exhibited selection signals beginning around 7,000 years ago, indicating a potential adaptive benefit related to immune responses.
title: The Selection Landscape and Genetic Legacy of Ancient Eurasians

finding: The SNP rs429358 was associated with the digit-symbol substitution test (DSST) and identified as a missense variant within APOE that alters the amino acid at position 130. This variant significantly increased the risk of Alzheimer's disease and was also linked to biomarkers of the disease, such as tau and amyloid-β levels, as well as measures of age-related cognitive decline and verbal memory.
title: Shared and distinct genetic influences between cognitive domains and psychiatric disorder risk based on genome-wide data

finding: This variant tagged an inversion near ZNF257 that is found predominantly in East Asian populations, resulting in disrupted expression of ZNF257 and downstream genes, leading to a reduced risk for T2D.
title: Identification of type 2 diabetes loci in 433,540 East Asian individuals

finding: The SNP rs2241712 in the promoter region of the TGFB1 gene was significantly associated with COPD among smokers in a case-control study, highlighting the role of genetic factors in the context of smoking.
title: Test Gene-Environment Interactions for Multiple Traits in Sequencing Association Studies

finding: Similarly, the SNP rs1800469 in the promoter region of TGFB1 was also found to be significantly associated with COPD among smokers, further supporting the involvement of TGFB1 variants in the disease's etiology within a smoking context.
title: Test Gene-Environment Interactions for Multiple Traits in Sequencing Association Studies

finding: This SNP showed significant association with SPINT2 gene expression changes in 22Rv1 cells as established through multiome profiling, and previous studies had identified it as a regulator of genome methylation.
title: Identify Regulatory eQTLs by Multiome Sequencing in Prostate Single Cells

finding: Significant association with tumor grade (P=5.10×10⁻⁴).
title: Common breast cancer risk loci predispose to distinct tumor subtypes

finding: Assessed with significant association to TN disease (P=1.07×10⁻⁵⁰).
title: Common breast cancer risk loci predispose to distinct tumor subtypes

finding: Exhibited no significant associations (P>0.05).
title: Common breast cancer risk loci predispose to distinct tumor subtypes

finding: Association with RP11-290F20.3 in FCGR3A+ monocytes was observed, marking its importance in genetic expression related to immune cells.
title: Expression QTLs in single-cell sequencing data

finding: Individuals heterozygous for the APOE4 allele (APOE3/4) demonstrated lower AIHH-induced diaphragm motor-evoked potential amplitude (MEP) compared to other APOE genotypes, with a p-value of 0.048. This finding related to the impact of APOE genotype on AIH-induced phrenic motor plasticity.
title: APOE4, Age & Sex Regulate Respiratory Plasticity Elicited By Acute Intermittent Hypercapnic-Hypoxia

finding: Similar to rs429358, individuals with the APOE4 allele (specifically, the APOE3/4 genotype) exhibited diminished AIHH-induced diaphragm MEP facilitation, indicating a significant influence of APOE genotype on responses to AIH.
title: APOE4, Age & Sex Regulate Respiratory Plasticity Elicited By Acute Intermittent Hypercapnic-Hypoxia

finding: The rs12459419 SNP was similarly associated with a reduced risk of Alzheimer's Disease (AD) and identified as a functional SNP. It led to increased expression of the D2-CD33 isoform, which lacks exon 2.
title: Pseudogene-mediated gene conversion after CRISPR-Cas9 editing demonstrated by partial CD33 conversion with SIGLEC22P

finding: This SNP was consistently associated with Alzheimer's disease (AD). It was found to be tagged by the TOMM40 gene, which encodes the translocase of the mitochondrial outer membrane complex, and associated with changes in mitochondrial metabolism in AD patients.
title: Deep Learning-based Feature Extraction with MRI Data in Neuroimaging Genetics for Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: This variant was predicted to increase binding affinity for NKX2-5 and was successfully validated, showing a 2.3-fold decrease in changed DNA binding.
title: Disease-Associated Non-Coding Variants Alter NKX2-5 DNA-Binding Affinity

finding: The rs429358 SNP, which is part of the APOE gene, was identified as a risk allele associated with late-onset Alzheimer’s disease (LOAD). Individuals carrying the allele exhibited reduced signal complexity and 'slowing of EEG', which are recognized EEG markers of Alzheimer's, indicating potential adverse effects on brain integrity prior to disease onset.
title: Alzheimer’s disease-like features in resting state EEG/fMRI of cognitively intact and healthy middle-aged APOE/PICALM risk carriers

finding: The rs7412 SNP, also within the APOE gene, was assessed along with rs429358 and presented findings consistent with risk for LOAD. Similar to rs429358, its association suggested reduced signal complexity and impaired functional connectivity in brain regions related to attention, marking it as a potential contributor to LOAD pathology before clinical symptoms appear.
title: Alzheimer’s disease-like features in resting state EEG/fMRI of cognitively intact and healthy middle-aged APOE/PICALM risk carriers

finding: The SNP rs7247241 was reported as causing allele-specific methylation in the 22Rv1 genome. It was found adjacent to a 162-bp co-methylated region, where the T allele was hypermethylated compared to the C allele. Additionally, the hypomethylated C allele had greater chromatin accessibility, and the risk allele T was associated with elevated expression of the oncogene PPP1R14A.
title: Fine Mapping Regulatory Variants by Characterizing Native CpG Methylation with Nanopore Long-Read Sequencing

finding: The SNP rs429358, associated with the APOE gene, influenced change rates for both the hippocampus and amygdala. This variant is a known risk factor for Alzheimer’s disease, causing faster increases in amygdala volume during childhood and faster declines in both regions later in life.
title: Dynamics of Brain Structure and its Genetic Architecture over the Lifespan

finding: Reported within causal configurations for WHRadjBMI and met posterior probability thresholds indicating potential causality.
title: Ancestral diversity improves discovery and fine-mapping of genetic loci for anthropometric traits - the Hispanic/Latino Anthropometry Consortium

finding: The missense mutation in LONP1 (rs11085147) was associated with methylation levels at mt-tRNA-G (position 9999) and mt-tRNA-H (position 12146). This gene is involved in the degradation of damaged polypeptides and maturation of mitochondrial proteins, indicating its significant role in mitochondrial tRNA methylation.
title: Nuclear genetic regulation of human mitochondrial RNA modification

finding: The susceptibility variant rs1800469 for colorectal cancer was a proxy for the pQTL rs2241714 and was associated with three proteins relevant to colorectal cancer, although causality could not be formally assessed.
title: Coding and regulatory variants affect serum protein levels and common disease

finding: This pQTL was shown to regulate three serum proteins that have been implicated in colorectal cancer, reinforcing the connection between genetic variants and protein levels affecting disease risk.
title: Coding and regulatory variants affect serum protein levels and common disease

finding: The rs143430880 variant in the GIP receptor gene (GIPR) was associated with lower bone mineral density (BMD) in humans. This finding indicated that this rare missense variant could influence bone health, although it did not appear to affect the overall risk of bone fractures.
title: GIP receptor reduces osteoclast activity and improves osteoblast survival by activating multiple signaling pathways

finding: SNP rs429358 was a major locus associated with Alzheimer’s disease and correlated with numerous health metrics.
title: Brain aging comprises many modes of structural and functional change with distinct genetic and biophysical associations

finding: The rs183444295 variant was identified in studies focusing on centenarians and was found to be associated with longevity. This variant was specifically mentioned alongside its role in strongly suppressing LINE1 retrotransposons and enhancing DNA double-strand break repair, indicating its potential relevance to pro-longevity pathways.
title: Identification of functional rare coding variants in IGF-1 gene in humans with exceptional longevity

finding: Similar to rs183444295, the rs201141490 variant was also identified among centenarians. It was noted for its role in enhancing the eradication of cancer cells compared to the wild-type, thereby contributing to the understanding of rare coding variants associated with longevity.
title: Identification of functional rare coding variants in IGF-1 gene in humans with exceptional longevity

finding: The rs7412 variant, along with rs429358, was associated with increased risk of Alzheimer's disease, statin medication, angina, and ischemic heart disease.
title: CoPheScan: phenome-wide association studies accounting for linkage disequilibrium

finding: The rs429358 variant correlated with risk for Alzheimer's disease and was involved with multiple cardiovascular traits.
title: CoPheScan: phenome-wide association studies accounting for linkage disequilibrium

finding: The rs34536443_G>C variant was associated with multiple immune-related diseases such as psoriasis and rheumatoid arthritis.
title: CoPheScan: phenome-wide association studies accounting for linkage disequilibrium

finding: The rs12720356_A>C variant was associated with ulcerative colitis, psoriasis, Crohn's disease, systemic lupus erythematosus, and RA traits.
title: CoPheScan: phenome-wide association studies accounting for linkage disequilibrium

finding: The study demonstrated that mothers with CA/CC genotypes of SNP rs8109886 had a 4.5 times reduced risk (OR = 0.22) of having children with Congenital Zika Syndrome (CZS). Furthermore, when combined with the CC genotype from rs12979860, 93% of these mothers delivered healthy newborns.
title: Congenital Zika Syndrome is associated with maternal genetic background

finding: The SNP rs12979860 was found to reduce the likelihood of abnormal CZS outcomes, with a protective combination of CC from rs12979860 and CA/CC from rs8109886 leading to a substantial reduction in risk (OR = 0.07), showing a strong protective effect against CZS.
title: Congenital Zika Syndrome is associated with maternal genetic background

finding: The allele variant of the APOE gene at SNP rs429358 was associated with an increased risk of developing Alzheimer's disease, highlighting its role in AD pathogenesis.
title: Open Science Datasets from PREVENT-AD, a Longitudinal Cohort of Pre-symptomatic Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The variant at SNP rs7412, also within the APOE gene, was noted for its interactive relationship with rs429358, influencing Alzheimer's disease susceptibility.
title: Open Science Datasets from PREVENT-AD, a Longitudinal Cohort of Pre-symptomatic Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The SNP rs612529T/C was associated with decreased SIRL-1 expression on monocytes, but not on granulocytes. This finding was derived from the analysis of plasma samples stratified by genotype in healthy individuals, suggesting that individuals with the C allele exhibited a tendency toward lower detectable levels of sSIRL-1, although this difference was not statistically significant. This SNP was specifically important in understanding SIRL-1's role as an immune inhibitory receptor implicated in modulating innate immune responses.
title: Soluble signal inhibitory receptor on leukocytes-1 is released from activated neutrophils by proteinase 3 cleavage

finding: The SNP rs1061679 was identified as part of a haplotype associated with positive selection. It affects protein folding and is located in the D1D2 domains of LILRB1.
title: Genetic diversity of the LILRB1 and LILRB2 coding regions in an admixed Brazilian population sample

finding: SNP rs1061680 was associated with a haplogroup that demonstrated evidence of positive selection, influencing the binding of LILRB1 to HLA-G.
title: Genetic diversity of the LILRB1 and LILRB2 coding regions in an admixed Brazilian population sample

finding: The variant rs1061681 was part of a major haplotype that encoded the amino acids LAIS and contributed to functional changes in LILRB1, confirmed as being positively selected.
title: Genetic diversity of the LILRB1 and LILRB2 coding regions in an admixed Brazilian population sample

finding: The variant rs383369 was associated with low LILRB2 expression levels and was previously reported, showing evidence of being positively selected.
title: Genetic diversity of the LILRB1 and LILRB2 coding regions in an admixed Brazilian population sample

finding: The SNP rs7247538 was classified as a positively selected residue that contributes to stabilizing mutations in LILRB2.
title: Genetic diversity of the LILRB1 and LILRB2 coding regions in an admixed Brazilian population sample

finding: This SNP was identified as a positively selected residue, contributing to the stability of the protein as concluded from the FoldX analysis.
title: Genetic diversity of the LILRB1 and LILRB2 coding regions in an admixed Brazilian population sample

finding: The rs7247451 SNP was recognized in a haplogroup defined by several positively selected variants in LILRB2.
title: Genetic diversity of the LILRB1 and LILRB2 coding regions in an admixed Brazilian population sample

finding: The SNP rs429358 was associated with Alzheimer’s disease (AD) diagnostic outcomes, reaching genome-wide significance with an odds ratio of 2.26 (95% CI = 1.66–3.07, P = 2.68E-07) for AD cases compared to controls. It was also associated with CSF amyloid classification, showing the strongest association (OR = 5.66, P = 1.95E-25), indicating a strong link to AD susceptibility.
title: Genome-wide association study of Alzheimer’s disease CSF biomarkers in the EMIF-AD Multimodal Biomarker Discovery dataset

finding: The A allele of rs4803042, identified as an eQTL for the gene ASB1, was associated with preferential binding of the transcription factor PORL2A. This association correlated with a decreased burst size and an increased burst frequency in gene expression, demonstrating how eQTLs can impact transcriptional kinetics.
title: Allelic Transcription Factor binding shape transcriptional kinetics observed with scRNA-seq in human cell lines

finding: The SNP rs1001281 was identified as being associated with 'MaxDrinks', a heritable trait that is recognized as a risk factor for developing alcohol use disorder (AUD). The association indicated that this SNP played a role in alcoholic behavior, marking it as an important genetic factor influencing alcohol consumption across species, including humans, based on prior studies.
title: Adaptor protein complex 2 in the orbitofrontal cortex predicts alcohol use disorder

finding: The SNP rs7412 was part of the method for determining the APOE genotype across cohorts, which played a critical role in investigating the association with Alzheimer's Disease (AD) risk and age of onset.
title: A Haptoglobin (HP) Structural Variant Alters the Effect of APOE Alleles on Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The SNP rs429358 was also utilized to assess the APOE genotype in various cohorts, significantly contributing to the study of its relationship with Alzheimer's Disease (AD) risk and age at onset.
title: A Haptoglobin (HP) Structural Variant Alters the Effect of APOE Alleles on Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The SNP rs7249925 was linked to NOSIP gene induction in the esophagus. The allele G was found to expand a GGGGGG stretch, resulting in increased G4 activity according to the predictions made by the DeepG4 model.
title: DeepG4 : A deep learning approach to predict active G-quadruplexes

finding: Resistin gene polymorphism rs3745367 was associated with an increased risk of type 2 diabetes mellitus in the Indian population, demonstrating its involvement in diabetes susceptibility.
title: Identification of Key Genes and Underlying Mechanisms in Cystic Fibrosis and its Associated Complications Based on Bioinformatics Analysis of Next Generation Sequencing Data Analysis

finding: The SNP rs429358, located near APOE, was identified as having a very strong association with self-rated health and resilience, having a significance level of P = 2 x 10^-40. This finding aligns with previous validations in external cohorts for traits related to human ageing.
title: Genetically independent phenotype analysis identifies LPA and VCAM1 as drug targets for human ageing

finding: This SNP in the <italic>APOE</italic> gene was carried by iPSC lines NCRM1 and NCRM5, which was related to increased risk for Alzheimer's disease (AD).
title: A reference induced pluripotent stem cell line for large-scale collaborative studies

finding: The <italic>APOE</italic> gene carries this variant as well, contributing to the risk associated with Alzheimer's disease when found together with rs429358.
title: A reference induced pluripotent stem cell line for large-scale collaborative studies

finding: The study specifically analyzed the APOE genotype in relation to Alzheimer's disease (AD) biomarkers. The rs7412 SNP was one of the two key genetic variants assessed alongside rs429358 to explore their role in AD pathology.
title: Multi-Platform Proteomic Analysis of Alzheimer’s Disease Cerebrospinal Fluid and Plasma Reveals Network Biomarkers Associated with Proteostasis and the Matrisome

finding: Similar to rs7412, the rs429358 SNP was analyzed as part of the APOE genotype investigation, which is crucial for understanding its implications in Alzheimer's disease biomarker classification and the overall genetics of AD.
title: Multi-Platform Proteomic Analysis of Alzheimer’s Disease Cerebrospinal Fluid and Plasma Reveals Network Biomarkers Associated with Proteostasis and the Matrisome

finding: It was identified as one of the strongest variants associated with risk of TN disease.
title: Common variants in breast cancer risk loci predispose to distinct tumor subtypes

finding: rs67397200 was associated with risk of triple-negative (TN) disease, indicating a significant role in the susceptibility to this subtype.
title: Common variants in breast cancer risk loci predispose to distinct tumor subtypes

finding: The SNP rs34536443 was identified as a missense variant in the TYK2 gene and was part of the original 95% credible sets.
title: Correcting the coverage of credible sets in Bayesian genetic fine-mapping

finding: The SNP rs4420638, located near the APOE locus, was implicated in non-additive gene interactions (naGIs) contributing to lipid traits, which included 9 suggestive cis-effects. This locus was one of the most significant contributors to naGIs across the studied traits.
title: Pairwise genetic interactions modulate lipid plasma levels and cellular uptake

finding: The variant rs55808806 significantly increased the expression of DCAF15 in arterial tissues, indicating its potential role in cardiovascular phenotypes.
title: Unveiling the role of Tdark genes in genetic diseases and phenotypes through bioinformatics-based functional enrichment and network analyses

finding: The 'AA' genotype of rs769449 was more associated with Alzheimer's Disease (AD) and Late Mild Cognitive Impairment (LMCI) groups compared to other groups, indicating a potential risk factor for these conditions.
title: A generalization of partial least squares regression and correspondence analysis for categorical and mixed data: An application with the ADNI data

finding: The 'GG' genotype of rs2075650 was found to be more associated with AD and LMCI than with other groups, suggesting its role as a genetic risk factor for these cognitive impairments.
title: A generalization of partial least squares regression and correspondence analysis for categorical and mixed data: An application with the ADNI data

finding: The 'TT' genotype of rs405697 showed a stronger association with the Control (CN) group, indicating a potential protective effect against Alzheimer's Disease.
title: A generalization of partial least squares regression and correspondence analysis for categorical and mixed data: An application with the ADNI data

finding: The 'TT' genotype of rs439401 was more associated with the CN group, suggesting a protective role against Alzheimer's pathology.
title: A generalization of partial least squares regression and correspondence analysis for categorical and mixed data: An application with the ADNI data

finding: The 'GG' genotype of rs4420638 was associated with increased AV45 uptake related to AD, suggesting its involvement in amyloid pathology.
title: A generalization of partial least squares regression and correspondence analysis for categorical and mixed data: An application with the ADNI data

finding: The 'AA' genotype of rs157582 correlated positively with increased ADAS13 scores, signifying a relationship with cognitive decline in AD.
title: A generalization of partial least squares regression and correspondence analysis for categorical and mixed data: An application with the ADNI data

finding: The 'GG' genotype of rs157580 was associated with the CN group, implying a possible protective effect in the context of Alzheimer's.
title: A generalization of partial least squares regression and correspondence analysis for categorical and mixed data: An application with the ADNI data

finding: The TC and TT genotypes of rs7412 were found to correlate with the CN group, providing evidence of a potential protective association.
title: A generalization of partial least squares regression and correspondence analysis for categorical and mixed data: An application with the ADNI data

finding: The 'GG' genotype of rs6859 was more associated with protective effects in the CN and SMC cohorts, suggesting it may serve as a genetic safeguard against cognitive decline.
title: A generalization of partial least squares regression and correspondence analysis for categorical and mixed data: An application with the ADNI data

finding: The intronic rs10401969 in SUGP1 on chr 19p13.11 was positively associated with vascular atherogenic traits, particularly triglyceride levels. This SNP's association with cardiovascular disease was highlighted through a calculated odds ratio (OR=0.95, P=2.8E-3) in a large study (n=268,744), indicating a trend towards a lower risk of coronary artery disease (CAD) in humans. Additionally, the prioritized candidate genes LPAR2, GMIP, GATAD2A, and TM6SF2 were identified through DEPICT analysis, with LPAR2's role in cholesterol metabolism and early-stage atherosclerosis emphasized.
title: Zebrafish larvae as a model system for systematic characterization of drugs and genes in dyslipidemia and atherosclerosis

finding: The study identified that the polymorphism rs7412, which denotes the presence of cysteine at position 112 in the ApoE protein (associated with the ApoE2 allele), was linked to increased ceramide levels and autophagic defects in retinal pigment epithelial (RPE) cells. This finding related to age-related macular degeneration (AMD), where inefficient cholesterol transport contributes to mitochondrial damage, implicating the role of ApoE2 in the pathogenic mechanisms of AMD.
title: Mitochondria-dependent phase separation of disease-relevant proteins drives pathological features of age-related macular degeneration

finding: The polymorphism rs429358, which results in an arginine at position 158 in the ApoE protein (associated with the ApoE4 allele), was noted for its protective qualities compared to ApoE2. The study revealed that ApoE4 lacks cysteines and exhibited resistance to phase separation and condensate formation, linking this finding to a differential risk profile for AMD and suggesting a role in protecting against mitochondrial dysfunction in RPE cells.
title: Mitochondria-dependent phase separation of disease-relevant proteins drives pathological features of age-related macular degeneration

finding: The Olink-specific variant rs4905 at EBI3 was noted to have implications for the binding of affinity reagents in relation to IL-27, indicating phenotypic associations.
title: Cross-platform proteomics to advance genetic prioritisation strategies

finding: The SNP rs7412 was associated with the APOE genotype determination, specifically distinguishing the APOE-ε4 carrier status among individuals with a positive family history (FH+) of dementia. In the study cohort, 30.5% of individuals with a positive FH were carriers of the APOE-ε4 allele.
title: Genetic risk of dementia modifies the impact of obesity on limbic white matter and spatial navigation behavior in cognitively healthy adults

finding: The SNP rs429358 was similarly involved in the determination of the APOE genotype. It played a role in distinguishing carriers of the APOE-ε4 allele, with a significant observation that 43% of individuals with a negative family history (FH-) were also carriers of the APOE-ε4 allele. This finding highlighted the genetic risk factors in association with dementia risk, impacting white matter myelin and cognitive functions.
title: Genetic risk of dementia modifies the impact of obesity on limbic white matter and spatial navigation behavior in cognitively healthy adults

finding: The rs7412 variant, corresponding to the ApoE2 allele, was associated with increased susceptibility to age-related macular degeneration (AMD). In the context of the study, ApoE2 was linked to the accumulation of cholesterol in retinal pigment epithelium (RPE) cells, leading to autophagic deficits and mitochondrial fragmentation. This altered cholesterol transport and its detrimental effects were pivotal in distinguishing the metabolic functions that diverge in the aging process towards AMD.
title: Apolipoprotein E isoform-specific phase transitions in the retinal pigment epithelium drive disease phenotypes in age-related macular degeneration

finding: The rs429358 variant, associated with the ApoE4 allele, was identified as protective against age-related macular degeneration (AMD). The study highlighted that ApoE4 effectively transported cholesterol and maintained RPE health under cellular stress, contrasting the detrimental effects seen in RPE expressing ApoE2. This protective role helped in preserving critical metabolic functions, further clarifying the gene's differing impacts on AMD risk and progression compared to its effects in Alzheimer's disease.
title: Apolipoprotein E isoform-specific phase transitions in the retinal pigment epithelium drive disease phenotypes in age-related macular degeneration

finding: The C-allele of this SNP marked the APOE-ε4 genotype, a risk factor for Alzheimer's disease, and was associated with lower odds of participation in the MHQ.
title: Genetic predictors of participation in optional components of UK Biobank

finding: The study identified that the presence of the rs429358 SNP (linked to the APOE ε4 allele) was associated with significant structural brain deviations in the hippocampus and default network. These patterns were particularly indicative of Alzheimer's disease and related dementias (ADRD) risk, as they highlighted co-deviating structural patterns that were found to correlate with family history of ADRD.
title: APOE ɛ2 vs APOE ɛ4 dosage shows sex-specific links to hippocampus-default network subregion co-variation

finding: The rs7412 SNP (linked to the APOE ε2 allele) demonstrated interactions with HC-DN co-variation patterns that were especially relevant for understanding social lifestyle impacts in males and physical activity in females. This finding reinforced the notion that the ε2 allele might serve as a protective factor against ADRD, contrasting with the detrimental effects seen with the ε4 allele.
title: APOE ɛ2 vs APOE ɛ4 dosage shows sex-specific links to hippocampus-default network subregion co-variation

finding: The SNP rs12720356, located in the TYK2 gene, was associated with Crohn's disease and psoriasis. The assessment demonstrated that this SNP could influence the expression of multiple genes, such as FDX1L, ICAM1, ICAM5, KRI1, MRPL4, GRAP2, TMED1, TYK2, and ZGLP6 across various tissues, utilizing expression QTL data from the GTEx database. This finding highlighted the SNP's role in genetic pleiotropy and potential connections to diverse biological pathways.
title: EpiGraphDB: A database and data mining platform for health data science

finding: The missense mutation rs1339188502, an A to G transition, was associated with significant alterations in CRISPR/Cas9 editing efficiencies. Specifically, it decreased the predicted 1 bp insertion probability by 45.8% and altered the frequencies of 1 bp frameshifts by a reduction of 30.2% and 2 bp frameshifts by an increase of 22.5%. This finding was contextualized within the editing efficiency analysis of the CD33 gene, highlighting the importance of considering genetic variations when selecting gRNAs.
title: CROTONdb: genome-wide variant effect prediction database for CRISPR/Cas9 editing outcomes

finding: The rs117960796 variant was linked with varying levels of sICAM-1, with further analysis revealing an independent significant association with another variant at the same locus.
title: Genome-wide association study identifies seven novel loci associating with circulating cytokines and cell adhesion molecules in Finns

finding: The rs74428614 variant was associated with sICAM-1 levels, indicative of multiple independent variants influencing this phenotype.
title: Genome-wide association study identifies seven novel loci associating with circulating cytokines and cell adhesion molecules in Finns

finding: This SNP was replicated as associated with LDL levels, identified in the intergenic region between genes BCAM and PVRL2.
title: Multi-scale Inference of Genetic Trait Architecture using Biologically Annotated Neural Networks

finding: The rs429358 SNP was associated with APOE variants that are known to play a significant role in the pathology of Alzheimer's disease. The study demonstrated that variations in this SNP could influence the response of synaptic integrity to pathological levels of Aβ in living human brain tissue.
title: Opposing roles of physiological and pathological amyloid-β on synapses in live human brain slice cultures

finding: The rs7412 SNP, also related to APOE variants, showed that its presence could modify the levels of Aβ and tau in the culture medium. This finding linked the genetic variant to alterations in synaptic transcript levels resulting from pharmacological manipulation of Aβ concentrations.
title: Opposing roles of physiological and pathological amyloid-β on synapses in live human brain slice cultures

finding: The study originally aimed to create cell lines homogenous for the rs429358 SNP, specifically achieving genotypes of APOE-ε4/ε4 (rs429358 C/C) and others. However, unexpected unintended insertions were identified in cell lines, including an accidental insertion that led to a mischaracterization of the genotype due to PCR amplification challenges related to the increased length of the insert.
title: Verification of CRISPR editing and finding transgenic inserts by Xdrop™ Indirect sequence capture followed by short- and long- read sequencing

finding: Similar to rs429358, the editing at rs7412 was intended to create specific homozygous genotypes (C/C for APOE-ε4/ε4 and T/T for APOE-ε2/ε2). Yet, unintended insertions were detected in the APOE-ε3/ε3 and APOE-ε2/ε2 cell lines, affecting the ability to confirm the expected genotype due to amplification difficulties caused by the insertion.
title: Verification of CRISPR editing and finding transgenic inserts by Xdrop™ Indirect sequence capture followed by short- and long- read sequencing

finding: The genetic variant rs492602 located in the FUT2 gene region was identified as an outlier across all best models when analyzing associations with age-related macular degeneration (AMD). Its inclusion indicated a significant association supporting potential involvement in AMD risk.
title: Selecting causal risk factors from high-throughput experiments using multivariable Mendelian randomization

finding: The genetic variant rs6859 in the APOE gene region was also classified as an outlier in the context of AMD risk analysis, highlighting its relevance to AMD pathophysiology in the model.
title: Selecting causal risk factors from high-throughput experiments using multivariable Mendelian randomization

finding: The rs12979860-T allele was associated with increased risk of HCC (p=0.0058) in a cohort of 3,566 patients from Japan, both in patients with (p=0.047) and without cirrhosis (p=0.011). This highlighted the genotype’s role in HCC risk among individuals who failed to clear HCV, despite a modest association with lower incidence of liver cirrhosis.
title: IFN-λ4 may contribute to HCV persistence by increasing ER stress and enhancing IRF1 signaling

finding: The SNP rs58542926, associated with the gene TM6SF2, was found to influence hepatic fibrosis progression in patients with non-alcoholic fatty liver disease, indicating its role in the disease's pathology.
title: Sample size calculation for a NanoString GeoMx spatial transcriptomics experiment to study predictors of fibrosis progression in non-alcoholic fatty liver disease

finding: The SNP rs641738, related to the MBOAT7-TMC4 variant, was reported to increase the risk of nonalcoholic fatty liver disease in individuals of European descent, showcasing its significance in the development of the disease.
title: Sample size calculation for a NanoString GeoMx spatial transcriptomics experiment to study predictors of fibrosis progression in non-alcoholic fatty liver disease

finding: The SNP rs11546996 was originally associated with primary biliary cirrhosis, believed to be linked to the gene SPIB. However, in this analysis, it was discovered that rs11546996 was associated with the gene PNKP, suggesting a potential re-evaluation of its causal gene related to the disease.
title: Incorporation of DNA methylation into eQTL mapping in African Americans

finding: This SNP, located within an intron of SIRT6, was associated with living beyond 100 years (P = 0.049) in Ashkenazi Jewish centenarians. It acted as a cis-eQTL, influencing the expression of SIRT6 across 18 tissue types.
title: A rare human centenarian variant of SIRT6 enhances genome stability and interaction with Lamin A

finding: The SNP rs7412, part of the ApoE gene, was analyzed for its association with dementia risk. The study confirmed that carriers of the ApoE ε4 allele, which includes the rs7412 variant, had a significant relationship with the gap between predicted brain age from MRI and chronological age, suggesting it could be used to predict dementia.
title: Grey Matter Age Prediction as a Biomarker for Risk of Dementia: A Population-based Study

finding: The SNP rs429358, also located within the ApoE gene, was similarly linked to increased dementia risk. The findings indicated that individuals carrying the ApoE ε4 allele, indicated by rs429358, were likely to have a significant age gap predictive of dementia as demonstrated by the study's results.
title: Grey Matter Age Prediction as a Biomarker for Risk of Dementia: A Population-based Study

finding: The SNP rs11546996 was associated with the gene PNKP in hepatocytes, indicating a novel SNP-gene relationship. In a prior GWAS study, this SNP was linked to primary biliary cirrhosis with an association to the gene SPIB, which is the nearest gene. Our analysis suggests that accounting for methylation in eQTL mapping revealed a potentially new causal gene for the disease.
title: Incorporation of DNA methylation into eQTL mapping in African Americans

finding: The SNP rs111444407 was identified as a GWAS-associated variant linked to bipolar disorder. It showed a significant trans-interchromosomal eQTL relationship with the gene REC8, indicating that this variant may have implications for the regulation of gene expression within the cohesin regulatory network. This connection exemplified the complexity of spatial-regulatory interactions and highlighted how variants in one locus (MAU2) could influence the expression of another (REC8), which is critical in meiosis.
title: Low tolerance for transcriptional variation at cohesin genes is accompanied by functional links to disease-relevant pathways

finding: The variant rs10524523, located in the TOMM40 intron 6 and corresponding to a T repeat, was found to be linked to the age of onset of cognitive decline, Alzheimer's disease, and sporadic inclusion body myositis. Biochemical and genetic evidence indicated that the TOMM40 mRNA brain expression was associated with the length of the polyT repeat, suggesting that variants affecting this repeat can impact gene expression.
title: Sequence-level instructions direct transcription at polyT short tandem repeats

finding: The variant rs2291668 was associated with increased levels of chromatin accessibility, active histone marks, and TNFSF14 expression. It was linked with rs1077667, a GWAS lead variant for multiple sclerosis, and was found in a killer T cell-specific TF footprint, indicating its role in the risk of multiple sclerosis.
title: Functional variants in hematopoietic transcription factor footprints and their roles in the risk of immune system diseases

finding: The rs2304204 SNP in IRF3 was identified as affecting transcription factor activity, with different allele frequencies across cohorts. Functional analyses showed that the G allele resulted in higher luciferase expression, indicating its role in modulating immune responses to influenza.
title: Integrated Drivers of Basal and Acute Immunity in Diverse Human Populations

finding: The SNP rs429358, associated with the APOE4 allele, contributed to significant interaction effects between cerebrovascular response, genotype, and amyloid-beta deposition on cognitive performance, particularly response inhibition. Specifically, carriers of the APOE4 allele who exhibited blunted cerebrovascular response showed impaired response inhibition. This highlighted the role of rs429358 in influencing cognitive dysfunction related to Alzheimer's pathology.
title: Cerebrovascular response to exercise interacts with individual genotype and amyloid-beta deposition to influence response inhibition with aging

finding: The SNP rs7412, which defines the APOE3 allele, formed part of the genetic analysis that demonstrated significant interactions among cerebrovascular function, genotype, and amyloid-beta levels affecting response inhibition. Although specifically mentioning carriers of APOE4, the study indirectly implied that the presence of rs7412 as part of an APOE3 genotype had relevance in contrasting cognitive responses in the context of aging and Alzheimer’s-related cognitive dysfunction.
title: Cerebrovascular response to exercise interacts with individual genotype and amyloid-beta deposition to influence response inhibition with aging

finding: The rs429358 variant was part of the complex associations identified with APOE, where it contributed to increased risk for Alzheimer's disease, ischemic heart disease, and it demonstrated a protective effect against certain metabolic traits.
title: CoPheScan: phenome-wide association studies accounting for linkage disequilibrium

finding: Similar to rs429358, rs7412 was associated with various phenotypes including increased risk of Alzheimer's disease, showcasing its role in determining APOE isoforms and their associated health risks.
title: CoPheScan: phenome-wide association studies accounting for linkage disequilibrium

finding: The rs34536443 variant was associated with multiple immune-related traits including psoriasis and rheumatoid arthritis, affirming its role in immune-mediated disease susceptibility.
title: CoPheScan: phenome-wide association studies accounting for linkage disequilibrium

finding: The variant rs12720356 was linked to inflammatory bowel diseases such as ulcerative colitis and Crohn's disease, thus supporting its significance in immune-mediated conditions.
title: CoPheScan: phenome-wide association studies accounting for linkage disequilibrium

finding: The SNP rs2305809, located in the upstream region of the RPS19 gene, was found to be associated with cervical cancer in a case-control study. This finding highlighted the potential role of this polymorphism in cancer predisposition.
title: Deciphering the protein dynamics and molecular determinants of iPSC-derived neurons

finding: The rs4682 SNP served as a synonymous quantitative trait locus for BSG expression. This variant was strongly associated with <italic>P. falciparum</italic> growth, indicating its role in shaping RBC phenotypes that affect susceptibility to malaria.
title: Common host variation drives malaria parasite fitness in healthy human red cells

finding: The locus indicated by rs12462756 significantly increased PRR12 gene expression in brain tissues and was recognized as a novel association with habitual sleep duration.
title: Multi-ancestry genome-wide analysis identifies common genetic variants for self-reported sleep duration and shared genetic effects

finding: The SNP rs429358, which involves the Cys112Arg variant of the APOE gene, was associated with cognitive performance measures. Participants who were carriers of the APOE-ε4 allele, identified through this SNP, exhibited lower beta peak frequencies in resting EEG, suggesting a potential link between this genetic variant and cognitive decline.
title: Resting EEG power spectra across middle to late life: Associations with age, cognition, APOE-ε4 carriage and cardiometabolic burden

finding: The SNP rs7412, corresponding to the Arg158Cys variant in the APOE gene, also showed a significant association with cognitive performance. Similar to rs429358, individuals carrying the APOE-ε4 allele indicated lower beta peak frequencies in EEG, reinforcing the role of APOE variants in cognitive aging and potential dementia risk.
title: Resting EEG power spectra across middle to late life: Associations with age, cognition, APOE-ε4 carriage and cardiometabolic burden

finding: The rs3752246 variant, associated with increased risk for late-onset Alzheimer's disease (LOAD) at the ABCA7 locus, was identified as the most common among predicted loss-of-function variants.
title: In vivo validation of late-onset Alzheimer’s disease genetic risk factors

finding: The rs61749990 variant was identified in ADSP exomes, linking it with neurodegeneration and neuron loss.
title: In vivo validation of late-onset Alzheimer’s disease genetic risk factors

finding: The rs12979860-T allele was associated with an increased risk of hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC) in a Japanese cohort, yielding a p-value of 0.0058, along with specific associations in patients with (p=0.047) and without cirrhosis (p=0.011). This polymorphism was shown to be completely linked with rs368234815 in Asian populations.
title: IFN-λ4 may contribute to HCV persistence by increasing ER stress and enhancing IRF1 signaling

finding: This SNP was associated with total cholesterol (TC) with a discovery P-value of 2.67 x 10^-16 and also with high-density lipoprotein (HDL) at P = 9.07 x 10^-9 and triglycerides (TG) at P = 7.44 x 10^-10. The findings indicated that this SNP plays a significant role in lipid levels in the studied Samoan population.
title: Genome-wide association studies in Samoans give insight into the genetic architecture of fasting serum lipid levels

finding: The SNP rs1160985 was identified as a peak SNP for low-density lipoprotein (LDL) with a discovery P-value of 2.61 x 10^-20. It also showed association with total cholesterol (TC) and demonstrated replication for these traits, suggesting its relevance in lipid metabolism in Samoans.
title: Genome-wide association studies in Samoans give insight into the genetic architecture of fasting serum lipid levels

finding: The rs7412 SNP was linked to the E4 allele of Apolipoprotein E (APOE), which is the strongest genetic predictor of late-onset Alzheimer's disease (AD). The analysis of young female carriers of the E4 allele demonstrated a notable decrease in energy expenditure when compared to non-carriers, indicating a metabolic shift towards aerobic glycolysis in line with findings related to E4-associated metabolic rewiring.
title: APOE4 Lowers Energy Expenditure and Impairs Glucose Oxidation by Increasing Flux through Aerobic Glycolysis

finding: The rs429358 SNP is another allele-determining SNP of the APOE gene, similarly associated with the E4 allele. Participants with this SNP exhibited decreased oxygen consumption and increased plasma lactate levels as part of the metabolic changes observed, which align with a Warburg-like metabolic endophenotype suggestive of early Alzheimer's pathology.
title: APOE4 Lowers Energy Expenditure and Impairs Glucose Oxidation by Increasing Flux through Aerobic Glycolysis

finding: This variant was also recognized as significant in the pooled analysis and related to American ancestry.
title: Cloud gazing: demonstrating paths for unlocking the value of cloud genomics through cross-cohort analysis

finding: Identified as significant in the context of the pooled analysis, this variant was associated with both functionally severe consequences and American ancestry.
title: Cloud gazing: demonstrating paths for unlocking the value of cloud genomics through cross-cohort analysis

finding: The TM6SF2 rs58542926 polymorphism was linked to non-alcoholic fatty liver disease and colorectal adenoma risk in the Chinese Han population, indicating its involvement in colorectal-associated diseases.
title: Identification of hub genes and key pathways in pediatric Crohn’s disease using next generation sequencing and bioinformatics analysis
